Ratings.comment: This is undeniably the hardest math class you will take as an engineering major.

Class is taught in a way that makes it more difficult than it has to be. Homeworks were returned with only vague suggestions on what was incorrect and took forever as there was a gap of knowledge that she assumes that we know between her teaching and the textbook (which is incomplete and basically worthless questions. I only passed due to a tutor.
Very Great professor. I learned a lot from her throughout this course. She's super patient and elaborate to answer any questions I have.

By far the hardest professor that teaches this course. Run if you have her. She is very sweet and clearly cares but shes goes WAY too fast in class to where its impossible to follow along, and gives no absolutely no examples of the types of questions that will appear on exams so there is no set way to study. Drop the class if you can
GET OUT OF HER CLASS WHILE YOU CAN!!

Natalia's class is very difficult, made more so by the awful textbook she teaches with. All homework relied on question sets from the textbook, some of which were worded very poorly. However, if you have a strong background in functions, how to transform them, as well as Calculus and Algebra, you will do fine. Office hours are definitely a must.

She is an awesome teacher but the textbook SUCKS. The course is VERY hard and so are the homework. Go to her office hours and you are saved. She is caring and will break down math concepts so you understand and help you learn. But the class is very hard so be warned if you do not have time for office hours. Exams are curved, which is a plus.
Evil professor, do not choose her!

The class is exceptionally challenging yet doable. Prof Natalia is very intelligent and very accessible through multiple approaches to support students. To well handle this course, ensure you don't miss any exams that are 80% of the total grade. There was a slight grading curve that led me to an 'A'  as the final grade.
Really thorough professor, you will learn a lot. Keep in mind the work is very intense, plan on 3-7 hour homework on any given homework.
My life was better before it.

80% of your grade id determined by exams, which have ~4 questions on them. From my experience, the questions on the first exam were much harder than anything she ever covered in class. I ended up withdrawing after the first exam because I did not see myself being able to pass the class.

RUN!!

- Lecture notes are very scattered so it is hard to understand the development of the concepts. 
-  Doesn't take or explain all questions seriously because she understands the material and assumes it is easy for students.
- Office hours is where she actually teaches
- homework is long and your grade depends on 1 question.

This class was very poorly organized and I would recommend that you drop the class if you see her name. She held alot of office hours but the homework was impossible if you didn't go. She was a fair grader for the exams however the average was often around 60-65%. The book was near impossible to understand and all the lectures relied off the book.

The class is almost all graded on tests (about 80%), but they are fair, and reflective of lecture material. The textbook is horrible, and the HW legit takes like 8-12 hrs a week, and is impossible without going to office hours. She has a lot of office hours, and is very willing to help though. The work for this feels more like a 4-5 credit class.

Prof. Golubeva truly cares for helping students succeed and is accessible outside of class (go to office hours), but the course is poorly structured. The Baker textbook tries to teach differential equations from an engineering perspective but is not very good at it. Homeworks are long, graded by a single question for accuracy, and graded harshly.

Dr. Golubeva is nothing but helpful and passionate about this topic and helping students get through it. However, the textbook is bad. The lectures are based off of the textbook as well, and there seems to be a lack of direction in the material for the first few weeks. I would take any other class she teaches, but not one with the Baker book.

Definitely the hardest course I've ever taken. Baker book is atrocious. Teaches using many engineering-related examples and then core concepts, which I'm not sure I enjoy. There was a 9%-11% curve for my section (both MT grades averaged ~65% and final averaged ~70%). Good professor? Sure. Content/roadmap/book? Horribly structured.

Her section for Math 2415 is one of the hardest classes I have ever taken. The homework is long, and you only get graded for pre-lectures, homework, two exams, and the final. However, Golubeva is incredibly caring and very willing to help with any questions you have. Office hours are essential. Her class is tough, but stick it out.

She's knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the subject, but it's extremely hard to get everything. The lectures are sometimes helpful, but the textbook used in this class is unintelligible, only one homework problem is graded out of the many assigned each time (and no feedback is given, just the grade), and no exam prep material is provided at all.
Doesn't know how to put math terms into a more understanding way so when he talks it a little confusing.
difficult test, hard grader

He is knowledgeable, funny, accessible, and explains concepts clearly enough. Many struggled because they put in virtually no effort and not due to his teaching. He could have slowed down at times to approach tough concepts from different angles, but in an analysis course you should be doing some independent reading anyways...

Did not care at all to help. TA was also not helpful and didn't seem to communicate with Stone. Did not seem to care during lectures to explain fully after the class stated confusion. Honestly worst prof i've ever had. Made it very hard to learn the content.

It's clear Dr. Stone is very knowledgeable but doesn't know how to teach. He makes the simplest concepts seem like a nightmare. He would rush through a thousand things in lectures and then we didn't end up needing over half of it. 3 exams plus the final and weekly HW (that takes hours) and quiz in recitation. Take a different lecturer!
Professor is not very good at explaining course work. Makes jokes at the end of class but no one cares. I think he just needs to change teaching style and set up notes differntly.

Stone is good, he was very accessible outside of class and receptive. He gave great feedback and was understanding. He's extremely intelligent and honestly seems uninterested in teaching something low like 1130. He would be way better for math majors and upper level classes. Overall, I would take him again, he's a very caring instructor.

It was very obvious that Professor Stone knew what he was talking about, but his teaching methods were not effective whatsoever. I had to learn most of the content myself, despite attending almost every single lecture. If it weren't for my amazing TA, I probably would have gotten a C in this class.
The best Calc 1 professor you could wish for! Loved his riddles!

Prof Stone is a really intelligent guy that you can tell simply needs to be doing something more stimulating than teaching Calc 1. He definitely is super knowledgeable but often times overcomplicates things and makes it hard to explain. Calc sucks and has to get done unfortunately and Prof Stone was by no means the worst, just not great.
Gives a riddle EVERY class which gets very annoying. A very smart guy but is not cut out for teaching. Doesn't know how to dumb done topics and just acts too smart for a calc 1 class.
He was a good professor and the lectures made sense for the most part. He can be funny at times.

Even if you are very smart and are going to get an A, you should still switch out of this class. Sutherland has 0 flexibility and never gives second chances- suppose you forgot to submit or do something on time even when it was completely out of your control. No clue with he is still hired, especially since he's only a tenured Professor.
Very very poorly made class, even an IMO medalist would struggle in this. 100% do not recommend! DROP OUT IF YOU HAVE HIM.

Extremely difficult class, especially for one that shouldn't even be that difficult. I took Calc BC in high school and got a 4 on the AP test, but the Professor never actually taught any of the concepts. I would not have got an A- if I did not take Calc BC. The final had problems that we never even did anything remotely similar to during lectures.

He does not care about your time. He literally wants students to do tons of useless problems, that have nothing to do with the exam, instead of actually helping students to be succesful in this class. Honestly cannot think about anything positive to say. Frequently messes up his answers in lecture problems, and the problems he does are pointless.

Got a 5 on the Calc AB test before starting this class. The only reason I even managed to get a B was because of everything I learned from Calc AB. I don't even think Sutherland taught a single useful thing in any of his lectures, to prepare us for the actual exams. Tried asking him a question one time, he completely shut me off.
PLEASE TAKE THIS CLASS WITH LITERALLY ANYBODY ELSE!!

Do not be fooled by these reviews! Sutherland isn't actually as bad as the reviews make him out to be. In fact, he's EVEN WORSE. No matter how good you are at calculus, I am begging you to please take this class with literally anybody else.

Currently in this guy's class, nothing he says makes sense. He just blabbers over random problems that he pulled out of his ass. We took our first midterm thsi week, nothing he did in class helped for the midterm. I'm considering skipping all his lectures from now and just self-studying instead to save my time. Do not be in this dude's class.

Only got an A because I self-studied for all the exams (while skipping half his lectures) and asked bunch of questions to Math 1152 TAs. Sutherland is quite literally the most useless Professor in all of OSU. He probably is smart and really good at math, but my god, he is the worst Professor of all time and has absolutely 0 compassion for humans.

If you believe anything on this website about an OSU professor, believe this man's page entirely. Take 1151 with literally anyone else. I can't believe he has a job. Not only a bad lecturer but a very rude and unpleasant person.

Honestly this is a hard course and idk how much control he has over it but theres too much homework and too test heavy and not very understanding and minor things get lots of points off, horrible lecture, over complicates and bad at explaining, doesn't properly awnser your questions, only got an A from self studying

Every negative quality that you thought a Professor could have, and I mean EVERY, this guy has. Not even just an absolutely horrendous Professor, but also a terrible human being with zero ethics or care in the world for any of his students. I cannot fathom how someone spent that much time and money on getting a phD, just fo ruin lives of students.

THIS IS THE WORST PROFESSOR AT OSU. PLEASE SWITCH INTO LITERALLY ANYONE ELSE"S CLASS, OR ELSE YOU WILL PROBABLY REGRET IT. HE WOULD NOT GIVE ME AN EXTENSION ON THE FIRST WRITTEN HOMEWORK ASSIGNMENT, WORTH 7% OF THE TOTAL GRADE, EVEN AFTER I TOLD HIM I WAS EXTREMELY SICK (I COULD NOT LEAVE MY BED) AND NEEDED MORE TIME TO PROPERLY DO THE ASSIGNMENT.
DO NOT BE IN THIS PROFESSOR'S CLASS, TRY YOUR HARDEST TO SWITCH INTO LITERALLY ANYONE ELSE"S CLASS.

Extremely difficult class that grades like math is your single life long dedication. It's super easy to lose too many points to math grammar and other formalities. Professor is also not accommodating in any way and does the minimum. And do not take Flipped and Flexible either!

Lets say on a test you decide not to, or forget to write the lim as k -> infinity for every single line of your work. You write it at the beginning, and in the final answer, but not in your work. This can and will literally result in a zero on that problem, even if the answer is correct. Alex Sutherland is hell. Stay away be any means possible.
DO YOUR WRITTEN HOMEWORK WELL.

This class requires EFFORT. None of the handholding that takes place in high school flies by in this class. This class is for hardworking ADULTS, and that HARDWORK is rewarded here. This man is genuinely a great professor, but he faces the misfortune of having to deal with all of these immature business majors who expect homework to be coloring.

I had to go through absolute hell and tons and tons of hours of studying to get an A. I completely studied everything online independently, since this Professor's lectures were completely useless. Nobody likes him as a Professor or person as he is unwilling to do more than the bare minimum for his students. If OSU doesn't fire him, we should riot.

I may have gotten an A- in this class but the only person that I can blame for that is myself. I clawed my way towards this grade, and I learned everything on my own. He uses such big, random, and ambiguous words, when he does not have to, like we already know that he is smart. Most of the grade is based off the written homeworks and midterms.

Zeshen Gu is worst lecturer I have ever had in my entire life. HIS TESTS ARE MUCH MUCH HARDER THAN HIS CLASS MATERIAL. Do not be fooled by the practice exams, switch sections or drop this class immediately.
Impossible to reach, impossible midterms. HE WILL FAIL YOU.
Professor is a really smart person. I love his lectures.

Extremely difficult midterms and little feedback. Tests were based more on fast computations than on understanding the material. If you can integrate by parts fast, you will succeed. If not, good luck. Tests were based on homework, just way too long to finish. I feel my grade didn't match my understanding. Avoid.

AVOID THIS PROFESSOR AT ALL COSTS. DROP OUT IF YOU HAVE HIM, EVEN IF IT TAKES AN EXTRA SEMESTER TO GRADUATE (just do the EM exam instead if no section works). Taking Gu is signing up for the worst semester of your life.

He is pretty funny in class as he randomly laughs out of nowhere, however, he is not so good at teaching though he is a teacher. He has more room for improvement than the cardinality of the real number set. Linear algebra is supposed to be an easy class, but not!!! No such thing as bad student, only a bad teacher.
WORST TEACHING, IMPOSSIBLE EXAMS, DO NOT TANK, YOU CAN QUALIFY FOR AIME/USAMO AND STILL FAIL THIS CLASS. FIND SOMEONE ELSE ASAP!

genuinely the most awful professor i have ever had the displeasure of having in my entire college career. handwriting = horrible. lecture notes arent even his. give up and throw in the towel with this prof, get out while you still can. bro comes to lecture in the same green shirt every day for weeks and the same sandals. he isnt professional.
make sense to all?

For your own mental health, drop this class. For the brave souls: don't bother attending lectures other than for the exams. Grind study the material on the practice exams and you'll get by.

The GTA, Natalia, is the only reason this class is survivable. She is an easy grader, so just put down ANY work for problems and you'll get pity points.

Not one to bash profs but my goodness. Lectures are awful. Bad notes and his handwriting is chicken scratch. First exam was near impossible to complete in time. To be fair, exams got slightly easier after the first but avgs. were still in the 60s. Just made the class harder than necessary. Textbook has lecture videos that were solid, use those!!

Drop this class if you have Zeshen Gu. Awful lecturer, moves too fast and expects you to know everything. His handwriting is illegible and he makes mistakes on half his problems. Tests are hard. Midterms were just 55 minutes and had about 5 long questions--averages were around 60%. Do the homework well, you'll need any grade help you can get

Dr. Zeshen Gu is an intelligent person but not very good at teaching. His lectures are very hard to follow and I learned little to nothing from them. However the homework is good and teaches the material effectively. The midterms and finals are fair and there is plenty of review material for the exams.

Horrible lecturer and even worse hand writing and explanations. Went through everything too quick. YouTube explained everything better once I stopped going to lectures. I'd drop the class and take it at cscc if you can. Grades are mostly determined by exams.
Worst lecturer at OSU, notorious for ruining students' perfect 4.0 status. If you get this professor, change IMMEDIATELY before it's too late.

Dr. Gu was clearly very smart and very passionate. He knew math very well, but just did not teach it very effectively. His lectures were always quite fast-paced, which made content quite difficult to understand. I don't think he really knew how to best communicate with students, which caused a lot of confusion on my end.

Do not take his class! He is a terrible professor and doesn't teach anything. He makes mistakes all the time and his writing is very messy. He is also very hard to understand. He will ruin your grade!!!

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. His handwriting is illegible, he is unable to concisely and effectively communicate answers. This professor wrote our final, took it himself, scored below an 80% on it, and took 50 minutes to complete the test (students get an hour). Completely unrealistic expectations for all of his students. Do not take Dr. Gu!!!

His lectures have no structure. Zeshen only reads off of slides (which aren't even his own). On the 1st day, I witnessed 20 people leave within the first 10 minutes. My favorite announcement from Zeshen was when he pushed back an assignment bc "he felt lazy" and didn't want to grade it "that weekend" (this was less than two days before it was due).

Going to this professor's lectures is like having to watch a toddler waddle around and spew incoherent garbage for 55 minutes. On top of that, the exams and quizzes were many times harder than was necessary, and the professor posts no notes on the Carmen webpage. If at all possible, either change lecturers or drop this class. You will hate it here.

I love M3816 because it helps me prepare for the SOA-FM exam. Additionally, Professor Molloy is super kind with his students—he provides extra resources for us to study, and he is always willing to help us.

Molloy is the best professor I have ever had. He genuinely cares about his students and is almost always available. The course was decently hard, but he teaches it very well and is always looking for ways to improve student's grades. Wish he taught more of the classes that I have to take.

Molloy is the best professor I have ever met at OSU. Please take his course. He will try his best to improve your grade. Every time I go during office hours, he is always patient. He replied to the emails so quickly.

This was a difficult class material-wise but Molloy is a great professor and really cares about his students. He wanted students to do well, and he curved all exams by around 10-15 percent. He offers office hours a lot and is always available over email. He is also willing to discuss the actuarial industry with students. Take 3618 with him!!

Martin is one of my favorite professors at OSU so far. Too many of my professors have "office hours" for 1 hour a week (not sure how you can consider it office hours plural if it's a singular hour), but Professor Molloy has office hours for multiple hours/day at least 3 days per week. Go to lecture and study the material and you'll do fine.

Martin is the best math proffesor I have ever had at OSU. He is so kind, helpful, and is great at explaining. If you participate in class, whether right or wrong, you get credit for it. He is always available on zoom if you need help. Go to class, pay attention, ask questions, you will get an A. If you are taking MATH 3618, take it with him!!!
Review exams are just like the actual exam. Easy hw due once a week. Attendance is not graded. Ended with a 98 in the class.

Overall, he was a great professor. He provided a thorough explanation of the topic with examples. However, sometimes, he made an easy concept seem way harder than it needed to be. Tests are not hard as long as you study using the study guide he provides.

you'll have a quiz every week and the final is cumulative but the class isn't that bad and I didn't go to half the lectures, everything was retaught in recs, but the rec and the lecture didn't always line up or they taught things different ways so it made it more confusing

Overall Dr. Ohl is a great guy but just an okay professor. He easily loses students after 10 minutes into lecture. Simply reads off slides and can't go into detail on why or how things are. Office hours is somewhat helpful. Your grade is mostly based on weekly quizzes (very loosely based on homework), your exams, and weekly homework (completion).

Prof Ohl is amazing. He explains everything super slow so that even a baby could understand, but not too slow its annoying. nothing has mandatory attendance. Very easy to access outside of class and seems really happy to help you understand. Makes a decently easy class VERY easy. 100% would recommend.
Amazing lecturer, super nice guy and unbelievably overqualified to teach this class. 100% take

Dr. Ohl is probably one of my favorite professors I've had! He explains concepts extremely well. He is very accessible outside of class; he always took the time during office hours to make sure I understood something when I wasn't sure. He cares about his students, and his exams are exactly like the homework (very reasonable for a 2 credit class).

Trent Ohl is easily the best professor I have had from the math department. He explains the material well and the homework is straightforward. He is very helpful in his office hours. If you can take MATH 4578 with him, do it.

Always Wrote and explained every step he took while doing a problem. He does multiple examples for each topic which is awesome. Get partial credit for showing work so it hedges points if you get the wrong answer on exams.
Great professor! Excellent lecture. 80% of lecture have slides. Not very much homework and have unlimited attempts.
Dr. Ohl overall was a amazing professor, went through each units thoroughly and explained the concepts clearly, plus he responds to emails pretty quick.

He's a great lecturer and a lot of challenging math concepts seemed easy after going to class and listening to his lectures! He explains things very well and is such a sweet guy and seems like he genuinely cares about his students!
Actually the sweetest cutest guy ever. Class is hard but it is math so it like should be. Would not want to take it with anyone else!

He cares about you and is passionate about what he is teaching. Class is hard and harder homework questions every week, along with quizzes every week. But he sometimes pushes back homework dates an extra day if he knows he is behind. Tough material.
Great Class, amazing teacher, just listen in lecture and you will succeed.

I have nothing bad to say about Professor Ohl. He has an amazing layout for the class, and everything on the exams is material he gives you in lecture and the study guides. He genuinely is a great person and makes for an awesome teacher.

He has clear expectations and his homework comes directly from examples in his lectures. His exams are take home  with problems similar to those of the homework. He records all his lectures, so it is not a big deal if you miss them. He is also flexible and always willing to help.

Hands down the best math professor I've ever had. Trent does a great job explaining content clearly during lectures and ensuring students understand it. If you ever have questions on homework he is more than willing to help guide you on how to set up problems and work through to the solution. He also had lots of fun with our class during lab!
Great guy! very clear on homework and exams. lots of fun in the lab where we play contexto!

Trent has been undeniably my favorite professor that I have taken math with at all of Ohio State. He cares about your success, and he helps you to succeed by making the class enjoyable. I don't think there is a better professor at all of Ohio State. He is very open to extensions on homeworks. I recommend everyone take him.

Terrible at teaching, goes extremely quickly and assumes you understand the material. Goal to pass the class is to see how little you can fail every exam so that other grades keep you with a high enough score.

For being pre-calc with review she did a good job re-teaching things to help you understand pre calculus. However, sometimes she over complicates things and goes into problems way too far. The hardest part was the amount of work to keep up with. Exams weren't that bad, but still had to study- quizzes are what dropped my grade.

Lots of homework, and lots of quizzes in recitation. Most of the time, the exams would have questions I have never seen before. The reason I got a good grade was because I was always in office hours and the tutor room. In lectures, she would go on tangents about a small detail that made a confusing concept impossible to understand by the end.

Over-complicates simple math to confuse students and calls it "understanding the theory." Her lectures are far too fast and impossible to complete on paper. Wrote her own textbook that's just as confusing as her lectures. Office hours are essential because she gives away answers there. Learned far more from recitation teacher and Organic Chem Tutor
takes problems that could be solved in two steps and turns them into 5 steps
Post answer keys with incorrect answers, never gets through a full lecture. Unwilling to work with students to help them succeed. Annoying voice.

Nothing stressed me out more last semester than this class. I was less busy with my core major classes than this prerequisite class. So much studying needs to be done just to receive a decent grade. The tests never match what we learn in class. Professor Miller often confuses herself in class and we never get through the entire lecture.

She's not good. We hardly ever got through our notes in lecture, she would frequently confuse herself and then everyone else. She actually told one of my classmates that her job is to confuse us in lecture and get everyone lost because it "makes us think". I could keep going, its all bad. Save yourself and your GPA. Don't take her.

If you would like to do well or maintain a good GPA, I would not recommend taking Professor Miller's class. She goes fast, and never finishes her lecture notes. If you have questions, she will give you what she believes is the right answer, but then mark it as incorrect when she grades it. The homework and tests are never on what is taught in class

Worst math teacher ever. You can attend every lecture and ask so many questions and it still won't make sense. Ask her for help on the homework and she will tell you what she believes is the right answer but then will take points off even though she just told you it was correct. Don't take this class if you care about your GPA.

If I could rate her zero, I would. She is the worst professor Ive ever had. She says we are not allowed to have tutoring help on assignments. The majority of the class is failing but she will not slow down the material. She confuses herself with her questions but expects us to solve them. If you care about your grade, dont take her courses.

She sometimes would start problems during lecture and not know or forget how to finish them. Overall, I think that she was a good lecturer and if you put in the work, you can receive a good grade in the class.
Great lecturer. Dont be afraid to ask questions during or after lecture.

Do not recommend. Going to lecture in person feels like a waste of time. Prof. Miller was unable to do certain example problems without giving up due to mistakes. She then had us go home and do them ourselves and put these questions on exams.
I thought there may have been an issue in grading my final exam and emailed her to ask for some clarification and she never replied. My grade was entered and I failed the course.

took her hybrid class, terrible decision. had to retake math1152. if you like online classes then this is your best bet. go to recitation, dont cram for exams, work on problems from the textbook and do not rely on her lectures. the math department makes the exams much harder than her actual class.

If you have not taken Calculus before I recommend taking it in person. Online is less clear but Elizabeth does a great job with it. This semester it was made much easier than before. All points were scaled down heavily to make getting an A very attainable. Very helpful and nice professor

This was the bridge course (the equivalent to 152).  She did the lecture online and then recitation was in person with a TA.  My TA was wonderful! However, I can't say the same for doctor miller.  Upon contacting her with a question, she was incredibly rude and short- not helpful at all.  Her exams were very difficult and there was hardly a curve.

This was the quarter semester bridge for 151 and 153.  Basically 152, but in 7 weeks, and all online with hybrid recitation.  Math department makes sure that the midterm and final exam make you sweat and feel less than empty in 50 minutes.

Best teacher I have had at OSU. She is so clear and so nice.  She explains everything perfectly and trumps the whole math department in teaching style.. she was perfect.  People from other 152 sections would watch her lectures cause she was so good.

I couldnt even finish this class, I am already horrible at math.. lectures were 1 hour long and not helpful at all, he would speed through it and skip over some steps. the TA's are amazing. Had to drop.

Prof Nance was an average professor. I felt he was not very accessible outside of the lecture. Lecture was focused on him talking about an already written out slideshow. It felt difficult to follow along since he was not actually writing anything during class. 
3 midterms and a cumulative final which you will find in any 1148 class.
I don't like this professor wasn't being reasonable and made me taking my final exam later than everyone so hard for no reason

Please note my poor grade came from me missing a lot of class this semester due to a death in the family. Professor Nance did his best to help me through a difficult time, is caring & does his best to help students learn math. Has a lot of students so don't expect a great rapport, but he is a good math prof.

Tony was a good professor, I was never good at math but he made math bearable and not so bad. I didn't like the material but he was a good professor who explained material well. One thing I didn't like was that he went too fast sometimes. Class has 3 midterms and final, weekly quizzes and homework. Success also depends on your TA.

He is so kind and clearly cares about everyone even though the lecture size is so big. Homework is due at same time same day every week which is easy and manageable. There is a quiz once a week in recitation but they weren't too bad. Kinda sped through lecture to keep time but overall his class was very manageable

Professor Nance is caring, but your TA plays a big role. I had a knowledgeable TA who struggled to explain things clearly because he was a forgein exchange student.  Homework is easy, but quizzes meant to be harder than exams. If you're struggling from the start, tutoring is very helpful—don't hesitate to go!
Great Professor
Good prof. Easy class. He has so many students in lecture so make sure you sign up for a good TA.

Excellent professor and really nice person. I'm glad I got his class.

You may have seen some of the math in 1148 before in high school but this course is very thorough and a good refresher to get started with math in college.
If you've never taken math 1148 before I would say you'll need some extra videos on youtube. I think he goes to fast sometimes and does not explain step by step for difficult things.
Professor Nance is great. His lectures are very straight-forward, as well is the criteria for the class. Paired with a good TA, 1131 should be easy for most.
Probably the best professor I have ever had.

Tony is the best math professor I've ever had. This is a difficult class, but if you show up to class, take good notes, and put effort into the homework you are in good shape for his exams. I wasn't a big fan of the grading scale since I'm not always a perfect test taker, but I can admit the exams were fair and borrow many proofs from lecture/hw.

Hands down the best professor I've ever had out of all the STEM classes I've taken so far, he is one of the few professors who's truly passionate about teaching the material. This class is HARD by all means but Tony makes it much easier by the way he explains proofs. 3 HW per week on average, but they sure help you be ready for the exams

Dr. Nance was a great professor. He explains the material very well and organizes the class very well. He is one of the few gems in the math department. The exams are fair and the questions are similar to examples from homework or in class. Overall, I am very glad I took this class with him.

Does a great job keeping lectures engaging even when dealing with dry material. Very clearly outlines what will be on exams. Exams are very fair and usually follow in class examples and homework. If you can take him for this class, I would highly recommend it.

Tony is probably the best lecturer you could get for this class. That being said, he is still a very dry lecturer. I found his tests to be very fair. Make sure to understand all the problems done in class and on the homework and you will do fine.
Great guy. Great teacher. If you don't like math, Tony will make you like it. Not sure if I'll meet a better teacher in college. A great math class to end on.

Tony Nance is the best mathematics professor at Ohio State for MATH 3345. The lectures are great, homework is mostly from the textbook. Exams are fair: most of the questions are from the homework and textbook/in-class examples.

He's not a bad person and his lectures aren't that bad, but his midterms (worth 20% of our grade each) are completely multiple choice and true/false. The high on our midterm was a B and the median was an F because of trick questions. If you need a high GPA for a scholarship, switch profs ASAP because the HW does not prep you for the exam.

Excellent professor. Was very responsive and helpful  with a personal issue I faced in his class. The class is a pretty standard college math class. You need to work to stay on track and get a good grade, but very manageable"

He is a really nice guy but the way he explains things can get really confusing. I like him as a person for sure but I would not recommend him as a teacher. I read some of these reviews and they are pretty accurate. You have to learn the material on your own. Lectures can usually be skipped since you have to teach yourself while doing the homework

The class wasn't the best, especially since most of the lectures were spent on one type of problem and not the other. Some of the exams also had questions that were graded wrong or even if the way to solve isn't his way it was marked down. He was okay, but some of the lectures were a bit confusing and you have to basically teach yourself the work.
Easy class. Good guy.

Henke is a really nice guy, but as a professor I'd say take anybody else given the option. If you don't self-teach yourself the material you won't pass; and he spends majority of the lecture going over how to find the X-int instead of actually difficult material. Check your exams too, at least one question has been incorrectly marked on every exam.

Professor Henke was a kind and caring instructor who setup clear expectations this class. He helped me learn the material in a calm manner without rushing. If you are in his class, I would recommend going to his posted office hours and trying to stay on task so that you don get too far behind.
Very bad at explaining difficult concepts, and often drone on topics that will never appear on exams
Not very good at explaining. Be prepared to teach yourself all the content.
Grading for quizes makes it hard to get points. You can miss one question and get an F
If you don't take the time to teach yourself the material, you will fail. Do NOT take his course if you can help it.

Math 1149 - Horrible teacher. Has a section specifically for lecture slides, yet never posted them until I asked. Then half way through the semester stopped posting again. Every time I emailed him It took forever for him to respond and he was surprisingly rude. I don't recommend this professor and would do anything to avoid taking his class again.

His explanations will make you more confused than you were in the beginning, if he bothers to explain at all. For this class, you will mostly teach yourself the material or you will fail. 
I hate to give a bad review because Sam is honestly a very nice guy, but he's just a bad teacher.

Professor Henke takes 10 minutes to explain how to solve x+4>0. His teaching style is monotonous and tedious when discussing even the simplest mathematical concepts. His teaching reinforced to me that public schools have a) low-quality instructors  and/or b) professors who fall within the "those who can't do, teach" stereotype.
This TA does not answer specific questions very well and he is very behind on grading. I did not get my final midterm back until 10 minutes before the final.

Sam is a great guy! He's super caring and was very helpful outside of class. The only issue I had was with the lectures. Most of his lecture presentations had multiple errors. He also read straight off the slides. I don't think he created them, though. Also, the quizzes only had three questions, so if you miss only one, your grade is a D.
hes the sweetest ever, hes super helpful with answering any questions, although he talks SO quietly

I LOVE SAM! Seriously, this guy saved my (academic) life. I would have probably failed 2162 if it weren't for him. Because of him, I was able to pull an A-. Never met a man more capable of explaining such difficult concepts, so knowledgeable about his field, and so genuine and relatable at the same time. Get Sam as your TA (but don't take 2162).
Best GTA. Ever. If it wasn't for his help before every midterm, I would have gotten a C or worse. He saved my semester. If I ever need help in anything math related, I know that I can always ask Sam.

Sam presents the material very well. The "second pass" through the material during recitation is very helpful because 2162 moves so quickly.   Because of his extensive and accessible coverage of course topics, he was known by my section as a savior. Expect lots of grade-saving review sessions before big exams.
Sam is a really nice TA overall. He explains things that I couldn't understand during lecture with simple terms that are easy to understand. He's very positive and enthusiastic about math.

Ok lectures, but struggled to answer questions from "lost" students. Do not take if you do not have *strong* calc foundations. He also assigned interesting but difficult add'l problems that weren't from the book. Not tech savvy and didn't predictably update lecture notes. Hw was sometimes assigned late eg 2 days before exam. Disagree w/ "5" ratings
really good professor have many extra contents you can enjoy math

Dr Casian was a bit fast-paced but his lectures and lecture notes were excellent in quality. He also covered exam problems and explained them very well, which was very helpful for preparing for exams. Him missing minus signs and mis-writing stuff also brought some levity to the lectures.

He is very passionate about teaching us as much math as possible, and his lecture notes are very detailed and helpful. He does go off on tangents frequently, often ending up teaching us analysis proofs even though they are not part of the curriculum. His classes are fun to attend and the homework and exams are only moderately challenging.

Calc 1 honors is very theoretical/analysis heavy. Dr. Casian is nice, responsive, and an ok lecturer but there is no opportunity to work on problems in class. You just watch him scribble on the chalkboard for an hour at lightning speed and leave the class confused. There is no recitation, just lecture 5 days a week. Take 1152 if you can.

Don't skip lectures. Most of the material will be learned through lectures and he doesn't do that good a job of posting his notes online. His lectures are okay but hard to follow sometimes and it doesn't help the class is quite difficult.

His lectures are informative, but usually hard to follow, so extra studying is required. His tests and homework are relatively easy, but also very easy to make punishing mistakes on. He often will ask for questions, then not look for raised hands, and answer questions badly. These factors make the class uninteresting, stressful, and not enjoyable.

Very fast lectures and a bad grading system. Most of the grade was based on multiple choice questions that are very easy to mess up from tiny mistakes and they can ruin your grade. Prof Casian provided very detailed lecture notes of everything he covered in order which was very helpful. He was always willing to stay late or meet for office hours.

Signed up for 2568, he taught the much harder 4568 in its place, got credit for 2568. The material taught in lectures is missing parts that help you with the exams and mini homework. Idk how I got a b.

He is a nice enough guy, but cannot lecture at all. By the end of the year no one would go because lecture was so useless. Also, it is practically impossible to get a good grade in his class. Exams are way harder than they need to be, and missing one question on an exam drops you a letter grade becasue of how it is set up. Homeworks way too long.

Nothing against the guy, but I was no fan of his teaching style. It feels like he just brushed over really important, foundational concepts, and then dived into some of the more technical/theoretical aspects of linear algebra. His lectures often jumped from on subject to another. Also, the homework do not prepare you well for quizzes/exams.

Dr. Casian, does not really care about the students at all. I went to his office hours to ask him questions about the homework, which had nothing to do with the Lectures he gave, and he denied help when there wasn't a single student in the zoom call. His lectures are terrible. The only helpful thing is the email he sends the night before the exam.
Hes actually bad at teaching. If you bother him enough you can bend the course to be more practical. Drop the class and take it with someone else.

He isn't the worst at teaching material but he makes his tests absurdly hard to the point where you're just guessing on 50% of questions. He gives a lot of extra credit so you will think you'll be fine but the extra credit doesn't matter because they're impossible. He adds on so much extra content compared to other professors. Do not take from him.
Avoid this man at all costs. He does not let you see your old quizzes, or exams. He holds office hours on Fridays after both of the weekly quizzes and homework are due. Not helpful at all.

The class covered fairly difficult material, but Dr. Casian did a generally very good job of teaching things and incorporating both good intuitive reasoning and insights into some higher-level math. Grading was also very lenient overall, and the online transition was handled in a very generous way with regards to exams. Would recommend.

Taking this class (linear algebra) was legitimately one of the worst experiences Ive had in college. His lectures were very confusing and only seemed vaguely connected so they were largely not helpful. The textbook was free and somewhat helpful but also failed to explain many very important concepts. He seems like a decent guy but not a good prof

Avoid, I'd say. The book (Golubitsky) is quite terrible, most commands don't work & it doesn't go into enough detail to teach yourself reliably. He uploads lectures that are vaguely related to each other & don't follow the book at all, but the HW is from the book He'll do reviews before exams but they don't help. He's seems like an OK guy generally

Prof. Casian would be great for someone serious about going in-depth into math. He often gives questions not standard in textbooks or proves things that other instructors would just give as formulas, which makes his class interesting but also very difficult/time-consuming. Fast lecturer, brilliant guy but not 100% at replying to emails

This could be because it was online lectures, but worst math lectures I've had. There are no online notes to download before lecture and this guy plows through all the material with little explanation. The lectures are pre-recorded and he gives almost no time to write what he has written before scrolling past it. 55 min lectures take me 3 hours.
Perhaps no professor is worse than him, he gives the impression that it is his task to fail or bring troubles to the students, if there is another professor, do not choose him.

Didn't teach himself, posted videos of other people explaining the topics. Extremely strict with the syllabus, didn't give me some points even though it was a technological error instead of a human error.

I had Connor for recitation as part of a flipped and flexible section of MATH1151, and he was great. His recitations were helpful in recapping and practicing some material in the lectures. You can tell he has a very good understanding of the subject and is genuinely wanting to be helpful. He is also understanding that the class is difficult.

Dr. Cassady made Calculus 1 feel like elementary Algebra. Truely one of the easiest math classes i've ever taken. And it's not because of the content, but rather how Dr.Cassady presented and taught the material.
Took the class in person and had him as lecturer and TA. Not much HW if you space it out correctly. He responds to emails fast!

Took Math 1151 hybrid, so lectures online and he was my recitation TA. When I visited office hours he was pretty informative. He didn't make the curriculum but the class itself is set up to be extremely difficult and his recitations didn't help nearly as much as my own studying. Really depends on how comfortable you are with calculus.
nice professor

A combination of best professor, best TA, and best design of course! Helpful lectures, good grading criteria that reduces stress, always patient, explains things clearly, respond quickly. Prof and TAs are really working hard helping you to get a good grade! Feel so lucky to be in this course for my first semester of college.

Prof. Vutha is truly one of the best math teachers around. He explains concepts clearly and genuinely cares about his students' success. Definitely take advantage of his office hours - they're super helpful. For study prep, I found unstuckstudy and the free textbook really useful.
He's awesome. Just take the class, I sucked at pre-calc, and he made me change my approach completely to math. Probably the best professor I'll ever have.

If you are paying attention, it will become clear that Dr. Vutha is a true blessing. He's a wonderful teacher who is extremely humble and selfless of his time.  I was a non traditional veteran student and was stressed about returning to college math. His positive energy and support made me feel seen in a five hundred person class and stick it out.

Super amazing teacher who actually cares about his students and wants to help! Willing to put in extra time and work around your schedule if additional help is needed. No textbook, everything can be learned from the organized notes he posts, and there were no surprises on the midterms. Go to office hours and monopolize on the extra credit offered!
My favorite professor!! Nice hand-writing, clear lecture slides and practice midterms.

Beyond being a gifted teacher, this guy's got a soul that's pure gold. 

He may have hundreds of student each semester, and yet he's got this knack of seeing the best in you and pulling you up, every single day, even if you can't see it yourself.

Whatever they're tossing his way in pay, it's a drop in the ocean for what he's truly worth.
Great guy, great sense of humor, and very reasonable. Definitely one of the best professors I've ever had. He's always looking to help, and cares more about you than the university and his job.

Amit is by far the best professor I have ever had. He is very kind and genuinely cares for all of his students and wants to see them succeed. Going to his office hours is very beneficial, especially for the written homework. He is very lenient with turning in late work and is very understanding.

Amit is the best teacher I have ever had. He is extremely understanding, down to earth, and kind. I actually learned everything I was being taught and understood it at a deeper level. I am so grateful to have had such an awesome experience being his student this year. He truly showed that he cared about each and every student.

Amit is the best math professor I have had. He provided us with clear notes and was thorough when explaining topics in lecture. He had numerous office hours throughout the week but was willing to help you anytime during the week regardless of his posted office hours. Amit wanted to see you succeed and cared for you much more than just a student.
Not many complaints. Amit did a good job being down to earth and making student feel like they are real people. Taught relatively well, but there is a lot of content to remember for the final.

Amit is one of the best professors I've had and really cares about his students. He's very understanding and has a good sense of humor. Weekly quizzes don't impact your grade too much. HW is due every week but overall a great prof and I would 100% take again.

Amit was the best math teacher I have had. He is very organized and uses a consistent format for lectures. He hosted zooms every Monday to prepare students for the weekly quizzes, held in-person exam review sessions, and was always helpful during office hours. Truly wants to see his students do well. Take Amit if possible.

Dr. Vutha is probably the best math professor I will ever have, which is sad for me, but great for you if you're planning to take any of his classes! He explains things thoroughly but in simple ways, and is always willing to help. His office hours are great to go to! He truly cares for you as a person and as a student :)
He was very funny and entertaining during class, he talked really fast though so you had to take notes fast.

Absolutely awesome guy. Incredibly caring and willing to meet with students outside of class, regardless of his office hours. Lectures are fast paced, but that is not his fault. He makes jokes during class and tries to make the content seem less boring. I highly recommend taking his class if you need the math credit!

Prof Vutha was an amazing professor and a great start to my freshman year. His lectures were detailed and helpful. He also hosted zoom reviews for every midterm and for the final which I found extremely helpful. Overall, his lectures made it easy to pass the class despite the material perhaps being difficult for some. I highly recommend him.
best ta ever hes awesome awesome !!!!!

He provides no materials, recordings, notes, or slides—just writing on anblackboard and a book focused on applying linear algebra in MATLAB. I struggled since I couldn't take notes, and the book was awful. His tests were mathematically easy but conceptually brutal. I don't know how strict he is on grading yet.
Makes algebraic mistakes on problems that a 5th grader could do. Lectures are pointless and expects you to learn the entire course by yourself.

Dr. Krishnan is a bit unorganized and his lectures can be hard to follow at times. The homework can be very challenging without guidance. However, his exams are fair and he grades very leniently. It is obvious he has a deep understanding of the course content, and the class is very interesting. One of the best math classes available.

Lectures were extremely hard to follow. I found it easier to understand concepts by just looking at online videos. 90% of all lectures are about concepts with very few examples of how to apply them to problems. Be ready to spend time outside of class learning. Exams were straightforward and similar to homework. Overall, the class felt disorganized.

I liked Professor Krishnan. He was kind and wanted to help. The homework was harder than the tests, but that was a good thing. He would work in broad terms and was difficult to understand in lecture, so it took a lot of outside studying to understand the content. Tests were generally fair and easier than homework.
He is a wonderful teacher, but a lot of homework Exam is not so hard

Pros: Tests are pretty simple (Same difficulty as easiest HW problems), Goes through many problems in class, Not much HW, Gives plenty of time to do HW, Very energetic Cons: Often made simple algebra mistakes during lectures which made following his lectures difficult sometimes Overall he was great. Study 3-4 hours a week and you should be good.
Clearly explains course material and tests reflected homework exactly. Had some interesting tangents to keep students engaged.

He wasn't great but wasn't bad either. Sometimes hard to contact. I felt that the course material was somewhat difficult but all the tests were extremely fair and to the point, no curveballs were thrown like many past math classes at OSU. Wasn't an excellent lecturer but was well prepared for class everyday. Attendance not mandatory, but helpful.
He is a nice guy and well-prepared.

Prof Krishnan's class was incredible (averages of 80% on midterms), until we got to second order differentials. He had to do some lectures twice because he got so many questions, and no one i talked to got it. Unfortunately, I have to actually apply ODE's in my major, so thats a big problem for me. Final was brutal, I went from a solid A to a B-.
Very easy grader.
Very easy class, never attended recitation, very easy A. Just do the hw and practice exam if needed. Let us drop a midterm

He could not clearly convey information, and he usually made it seem more confusing than it actually was. I am not sure if he understood the content himself, and he would make multiple mistakes in every lecture. The TA was very helpful though.

Sure he's nice, but that does not make him a good teacher. He continuously taught us incorrectly (which had to be corrected by students). Multiple times a lecture, a student would ask a question, and he would be derailed for at least 10 minutes trying to understand how to do a concept, ending our classes early because he couldn't figure it out.

Professors are happy to answer questions, so office hours are valuable. But only if you have a clear purpose. He also enjoys talking to students about things that are at a higher level than textbooks. He's willing to help the whole class maintain their GPA

Pretty much what everyone else said.  Very nice and caring professor but the lectures are hard to follow. He really cares and seems like he enjoys teaching but the lectures are a little complicated and I ended up learning more from online videos.

Somewhat caring professor, but I've noticed he's pretty lazy. Have to beg to have solutions to study guides just for him to skip multiple steps of work to where it ends up confusing you even more. Not to mention his handwriting is very difficult to read, and his accent is hard to understand at points. Exam and study guide difficulty were not equal.

Sovan is a nice guy and cares greatly for his students. However, lectures are more complicated than needed and online videos were more useful so I stopped going to lecture. Study guides are very useful to studying for exams. Written homework's aren't terrible. You will have to study the concepts on your own though. Good luck.

He's sweet and obviously is passionate about math, but his lectures personally didn't help me, I feel like I got more out of YouTube videos than his lectures sometimes. The midterms were okay if you did the study guide but the final was tough. I do think he overcomplicated some concepts and the exams were way tougher than they needed to be.

While Dr Mondal is very passionate about mathimatics, i feel that he weighs the exams a bit too heavily. I was at a A until my final and somehow managed to drop 6 percent due to getting a 76 on the final. A bit salty but life's tough

This guy is a really good professor. The exams were very easy if you studied (I did not). Focus on going to lectures and doing the practice problems, and study the study guides thoroughly. If you do that you can get an A.

Sometimes the lecture is lacking in detail, but that may be because he doesn't want to confuse everyone. But you can go to professor's office hours and he helps. He is very kind and wants you to do well. He prioritizes your mental health and only tests you on stuff done in lecture. Take a class with him if he is available!

Professor Mondal is really very sweet, but his course takes a lot of time and effort. Currently, the professor follows a math 2153 syllabus that is a bit more unique. I would probably take this course with a different professor if possible.
He tries his best. Super nice. Always available in office hours. Knows what he is doing.

Dr. Mondal cares a lot about teaching. He's super nice and despite a bit of an accent, you can usually understand him. Exams are pretty tough. If you like math and are interested in learning, this is a great class; he a handful of proofs, so you really understand everything. If you're just trying to knock out a graduation credit... maybe stay away.

He's a kind person, but I can say he's new here and doesn't really know what's going on. Calculus 3 is a tough course but mostly it's still common calculus. Not to mention his accent, he doesn't explain things well. It can take a long time for him just to explain some straightforward points. Better off focusing on the textbook and recitation.

Dr. Sanford is one of my favorite professors I ever had. He is very supportive and is willing to make sure that students are understanding the concepts in a challenging course like calculus 3 or any math course. Extremely helpful during office hours whether it is feedback on an exam or a tough homework problem.

I thought that Dr. Sanford was a really nice person, however, his style of teaching only really catered towards someone with a "mathematical" mind. So, sometimes this caused his lectures to be confusing sometimes. Office hours are great and definitely helped me before the exams. Homework is very tough and can take hours.

Prof. Sanford is a very passionate professor who cares about the development of his students' understanding of the concepts rather than just showing them how to plug in and get solutions. While he does show shortcuts, he shows the more complex derivations of those shortcuts as well. This class takes effort but Sean does care about his students.
Some of the concepts covered are difficult, however the class itself is not very hard. If you come prepared to the quizzes and exams, you will succeed.

This was the worst math class I've ever taken. Though he's  smart, this professor cannot teach. He assumes that his students already know a lot of things and skips over them while providing unnecessarily complex explanations during his lectures. If you don't understand his 1st lecture never go again. Watch youtube tutorials, you'll learn more.

He is passionate about helping his students understand math instead of just being able to plug numbers into a formula. I learned a lot and felt that the exams and quizzes were always reasonable, even if hard. But, he is always willing to help and his office hours are useful.

I really enjoyed his lectures, and I believe there is a lot to gain from them. his quizzes and exams are very reasonable and not overly difficult. However, its still a tough subject and class; if youve always struggled with math, like me, be prepared to put the work in. i wish i could have him again

Calc 3 is hard but the class is not. I started not going to lec since the second month and just used yt and hw to learn and review, still got A. Sean actually knows math as every time student asked a question he could answer it quickly and well. A lot of hw to do, 2 of 6 lowest quiz grades will be dropped, midterm&final are relatively easy.

The guy is passionate about teaching and will go out of his way to make sure you understand, however the content, especially unit 17 are very hard to understand conceptually, and skipping 1 lecture is enough to get lost. Don't worry about the quizzes. Make sure you maximize midterm 1 to have wiggle room for the other 2 exams.

Sean is a intelligent individual, and unique in the way that he both has a fundamental understanding for why the math works, and how to explain it to a student. You walk away with both a understanding of the equation and why it works which I appreciate.

Exams are simple, only gripe is that there is a lot of HW some weeks. 

FYI: textbook not used.

Don't bother going to lecture, the textbook videos are 100x better than his were. Extremely homework heavy with an unreasonable amount due each week. Passable class, but only if you decide to put in the work yourself.

Sean is smart, and many people like his lectures, but he speaks with terms that students don't understand, making it hard to grasp the content. He gets sidetracked and talks about why we use certain equations rather than showing us how to use the equations. 2/6 quiz grades get dropped. Midterms are fair, you will do good if you prepare.
Good professor. His lectures are very amazing. The quizzes and midterms are very simple, but the homework and final are a little difficult but still acceptable.
I learned a lot from his course. His exams are with appropriate difficulty.

I highly recommend Mr. Sanford! His teaching is very striking. The lectures deserve to be attended, though they are not mandatory, because you could really learn Calculus 3 knowledge in his lecture. Quizzes and midterms are accessible, but weekly assignments and the final exam are challenging but not unsolvable.

Mr. Sanford is an amazing professor. His lectures are very valuable, so even the attendance is not mandatory, the lectures are deserved to attend. Three quizzes and three midterms are very easy, and the lowest score of quizzes would be dropped. The homework and final exam are challenging, but not inextricable.

A very good professor! Lectures don't count for attendance but are well worth listening to. His quizzes and midterms are easy. The lowest quiz score will be dropped. Homework and the final exam are difficult, but the homework will certainly make you improve as long as you work hard, and the final exam score is with a certain extent of curve.

Very solid professor! His lectures were not compulsory, but they were very clear. His homework was a bit difficult, but you could try it many times until you got it all right, and his midterms and quizzes were very easy, only 40% as difficult as the homework! Moreover, he would drop the lowest quiz score! However, the final is a little challenging.

If I could give him a zero I would he openly lie about what's on exams and would never give you any practice material until Sunday night when your exam was on the Wednesday. I can't talk enough about how awful he is as a teacher he did not even show up to 3 out of our 4 exams. He is going to make me have to take the class again.

Prof. Sanford is friendly and organized. He projects his iPad to the screen and writes the class lecture on a notetaking app and posts all the class notes to the class Carmen, which is very helpful. His grading is fair and the first midterm had an average of 90. I have no complaints about this class and I recommend taking it with Prof. Sanford.

Mr. Dain knows the material he teaches well. He does a good job at keeping people as engaged as possible. I'm a student who has returned to college after many years. Math was the class I was most concerned about, as I did not get good grades when I took the same class at another college before. The professor matters and he's a good one.

He was a great lecturer and very accessible. Midterms/exams were a little tricky but as long as you study and pay attention, you will do well. Homework was never too excessive and he made the lectures fun and simple.
great professor would take again

This class was super easy even though he teaches fairly quickly. He's a great professor and makes sense just make sure to keep up with notes. Everything is straightforward and easygoing but there are a lot of tests so make sure you study. The midterms are simple as long as you know the material.

Dain was an amazing professor for 1050. There was a lot of homework from the book, but he gave you the due dates at the very beginning and you knew when they were due, along with exams. Homework was completion based and no accuracy based, but he would leave feedback. Very open for questions and office hours and helps students as much as he can!

He's super nice! I'm just not a math person so it was kind of difficult for me to understand just generally, but he delivered the material in the most fun and clear way I think anyone could've done. I'd take him for 1148 if I could !

Pretty easy class. I stopped going to lectures and recitations and watched the videos on ALEKS instead and still got an A. When I did go to lectures, Dain made them interesting and fun. Midterms are a bit tricky but multiple choice and a few short answer and weekly recitation quizzes are only 2 questions.

Homework is graded for accuracy, but you're able to correct the ones you missed (as long as it's submitted before the due date!). Textbook is provided online. Lectures were clear and easy to follow, and he posts his completed notes to canvas after every lecture.

I love his class. He was able to explain little details in an essay way. He will have time for extra classes to help you if needed. Besides we have recorded all the classes! That was the best and his jokes :)

Dain was super kind and a great professor. I struggle with math a lot, so I didn't do too great in his class. His lectures were often very boring and dry, but he's a really good educator. If you struggle with math, your TA and/or office hours will be your best friend.

He is one of the nicest professors I've ever had. Genuinely such a sweet man who cares for all of his students. He really wants everyone to succeed. I'm not good at math but this class was relatively not too bad for me! Take him if you can he is so nice 10/10

Literally, the nicest man I've ever met, and also one of the BEST math teachers I've ever had. I'm not even exaggerating. He's a very sweet guy, who takes his time in lectures to explain things. Very understanding, and explains concepts thoroughly. His tests aren't hard, he genuinely wants you to succeed. 10/10

Professor Dain was awesome, he is very sweet and understanding. He was prepared each lecture with notes that were understandable. Also very forgiving, he allowed me to make up assignments and take an exam late since I was unable to at the scheduled time. Final exam was kind of hard for me which knocked me down to a B+. Great professor!
This course is super easy, but he is a great lecturer and explains math so well. He makes jokes here and there which lightens the mood. A very good professor!
Great

This class was fast paced, but he would slow down and go back if u asked. He would actually answer questions we had and would really go through them step by step. Math is usually torture for me, but he kind of made it enjoyable as he cracked jokes in class to lighten the mood. Wouldnt take again because it was a bit too fast, but i do recommend.
I really enjoy the way he goes over the material during class. he leaves homework twice a week and one quiz per week about the things we have learned.
Professor Dain is so caring and nice. His lectures are pretty interesting and he loves talking to his students. He also does a superb job on teaching.
I love Professor Dain! He is literally so sweet and funny. He truly cares about his students and tries to make math fun. I highly recommend taking any of his classes. It is an easy class as well.
Best math teacher Ive ever had. I would take every single math class he teaches. Very funny and will take time to answer any questions.

Pretty decent guy, all things considered. Seemed like he cared about teaching and his students. Gave lectures at a pace that I could follow and would stay after class to answer questions (even ~20 min after lecture ended), although obviously this may have been unique to our Math 1148 class specifically. Cracked a funny joke every now and then, too!

I hated this class. I gave up on the lectures as it was so hard to follow him. I really do not recommend this course. The class is midterm and final heavy and It makes it hard to learn with how the teaching is set up. It was hard to see anything or hear him in the lectures and he believes you need to teach yourself math and that he can't do it.

I gave up on attending this lecture. He seems like a nice guy, but I could not follow anything he taught. I did better just attending recitations and learning through the homework. If you can not learn things without a teacher- choose another professor. Attendance is not mandatory. There is a quiz every single week. Exams are weighted heavily.

He has no sense of direciton in his lectures.He writes random things on the chalk baord with no lesson plans. I tried my very best to pay attention but genuiley couldn't follow along. After the first midterm,I started going to another lectuere,Tony Nance. I wouldnt have passed without him. If you get this lectuer  switch out or just go to another.
The instructor was very challenging and lazy don't take his class !!!

Overall very mid teacher. Not bad not great. Found myself getting lost in lectures because of lack of direction, but still did alright. Seemed to genuinely care about his students and made a few jokes that made lectures better.
I think he is really good at lectures and gives information clearly and explains things well. Grades very fairly and is very understanding. Really funny guy! Overall, a great teacher.

You think this would be an easy class because it's college algebra, but not with this professor. He bases most of your grade off exams. If you even get an 100 percent on hw, quizzes and attendance, it will do nothing. He is a horrible lecturer and only went through like one problem in class. Exams are nothing like the recitations. Don't recommend.

Lectures were on the chalkboard (no PowerPoint presentation, which is a plus) and easy to understand as long as you attend all lectures. Professor is hilarious and respected by his students. He will always help students or lecture extra topics after class. You are also given PowerPoints of each lecture and recordings of each recitation on Canvas.

His teaching style is difficult to adjust to since he uses primarily powerpoints but they are given to students outside of class and he was flexible in adjusting his teaching style when students asked to have him write on the board instead. he cares about his students and is very funny - class not mandatory but i dont recommend skipping often.

Very nice, but a horrible lecture professor. He just talks numbers at you on a slideshow/powerpoint instead of using the board and actually doing the problems so we can see where he got the answers. Very frustrating especially when students have given suggestions like using the board more, he just ignores us.

Okay so math is a subject that you need to write out on the board. Not literally talk numbers at us. He is a nice man but he does'nt write on the board. HE JUST TALKS WITH POWERPOINT SLIDES!!!! That is not how math works. SO I do not think he is fit if you're a visual learner. Good Luck!
The nicest professor I have ever had. He likes to joke and he told my lecture about how he was proud of us all which was honestly just so wholesome.

Dr. Talamo is AMAZING. I struggled BADLY in 1151 and was buckling up for another hard semester. He does an amazing job of teaching the material in a practical way. His #1 priority is getting everyone to have a solid understanding of the material and it shows. Normally I'd rate this class a 5 for difficulty but his teaching is so good it gets a 4.
Talamo is a great prof. You can pretty much fully take the class from home on your own time if you want. Every midterm there are corrections, as well as extra credit opportunities.
Great teacher, makes all lecture material available online. No curve hurts, but the group portion of the class makes it up.

Great professor, actually cares about his students learning the material instead of them getting a grade. Allows cheat sheets and revision for tests, letting you get a good grade and an opportunity to review the material. Put the effort expected for a 5 credit hour course into it and study for finals and you'll get an A.

Jim is a very good professor. He explains concepts very clearly and the class is extremely organized which is very nice. However, this class is definitely challenging and time consuming. There is a lot of work, but it prepares you well for the exams.

Best Math Professor ever. If James teach any other math courses, I will choose him without a second thought. All the hard parts are clearly explained by Jim‘s intuitive lecture notes, which made my study go smoothly throughout this course.

1000/10 

One of the best math teachers I've had in a long time. Makes Calc 2 super easy if you pay attention to the lectures and do all your work on time. Gives good feedback and clarification on concepts when needed and gives priority to actually understanding the topic rather than worrying about your grade for the class.

Extremely understanding and nice professor. Content is hard and notorious weed out but in reality the practice exams are so similar to test and you are given so much review material, If you put in the work you will excel. Midterms and exams might be out of 120 and put in outta 100, boosting grade. Also allows revisions to learn and get upto 20 back

Provides plenty of material including lecture videos and practice problems. You need a good group for team exams and homeworks because they are hell. Exams are very similar to practice exams and revisions allow you to get a lot of points back. Says there isn't a curve but all exam grades are out of 100 instead of the actual amount of points listed.
Great lecturer, teaches hard subject well

Great lecturer that makes difficult content pretty digestible; revisions and extra credit will buffer your grade a ton. Lots of homework that's really easy to cheat on, but not doing it makes the class very hard, so try to do as much of it as possible.

Dr. Talamo gives very little partial credit on exams and his rubrics are extremely difficult. You can get 20 points back but not on the final (worth 25% of your grade). His teaching was terrible. He doesn't teach. He expects you to watch lectures outside of class, adding an entire other course load worth of time onto what he already requires.

Professor Talamo made this class significantly easier than the content actually is. There are online lectures, so you don't need to go to lecture or recitation, but my recitation instructor was very helpful. The instructional team for this class is the best I've seen at the university. Talamo genuinely cares about the success of his students.
actually one of the best professors I've ever had for math
He might be the best professor I've ever had. Absolutely amazing at what he does, and watching his online lectures made me feel actually enlightened.
Professor Talamo is a fantastic teacher - his lectures are engaging and he provides tons of support. Use unstuckstudy alongside the textbook and study sessions for an easy A.
There's a reason he has so many great reviews he's awesome

was very fair and had all his lectures zoomed as well so you didnt have to go in class which was very helpful. Calc 2 as a subject can be hard but he is VERY fair and gives corrections and extra credit on midterms and even the final. Just the take home midterms are very difficult so make sure you give your team a lot of time to complete those.

This class is a lot of learning and cramming lol but he did an amazing job teaching the content. I am very happy to have had him as my professor. Make sure to watch the prerecorded lectures to get a better understanding of the lecture and make sure to do test corrections, they help a lot with your grade. You got this!!
We love Jim! We love Jim! Study, do your revisions, and don't pick bricks for teammates on the group parts of exams, and you will do fine. Also... do the homework... for real. I see you.

Steer clear of courses taught by Victor if you can. I found him cryptic when asking questions, as he sometimes would just tell you to figure it out yourself when you asked him anything at all. Incredibly frustrating course, and a frustrating experience with him at the helm.

Taught things in a very random order, I never felt like I understood how the previous material connected and because of that I struggled. Random group projects at the end of the class that took so much time, but counted for very little of your grade. Took this class in AU2023 and I needed it to get into my major, but I wouldn't take again.

I feel as though I was teaching myself. The lectures were pointless, and I would not have attended if participation were not a part of the final grade. Save yourself the tears and take math 1126 at a community college.

He is caring and has good intentions, but I would get confused from his lectures because he messes up often and so having a good TA was helpful. I mostly taught myself the material. Tests were not bad, the review guides were super helpful. Overall he is fine but get help if needed and do the homework/reviews!

Vic was incredibly kind and caring when I had a personal emergency that caused me to miss over a week of class (the most accommodating instructor I had for sure), but his lectures are often long, over time, boring, and hard to follow. Homework/quizzes are graded harshly- it has to be worded exactly right or you lose points. Hope for a good TA.

I think that Vic is a nice guy & means well, but he often spends the entire lecture going over one basic problem over & over again. Weekly quizzes should be based on the homework from that week, but they almost never cover the same material & the homework isn't even graded before the quiz so we aren't sure if we did the problem right anyways.

Overall not a good prof. Vic seems nice, but he would rather tell bad jokes than actually teach you the material. If you don't have a good TA, the weekly quizzes will be hard. The exams will kill your grade if you have no background in calc. There's not even a point in going to lecture because he messes up the problems more than he gets them right.

Ferdinand is a nice guy who means well, but he's not that great at explaining the material. This could potentially be because this course covers a lot of material in one semester, so it's hard to thoroughly cover it all.
