I'm not a math brain, but I had a good TA and the textbook was very helpful. Do the recommended practice problems from the book!
Run away screaming.
He's literally terrible. He shows up late for class and doesn't even teach. He spent one class just talking about kool-aid. There's one homework assignment and one quiz once a week.

Math 1150/Precalc - skip lecture, go to recitation, do your homework and practice problems. I was blessed with an amazing TA (Greg LeVay) and he taught us the class basically. Vic is not a good lecturer, so skip lectures and just work on practice problems or homework.

Ferdinand doesn't really teach students the material. Even if you go to class, you don't really learn anything. This class takes things you know and makes you feel like you don't know them. In addition, if you have a bad TA it's a mess.

Vic is pretty nice but nice does not mean that he is a good professor He mostly relies on online videos that are posted by the math department which you can watch at home and teach yourself He also makes you do all the recitation worksheets by yourself and tries to glaze over the answers Do not recommend if you have not taken calc before
He often made mistakes in lecture, and a lot of students didn't attend the lectures because of that

Ferdinand is kind of bumbling and disorganized, gets on tangets and goes off topic. Makes a lot of dad jokes, literally always goes over class time. Says "here" and "there" a lot. Definitely see your TA!

Knows his stuff, but doesn't really know how to articulate it to students. Made easy simple problems super complex. After a while I stopped showing up to lectures because they were useless. Textbook, TAs and math learning center was much more helpful. Funny, quirky, nice guy though.

Seems like a nice enough guy, but made my pre-calculus experience harder than in needed to be. Often made mistakes in lecture. Knew what he was talking about, didn't know how to explain it to his students in a concise manner. Would not recommend.

Absolutely horrible. Makes terrible jokes, lectures never ends on time, and makes things a million time more confusing than they need to be. Took him 5 steps to show how to convert radians to degrees. Something simple, which he makes so difficult.
The course is hard.
He made mistakes in his lectures.

Dr. DeBoer is an alright lecturer. He does a decent job of explaining concepts most of the time, but doesn't answer questions that well (but you can do that during recitation as well). 1151 was a insanely difficult class and the graders are harsh. If taking 1172, I wouldn't recommend the lectures as they are basically glorified recitations.

If you have this professor for 1172,  I recommend you not attend the lectures, it is very useless and he does not know how to explain any concepts. I watched pre-recorded videos from the course modules that are from a different lecturer that you should switch to if you can named James Talamo. This course in general is not hard if you want to pass
His lectures were extremely boring and atrocious grading. If you can switch to James Talamo, please for the love of god do so.

Very monotone, boring lectures—that makes it clear he does not want to be there any more than his students. The class itself is not too hard; if you do the midterm reviews and actually understand that material, you should be fine.

Had him for Calc 1 and honestly have no complaints. Went in a little worried because of his reviews but saw nothing wrong. Calc 1 professor doesn't really matter that much, no matter who you have it's the same assignments and tests and Professor Deboer did a fine job at teaching it, so don't let these reviews throw you off.
DeBoer is a terrible lecturer who doesn't explain what he writes down, he just writes. Also his handwriting is terrible so good luck trying to understand new concepts AND read what he writes.

Neil was smart, but an absolute terrible teacher. He couldn't explain things clearly. When explaining straightforward concepts, he'd make them so difficult by neglecting to explain anything he's doing. He's open to questions but sucks at answering them. Be prepared to teach yourself the course. If, like me, this is your first calc course, good luck
I did not like having Neil as a professor. He was not a good professor at all. He went through things very quickly and did not explain very well, in my opinion. Would not recommend.

Lectures were boring, but I felt like he covered the necessary content and material. His handwriting is not the greatest, but not the worst I've seen. He goes through material and practice problems very quickly. In conclusion, not a bad teacher just boring.

Neil DeBoer's teaching is a disorganized mess. He skips crucial content, forcing us to practice example problems with no proper grounding. Even with my background in Calculus I and II, his explanations leave me confused, making this class a nightmare for anyone without prior calculus experience.
Avoid. Would have dropped before the deadline if I knew how poorly taught this section would be.
DEBEOR THE GOAT
He doesn't know how to teach.

Prepared students well for exams and always answered questions in class. Extremely knowledgeable with insightful lectures. Also, had a great grading system which allowed students to complete exam corrections. Overall, one of the best math classes I've taken at OSU.
doesn't seem to know how to teach. very rarely answers questions during class. focuses too much on lecturing rather than helping students

A lot of the problems that people have with him are due to things the math dept. at OSU does instead of Neil specifically. Neil was a good lecturer: he answered any questions that came up and was pretty clear with his examples. I will say that he often did fly through some examples too quickly and didn't explain a lot of things he did in detail.

neil seems like a nice person, but he CANNOT lecture. granted, he was always willing to explain and provide examples if you are confused, but i feel like most of the context was explained in very vague terms and was too fast paced for anyone to actually come up with questions in lecture. without a decent TA, i would have failed.

Calc 2 is a difficult class no matter who you end up having as a professor. I believe Neil did a very good job in his lectures in explaining concepts and always answered questions whenever people had them. In calc 2 specifically, I see no reason for him to be a 1-star as anything unrelated to lecturing is dependent on the math department.

His lectures aren't great, but I don't think he deserves as bad of a reputation. He is always willing to answer questions and do more examples if anyone is confused. He is caring, but boring. I wouldn't seek out another class from him, but it was overall okay. Having a great recitation teacher definitely made the class 10x better.

Dr. Sirvent was extremely kind and caring, one of the nicest professors I've had at OSU. Though, the PDE course was pretty challenging, so I do suggest going to her office hours. Homework was super hard, but the exams were fine. Exam problems and difficulty matched the level of examples from lectures and exam review days.
Maritza is a very excellent professor. She takes care of all the students. I have a good sense in her course!

Homework in this class is way too hard and not covered at all by the lectures. The exams aren't terrible, but there is nowhere to find similar caliber problems of the exam. Definitely avoid this section if you learn by example like I do.
I love Prof Sirvent with my whole heart! She is so energetic and funny, but also delivers the most concise and educational lectures I've ever heard. I wish I could take her again!
She is not a bad teacher but her exams are so random and not covered in class. Minimal curve at the end. Final was impossible.

The thing with Maritza is that she is an amazing person, but a terrible lecturer. Half the time shell forget what shes talking about in class on the spot. She doesnt give any prep or motivation for the kings were learning so things seems out of nowhere. She does make up for it by giving ridiculously easy exams. Some studying will get you A.

We all know partial differential equation is hard, but Professor Sirvent makes it less suffer. Great lecture, great notes. Plenty of homework help you understand. Exams are fair and a little curve will help you get A

I loved Maritza but hated this class. I originally only went to lectures and was doing poorly but I started regularly attending office hours and she was insanely helpful and really good in the one on one settings. Also, once she gets to know you, she will be more than happy to just chat. A total gem.

Maritza is the kind of professor who loves what she does, and wants to help her students be as successful as possible. Her lectures were never dull, and even if the material was somewhat boring she found a way to make it lively.

Dr. Sirvent-Leon is a wonderful professor. She is very clear in expectations, and the syllabus is laid out well. She assigns homework relevant to the exams which is nice. Her lectures are very clear and she is able to communicate material well. Very willing to help you succeed. I suggest also completing problems in back of book. I learned a ton.

As a person, she's adorable and super sweet. Definitely wants you to do well, but the class is pretty rough. You'll be completely lost in the homework, and the book is totally useless. Exams are simplified down to the most basic examples, which saved my grade. Class is taught exactly the same as Lakos's class, so as teachers they're pretty similar.

Great teacher, patient and willing to help for any reason necessary. The class, however, is not very good, and too much time is spent on really easy topics. MATH 2415 could use some work, but the professor is excellent.

Not a very good teacher. She is often unclear in what she is writing on the board and spends the entire week doing a single example that she starts over at the beginning of each class. She is nice though and will help out when you ask.  The Gregory Baker textbook used is absolutely atrocious.

Maritza made this class a lot easier than it could have been otherwise. Always really clear during lecture and uploaded notes online when other lecturers did not. Available to students. I have negative comments about 2415 but not Maritza as a professor. She is teaching this class the best it can be taught, but the book is awful. Tons of homework.

There was too much homework and they were hard to solve. But, the exams on the other hand were very  easy, and this what made this class to be one of my favorites and easiest even though it was not an easy subject. She was very nice and helpful if you asked her.
Good at explaining things, fair class
lectures are not clear. Hard and a lot of homework. The lecture notes were not helping for the homework. and the homework are nor related to what she and the book explain.

She is so adorable and nice! She has an accent, but it does not distract from her teaching. Sometimes she gets a little confused with what she's doing, but she always figures it out. She's a good teacher! Just make sure to take notes, do the homework, do the take home quizzes, go to recitation to take the quizzes, and study! Need textbook to study!
I felt like she was sometimes hard to understand and when teaching she often stayed on one topic for a long time then fly through another. And she often got off topic but she is a very sweet lady
Hardest class I have ever taken. Do not take unless 100% necessary. Tests were impossible, quizzes every week, so much homework. Very difficult to understand.

This is the first time I have ever rated a Professor, and that is usually because my professors so far at OSU have been excellent. This Professor is an exception. BY FAR the worst professor I have had since being here. She doesn't speak good english due to a heavy german accent, and she has the handwriting of my 4 year old sister. Don't take it.

this is the absolute worst teacher i've ever had. just wait till you have a lecture with her. you can never understand what she is saying and her numbers don't look like what she is trying to say. i'm seriously considering dropping out of college because of her
Heavy German accent, not a good pick for lecturer
make sure you study since exams are worth 85% of your grade

Class difficulty wasn't bad. Liu graded by VERY few things. She doesn't curve, so don't expect it. Grading can be very picky. She often paused & asked us Qs during lectures, it can be very distracting. Many students found her to be impatient & easily annoyed if we asked too many Qs. I think it's just her personality, but it truly has to improve.

Her lectures are VERY fast paced, but all good information (could be overwhelming though cause if there's 1 piece you don't understand then the rest of that lecture will make 0 sense). She does want to help students to do good, but sometimes feel scary to approach. Very smart, knows the material well. Class average turned out to be high B+ / low A-

Ah, Robert—truly a master of his craft… if his craft is making students question their life choices. His lectures are the perfect cure for insomnia, and his grading system? A mix of dart throws and horoscope readings. Truly, Robert redefines education… by making sure you learn nothing from him. Bravo, Robert, bravo!
Biased lecturer, gives his favorite students higher grades. No idea how he ended up at yale
Very bad professor, not knowledgeable at all
No Comments
Awesome, extremely helpful, quizzes fair.

Margolis was a good professor would made linear algebra very straightforward and easy to learn. The tests were all very easy, and there was not too much homework either. The class is very focused on the content covered in the lectures so I would make sure not to skip class, but he does upload the notes after each lecture.
A great professor who made the class seem easy. Lectures were clear and the notes he writes are helpful for homeworks. Homeworks and tests were easy.

Plz avoid, if take this class be prepared for lot of outside studying. Vry poor lectures, often unable to answer questions if asked. Good guy, but horrid prof. Vry test heavy, but luckily test is 80% same as prctic exam. Final is hvy, can succeed in class, but need to do lot of self study. Exmples r helpful but not many done in class. Gl w Chao!

Take another professor. He doesn't curve exams no matter if the averages are low, and doesn't even grade all your homework problems, making your time spent on a problem basically useless. He'll assign 10, but will only grade 3 and won't tell you which ones he's grading or not. just be prepared to learn everything on your own.
Dr. Lin was a chiller but the class itself is difficult to teach. The class tries to fit 5 credit hours of content into a 3 credit hour class.

This is by far the worst professor I have ever taken a course from. He often made mistakes when teaching, but never corrected them making the class confused. Purposefully assigned the hardest homework and exam questions. Nobody was able to finish exams on time. Often made comments about hating his job and even was racist at times. PLEASE AVOID HIM!
No curve even though averages were low 70s or 60s.

Lin was a horrible professor. He was nice, but he couldn't teach if his life depended on it. He wasted so much time explaining his prewritten PowerPoint notes that we barely got to the examples. No curves, no extra credit. Midterms 1 and 2 were 50% and the final was worth 35%. Told us to drop the class after the dropping deadline. Avoid!

Get a different professor if you can. His lectures are very difficult to understand and do not prepare you for how difficult the exams are. This is the first time I struggled in a math class. I went to his office hours for help and was told "you just need to understand the math". I'm retaking the class right now with Sharma and have an A no problem

The worst professor I ever has, shows no remorse and told students who are not doing good in the class to just drop it near the end of the semester because it will be "Good for him and us". He doesn't know how to explain things and constantly messes up. Exams are worth 85% of the grade and he will double dock for algebraic mistake.

Not finished with Business Calc yet. This is my first calculus class, so the material is relatively difficult, but Professor Lin does everything he can for his students to succeed. I wish I could give him a 10; he's a super down-to-Earth dude. The class is very doable if you put the time in and attend lectures and some office hours.

This class was absurdly ridiciulous. There were times in class when this professor did the problem wrong and taught extremely important material (almost 1/4 of the exam) three days before. Exams are 85% of your grade and if you do bad on one exam it is difficult to bounce back. If you have him, I recommend taking online through different university
Super friendly and explains topics well. Would definitely recommend

He is an amazing professor and is also very kind and chill. His handwriting and notation is confusing at times but it didn't harm my learning. His practice exams were pretty much the same as the real exams and I think if you attend every lecture and recitation it would be hard to not get close to an A.

Prof Kunz has been one of my favorite lecturers. His handwriting and notation is confusing at times. There were plenty of classes I left feeling like nothing made sense but the following class, recitations, and the online textbook were very helpful. Exams are straightforward and the class is an easy B if you study and attend lecture/recitation.

Was an okay professor, he has a very thick accent and his handwriting is super hard to read. Exams were exactly like the practice, and he posted all of his notes online. We had a few homework assignments, but were super helpful and an easy way to boost your grade. There is a slight curve at the end of the class.

Great professor, definitely cared about your success in the class and how he was able to make his lectures better. The quizzes in recitation were fairly easy and so were the exams. Only complaint is that he usually starts a few min early for lectures and some of the way he writes greek letters are a bit difficult to read.

No one pays attention in the class, it seems like it's his second year teaching at OSU, maybe he is unexperienced. He just talks and points. I've taken SRM before (and failed) but I know for sure you don't need to know Rstudio, but he focuses on that. Litteraly saw a guy falling asleep like in a movie almost every class. He was the only available.

Dr. Li is incredibly knowledgeable and patient with students. The grade is based on weekly homework, 3 midterm exams, and a final exam, and she always reviews before exams. She explains the material well and genuinely cares about students' understanding. She also answers emails quickly and extends office hours. Amazing professor for Diff Eq!

Very kind professor, extremely organized. Everything was thoroughly planned and lectures always made sense and were very clear. Numerous midterms and weekly graded homework gave a nice cushion. Good review guides provided. Really good for OSU math.

Very compassionate professor and a good lecturer. She remembers names, has prizes for participation, always stays after class to answer questions, and answers emails quickly. Only 1 homework assignment a week and the 3 lowest scores are dropped. Very lenient grader. I would recommend anyone who is interested in taking MATH 2415 to take her class.
Very nice teacher, patiently answer all the questions after class.

Weekly homework yet I never got anything graded until November. By that time it was almost too late to save my grade, but lowest 2 homework grades were dropped. Midterms were alright, there was somewhat of a curve. Just confusing lectures but office hours are helpful. However, Foundations sequence is inherently difficult.

Professor Estill said he would curve midterm 2 or add an end of the year curve due to poor results, and he just never ended up doing it. Sent multiple emails throughout the semester regarding grading and never responded to a single one. Does not care about his students and their grades whatsoever. Nice guy, but one of the worst professors ever.

He cares for students and has a good sense of humor. However, his lectures are really dry and hard to understand. He also grades homeworks and tests really slow. He is a very nice grader but that is because almost everybody in the class does not understand what is going on.

Super easy grader, unfortunately Estill is also an incredibly slow grader, midterms were graded over a month after just before the next test. Other than that Estill is a great guy who genuinely likes what he does. He is super helpful although lectures be a little hard to follow, the homework definitely helps to solidify things.
Awesome dude and tests are directly from homework. Just make sure you go to office hours for homework's because graders can be harsh. Really nice guy just go to him and he will help you.

He's a very nice man but not a reliable professor. As others said, very slow grader. Classes were canceled or moved to zoom VERY often, and it was hard to learn online. midterm 2 was graded oddly harshly (no partial credit given at all?). I do appreciate his consideration for international students and he is very helpful in office hours.
Not sure why there's so many negative reviews. He's a solid and nice guy who is passionate about the subject. His lectures are helpful in my opinion. He is also very open to questions.
Super Chill Guy. Very helpful in Office hours. Just study his slides and you should be good to go.

If you haven't taken math in a while, it might be a little of an adjustment. But he is an easy grader and gives easy exams (much easier than HW). Not a good set up for Foundations 2, but super accessible for office hours and questions. Doesn't provide lecture slides until after.

Estill is truly a nice guy, but imo cannot lecture to save his life. The final was also oddly difficult compared to the midterms. Not hard to get an A in this class, but I do not feel like I learned much. Office hours are v helpful, which makes up for the mid lectures.

NEVER answer emails. Not a single thing graded until two days before the second midterm, so we didn't have any feedback to know what we were doing wrong. His lectures were way too focused on proofs, even though engineers don't care about proofs. He taught like a math class when it literally is not a math class. His lecture slides are walls of text.

My major concern is that I didn't know what my grade in the course was until after the final exam was taken because he takes forever to grade assignments. Lectures can be a little difficult to follow, but they do directly coincide with exam material which is helpful. He is a fun person, however I do feel that his lectures could be made more clear

This is the WORST professor I've ever had. He can't teach to save his life and is always off topic. I would go to his office hours consistently and leave feeling even more confused. I ended up bombing all of my tests and considered switching majors, but after retaking the class with someone else and getting an A- I realized he was just horrible.

Did not show up for our final exam and did not grade assignments for the entire semester until eventually grading them for completion nearing finals week. He is a nice guy, but I am pretty nervous for foundations II as I am unprepared and will likely have to self-teach and play catch up

Look, if you take his Foundations I class it's an easy A. But you won't learn a thing and won't be prepared for foundations II. His lectures are abysmal and people perform so poorly on certain exam questions that he doesn't grade them at all. Also, for one of his sections he just didn't show up for the final. He's a nice guy, but is unfit to teach.
Good class overall. Lectures are a little hard to follow and confusing but prepares for exams very well, and is very accesible at office hours.

Estill's lectures were pretty subpar. I felt they were unorganized and I didn't think he did a great job of actually teaching us the content that would show up on homework and tests. But I'll admit that his office hours were SUPER HELPFUL, so if you're ever stuck on homework problems definitely attend office hours and he'll help you out.

Not the best lecture format as he would go through presentations of like 70-80 slides and it wasn't always clear what you should take notes on, but he grades leniently and his office hours were always a huge help

Dr. Estill is overall a nice guy, but a terrible teacher. His lectures consisted of him reading over 70+ slide long presentations and were boring and difficult to follow. Seems to have short term memory loss, often forgetting what he's talking about mid-sentence. One week left in the course and 80% of assignments weren't graded yet. Exams were easy

Dr. Estill goes through lecture material very fast, which can be confusing. The organization of the material got messy in the middle of the course, but got cleaner towards the end of the semester. Dr. Estill is extremely helpful during review sessions and office hours though. You can tell he really cares about his students.
I learned so much from this processor and I would 100% take another math course with her. She is an expert in her field as well as a gifted teacher.
she was amazing!!! i actually took math 1116, but she was so helpful and kind and funny. i would take any of her classes; she's just so good!!!!!

She was by far the best professor i've had at Ohio State, she was very caring about all of her students and would always respond to her emails within an hour or two. What really stood out to me was that she knew every persons name in my lecture hall which was very unique of any lecture i've had. I would recommend going to office hours often.

Never have I ever in any school had such a good professor that cared so much about her students. She is funny and responds to emails immediately, weekdays or weekends. She has no problem spending extra time of her own to meet up with students to help or go over things. She honestly carried the difficult class and made it enjoyable.

She is honestly one of the best professors here. She understands these are hard concepts, and not everyone understands them right away. What impressed me is that she remembers her students' names. Her lectures really help and she's fun! Don't be afraid to ask her questions, even by email, she will help you to make sure you understand.

Marvelous! The BEST math instructor I've ever had. The inverted classroom approach enables you to go at your own pace and ask questions during class with crystal-clear explanations from Dr. Rudman! She will respond to e-mails at pretty much any time seemingly, even late at night. Incredible.
She is an absolute gem! makes sure everyone truly understands the concepts and memorizes everyone's name, even in a 200 person lecture hall.

Amazing professor! You can tell she really cares about her students. She made Calc 3 feel easy because of how well she taught it. She is always willing to talk and help if you need it. 10/10 best professor I have ever had.
Fantastic professor. I would absolutely recommend taking her class.

okay so this was for trig math 1149 but it didnt give me that option to select. but she was amazing!!!! she really takes her time and cares for students. Her exams are exactly what she says they are going to be. No sneaky tricks and she helps outside of class. She has a great caring side about her. just 10/10

Best professor I've had at OSU, I cannot recommend her enough! Great person, funny, and care so much for her students. Lectures were well organized, easy to understand, and had lots of good examples. Weekly homework was sometimes tedious, but prepares you extremely well for midterms and the final (which were always straightforward).

Professor Rudman is literally the best professor I've ever had (and probably ever will have). Calc III is certainly not an easy class, but she explains the material extremely well. She cares so much about teaching and makes sure every single person understands the content. I really hope OSU hires her after her Ross contract ends in a few years.

I wish I could have her for every math class! she makes sure she is teaching everything the best way she can/genuinely wants us to understand everything. The homework wasn't the easiest but over-prepared us for the tests. If you go to the lectures you don't really have to do much outside studying because they're similar to the in-class examples.

The best math instructor I've had. Always willing to help outside of class, phenomenal lectures with great explanations. Homework was fair (if not time consuming), and exams were straight forward and fair. No tricks in this class - you come to class, you do the homework, and you ask questions when you don't understand, you get an A. Take her class!
One of the best professors I've had at OSU and definitely the best I've had in the math department!

Dr. Rudman is an amazing professor and a really nice lady. She really cares about her students. Attendance is not mandatory, but her lectures make subjects easy to understand and are worth it. She interacts with her class and is always available for extra help. There is one homework each week that is pretty long, but the tests are much easier.
One of the best professors in the math department at OSU. Homework is hard but you are allowed wolfram. Exams are straightforward. honestly learned a lot from her and her teaching style.

Could not imagine a better math professor. Interesting lectures, goes out of her way to answer questions thoroughly, and makes sure you never feel stupid for asking a question. Always taught in a way that just clicked. Exams never had unexpected questions or tried to trick you. Cannot recommend enough.
She's one of the best, if not the best professors in the Math department. She's the angel of Math

Legit the best math prof at OSU. AMAZING lectures, makes the content easy to understand and enjoyable. Tests were very straightforward, not trying to trick you or anything. A lot of homework but you get unlimited attempts so its not too bad. Highly recommend her for calc 3!

Not accessible outside of class and office hours AT ALL. Her exams are harshly graded, homeworks are fine but long and tedious. She's very old fashioned and doesn't provide practice exams or study guides or allow cheat sheets. She's a bit intimidating but is nice if you try and ask questions. She could have done more for her students though

Although this was one of the most difficult courses I have taken, I feel like I learned a lot about both Algebra as well as being a better mathematician. Dr. Cueto is a fantastic professor and cares about how her students perform. It is because of this the course was challenging, however if you put in the effort you will do well in the course.

this is your sign if you are reading this to not take this professor. I have gotten an A in every single math class I have taken until I took 3345 with her and failed. She is the most harsh grader I have ever seen and is rude. If you show up to office hours/ask questions she acts mad. She will give you a 0 on an exam question if you miss 1 part.

This course was challenging, but the tests were not too hard. The lectures focus on the theory instead of practice questions. something I dont like: 50% of the final is series (23AU), but the series was only 2/13 of everything we learned. (2) We do not have enough time to review for tests; the Instructor didn't pay much attention on review sections

Avoid at all costs. I already took the equivilant of 1181H and she still manages to make the easiest concepts incredibly difficult to understand. If you take her class get ready for math with no numbers and only letters. Tells us tests will be easier than practice tests but they're actually way harder. Very inaccessible outside class.

Tough but doable. First suggestion- READ THE BOOK. Her lectures are extremely hard to follow at times (not always), but the book covers everything you need to know. If you study the book very thoroughly, you'll be good.  3 exams, 4 quizzes, weekly homework. She gives optional homework questions too- do those when you have the time, or to review.

I absolutely loved having Professor Cueto this semester. Her class was tough -- probably the toughest I have ever taken. However, if you put in the work, you get so much out of it. She really inspires the whole class to love calculus and understand the underlying concepts. Exams were hard and make up most of your grade, though. Would recommend.

Cueto Is a nice person out of class. Her teaching style though seems to lack when it comes to an introductory class. Sometimes lectures are helpful sometimes not. The textbook is a brick wall and the proof she does is not related to the homework/test itself, except for specific types of problems. Self-study and try to work more efficiently in math.

Prof. Cueto was unapproachable. She was clearly annoyed when you asked questions in class. Her exams are unnecessarily difficult. If she is teaching this class, just pass out of it with the qualifying test instead because you will have a terrible time in her class.

Professor Cueto is a really nice professor. Her lectures were decent and the midterms weren't hard at all but for the final it felt like she shot a death cannon at everyone. Averages were an 85% and then the final average was like a 60. Read the textbook along with her lectures and the class is not bad

I found her to be intimidating and difficult to approach. I was afraid to ask questions because I felt that she was being judgmental. If I take another class I'll tale my chances with a different prof

Prof Cueto is very willing to meet with you. She is very understanding about extensions and stuff like that, just make sure to show her that you are putting effort in. Her lectures are very close to the book, but she does a good job illustrating theorems. There's a reasonable amount of homework due about once a week. Overall, great prof!

Overall she was a very forgiving grader on both the homework and the exams. She wanted the whole class to succeed and do well. The first exam was a lil rough, but all the ones after were not hard. She adapted to the classes abilities and the class as a whole was successful.

She is very lecture heavy and I do not find her lectures to be very helpful.  The homework is optional, but to do well you really have to do it.  She provides very few examples (and even the examples seemed pretty abstract to me).  She says the tests are easy, but I did not think so.

Cueto is willing to meet outside of class to answer questions. Teaching is heavily based in theory with few examples (in recitation challenging examples). I had to read and re-read the text to understand. TONS Of HW and tests are challenging and too long.  Noticed several errors in her online keys. I'd avoid.  My class ended up with a big curve.
You have to be the next einstein to get an A in her class

Prof Cueto is one of the most confusing professors I've had to date. She only teaches conceptual ideas and never does numerical problems. If you ask a question in class she talks down to you and never fully explains the topic. Her exams are very difficult and she assigns very long homework assignments. AVOID HER AT ALL COSTS.

Wow this class was awful. she's so robotic when teaching, you can tell she's taking phrases right from the book and she never does examples so you learn nothing in lecture. She also talks to students like they are dumb when they ask questions. Try and avoid having her as your teacher.

Try your best to avoid this professor you will not learn majority of the material because you will be overwhelmed with the way she tries to explain the materials and the amount of homework she assigns

If you have to take this class, i would recommend taking it with another professor. Her lectures are very long and confusing and she doesn't give a lot of examples. I didn't really understand the topics until i did the homework. The homework is also pretty long , and took (at least for me) a long time to complete.
awful TA, wearing a microphone that has no effect

I ended up dropping the class but for the classes I went to, it sucked. Classes were so boring and she speaks very fast and not clear; very hard to follow along with. She also seems unsure of herself for anything she talks about for the most part, otherwise she seemed sweet. Wouldn't recommend though.

Her "teaching" is just standing at the front of the room, mumbling as she works her way through math problems. She's also incredibly rude. She publicly scolds and shames students when they're wrong. She once incorrectly docked points from my assignment, and tried to bully me out of emailing the professor to fix it. So many more examples, DONT TAKE!

She is hard to understand because of her accents. Lectures are her just talking about her pre-written notes. I never went to the lectures and did the notes myself and got an A. The class isn't horrible as long as you study well for the tests and quizzes. Not that many assignments.

Can't understand her, recitation teacher was also awful, her notes are messy and unhelpful. If you want to pass this class ypu have to read the text book on your own. I did tutoring and still failed. Also homework is the hardest part of the class.

A lot of people complain about her accent, but it honestly isn't that heavy. Her office hours are a great resource, and while it's pretty test heavy it's not the end of the world if you do bad on one exam. Uploads online lectures so that you can choose to go or not go to class, and attendance isn't mandatory for recitation or lecture.

She is very nice, but not a good professor. She has a very strong accent and it his hard to understand, also her notes are the messiest notes I have ever seen and it is hard to follow along. Eventually I just stopped going to lectures because it did not help me at all. I would teach myself through the textbook.

I really like the layout of this course. I highly recommend doing the pre-lecture extra credit quizzes immediately after class, because they really help and take 5 minutes to do. The exams were super easy, mostly multiple choice, and the difficulty of the exam questions matched the difficulty of the questions we did in class.

Her lectures weren't helpful to me at all as her handwritten notes were difficult to read and understand. Pretty much stopped going to lectures and taught myself using the textbook. She's a nice person but just not a very good teacher. She does cancel class a lot and there are extra credit opportunities.

I have personal beef with Rachida. She told us we had to memorize 22 formulas for an exam, not wanting to fail I did, and forgot to mention she decided to provide them. Her homework includes a lot of information that we never go over bc she doesn't make them. She he cancels class but fails to let us know, and talks to us like children.

The lectures can be hit or miss, but using resources like Unstuck study AI alongside the textbook makes it doable. Grading is mostly based on quizzes and exams, so staying on top of the material is key. Overall, an average class.

She was a really average professor, to be honest. She definitely wasn't a bad professor, but she wasn't great either, she's just middle of the road. Lectures can be boring and also hard to understand because of her accent, although you do get used to it.

I took Calc 3 2153 and learned nothing from going to her lectures, her accent made it so hard to understand. Her PDF of notes was the only thing I learned from. Exams were kind of out of pocket/not what I expected. When you got 2-3 of the MC questions wrong brought the exam grade down a letter grade. She was friendly though and wanted us to learn.

Dr.Aboughazi is a wonderful person, but her class is difficult. It was 80% exams/quizzes and 20% homework. There was no curve, but 1 quiz and 2 HW's were dropped and there was no cumulative final. Lectures could be very scattered/confusing, but the homework examples on the online platform help a lot. General physics knowledge may help as well.
I thought she was fairly good at explaining concepts and included helpful examples as well as provided multiple practice problems for each exam. The weekly quizzes were kind of annoying but doable.

Lectures can be boring, but there are shortened video forms of the lecture material posted for the entire semester. Doesn't move on until someone provides an answer to her question, she does not answer her own questions typically. Pretty easy to follow notes.
Professor Aboughazi is so sweet and gives plenty of examples during lecture
Lectures are too hard to read and she doesn;t explain topics literally just solves the problems and expects you to put two and two together. She is a very nice person but a very bad teacher!!

She grades literally nothing, the TA's grade every assignment. One time she put in an online Carmen quiz answer wrong and said it was only one point and she won't fix it as it doesn't matter because it was too much work to fix everyone's grade. She doesn't really care. If you're decent at math going into the class you're fine. Ask your TA for help.

She knows what she's doing, however, lectures tend to get boring. Wants students to succeed so if you do your work, you will get an A. There are quizzes every week, 3 exams (including the final), and 1 homework a week.

Lectures were 90% practice problems, so you definitely have to read the textbook and teach the chapters to yourself to actually learn the material. Lecture notes not organized super well and could be difficult to understand. Grades mostly based on recitation quizzes and online exams.
She loves to say the number trillion and she makes no sense whatsoever. She is so confusing. Good luck.
Nah
He was my recitation instructor. He is amazing! His recitations were actually very helpful and he is good at teaching. He is definitely nerdy and a little awkward, but he made the class kind of silly
Horrible Professor. If you end up with her, attend a different lecturer because you will learn nothing.

I didn't have her for a class, she was my advisor unfortunately. Never let me talk, talked endlessly about things I didn't ask, screwed me into taking calculus twice (on top of AP calc i took in highscool), not responsive to emails, makes it hard for me to follow my religion. 

Seriously dislike her, she should be fired.

STAY AWAY!!! All she does is mumble to the board the whole time. She doesn't face the class at all, and she writes way too fast. It's impossible to learn anything from her. I had to rely solely on my TA to pass this class. Don't bother going to lectures, you'll learn nothing.
literally just mumbled to herself the whole time for every lecture. i never actually learned anything in lecture so it's pointless to go. had to teach myself everything.
For your own sanity, do not take this professor.

every lecture she faces the board and mumbles to herself and says yes we know this so then we do this for the whole time no one asks questions because she doesnt look up. Absolutely no notes or calendar. The notes you get are photos she emails of the board hours after lecture.I have to use the book and teach myself lecture is pretty much pointless

do NOT take any class with Barbu if you have SLDS accommodations. I provided my accommodations before the semester started and discussed with the professor before lecture and she would not accommodate me. it was so bad i had to petition to waive math 1149 as a graduation requirement bc i was being denied my right to an equitable classroom.

I genuinely felt like I was going to have an aneurysm in this class. She wrote way too fast, didn't explain topics or label them, and assumed you knew all of the material. I was told that questions weren't for the classroom and to ask the TA but the TA got mad when I asked questions or said they were going too fast.I learned nothing. Switch classes

oh my god...AVOID THIS CLASS. if you can take this class over the summer PLEASE consider. Basically...The whole department is awful. She uses a chalkboard, can never tell what shes writing, no notes that are on canvas. I utilized the textbook and taught myself everything. actually the most horrendous class ever and i did very well in 1148.
Terrible

She flies through material and does not take questions or look at students. I stopped going after the first week. Attending lecture is extra credit. The tests are awful and so are the exams. I tried to teach myself from the book because her and my TA were unhelpful. This class is near impossible to pass. Do not take it if you can.
Did not even look back at students. Stopped going to lectures after the first couple of weeks. TA as a life saver and the only reason I passed the in-person quizzes.
Literally is just talking to herself

Honestly it's not her fault, OSU's math department just sucks for math1148 & math1149. She crammed a lot of info during lecture and went very fast but she does seem very nice when you speak to her 1 on 1. You'll have to rely on your TA if you want to do good. Exams were open book so use google all you want but it's not easy questions.

Steer clear. She wrote and spoke extremely quickly (and mumbled much of the material) and I ended up not getting a thing out of the lectures despite attending every time. No questions were taken. Neither core concepts or the thought process behind what we were doing was explained. My worst academic experience to date.
She turned her back to us the whole time. She spoke very fast and it seemed like she did not want to be there.

Lol. She's nice when talking to her one-on-one, but she literally can't teach. 

1. Like others have mentioned, she has her back turned the ENTIRE duration of class like she's talking to herself. 

2. She talks & writes so fast as if she's in a speeding contest. 

3. She never asks if students have any questions. 

Should I keep the list going...?

shes seems like she doesnt want to teach us. she keeps her back to us the whole time while reading off of a paper. no real reason to even go to lecture you wont get anything. make use of your TA and connect math resources
Nice professor, but goes way to fast to even comprehend lecture material. Your TA is the best way to understand the material.

Literally the worse professor I have ever had. Lectures are pointless. The TA I had was 100x better than the actual professor. Professor doesnt know what shes doing 95% of the time. I had to teach myself everything. Definitely read all the chapters on the midterms and do the practice problems
so hard, a half class cannot pass. most of student will retake.

Very poor at teaching the material. A lot of times it seemed like he didnt even know the material. Often he would start a practice problem, then not know how to solve it and say he would send out the answer later that day.

I had a hard time learning from his lectures and it felt like a lot of the time he was not prepared and struggled to even finish one example problem in his notes. His lectures were unorganized and I had to heavily rely on the recitations and math tutoring services to get me through this course.

I feel bad rating him a 3 because I think he genuinely tries and cares about his students, but his English is not perfect, and he struggles to relay the message sometimes. In addition to recitation, there are thousands of outside resources to help you succeed in the class, though. The exams are standardized and fair. No excuse to not do well.

He is constantly cracking jokes in class which did a lot to keep me engaged and entertained. He is willing to work with students with extenuating circumstances as long as he is informed well enough in advance. His lectures are very detailed and interesting and he always posted the lecture notes. He is am excellent professor I would recommend.
The class is hard if you never learn Cal befor, but the professors is great, he will help you with everything, if you have anything you don't know ask him after class or go to his office hour.

Clear and worthwhile lectures. He posts slides online and says that it's so you don't need to take careful notes, but he sometimes forgets to post them in a timely manner so take good notes anyway. Responds to regrade requests for tests and is a fair grader. Helpful in office hours. Great person who cares about students learning.
Made the lectures interesting. Broke down information in an easily absorbable manner. Very willing to help students outside of class.
The class is very hard, but professor Anup was awesome, go to office hours.

Makes lecture interesting, relates the material to different real life examples, office hours are great. Calc will always be difficult especially at OSU, but he made the class bearable. If you have to take calc to understand another class like physics, I recommend him because he gives very detailed and understandable explanations. Cool dude.

Calculus is hard course regardless, but Anup is a great professor!  He makes calculus content understandable and comprehendible. He has great notes, examples and directions, keeps lecture interesting and is overall a great guy and professor. I recommend taking 1151 with him.
I love Anup

There weren't fill in the blank slides given you had to write what he wrote down. Most of the time you couldn't even see what he was writing cuz his hand writing was impossible to read. Half way through the semester went to a different professor's lecture. AVOID HIS CLASS IF YOU CAN'T DECODE BAD HAND WRITING.

Anup is actually an amazing professor, guy is super knowledgeable and makes jokes during class that keep lecture entertaining. It's easy to pay attention and he makes lots of connections to previous material so you always understand the WHY as well as the HOW. If you pay attention, you will learn a lot.

Really great at reading the room and asking students their opinions on the material being covered in lecture. Very available for questions outside of class during office hours. Makes great analogies and jokes during lecture that help students think about math in a different way.

good sense of humor, but man, calculus is not easy. 

confusing at times, but i could have utilized office hours and i chose not to :p

He kept class interesting by joking around and connecting back to old lessons. Lectures always seems to build on each other as the semester progressed. The material was hard to understand at times, but studying outside of class, practice problems/exams, and attending lecture were super helpful and important.
Good lectures that don't go crazy fast and are good about tying back previous concepts. Likes to interact with the class and make jokes to keep the lecture interesting.

Overall great person and professor. Cons are he has in cases a thick accent that makes hard to understand him, and he moves at a very fast pace expecting that all students know the material. But other than that he has a good sense of humor and trys to keep students involved.
Goes through material fast which keeps you engaged if you keep up with it. Very chill, runs good office hours, would take again.

Amazing professor!! This class is pretty difficult and the homeworks/take home exams can take hours on hours, so be prepared to put in work. However, he is super super helpful in office hours or over email and will really sit to help you understand a problem. Would say he is a pretty fair grader also! Would definitely take him again

It's a little bit late to evaluate but awesome professor! Extra office hours make your life easier. 
The material is hard to understand, but he is always ready to answer your questions. 
You really learn stuff.

Very nice professor, and very knowledgable of the subjects. He was very helpful in office hours and tries his best to make sure everyone did well. His tests were fair and he was generous with the partial credit. His lectures are interesting, but he had a tendency to write every single word and it made his proofs take longer than needed sometimes.

Such an awesome professor! I actually enjoyed taking MATH 3345 with him. Knowledgeable about math but not condescending. Engaging lectures and very understanding and down to earth with students. He's aware that the class is hard but tries to make success achievable. Exams were fair and I felt he gave us the material to be prepared for them.

Lectures are just alright - they weren't too helpful for me, but they weren't really bad per-se. XIMERA Textbook readings are assigned along with the lectures (usually due the day after a lecture) and that's what got me through the class best

Fun professor to have, at some points over complicated things but besides that was great. Not much is up to him since OSU makes 1151 more challenging for no reason. Be prepared for midterms those are curveballs compared to the practice ones given by the department.
Despite looking he just got out of bed he knows his stuff and can be a pretty funny guy.
He is probably the best math professor you'll have all of college. Lectures are very helpful and I recommend going even though they aren't mandatory

Honestly, the course is the same for all the professors—the same lessons, tests, and homework. However, Prof. Katz is the best lecturer for this class at OSU. He has a low rating, but that's based on things he can't control, the class is going to be hard regardless of whoever you choose. He lets you ask questions if lthe ecture finishes early.

He was funny, and I will give him credit for that; however, that is it. He consistently made mistakes and stumbled over himself, constantly confusing not just the class but himself in the process. If you took calculus before, and your TA is good, you should be okay. The midterms are what you need to look out for. Awful with communicating.

Katz is alright. He delivers the content well and can be funny, but he tends to mess up in lectures and say "you get the gist, let's move on". Class felt a lot easier since I had taken AP Calc in HS, but if you didn't so long as you pay attention in recitation (and have a good TA, I didn't), study the practice exams, and attend lecture you're fine.

Justin is a chill dude but he is not a great teacher. I didn't take calc in HS so the entire semester I was teaching myself. He overcomplicated everything and the lectures all made no sense. Im normally good at math but smth about this class made it terrible. The concepts themselves were not hard but the grading was so strict and my TA was awful.

Katz is mad funny. He always seems like he's had a long night of drinking and crying before every lecture. 1151 is not all that bad as long as you study a decent amount for each midterm. Also, remember that all of your real midterms are harder than the practice midterms.

He's a great guy, but honestly the way he teaches never stuck with me. I attended almost every lecture and payed attention, but I still got very confused. I unfortunately did not take a calc class in high school, so I had to teach myself a lot. My TA was also no help, so I had to do a lot of self-studying. I barely passed, it was HARD.

He's a great person but a terrible professor. If you want any chance of success in this class (if you didn't take calc in highschool) you're going to need to teach yourself. He often gets confused and his TA Alexander Habib was also always confused. The way he teaches differs from the way the exams are graded.

Professor Katz' way of explaining concepts does not make sense to me. On top of that, he makes constant mistakes in his practice problems during the lectures. Luckily, I took calculus in high school, but if you didn't, good luck in his class. Very test heavy and bad explanations. My TA was also awful so maybe a good TA would make it manageable.

He's a great guy and gets too much hate. The class is designed to be difficult and is unreasonably hard, but he honestly made it much more manageable and bearable. I'd definitely take another class with him.

Had him for an 8:00am lecture - which isn't the best to begin with but was doable. I've taken calc previously in high school, and the way the department teaches calc is really confusing even to me. If you're reading this as a student wondering if you should take credit for 1151 or retake it, I'd recommend to take the credit and take 1172 instead.

Would not take this class with him again. Math 1151 is already pretty hard, but I would say Katz makes it harder. He makes mistakes often in lecture. Very tough grader and overall, just not the best teacher. The way he teaches can be hard to follow and understand in my opinion. A lot of your time will be spent relearning material outside of class.
Very energetic, great personality (most of the time), and a great teacher.

Really cool prof just a subject OSU makes too difficult. Not the best teacher but still learned things decently from him. Be ready to learn some things on your own time. 5 midterms and a final, 1 midterm gets dropped. Practice midterms to study are not like the actual midterms at times but that's just the math department at OSU.
n/a n/a n/a n/a
Linus Ge is my goat. Justin gets too much hate.
Taught the course like everyone took calc in high school, but still was a chill guy. TA Dennis however...not so chill.

Really a bad lecturer, extremely unclear. You can tell he knows what he's doing but is so so bad at explaining things. I got through it by skipping lectures. Just read the textbook, watch some videos online and study hard for the exams which are the vast majority of the grade. Grading is lenient and his review guides basically mirror the exams.

Makes this class way harder than it has to be. He teaches like a graduate class, exams are a race against the clock, no point in showing up to lecture (about 1/3 of my class does, I am one of them), no curve, 45% final exam 30% midterm 25% tedious weekly homework. His lectures don't correlate to anything, homework won't prep for exam. Don't take it

Really cares about linear algebra and a super nice guy but not the best at communicating it. Lectures are kind of useless because he just does proofs and abstract concepts and he barely gives any examples. not much homework but very loosly align with his lectures. Tests are hard but his sample exams are almost identical to the actuals exams.

Honestly if he didn't give us so much homework then I wouldn't be rating this class so low. The textbook is pretty ok at explaining stuff, proofs do get somewhat confusing though. I also wish the homework had less proofs.

He takes no care in explaining concepts, with abstract examples/definitions with no simplifications to help. He talks too fast for information to digest as well. HW does not line up with his lectures, sometimes touching on topics he discusses the next week over. He genuinely loves linear algebra but cannot communicate that love to others.

Yao's vast knowledge extends beyond textbooks. He introduces improved proofs and offers extra help outside class. His review sessions and study guides aid exams, making challenging material manageable. Can talk fast in lectures, would recommend following his logic rather than taking notes, as he posts all his lecture notes after lectures.

Solid professor for analysis, explains the theory well and was able to answer questions satisfactorily. Homework's not too hard but does require you to think hard and/or go to office hours, for the most part definitely harder than proofs done in class.  Spent a lot of time on exam reviews, do think could've done it more rigorously/learn more stuff.

To put it bluntly, Yao was the worst math professor I have had. He spoke way too quickly and incomprehensibly during lecture and his hand writing was extremely difficult to read. His examples were very unhelpful and had a very difficult time answering students' questions clearly. You would be better off learning through the textbook on your own.

Nice and smart guy, but not a good lecturer. Sped through lectures with lots of complex, unhelpful examples and concepts Also was not very well organized, gave us the wrong (more difficult) midterm 1 and an excessively difficult final (both were then curved, but not enough IMO). I learned 99% of material from the textbook and practice exams.

I really wish I could give Yao a better rating, because he is a nice, caring, and smart person. Unfortunately his way of teaching is very confusing, and I found myself lost more often than not, having to rely on the textbook and YouTube videos to learn. I think with experience, he will become a better professor, but for now, I wouldn't recommend.

BFR don't take Linear Algebra with Liding, he will only lessen your understanding of the content with a combination of bad handwriting, poor word choice, useless abstract examples, inconclusive answers to student questions, and the inability to explain basic concepts.

A nice guy, but introduces concepts in a very poor manner. Introduces variables, and words that nobody in the class is familiar with and fails to elaborate on them. You're basically lost in the class until the practice exam comes out (which is very similar to the actual exam). No curve either. I don't know how anyone got an A.

Prof Yao is incredibly smart and caring, but he cannot teach. His lectures are disorganized and incomprehensible, and the examples are complex not relevant. His practice exams are EXACTLY like the actual exam, which is the only thing that will get you through this course, but other than that the students do not know what is going on in the class.

Legitimately probably one of the worst teachers I've ever had. I've never seen a teacher so woefully unprepared to teach a course. For the first Midterm, he gave us the WRONG exam and his lecture notes were nearly unreadable. This may explain why his lectures are disorganized and only consist of abstract examples and theories.

This may be the first semester that Liding Yao has taught Linear Algebra, but this class has been nearly impossible without reading the textbook. Yao's lectures are mid at best, and his notes are nearly unreadable. He is an unconfident lecturer and should take some time to learn how to teach better before he has any more sections of Linear Algebra.

Professor Booby is a really good teacher who supported students to ask more questions during the class. I'll recommend the TA Mejia Cordero Julian, his office hour always help me to figure out issues.

Dr. Ramsey truly cares about teaching and making his students learn. His standards-based class does seem difficult at times, but it does set help set a clear path of what exactly you should do to get the grade you want. His office hours are greatly helpful. Lectures are unconventional and involve very important group activities and discussions.

Dr. Ramsey has been the best professor I've had as a freshmen at OSU because he's genuinely willing to help you succeed in the class. Also, he has helped me a lot throughout the semester class and he responds to your emails in less than 2-3 hours which is awesome when you're solving problems and have questions. Overall, I'll suggest him for Calc 1.

Professor Ramsey is an excellent lecturer, along with my TA Juan Pablo De Resis. Both are extremely friendly to student and responds to emails very quickly. Professor Ramsey always posts recordings of lectures, complete notes, and many many practice exams to help with the review process. Best Calc 1 teacher here at OSU in my opinion.

The class is organized, and he teaches very well. However, he is arrogant and does not reply to emails at all, so do not bother to email him for problems you have. He does not accept any kind of responsibility for his TA(graders) and It has a tough grading role,

I took MAth 1140 to get a deeper understanding of calculus as an engineer. While he gives okay lectures and multiple homework quizzes per week, he wasn't a very hard teacher. He and the TA are very different graders and your grades on exams and written homework will reflect that. Also, he continues to post practice assignments without answers.
Amazing!!!!!

Very thoughtful professor but tends to go through lecture material extremely quickly. If you get stuck on a concept make sure that you learn it before the next class or you will go down an endless rabbit hole of having to learn the entire sections before the exams. Lots of midterms but not worth that much of your grade.

Great instructor. Spells everything out for you and will help you learn. Homework is easy and tests can be difficult. The hard part isn't the math but you must explain everything and show ALL work, you can't skip steps or use alternate methodology, you MUST use what was discussed in lecture.

Bobby makes sure to teach you everything fully and does a well job doing so. However, you will almost undoubtedly lose points for not wording things the exact way he wants you to and take away points for reasons outside of math.
I am not good at math actually, but prof Ramey makes it easy to understand. If you need to take 1151 in OSU, I strongly recommend you to take his class.
Great Calc I professor. It's 1151 so expect the class to be hard and a lot of work. Overall, Ramsey made the content easy to understand.
Pretty good class, tough but doable, the professor makes it easier to understand but it was a struggle for sure. Tests aren't anything like the in class work or homework though.

Clear lectures, straightforward exams. As a person, Bobby is definitely rude and thinks hes better than his students. But at the end of the day, that doesnt really matter for a college course, so Id recommend. Just dont ever ask for help or clarification, go to the TA (much nicer!!).

I took his flipped-and-flexible version of Calculus 1 and enjoyed it. It is extremely nice for people who can't attend a 1 hour lecture multiple times a week and need to work on their work throughout the day.

He's straight to the point and clear in every lecture. I recommend you take Math 1140/1141 because you learn at a much more reasonable pace when compared to Math 1151 (you learn the same content over 2 semesters instead of one).

Prof Ramsey said on the first day that this was the first and last time we would ever see him. Assigned flipped & flexible modules for our lectures so basically had to teach ourselves everything. 12 assignments due every tues/thurs and exams/worksheets due Mondays. Recitation is pointless but attendance is graded (only reason people show).

There's a LOT of homework and typically the homework is nothing like the exams. Prof Ramsey is a good lecturer and he explains things well however don't ask questions because he's very condescending when answering. The exams have sample midterms that are usually very similar so I would practice those.

We have not seen this guy once this entire semester, the only teacher we see is the TA. The course is terribly organized and heavy on pointless online homework instead of more class time. It is very hard to learn anything in this calculus course and the grading is terrible on the written homework and the frequent midterms.
Bobby is super condescending when you ask questions. The lectures are very simple and straightforward, but the midterms dont really relate sometimes. He is definitely rude though.

Lots of theory, LOTS of homework. Tests are fairly easy, usually pulled directly from hw, but you will need to memorize 2-3 proofs for each and be skilled at homework examples. His lectures are okay but he is super helpful if you ask the right question. Overall, I love Dr. Falkner and hope to take another class with him in the future.

He's a nice guy but his teaching sucks. He spends almost the entire lecture writing out proofs, and rarely gets around to teaching us how to actually solve the problems he assigned for homework, and even when he does his explanations are lacking in vital information. If you didn't take AP Calc BC, you will struggle. The textbook is as bad as he is.

Falkner is a very kind and passionate professor, but PLEASE don't take this class unless you have calc 2 experience and want a challenge. The new material was taught poorly (focused on proofs) and HW was overly complex and took hours to complete each night. The textbook doesn't help. You won't know your grade until after the semester ends.

Professor Falkner requires us to memorize some analysis content, but memory does not require understanding. This is very unfriendly. Overall, this professor's lecture was good and I learned a lot. A little reminder, for any freshmen who want to learn real math, just take 4181H and don't waste your time on calculus.

He is a nice professor! Generous on giving extensions even if the reason is today is my birthday lol. But he is a tough grader, caring details and wording a lot. However, the curve is also big, so overall your grade won't be bad. He also gives bonus questions as extra credit. Recommend him!
g

All the homework is in the textbooks, but finding its solution online is hard, so you have better solve it as early as possible. However, his test is not quite tricky since there is always a makeup quiz for each midterm exam for everyone, and he will give positive feedback for each question you ask. A strict, humourous, and kind professor.
He's good at what he does, but it's a difficult class.

If you want your semester to be easy to get an A, don't choose Neil Falkner. but he is a very serious and demanding teacher to his students. I did all his bonus problems and reviewed them carefully, but I still lost a lot of points because of mistakes in details. But I think Neil Falkner is generally a serious and responsible teacher.

Average/Median for both midterms was in the 50%range. Having nearly finished my degree he is the toughest grader I have come across. You need to attend class because he does not post his material online or record lectures. You need to enter the exams knowing exactly how to do the proofs on there,he will give you a zero on questions for very little.

Did not do anything to improve the class average of 50% for both exams and said "we weren't doing enough" or "pulling our weight". Was passive-aggressive when students asked questions at times. Takes almost all points off for grammatical or spelling errors. Would stand in front of the board so it was hard to see what he was writing

Class averages for midterms were 50% and instead of helping he told students that they needed to "pull their weight". If you make a typo or forget a small logic statement he will not hesitate to give a zero for a midterm question. Not very helpful to students and overall has the opinion of you either pass or fail.

Professor Falkners probability class was the most unpleasant math course I took at OSU, and this includes a class taken by a different professor who would insult students to their face. 80% of the grade is exams, and he grades super hard. An 80% is an A in the class , to be fair, but I spent hours studying for exams and got screwed by minor typos.

Dr. Falkner was a pretty good professor. I didnt take BC Calc, so I struggled for being so far behind my classmates. Dr. Falkner didnt usually teach the material, often opting to take deep dives into theory. He expected that we knew the material, and I did not, which made the class hard. The textbook was also very confusing sometimes.

I love Neil Falkner! While I found that a lot of times his lectures were not super helpful for me when doing actual homework, if you're stuck he's always available during office hours to help you out and explains everything really well. He grades exams really harshly, but there's a really nice curve at the end of the course!

A legend, honestly. For lack of a better phrase, this class slaps. His lectures are easy to follow and hes available at his office long past his official office hours. Tests are hard, but thats to be expected. Theres no Carmen course for you to check your grades on, but its easy to calculate with a spreadsheet.
Great class and professor; would recommend. That being said, somewhat harsh grading, and as others have mentioned you have to either see him in office hours for your grade or calculate it yourself.

He was very irresponsible in teaching Honors Complex Analysis. He got caught up in technical points for summing series and neglected to teach us much actual, you know, complex analysis. I don't think his class was adequate for a strong undergrad program. When I looked at Berkeley's prelims, I could do all everything but the complex.

He's one fun, entertaining guy. When he gets really excited, he takes out a prop mallet and hits himself over the head like a living cartoon character. That, alone, is worth the price of admission. A real character!

Doesnt use a carmen page so youll have to manually calculate your own grades. Has office ours everyday and it always accesible by email. Very kind and understanding of when you forget your homework or have any questions. Doesnt tell you but he curves your overall grade. Overall a very kind man.

Make sure you understand all the concepts on the homework. I didn't, so that's why I got a B. Use his office hours to clear up your understanding of the concepts. His lectures are decent, but the exams are very conceptual and demand a lot of understanding and practice to do well.

He is a good professor who has a true passion for the material. The homeworks are long, but they really help you understand the material. Make sure to participate in class, because it may help you if you are on the edge of the grading scale at the end of the semester.

Generally ok/good lectures and are helpful in office hours. Respectable mathematician.

HOWEVER, there is no TA nor recitation for this class. The prof has 2 office hours a week for BOTH sections that are always packed and that is it. No study guides, no practice finals, not accessible for questions.

An amazing lecturer who is always open to answer questions and re-explain things during the middle of lecture. His Linear Algebra class is quite hard but it is very fair in my opinion. The midterms and final are heavily based on the homework and examples from lecture. Only grades are homework and midterms and sometimes homework is super long.

Not an option but I took 4530. Anyways, I went to almost every office hours and it barely improved my grade.  I ended up purchasing chegg just because of this class. Even after purchasing chegg I still didn't get the grades I wanted. Tests are too hard and can have content that wasn't reviewed. For second midterm I got 57% and was above the mean.

- His accent takes a little getting used to
- He doesn't record lectures
- He doesn't take attendance
- He doesn't use slideshows, only the chalkboard

Dr. Huang knows the material and teaches it well, but he doesn't do a good job of creating a relaxed atmosphere during lectures. People are nervous whenever he asks a question to the class.

He does not offer any recorded lecture videos or notes on Carmen, but he does not take attendance as well, which means you have to attend his in-person class EVERY TIME or you will miss something covered. Exams are extremely difficult and the avg is only 50% and you need to pay extra much more effort for this 3 credit course. Again, VERY HARD.

Math 1152: Calculus 2. Applied Math student here. He is the nicest Professor I have taken at OSU, but the DAMN COVID-19 broke out in March 2020. I could definitely reach an A if is in person!! He prepares for every lecture carefully. Really willing and accessible to help students after class. I would definitely rate a high score for Prof. Huang.
he's always willing to help students
Professor Huang gives very clear and concise lectures. The homework can be challenging but he is very helpful in Office hours. Almost always ran out of time on test.
His accent was very thick, but I got used to it as things went on. While he may not explain things clearly, he knows his stuff and is always willing to help.

Exams are extremely difficult and given not enough time. Exams are basically entire grade. Lecture is hard to understand due to his accent. Exams graded very hard. Hardest class at OSU. Had an A in Math1151 (calculus 1) and now a C- in Math 1152 (calculus 2)
Super nice and caring professor who teaches a difficult class, he seems to genuinely enjoy teaching and he is super funny

My biggest problem with Prof. Huang's teaching was a lack of resources. No feedback on homework, no practice tests or solutions to study. I had to buy a subscription to Chegg for the sole purpose of giving myself practice problems for the final. His lectures are okay but he can sometimes be sassy when you ask a question.

Professor Huang's calc 1 lectures are by far the least interactive among all the other professors, by comparison to my peers. He essentially only does practice problems on the board with little to no conceptual explanation. Additionally, the tests are not graded in accordance to quiz grading standards which makes it difficult to know what to expect

Calculus 1 was the hardest class that I have taken in my entire life so far. I did not really enjoy my professor either because he didn't really make the lecture interactive. Lecture normally consisted of him giving definitions and working questions on the board. Recitation, however, was very interactive and helpful. Be prepared to work very hard.
I am not criticizing his intelligence. He is very smart and knowledgeable about the material, perhaps TOO knowledgeable... I did not pass his class and ended up having to retake 1151 during Sum19.

Professor Huang is a pretty decent professor, and he explained the material relatively well. That being said, the subject is a little complicated and you definitely have to put in effort yourself. Don't buy into their being a big curve, we only had a curve of roughly 1%, and definitely read the textbook. Homework is graded very tightly too.
This guy is self obsessed and thinks he's better than you. Most professors I give bad reviews to are just bad at teaching, he is a bad person

Loads of homework assignments every week! Lecture-wise, he's not good. He moves very fast, and he doesn't explain well either. Any substitute lecturer I had in his class was always better than him. Test heavy! I've taken 5 midterms and then the final at the end of the semester. Please avoid this guy if you can, if not, go to tutoring.
run!

AVOID!!! His explanations made no sense and then he gets mad at people for asking questions during lecture. Lectures, recitation, and the textbook were all useless when preparing for midterms because he never taught the content well (if at all) in the first place.

The class was difficult, but I found the lectures very helpful (exams are modified HW problems and he says exactly what to know in class reviews.) Just read the book, go to class, and try the HW problems once before googling answers. I'm an Econ major who hadn't taken Calc in 3 years, so you'll be fine with some honest effort. Curved a good bit.

It's unnecessary how hard he makes the exams. The averages for both midterms were a 56% and 64%. Very conceptual question based professor, especially on the exams. Gives little partial credit and class is very heavy on the exams (for instance the final is 40% of the grade).
