lecture, HW, textbook, himself, none of them would be helpful to your exam, and he even won't give you any sample exam b/c he thinks' you guys need to learn and understand and all the practice problems are not helpful at all, so if you want some fresh experience about how bad a class can be, choose him, he won't let you down

Lectures are horrible and unhelpful, especially when trying to do the homework. I had to learn the material online (the book wasn't great either), and I still didn't understand the lectures. Do not take this class if you have any other options!

Overall nice guy and decent lectures but he does not teach anything that is on the midterms. The midterms make or break your grade so if you have him, you're gonna have to teach yourself the material or you will fail. Have fun if you're stuck with him.

Math 1151 is a hard course. However this professor was especially challenging because he didn't cover content on the midterms. The midterms make or break your grade so you cannot afford to do bad on them if you want a good grade. However this professor did not teach me what I needed to know to succeed, I had to teach myself the whole course.

IF YOU GET THIS PROFESSOR FOR MATH 1151, SWITCH OUT. I'm not kidding, I worked my butt off for class and I still ended with a C+. The lecturer taught content that was NOT ON THE MIDTERMS and considering the midterms have such a heavy weight, it sent my grade to hell. He was a bad teacher and I had to teach EVERYTHING to myself. Save yourself.

He was always very engaging in lectures despite the large number of students. He frequently used TopHat and a thumbs up/mid/down system to gauge the students understanding. He also provided worksheets and had a "pet of the day" at the beginning of class featuring a students submitted pictures!
He cares about how we interpret his content and is very open to feedback and adjusting to his students

Dr. Szczesny makes MATH 1172 very approachable, and does an amazing job teaching concepts in a way that gives you an understanding as to why they work. The class has a focus on actually learning the concepts over getting the grade, with exam corrections for half-credit back instead of curves. Would highly recommend for 1172

I had him as a TA and professor for 1172 and it was beneficial to me because I could ask him to explain the lecture content during recitation. He wants the best for his students and cares about us learning the content. He likes to show off his cats and his students' pets.

michelle seems like a nice person, but personally i didn't love her lectures. they were all very boring and she would often breeze through examples but spend lots of time talking about the random studies she was using in class. not too bad though, just pretty boring and uninteresting.

Dr. Everson was the sweetest and most caring professor I have ever had! Especially for an online class, she was SO communicative and checked in weekly to let us know she was there to help. Her lectures were great to watch and she illustrated every concept in a great way with a lot of examples to go through. I would 1000% recommend taking her class!
Very easy class and team of lecturers are very good.

I really enjoyed Professor Everson's class. I liked the way that the class was set up and how she graded things. Her lectures were great to watch and she gave plenty of examples in case a concept is unclear. She emails about once a week to ask how everyone is doing and is overall so sweet! 100% would recommend her.
Weekly in-person recitation to work on a lab assignment. Weekly asynchronous work includes some reading, normally 2 lessons, and an online homework. Open-note, noncumulative midterm and final.

I took it from Ms. Wenxin Du (lecture) and Mr. Jake Roberts (recitation). The class is super easy and the teachers are pretty nice. You only need to attend the recitation and there are only two assignments every week (both pretty easy only take like 20 minutes). You can miss 3 recitation, one lowest-grade lab&quiz will be dropped. TAKE THIS CLASS

Dr. Everson truly cares about her students and wants to see them succeed. I was dreading taking a math course, but Dr. Everson made it very easy and offered so much help and resources outside of class. It actually ended up being my favorite class of the semester! Definitely take this class with her if you can!!

The class was asynchronous, but Dr. Everson tried to get to know people and was always available if need be. She sent very kind emails and carmen messages. The material is fairly straightforward and the exams were not difficult.

I loved taking stats with Dr. Everson. She is so caring and willing to help. She made stats not as scary as I imagined since I am someone who is not good at math. The homework was not hard and is very manageable. I liked the way this class was structured and the lectures were engaging and she made sure to tell us why the info is important.
If you're taking STATS1350, then you 100% should take it with Dr. Everson. She is an amazing lecturer and always makes it very clear that you can reach out to her for whatever.

Lectures can be long, but the textbook should work fine on its own. Very nice and cares about you understanding the material, and frequently checks in to make sure everything is explained clearly. Feedback is thorough so you know where to improve. Exams are not too different from regular assignments. I suck at math but this class was great!

Professor Everson is one of the best professors I have ever had. She is so kind and understanding and responds to help on emails quickly. Her lectures were very clear and engaging and her practice study exams helped a lot. She has a passion for her students and I would highly recommend her.

I absolutely fell in love with this professor. Her lectures are not just to talk about random things, but actually goes according to the homework and exams. The midterm practice exam was very similar to the actual midterm exam, same with the final. She is great at teaching. One of the best I have had since attending OSU!

Professor Everson was an amazing professor! She is such a caring person, she emails students each week to make sure that everything is going good. Her lectures are very easy to understand and she explains the material well. If you review the lectures and the example problems in the lecture notes, you will go just fine on exams and homework.

Prof Everson's course was extremely well organized and easy to navigate. She made Stats interesting, accessible, and applicable to the real world. I truly loved learning from her and was so touched she took the time to send personalized messages to every single one of her students. Her lectures were relaxing (she has an extremely soothing voice!).

She was such a great professor. Honestly she was the only professor who truly took the time to reach out to me and check on the class throughout the whole semester. She was super understanding. The class was an Easy A. Labs and Homework are due every week, but they were super easy if you watched lecture. Exams were very easy too.

Professor Everson is an actual angel. She emails students weekly to remind them of assignments, and checks in on us to see how we are, which is especially important in a pandemic. Her exams are open note, and when Carmen went down unexpectedly she worked to help fix the problem and gave us all extra credit due to the stress. 100/10 do recommend!

Prof. Everson is seriously so nice and caring. I took the class online bc of covid and she took time weekly to check in on her students personally. I never expected that. The class can be difficult if you aren't the best at math (me) but she has plenty of office hours that are very helpful. The TA's were helpful as well.

I am taking Stats 1350 with prof. Everson this semester, and she has just been so wonderful. Despite my course being completely online and asynchronous, Prof. Everson makes the course personal and values her students. She offers lots of Zooms throughout the week with herself and TA's to get extra help. I wish I had more classes to take with her..

It seems like he's turned a new leaf in comparison to his old ratings. The class is straight forward. He only lectures on a chalk board so while attendance is not mandatory, you should go. He still arrives just on time still, but he is prepared when teaching. Each lecture he covers the concept and goes over good examples from the book. I liked him.

Prof. Lafont is not a someone that you want to have as a professor. He is a tough grader and his lectures are very hard to follow. It seemed like he was only there because the university was making him. It was pretty clear that he would much rather be doing research than teaching.

Prof LaFont made an effort to teach but he should really stick with his research... lecture was pointless and extremely unorganized! Pray for a good TA! Also, be prepared to get difficult exams that do not resemble any problems from class... that is if the prof decides to show up. Have fun learning the class from your TA and the textbook!

Does lots of in-depth examples, but as a result doesn't cover all the material he should. What you do learn, you know well, but overall had a bad experience. Shows up late and lectures until whenever he feels like (no bells in our building). First couple quizzes were really tough. The exams will cover things you've never discussed in class.

If you get this professor, drop the course or get a section change. I repeat, drop the course or get a section change. Tends to lecture into the board and prove every single formula given. If you have a good TA, you can survive the course, but if not, DROP!!!
TERRIBLE!!!  Never gave out practice exams and his lectures are worthless.

Horrible.  Has a huge fetish with proving everything.  We didn't cover the entire last chapter.  Useless lectures, useless recitations that everyone skips, tests that don't correlate with stuff covered in class.  Avoid.  Our final had one problem worth over 25% of the final - we spent one-two days on it in class.  Godawful teacher.
Very smart proffesor, really knows his stuff. The class is supposed to be challenging but his explanations of things are very thorough so it makes it somewhat less challenging.

I had him for both of my calculus classes, and he is utterly useless. Expect to spend endless hours at the MSLC to fully understand the material with him. No accent, although by the name you might expect it, but a horrible teacher. Does not get anything across clearly and only proves everything.
Definitely not a good Lecture Teacher, unless u like writing a book of notes every class that doesnt help to learn the topic!

Writes literally everything he says on the board. He has a million "remarks" and proofs. Not very clear in his explanations. Going to class doesn't help at all. Odd man- smokes his cigarettes holding his pack of chalk.

Ok so he has a few words that he just loves to use (i.e. remark, note, this gadget etc.)... but I still learned a lot from his class.  If you don't like reading the text, go to class and he basically reads it to you which isn't always a bad thing.  Be optimistic!
I could have skipped class, only read the book, and gotten the same grade.  He doesn't actually do anything I would call "teaching."

He wrote down everything he says, which was quite annoying, but at least he covered everything. Most people never came to class, and the ones that were there usually fell asleep. Nice curve on the course though... I managed to get an A in the course with an 85%.
If i hear the work Remark one more time, i might scream. He just rewords everything out of the book, including proofs. If you have him, at least try to get a good T.A.
No Comments

Let's just say that if I wanted to write every word that came out of his mouth, I would.  He doesn't need to do that for us.  He could probably be a good teacher, except for the fact that he just restates things.

This professor explains things as if one is reading out of the text book.  He fails to serve as a bridge between the advanced reader and the layman.  Furthermore, the use of powerpoint with an overhead projector is extremely useful, but for some reason he does not use this.

Very knowledgable and a good prof all around. He was funny and you could tell he enjoyed teaching. The grading is very midterm heavy and attendance is necessary. Content builds so if you miss a class or two it is hard to catch up

DA is a fantastic lecturer, the best I've ever had. His intensive knowledge of the subject means he can explain everything very well. That being said, his tests were HARD, and he was a very tough grader. If you want to learn the subject matter, take the class with DA, but if you want to get an easy A take the other teacher.

Hes a chill prof. Lectures are a lot though, so be ready to write. Someone said, which I agree with, hes too knowledgeable sometimes so the content ends up going over our heads; but sometimes, usually after us asking questions, he simplifies things down. Thankfully, exam content matches what he teaches in lectures/practice exams. Hes alright.

Professor Anderson is very knowledgeable in Mathematics. Perhaps too knowledgeable. I find that he doesnt realize that what he is saying is very confusing to students. His lectures are a bit messy. I would definitely recommend reading the textbook to help understand his lectures.

I honestly don't understand a lot of these negative comments about Neil. In this class he was very good as a lecturer, always stopped to ask if anyone had questions, and explained topics thoroughly. Yes, in lecture he can be kind of droning but its a math professor what do you expect. Even if you don't like him the lecture videos are very good.

Very bad! Even attempting to learn with Dr. Deboer was a total waste of time. I would recommend going to other lectures if he were to be your lecturer because you will learn nothing with him. He refuses to do problems with actual numbers and chooses to only use variables, which don't help your understanding.  Beware and please avoid him.

Dr. DeBoer is an alright lecturer. He does a decent job of explaining concepts most of the time, but doesn't answer questions that well (but you can do that during recitation as well). 1151 was a insanely difficult class and the graders are harsh. If taking 1172, I wouldn't recommend the lectures as they are basically glorified recitations.

If you have this professor for 1172,  I recommend you not attend the lectures, it is very useless and he does not know how to explain any concepts. I watched pre-recorded videos from the course modules that are from a different lecturer that you should switch to if you can named James Talamo. This course in general is not hard if you want to pass
His lectures were extremely boring and atrocious grading. If you can switch to James Talamo, please for the love of god do so.

Very monotone, boring lectures—that makes it clear he does not want to be there any more than his students. The class itself is not too hard; if you do the midterm reviews and actually understand that material, you should be fine.

Had him for Calc 1 and honestly have no complaints. Went in a little worried because of his reviews but saw nothing wrong. Calc 1 professor doesn't really matter that much, no matter who you have it's the same assignments and tests and Professor Deboer did a fine job at teaching it, so don't let these reviews throw you off.
DeBoer is a terrible lecturer who doesn't explain what he writes down, he just writes. Also his handwriting is terrible so good luck trying to understand new concepts AND read what he writes.

Neil was smart, but an absolute terrible teacher. He couldn't explain things clearly. When explaining straightforward concepts, he'd make them so difficult by neglecting to explain anything he's doing. He's open to questions but sucks at answering them. Be prepared to teach yourself the course. If, like me, this is your first calc course, good luck
I did not like having Neil as a professor. He was not a good professor at all. He went through things very quickly and did not explain very well, in my opinion. Would not recommend.

Lectures were boring, but I felt like he covered the necessary content and material. His handwriting is not the greatest, but not the worst I've seen. He goes through material and practice problems very quickly. In conclusion, not a bad teacher just boring.

Neil DeBoer's teaching is a disorganized mess. He skips crucial content, forcing us to practice example problems with no proper grounding. Even with my background in Calculus I and II, his explanations leave me confused, making this class a nightmare for anyone without prior calculus experience.
Avoid. Would have dropped before the deadline if I knew how poorly taught this section would be.
DEBEOR THE GOAT
He doesn't know how to teach.

Prepared students well for exams and always answered questions in class. Extremely knowledgeable with insightful lectures. Also, had a great grading system which allowed students to complete exam corrections. Overall, one of the best math classes I've taken at OSU.
doesn't seem to know how to teach. very rarely answers questions during class. focuses too much on lecturing rather than helping students

A lot of the problems that people have with him are due to things the math dept. at OSU does instead of Neil specifically. Neil was a good lecturer: he answered any questions that came up and was pretty clear with his examples. I will say that he often did fly through some examples too quickly and didn't explain a lot of things he did in detail.

neil seems like a nice person, but he CANNOT lecture. granted, he was always willing to explain and provide examples if you are confused, but i feel like most of the context was explained in very vague terms and was too fast paced for anyone to actually come up with questions in lecture. without a decent TA, i would have failed.

Calc 2 is a difficult class no matter who you end up having as a professor. I believe Neil did a very good job in his lectures in explaining concepts and always answered questions whenever people had them. In calc 2 specifically, I see no reason for him to be a 1-star as anything unrelated to lecturing is dependent on the math department.

His lectures aren't great, but I don't think he deserves as bad of a reputation. He is always willing to answer questions and do more examples if anyone is confused. He is caring, but boring. I wouldn't seek out another class from him, but it was overall okay. Having a great recitation teacher definitely made the class 10x better.

He is quite possibly the most by the book lecturer of all time. He'll usually write on the board straight from the book, wasting lots of time He does an OK job with question answering though. Would've done a lot worse if not for my recitation professor. Not the worst in the world, but he makes simple material confusing.

Very nice guy, but terrible class set up. Your entire grade is based around 7 exams that are pass or fail, which the homework and quizzes have very little to do with. Notes are also structured poorly, there are few to none example problems. I would not recommend this class to anyone.

Neil seems knowledgeable and nice, but man, I did not learn anything from his lectures. I felt like I was drowning the entire semester having to piece together random sources on the internet to figure out what was going on. He didn't make it very clear what would be on the weekly quizzes either, I often felt unprepared for the quizzes.

I used to love math, but calc 2 and 3 at OSU made me hate it. I don't want to be mean, but he was not a good professor, you have to rely on the HW and "textbook" assignments. One plus: you can continue to try to complete previous problems from exams, but grading is very difficult, you really need to work hard to even get a decent grade

Very nice guy. Not-so-great professor. Didn't go to lectures because we were expected to learn the content through online lecture videos and only go to class with questions. Did not help to have practically no professor since this was my first time taking calculus. Great that attendance was not mandatory though. That would've been a waste.

Went to class for about 2-3 weeks because it was impossible to hear him speak, no matter where your seat was in the class. On top of this, he rarely explained concepts, mainly focused on the answer and not how to work towards getting said answer. Showed up late to class about 50% of the times I attended.

DeBoer did little to no actual teaching in class--you were expected to watch the lecture videos online beforehand and only ask clarifying questions in class. His handwriting for the video notes was also nigh unreadable. However, you did get multiple tries on each exam and only had to redo the questions you got wrong on the last try, which was nice.

Avoid like plague. Sounds sweet when you hear pass/fail exams but it is actually 100% or fail there is also an exam every other Monday and weekend quizzes. Homeworks are random content that is not covered on exams and there is no examples in class so much of the exam questions are seen for the first time on the exam Made account just for this

Deboer's pass/fail course setup is bizarre and confusing for students. The class is unnecessarily stressful for students as throughout the semester you won't really know what your grade is until after the final and he is very lazy when it comes to posting grades or providing students with practice problems to prepare for tests. Avoid at all costs.

Avoid DeBoer. Lectures are dry and lack examples. The course set up is bizarre. It's difficult to explain and even more difficult to succeed within it. Midterms are graded pass/fail, but to pass you need a 100%. Grades are not shown on carmen and the weight of each is unknown so final grades won't be known until the end of the course. Please avoid!
One of the worst professors I've ever had. I almost failed the class but just barely scraped by with a passing grade. If you can, avoid this lecturer.

DeBoer's lectures aren't the most interesting but he does a good job of explaining the material and provides a lot of examples that closely mimic the exams. If you go to his lectures and do the practice problems he gives you, you should have no problem passing the class.

The lecturer wasn't my favorite by any means. Professor DeBoer's lectures felt all over the place and they didn't really make sense most times. I honestly learned a lot more and only passed this class because of the TA that was assigned to my particular section. The notes are also super hard to read. I recommend another teacher or Heavy Self Study

DeBoer may have been a nice guy but as a teacher, he was too nervous while speaking to us during lectures and was whispering half the time. His lectures overcomplicated the topics and did not prepare for the tests since he zoomed by topics so quickly, only to realize in recitation the actual topic is way simpler than the examples he showed.

This was the worst professor I have ever had in my life. He has sympathy at all for his students. At least 30% of students failed his course because there was no curve at the end. I hope he gets fired

This class was an exam based class with 3 midterms and 1 final. There is a homework and quiz EVERY single week. The professor does not teach well, he goes up there and just writes, no presentation or steps. My TA explained everything, he should have been the professor. I do not recommend him because he teaches like you already know the information.

It's a shame they let people like this teach. This kind of apathy shows a complete disregard for any student and the university. He also wastes TAs time inside recitation by needing them to reexplain something that he "tried" to cover in lecture. Even further embarrassing this guy makes regular mistakes on low level material.

I took calc in high school but was left utterly confused when I would attend his lectures - covering topics I already knew. I eventually stopped attending lecture and had to rely on my great TA and recitation to get me through the class. Neil seems like a nice guy but not my choice of lecturer.

DeBoer is a great person and seems very caring. He is understanding of circumstances. His lectures are boring and he doesn't explain the content clearly, he just writes stuff on the board with no explanation. I skipped lecture but had to go to every recitation to save my time and understand the content.

I will first say that DeBoer is a nice, caring person, but is a terrible lecturer. Like others said, his handwriting is illegible. He often did not explain the most important aspects of the topics being discussed in lecture. He seemed very disorganized. Everything I learned was from recitation or YouTube.

Professor DeBoer is a good person but not a good professor. He does not teach very well so his material is hard to understand. Make sure to pay attention in lecture because he goes over things really fast.

DeBoer is nice as a person. However, I believe the way he teaches can be improved. For one, his online notes are illegible, so good luck if you can't read bad handwriting. On the other hand, he does try to respond to people's questions well.

This class has 3 exams, but the final is not cumulative over the whole year just the newest stuff and then like the first 6 lessons. The lecturer is hard to understand but she records all the lectures so you don't have to go to class. There are 3 quizzes in recitation, and lowest one gets dropped. Felt the content was duable and easy to get help.

Her teaching style was very confusing and I really struggled to understand the material in lectures. Exams are nothing like the practice problems she recommends. Not sure why I can do the homework without struggle but manage to do poorly on the exams. You don't know what's on the exams and they're 70% of your grade. Good luck.

She is hard to understand because of her accents. Lectures are her just talking about her pre-written notes. I never went to the lectures and did the notes myself and got an A. The class isn't horrible as long as you study well for the tests and quizzes. Not that many assignments.

Can't understand her, recitation teacher was also awful, her notes are messy and unhelpful. If you want to pass this class ypu have to read the text book on your own. I did tutoring and still failed. Also homework is the hardest part of the class.

A lot of people complain about her accent, but it honestly isn't that heavy. Her office hours are a great resource, and while it's pretty test heavy it's not the end of the world if you do bad on one exam. Uploads online lectures so that you can choose to go or not go to class, and attendance isn't mandatory for recitation or lecture.

She is very nice, but not a good professor. She has a very strong accent and it his hard to understand, also her notes are the messiest notes I have ever seen and it is hard to follow along. Eventually I just stopped going to lectures because it did not help me at all. I would teach myself through the textbook.

I really like the layout of this course. I highly recommend doing the pre-lecture extra credit quizzes immediately after class, because they really help and take 5 minutes to do. The exams were super easy, mostly multiple choice, and the difficulty of the exam questions matched the difficulty of the questions we did in class.

Her lectures weren't helpful to me at all as her handwritten notes were difficult to read and understand. Pretty much stopped going to lectures and taught myself using the textbook. She's a nice person but just not a very good teacher. She does cancel class a lot and there are extra credit opportunities.

I have personal beef with Rachida. She told us we had to memorize 22 formulas for an exam, not wanting to fail I did, and forgot to mention she decided to provide them. Her homework includes a lot of information that we never go over bc she doesn't make them. She he cancels class but fails to let us know, and talks to us like children.

The lectures can be hit or miss, but using resources like Unstuck study AI alongside the textbook makes it doable. Grading is mostly based on quizzes and exams, so staying on top of the material is key. Overall, an average class.

She was a really average professor, to be honest. She definitely wasn't a bad professor, but she wasn't great either, she's just middle of the road. Lectures can be boring and also hard to understand because of her accent, although you do get used to it.

I took Calc 3 2153 and learned nothing from going to her lectures, her accent made it so hard to understand. Her PDF of notes was the only thing I learned from. Exams were kind of out of pocket/not what I expected. When you got 2-3 of the MC questions wrong brought the exam grade down a letter grade. She was friendly though and wanted us to learn.

Dr.Aboughazi is a wonderful person, but her class is difficult. It was 80% exams/quizzes and 20% homework. There was no curve, but 1 quiz and 2 HW's were dropped and there was no cumulative final. Lectures could be very scattered/confusing, but the homework examples on the online platform help a lot. General physics knowledge may help as well.
I thought she was fairly good at explaining concepts and included helpful examples as well as provided multiple practice problems for each exam. The weekly quizzes were kind of annoying but doable.

Lectures can be boring, but there are shortened video forms of the lecture material posted for the entire semester. Doesn't move on until someone provides an answer to her question, she does not answer her own questions typically. Pretty easy to follow notes.
Professor Aboughazi is so sweet and gives plenty of examples during lecture
Lectures are too hard to read and she doesn;t explain topics literally just solves the problems and expects you to put two and two together. She is a very nice person but a very bad teacher!!

She grades literally nothing, the TA's grade every assignment. One time she put in an online Carmen quiz answer wrong and said it was only one point and she won't fix it as it doesn't matter because it was too much work to fix everyone's grade. She doesn't really care. If you're decent at math going into the class you're fine. Ask your TA for help.

She knows what she's doing, however, lectures tend to get boring. Wants students to succeed so if you do your work, you will get an A. There are quizzes every week, 3 exams (including the final), and 1 homework a week.

Lectures were 90% practice problems, so you definitely have to read the textbook and teach the chapters to yourself to actually learn the material. Lecture notes not organized super well and could be difficult to understand. Grades mostly based on recitation quizzes and online exams.
She loves to say the number trillion and she makes no sense whatsoever. She is so confusing. Good luck.
Nah
Hard to understand and goes off on random tangents.

I was super scared going into this semester just because Ive heard diff eq is a nightmare universally; I never would have thought that I could end the class with an A-! Lecs both online and in-person, homework isnt awful (it is group hw though), and exams/quizzes are fair. Plus, if you do well on the last three quizzes, you wont have a final ;)

Rachida is a very sweet and kind individual, who is eager to help her students when they don't understand material. I recommend taking a blended course with half days with a TA, since her class is very fast-paced and it helps to have someone in between to slow things down.

not a good lecturer. all she does is draw arrows and circle prewritten notes. you do not need to show up to class, but I recommend going to recitation. don't get me wrong, she is very sweet, but personally not my favorite professor/way of learning. 3 exams (1 is a final) that are multiple-choice, and some homework assignments in connect math.

She was nice, but not a good lecturer at all. her lectures were all online and were very boring. She doesn't speak very good English which made it hard to follow. By the end of the semester I was not attending lecture and teaching myself out of the homework and textbooks which you are required to purchase.
This class sucked. The lectures would not work half the time and she would not check the chat that is telling her that it isn't working.
Rough class and she was no help. Her notes don't make sense and she doesn't explain anything well. Do NOT take her class unless you already know trig or if it's absolutely necessary.
Terrible. Just terrible. Only thing saving you is online quizzes & exams. Because she cannot lecture.

She's horrible, has a heavy accent. Could not understand her at all. DO NOT TAKE HER AT ALL COSTS. Exams were online, and quizzes were in recitations. Exams and quizzes were very difficult. Her notes were very sloppy. I did not learn anything from her. You have to teach yourself everything. There is no extra credit. Homework was also online & hard

Her lectures were frustrating because her notes were messy, she talks very scatterbrained and her accent makes her harder to understand at times. She struggles with technology and spent a lot of class time figuring out technical problems over zoom. Top it off with her singing at 9AM and I stopped attending the lectures.

Not the worst professor, not the best. The course content was well outlined and explained. All her notes are in her handwriting and can be very confusing. The way she explains things can be difficult to understand. I probably did so well because of how well my high school math teachers prepped me.

Goes through material rather slowly but is thorough, and lectures are recorded so you can go through them later at your own pace. References the book minimally but is is easily accessible online. Professor always tries to interact with students

Notes were extremely helpful for me, lectures not so much. I would often work on my own problems and have the lecture on in the background. However she is great at being upbeat and answering questions, genuinely wants you to succeed.

She's a pretty decent instructor. Sometimes the lectures were hard to follow, but every time I asked her a question, she would answer it well. It is boring to watch the lectures, but they are somewhat important to pass the class. This class was lectures 3 days a week, recitation 2 days a week, and you have normally one homework and one quiz per wk.

She post lecture videos and notes from each lecture on carmen. The notes were a little lacking but overall good prof. Weekly homework assignments and quizzes that aren't that hard (sometimes they did take more time than necessary). If you review the material from the homework and ask your TA what would be on the quiz you will do well.

She isn't the greatest, but she isn't the worst either. I took this class online, and her lectures were very boring and disengaging, not sure how she translate to in person lectures. Every lecture was recorded so you don't have to attend. If you pay attention and do the homework, you'll pass easily, but that can be difficult to do at times.

By far one of the most disorganized math teachers I have ever encountered. She jumps from topic to topic with little explanation and her notes look like a 10 year old wrote them (literal chicken scratch). While her class is by no means hard, if you actually want to learn pre-calc material TAKE ANOTHER PROFESSORS course.

Aboughazi's lectures were often hard to understand and to complete my own notes I often had to reference the textbook to make sense of what she was saying. I relied more on my TA toward the end of the semester to learn the material.

Rachida is a nice person, but she doesn't speak English or teach very well. Also her lectures were very hard to follow. I had her for PE calc and the class was easy and I really didn't even attend the lectures at all.

She is a terrible professor, very accent heavy and does not explain things clearly at all. She moves through topics incredibly fast in her lectures and does not answer questions but instead tells students she has no idea what they are talking about. Only way to learn anything is a TA and mine was terrible as well.

She is very hard to follow and does not teach Trig in the most easy way to understand. I have no Pre-Calc background and my saving grace was my TA: Eric Fawcett. I learned more from him than from the professor. Not a bad professor just needs to improve on communication.
The class was unorganized, and the professor was very confusing. She didn't even post office hours. Recitation TA's are the only way to learn anything. Would never and will never have her again.
Class was disorganized and to have someone sing to you about trig at 8 am and then not answer questions was interesting. Did not have office hours, would not reccomend this teacher

dont be fooled by her high rating, she is a terrible math teacher. notes are extremely unprofessional and looks like doodle bob wrote them instead. accent heavy so you cant understand her. people slander sherry but you will be begging for sherry after this class. besides eric the TA's are pretty bad and not eduan level overall a downgrade from 1148

If she was teaching calc or higher this would be a nightmare. Only 12 people show up to lectures and the first one had 170ish. Her notes are unreadable and you cant understand her. Trig is easy but I would avoid if you struggle with the content because she cant teach.

Very poor lectures that don't help at all I have self taught my way through this entire class. Can't believe she is a professor it seems like she has no background in teaching at all. Homework is not bad and is often helpful because you work with a partner. The exams are terrible many questions are things that are not even reviewed.

Lectures are a joke no one shows up because she is so bad at teaching online. The exams on connect math are made up of questions she's not even aware of when you ask she won't know how many questions are on it. If you miss a single question on the connect math exam's your grade drops by a letter each question. Do not recommend this professor.
She is actually caring, and an easy class. If you watch her lectures and do online homework then it's an easy A.

She genuinely cares about her students, and I am sure that the majority of the assignments and amount of exams were determined by the math dept- not her. Here notes could be confusing and I found her lectures to not be super engaging, but if you attend, participate, and really try on your homework (which should be an easy A), you will be fine!

Had her for my precalc class last semester, I haven't taken a math class in over a year but it was fine. Really tho, it was my TA that saved me learning wise. Her lectures are a little all over the place but she is super nice. Grades are worth 60% of your grade so as long as you do the review you should be good.

I am taking this class during the COVID pandemic so everything is online. I fell behind in all my classes for various personal life reasons. She is the only professor that did not allow me to catch up on my work despite me describing my situation to her. She has absolutely no sympathy for her students and I recommend no one takes her classes ever.

I didnt mind the lecturer herself, it was just the fact that class was online. Exams were on a program called Connect Math, and you typed your final answer with no way to show your work. This made exams challenging because you couldnt get partial credit for your work. If it was in person, Id recommend this professor.
Shes okay. But make sure to do a lot of practice on your own.
This was the second class I took with her and would take another any day! Shes a fair grader and youre more heavily weighted by homeworks than exams and quizzes. The criteria for an A is 90.

Always flies through the lectures expecting everyone to understanding everything ahead of time. Does not respect students questions and concerns and gives no insight as to what is to be expected on the test. Disgraceful.

The professor was not bad, but it was not a great learning environment. The ideas were scattered and out of order making class hard to understand and easy to zone out. Overall not a bad professor and cares about what she is teaching. I would recommend going to office hours and asking questions there.

Sweetest woman in the world! Her lectures were okay, attendance is not mandatory but it helps to listen. Recitation definitely taught more than lecture. She puts up plenty resources to do well on tests, the exams have the exact types of problems in the practice exams and quizzes. If you still feel shaky, do the homework.

Super nice, but quickly blows through lectures, and posts the notes online after class. After the first 4 weeks, I stopped showing up every single day because I actually learned more from my TA during recitation than I did in lecture.

As far as math goes, this prof is actually pretty great. I have trouble paying attention in math and enjoying professors, but she does a really good job teaching what she does, despite the dry subject matter.
What a woman. She is hilarious and a great lecturer. I'm not the best at math and she made 1150 a lot easier for me

I had to drop this class initially and she was WAY better than my previous guy. She organizes her notes in a way that clearly outlines different examples and she knows what she's doing. Really listen to her tips and tricks!!! This is a difficult class so make sure you are doing the PRACTICE WORKSHEETS and PRACTICE EXAMS!!!

Great lecture style- gave info in easy-to-understand pieces and did example problems solved during lecture. Receptive to questions during lecture. Class is hard (taylor series) but she/math dept. made sure to give us a list of things to know for test. Prof. also gave a self-made guide before exams in addition to study guide given by the department.

Nice lady, but blows through lecture material like you already know it, and then immediately posts the notes online. Total waste of time going to lecture when Khan Academy videos teach the material, and you have a recitation.

Didn't go to lecture--she just posted all the lecture notes on Carmen and I wrote them down and studied them from there. Nice lady, did not find lecture very useful. Found that many people had the same experience, but I still recommend going the first few weeks to see for yourself.

Dr. Aboughazi was very prepared and on schedule. She cared about her students and always finished material on time. If you do all of the practice problems and practice midterms you will do okay on exams. The first exam is hard, second easy, third medium and the final is hard.

Dr. Aboughazi is a charming woman who lectures well. She is good at breaking things down and always put the abstract concepts in understandable context. She is fairly easy-going, and likes to joke around a bit. She also has an accent but it never once got in the way of my understanding. I like math, so I may be biased, but her course was enjoyable.

Dr. Aboughazi clearly cares about math and does her best to explain things well, but lectures became pointless. Her notes are posted online and she just explains them in her lectures. If you have questions, feel free to go to the lectures, but recitation is more beneficial.

She seemed nice enough but I found her lectures unclear and unorganized. The book problems helped me prep for the tests but the quizzes were killer because the questions always seemed to be way out of left field. Maybe it's because I had a bad TA, but with this class I had to do a lot on my own.
She is a great prof. She's very accommodating and her teaching style is organized.

I can't understand what is she talking about during classes. I attended most classes before midterm 2, but I gave up because of her. She doesn't write anything during class but uses her previous lecture notes. Although she uploaded her notes on Carmen, it still be difficult to get an A.
It is very hard to understand what she is saying.  Even so, she seems to typically find the most complicated way to solve an equation. Recitation is important and where you'll learn the most.
Unorganized, hard to follow and understand. Did not prepare students well for quizzes.

Sometimes has no idea what she is even talking about, gets sidetracked very easily and although her accent is not hard to understand it caused some confusion when she is explaining things. However the way the class is set up you have some help with the grades, but the tests are heavily weighted and very hard.

Dr. Aboughazi was a wonderful and quirky Math 1150 professor. She does have an accent but it's really easy to understand. She is knowledgeable about the material and was very good at explaining everything.  Not too difficult because there are clear things you can do to help yourself understand the material. I suggest doing book problems.

She is constantly trying to get people involved with the lecture, by asking questions. She has an accent, but is very easy to understand. She is a sort of motherly figure, and is very knowledgeable. I never absolutely dreaded attending. Definitely attend lecture, it will help immensely.

Professor Aboughazi knows what she's doing. She has an accent which took a little getting used to but not hard to understand. She's always more than willing to answer questions if you contact her. Really a sweet lady if you get to know her too! Do the review problems on the course page and thats basically the exams.

She is a wonderful professor! I took Pre-Calc in high school (junior year) and didn't take a math senior year. I didn't remember a lot of the pre-calc stuff I learned, but I put the time into the class that was necessary and ended up with an A. Even though its not required, go to recitation and do the practice problems! They're both super helpful.
Can't understand her very well, never went to lecture and still did well

I am currently taking math 1150 and so far she is a very good lecturer. I learn much better in a standard environment and  she has very clear lectures that explain her whole thought process for each problem. This means that her lectures are very fast paced but you should pay attention to these because they are vital to the class. Accent is no probl

Goes quickly in lecture, but posts her notes on Carmen so you can access them there later if you miss something. Didn't use the physical textbook much. She has an accent, but she's easy to understand.

She is good. Not great but good. Lectures are long but not too painful if you have your computer or phone. Just do the online homework and take notes. She goes very slow so it easy to follow along. Her accent is annoying at first but after the first week you just don't care anymore and her notes are there to help when you can't understand.
Her accent isn't hard to understand. Clearer than my previous calc professors and somehow her lectures don't seem as long or boring.

I am in no way a math wiz, but I got an A in this class. Dr. Aboughazi has an accent but I had no trouble understanding her. She kept my attention and was more than willing to answer questions. She likes class participation. As long as you go to lecture, do the homework, and get help when needed, you will have no problems with this class.

Although she is hard to understand at times she is a great teacher. She really made sure that students understood what was going on and also enjoyed the subject. The textbook is only really necessary if you plan on doing the problems in it, but the access code that comes along with it is mandatory

She seems nice in person, but annoyed when approached for help. Her mind seemed all over the place at times. Lecture was hard to focus in, because the way things were explained seemed confusing to me. I mostly use youtube to help me. On the bright side, the test are straight forward and there's no trick questions.

Her accent is really not that hard to understand. At 8am however, this lecture is extremely boring and she can be quite sassy sometimes. Math 1152 is not too difficult for the majority of the class except for one month working on series. Tests are standardized by the math department as well as in class and take home quizzes.

Aboughazi prepares you well for the exams, which are made by the department. She's a good teacher and just wants the best for her students. Some say her accent is hard to understand, but I had no problem.

Her accent is a little tough to understand but not impossible. Her lectures are long but very thorough when going through the material. I thought she was a very good teacher and I would take her again.

Everyone says she is hard to understand.. however I could understand her accent just fine. There is a lot of material so it may seem very difficult at times, but she is always wanting and willing to help so that everyone can succeed.

You can barely understand a word she says. When you do understand her, you realize she literally takes the hardest route to explain a simple topic. Why? No clue. Even if you've taken pre-calc before, good luck. She's confusing.

She's a sweet lady and I like her as a person, but I could not understand her most of the time she talked. Most people ended up skipping her class every day because she put her notes online, and those are easier to understand than her voice. However, the class is easy, just actually do the book homework. It helps a lot.

This class was really easy, and I am not gifted in math. I usually do not do well in math courses. Her lectures are so clear I did not have to study. I reviewed for a couple hours before the midterms and everything made sense. Take her class but do not miss  lectures. She posts lectures on carmen, but you need to be there because she goes in depth.

Exams were hard but she's a good lecturer. Accent is not terrible at all. The exams are department-wide, so I got screwed over on those. Will likely end up with a B- or C+. Do the homework. 80% is all you need to get full credit on homework and quizzes. She really does not want her students to fail.

She is funny and makes jokes to keep you entertained. All her lectures are online, so missing class isn't a problem. Notes are a MUST to understand the information. She can be hard to understand but lecture is always packed with people because she gives good examples and is a great teacher, if you take 1150, take her!
She is a good professor, however she is hard to understand and scatterbrained at times.

She is totally awesome! She may be a bit difficult to understand at first, but I think she is a great teacher overall. She is very interested in how her students do, and she makes goofy but funny jokes all the time. I loved her!

She is quirky and funny. Class isn't hard at all. Study the day of the evening test and you'll do at least as good as me. Make good use of textbook. Exams are dept. wide so don't judge her based on how hard the exams are.
Unclear and confusing, but very nice and helpful one on one.

Works hard to make sure the majority of the lecture understands, works through the problems, answers any raised hand.  If you go to class and pay attention(no phone/laptop) then you should do fine.  Her accent is easy to understand didn't really bother me on the first day either.

She makes the class at 8 A.M. somewhat interesting with a good personality and explains the concepts well. Goes through problems slowly enough to understand and answers questions asked very well. A great teacher recommended for any Math Class. Her accent you get used to very fast and it does NOT distract at all from the class
A little hard to understand at times, but a very entertaining teacher. She knows what she is talking about and is willing to help and always answers emails.
Very clear and extremely helpfull. A+++

She was AWESOME. I quit going to my scheduled lecture and started going to hers because she was so much better. Yeah, she can be hard to understand at times because of her accent but it's something minor you'll get used to. TAKE HER AS YOUR MATH PROFESSOR.

Teacher is very knowledgeable and eager to teach. Depending on the topic and individual person, lecture can be skipped. I relied on my TA a lot because I fell asleep whenever I did go to lecture. She's a good GE teacher and explains each math problem thoroughly. Book HW is not required, Online Hw is but it is very easy.
Extremely scatterbrained and challenging to understand. Can't always read her writing. Happy and bubbly and she knows her stuff but I just couldn't understand her.

She was so nice and happy, which was cool since it was an 8am math class, but I could not understand a word she said. She liked to skip steps when working problems out on the board because the were obvious to her, but I was completely lost. She says there's a curve at the end of the semester, and I really hope that's true because I'm failing.

Although Aboughazi is a bit difficult to understand at times, this was the easiest math course I have taken at OSU thus far. If you struggled in 151/152, this will be cake in comparison. I missed 9 points on the final with little (4 hours) studying. This was her first time teaching the course, so there was lots of HW with no quizzes. Book=necessity
She is so funny. Make the materials easy to learn and moderate amount of homework to do.
She really keeps the class interesting and tries to get everyone involved and get excited about learning. I would definitely recommend this class to other students.

she knows her stuff, but she's really scatter-brained and annoyingly happy and hyper sometimes, plus her accent is rough... i skipped all her lectures after the first week or two and just used patrickjmt.com to learn everything, and i got an A. honestly, just skip.

Very upbeat and makes lectures interesting; however, her handwriting is terrible and the midterms and final are hard. Told my class there would be a curve at the end of the quarter but it never happened.
Has accent but still easy to understand.  Will answer any questions thoroughly.  Overall a solid teacher.

She gives the class attitude a lot. does not teach, but asks the class questions assuming there is someone out there that already knows.  accent is easy to understand but how she words things is not always easy.  If there is an exam question that it seems like EVERYONE is saying is hard, she will tell you it was easy.
While she was a very challenging professor, I found her to be extremely clear and she knew her material well and communicated it well.  In my  mind, an excellent professor!

As others have said, you will be able to understand her accent after one week of going to lecture. She goes through problems thoroughly, she is nice, she is amusing too. Her handwriting can be difficult to read at times, but it should not pose a problem and don't be afraid to ask for clarifications. Sometimes she is a little scatter-brained.

Worst professor I have ever had. Her accent is extremely difficult to understand, and the few times I was able to comprehend a full sentence, it was complete nonsense and unrelated. It doesn't help that her handwriting is at the skill level of a 2 year old so you cant even follow the notes. Expect to learn the material completely out of the book.
She's very clear unless you're not accustomed to her accent. Very helpful in her office hour. Exams do not come from her, but from a math department. Do all extra credits online.
Comes off nice, but then after a while gives an unnecessary attitude
Rachida was great best math lecturer i have had here at OSU. I had her fall quarter wish i still could have a course with her. Her accent  you will get used to after week 1. Take her:)
She was awesome. Her class was very easy but only because she was a truely great professor. You get used to her accent

Nice woman, entertaining to listen too. Good teacher really goes over important points to clarify what she's talking about. Sometimes babbles nonsense that has nothing to do with the topic at hand, but its not too bad
She was kind of hard to understand at times. I didn't think math 104 would be hard, but she doesn't really explain stuff in class well. My TA is great though!

She is a wonderful teacher with a great attitude. She will stay after class to help you and encourages you to visit her office hours if you need extra help. You need to go to class everyday and pay attention if you expect to do well, so showing up for tests and quizzes only won't cut it.

Amazing professor. Very helpful but you have to get to know her. Go to her office hours! She will gladly review a midterm with you and try to get you points back for that midterm! It takes a week to start to understand her but just sit up front and ask her to repeat if needed. She's from Morocco so she speaks english well with a small accent.
Too fast to understand + bad accent.
She was alright. Meh...
Writes too fast and needs an English speaking course. The Indian professor is much better.

Could be worse.  She knows the material, but her biggest issue is that she's a small woman with a small voice in a giant lecture hall; using a microphone just made her voice sound muddy. Accent wasn't much of an issue.  In a smaller class I'd have no problem taking her again.

Sometimes spoke to fast, but I didn't find her hard to understand as some previous reviewers.  Helpful and would explain questions thoroughly when asked.  Sometimes she was slightly unorganized but for the most part the class was good.  Tests were pretty much as expected - everything she went over in lecture.
Loved Her!!!
She is very helpful. She makes the class fun and lively. She has loads of energy and enjoys what she does. I recommend her.

She's nice, but a little hard to understand. If you ask for help, she's good about that and seems to take note of it (my final grade was higher than I expected). As far as the class goes, you just need a good TA and you'll be fine.
Very difficult to understand and she talks extremely fast.

She did seem a little unorganized at times, but you will not find a better professor for 153. Everyone I know has averages in the 60's, but our class's average on the exams was in the 80's, just unheard of. She is really helpful and she will do whatever she can to help you. Take her
She was a nice woman who seemed genuinely interested in teaching.  Sometimes she seemed rushed and had a hard time getting her point across and was a little hard to understand.

I love her! She is adorable. She is very cheery and really enjoys teaching. She gets excited about math (and then her voice gets really high). She is easy to understand most of the time and tries very hard to answer any questions you have.
She is a great teacher. She enjoys her job and I liked her. She was the first professor for my first college class ever at 8:30 ugh
Good professor; assignments were clear, and the class is less boring than you would expect.
good
she is very helpful but odd. she makes funny noises every so often when she is lecturing. doesn't go over the last sections enough so the final is really tough unless you DO THE HOMEWORK.

She's a great teacher! Don't listen to the reviews about her creating a hard final, she has no control over the midterms and finals. They are made by the math department.  I would definitely reccommend her, even though you can't choose the math lecturer. If you don't get her, go to her lectures anyway.

Rachida Aboughazi is my Professor for my Math 150 class.  Her teaching style is the key to my success because she is clear and organized.  She involves the students in her teaching and makes sure we know what is going on and we understand the material.
She's a really nice woman but watch out for the final, it's based mostly in the end of the course that we never really went over.
very nice and clear

Not the best professor... You can't help but like her because she is very nice but doesn't explain things well and has an accent. You pretty much have to teach yourself or hope for a good TA. Just do the homework and the class isnt too bad.
Teaches VERY FAST. would not recommend!
Loved her! She really cares about the students, and when you get her attention to ask a question, she really focuses in on you and tries to answer. Do the homework and the exams are easy!
I really enjoyed having her. She has an accent, but she explains things very well and to the point.
I thought Dr. Aboughazi was great. I didn't find her accent difficult at all. She's a little spontaneous, but in a math class I think that's good. I definitely recommend her!

She was a really sweet woman, and tried to make it as fun as possible. It sometimes got hard to understand her because she doesn't speak great english - but she tried to be as helpful as possible. Give her a shot!

She tries her hardest to get her students understand the material. The only problem is that Aboughazi has trouble speaking English. most everyone has blanks looks on their faces because going to lecture is like going to a different country. She is very nice and knows her math, but can't clarify it too well.
She's alright, can be hard to understand with the accent though. But does try her best to help you.
Hard to understand, doesn't know how to teach.
I would not recommend her to anyone
goes way to fast and hard to understand  she seems to go over the easy stuff a lot and the hard stuff not much i had to read the book multiple time but my TA was Helpful.
She goes WAY too fast!  It's hard to understand what her point is.  I'm a great student (GPA above 3.5), but I failed this class.  Thank god for freshman forgiveness.
Great teacher, pretty funny when her voice goes high haha
She was very helpful, very well prepared, used many examples, and explained her examples in more than one way to make sure that everyone understood.
Rachida was a good teacher. She cared, she was friendly, and took time out to explain things when someone asked.
she is outgoing ready to listern to students all the time
Excellent
She was a great teacher.  I would recommend her to anyone.

her english is slightly broken at times- which can be confusing when she is explaining how to do the math problems. but for the most part i would recommed her, she has a sense of humor and she is nice.
eh
Good teacher.  Hard to understand.  Willing to help.
Good teacher... not that easy to understand but is helpful. you need to go to class to get the notes but the notes were helpful in studying. tests were pretty easy!
This woman is HILAROUS! one of my favorites. Very clear and funny.

I actually had 153 last spring.  From what I've experienced, Math teachers are usually the most out there in terms of having no grasp of what they should be expecting of students, as in talking about greek historians and then making an final of what seems like theory.  Aboughazi actually tested us on what she taught, which is commendable.

Tended to be confusing in the lecture, she got too excited and was all over the place.  If you are taking a math with content you haven't learned before, I wouldn't recommend her.  She's fine to trip your memory but not so awesome if you need to understand new concepts.  She was willing to help, though, and had a caring attitude.
hard to understand
She was better than other math professors at Ohio State. No big curveballs on tests... just what she says will be on there. If you can do the homework and the class examples, you'll be fine
A very clear lecture. And a wonder in office hours. I loved her.
Her English isn't perfect, but she tries her best to be clear.  She is always willing to help, something hard to find in most teachers.  If you go to class and take notes you should do fine.
No Comments
No Comments
Very helpful and has genuine desire to teach so that everyone understands what's going on, but you have to go to class!

I was a math major when I took this, which may be why I thought it was easy...but still I don't think it was too challenging.  The homework was never overwhelming, nor were the tests.  She seemed like a nice lady, but she was hard to understand sometimes with the accent.  She seemed very willing to help students.
She was ok, but her accent was hard to understand....and the class just sucked in general so I dont know how she was compared to everyone else.

Yeah, her accent made it hard to understand her, but she was always willing to go the extra mile for you.  If you were having problems with something and talked to her about it, she would always meet you in the tutor room to help you out...even if it wasn't in her office hours.  She's really nice and easy to talk to too.
She is... pretty much terrible. Her accent hinders things and she always teaches the easy stuff and leaves us to be raped on the tests.
I would not reccomend her

I don't like math, but Aboughazi made Math FUN! She taught my first college math class of my first college quarter and was soooo wonderful! I would take a class again with her any day! She has a great sense of humor and is very sweet and helpful!
she is probably one of the better professors here.. def not stressful
I took her class in '98!  she was awesome!  She was the reason I stuck with my degree program...Engineering!  Very helpful
This lady is hilarious, I wish she was my mom!!
She is very funny and interesting. I like her. He is a funn teacher to watch.
She was HILARIOUS. She came to calss everyday in sweatpants and oversized shirts. And she was the best Calculus teacher EVER.
No Comments
She was okay, but yes at times it was hard to understand what she was saying.

I had her for two classes and she was awesome. She is the sweetest lady ever, a little difficult to understand at first, but you get used to her accent. She wasn't too hard, but math is a subject that you have to keep up with or you'll be lost.
She's awesome!  Very helpful and great at explaining the more difficult concepts.  Kind of out there, but she's fun.
She is a very nice lady. Her explanations are very clear and she is very willing to teach. She also has a very unique personality and brings a lot of laughter into the class.
she is precious. absolutely adorable and I really felt like she cared that we did well on the exams. not 'tearing your hair out and barely passing' well, but actually well. greatly appreciated.

Great math teacher, makes tests straight forward.  Not too much homework, like 2 problems per section.  If you don't go to class, at least go the time before an exam, her exams are exactly like the review problems.
made it easy, lovable accent
knows what she's talking about. she's very funny and always willing to help.
This teacher is almost impossible to understand and seemed to make things more confusing.  Once i stopped going to classes and started using my TA, Phil Paun more often,  My grade shot up.
Couldn't really understand what she said and was a little crazy.
it is hard to understand what she is saying all the time
rachida rocked my socks!  she was great.  if i had to take another 7:30 am math class, she would be my lady.
The best Math professor I ever had
She is very nice and tries hard, but her accent is hard to understand at first. She goes a too slow in lecture. Some times it is hard to follow because she goes so slow. Easy tests, nice lady
This teacher was amazing. The material seemed easy because of the way she taught! She loves to help and her lectures are amazing! Thumbs way up!
i didnt go to class much, but the tests weren't very hard. it was easy, but she didnt curve.
Great easy going clear teacher, very funny

She really cares for her students and wants them to succeed.  She was one of the best math teachers I have ever had; math will really make sense to you if taught by Prof. Aboughazi.  She is also very enthusiastic about her job and about math!
Honestly, one of the best math profs I've ever had on this campus--and I'm not one who's big on the math dept here. Made the 0730 class seem fun because she's always so friendly and ready to teach.
Absolutely amazing!!!!  The first time I ever understood math.

Difficult to understand but always very energetic. Even when asking questions in person, it was often difficult to decipher her "help". Was embarrased more than once by asking a "dumb" question (& since it is math, many questions are d
Pretty much the best math teacher you can hope for
She was very smart, but difficult to understand with her accent sometimes.  The class was easy.  She was not really interesting: do not take this class at 7:30 in the morning, you will rarely go.
the best professor i have ever had!!!!!!!!!!!!
Hyper, all over the place...and hard to understand with her thick accent!
She is an amazing professor..she is incredibly helpful and clear and fair.
Good luck understanding this woman. She always wears lovely socks and comes in at the bell.
She makes midterms and final very similar to example problems she goes over before the exams.  Her examples are easy to follow.
uses really good examples, and if you can understand her accent, she explains things very well.  not really a class you would get bored in.
Once you understand her accent and her teaching style, you realize that she does have a method to her madness

she explains things extremely well by showing easier examples and then increasing the difficulty. her tests were fair and the review sessions were very helpful. aboughazi is by far the best math 152 teacher i have seen at osu
Her speech is a little hard to understand but she explains the concepts very well.
She makes the subject much easier to learn and she is easy to understand. Always willing to help out. Just study what she tells you to and you'll be fine.
She was 10X easier than all of the other 152 classes.  Her midterms were the same!  Definetly recomend!
No Comments
Hmmm...I thought she did a great job of explaining things--I had no problems understanding her and the exams were easy...
Didn't understand a word
She made things understandable and was pretty cool, I skipped the midterm and she let me take it 3 weeks later!
No Comments
she is so impossible to understand that I ended up never going to lecture
No Comments
Chill guy. Easy class especially if you have a good TA.

I love Prof. Henke! 

The lectures are more about building understanding over time rather than getting everything right away, but if you reach out to him or the TA outside of class, you'll be totally fine.

He's really patient and breaks things down clearly in one-on-one meetings, which made a huge difference for me on the exam

Excellent professor. Was very responsive and helpful  with a personal issue I faced in his class. The class is a pretty standard college math class. You need to work to stay on track and get a good grade, but very manageable"

He is a really nice guy but the way he explains things can get really confusing. I like him as a person for sure but I would not recommend him as a teacher. I read some of these reviews and they are pretty accurate. You have to learn the material on your own. Lectures can usually be skipped since you have to teach yourself while doing the homework

The class wasn't the best, especially since most of the lectures were spent on one type of problem and not the other. Some of the exams also had questions that were graded wrong or even if the way to solve isn't his way it was marked down. He was okay, but some of the lectures were a bit confusing and you have to basically teach yourself the work.
Easy class. Good guy.

Henke is a really nice guy, but as a professor I'd say take anybody else given the option. If you don't self-teach yourself the material you won't pass; and he spends majority of the lecture going over how to find the X-int instead of actually difficult material. Check your exams too, at least one question has been incorrectly marked on every exam.

Professor Henke was a kind and caring instructor who setup clear expectations this class. He helped me learn the material in a calm manner without rushing. If you are in his class, I would recommend going to his posted office hours and trying to stay on task so that you don get too far behind.
Very bad at explaining difficult concepts, and often drone on topics that will never appear on exams
Not very good at explaining. Be prepared to teach yourself all the content.
Grading for quizes makes it hard to get points. You can miss one question and get an F
If you don't take the time to teach yourself the material, you will fail. Do NOT take his course if you can help it.

Math 1149 - Horrible teacher. Has a section specifically for lecture slides, yet never posted them until I asked. Then half way through the semester stopped posting again. Every time I emailed him It took forever for him to respond and he was surprisingly rude. I don't recommend this professor and would do anything to avoid taking his class again.

His explanations will make you more confused than you were in the beginning, if he bothers to explain at all. For this class, you will mostly teach yourself the material or you will fail. 
I hate to give a bad review because Sam is honestly a very nice guy, but he's just a bad teacher.

Professor Henke takes 10 minutes to explain how to solve x+4>0. His teaching style is monotonous and tedious when discussing even the simplest mathematical concepts. His teaching reinforced to me that public schools have a) low-quality instructors  and/or b) professors who fall within the "those who can't do, teach" stereotype.
This TA does not answer specific questions very well and he is very behind on grading. I did not get my final midterm back until 10 minutes before the final.

Sam is a great guy! He’s super caring and was very helpful outside of class. The only issue I had was with the lectures. Most of his lecture presentations had multiple errors. He also read straight off the slides. I don’t think he created them, though. Also, the quizzes only had three questions, so if you miss only one, your grade is a D.
hes the sweetest ever, hes super helpful with answering any questions, although he talks SO quietly

I LOVE SAM! Seriously, this guy saved my (academic) life. I would have probably failed 2162 if it weren't for him. Because of him, I was able to pull an A-. Never met a man more capable of explaining such difficult concepts, so knowledgeable about his field, and so genuine and relatable at the same time. Get Sam as your TA (but don't take 2162).
Best GTA. Ever. If it wasn't for his help before every midterm, I would have gotten a C or worse. He saved my semester. If I ever need help in anything math related, I know that I can always ask Sam.

Sam presents the material very well. The "second pass" through the material during recitation is very helpful because 2162 moves so quickly.   Because of his extensive and accessible coverage of course topics, he was known by my section as a savior. Expect lots of grade-saving review sessions before big exams.
Sam is a really nice TA overall. He explains things that I couldn't understand during lecture with simple terms that are easy to understand. He's very positive and enthusiastic about math.

He was a TA for my math class. He followed the professors crazy grading rules, so I didn't like him much. Overall he is nice, but don't bother going to recitation. He has you work in teams to answer questions and it's overall kind of ridiculous.
Very good TA. explain everything perfectly. Can't ask more. I strongly recommend him!

Please do not take this class ever, I have never had a worse professor than her as I learn more sitting at home and not doing anything than I do attending class. Thick accent that you can not understand and the worst hand writing I have ever seen. Nothing she does or says makes sense in any way I have never been more confused in a class ever
Thick accent and horrible handwriting. Do not pick this lecturer. Everything is overcomplicated and you're better off learning on your own.

If you want to go insane and have no regard for your mental wellbeing, then this is the professor for you! Otherwise, avoid at all costs. I stopped going to lecture because I learned absolutely nothing. She just goes right into example problems and TopHat, little to no explanation. Her work overcomplicates everything. Very heavy accent.

This is the first time I have ever rated a Professor, and that is usually because my professors so far at OSU have been excellent. This Professor is an exception. BY FAR the worst professor I have had since being here. She doesn't speak good english due to a heavy german accent, and she has the handwriting of my 4 year old sister. Don't take it.

this is the absolute worst teacher i've ever had. just wait till you have a lecture with her. you can never understand what she is saying and her numbers don't look like what she is trying to say. i'm seriously considering dropping out of college because of her
Heavy German accent, not a good pick for lecturer
make sure you study since exams are worth 85% of your grade

Professor Stone is highly knowledgable on the course material and elaborates when questions are asked. He stays after lecture to answer questions and has multiple office hours each week. Exams are straight forward, you will do fine if you attend recitation and do the homework (2 questions a week). Has a sarcastic tone that makes lectures funny.
Doesn't know how to put math terms into a more understanding way so when he talks it a little confusing.
difficult test, hard grader

He is knowledgeable, funny, accessible, and explains concepts clearly enough. Many struggled because they put in virtually no effort and not due to his teaching. He could have slowed down at times to approach tough concepts from different angles, but in an analysis course you should be doing some independent reading anyways...

Did not care at all to help. TA was also not helpful and didn't seem to communicate with Stone. Did not seem to care during lectures to explain fully after the class stated confusion. Honestly worst prof i've ever had. Made it very hard to learn the content.

It's clear Dr. Stone is very knowledgeable but doesn't know how to teach. He makes the simplest concepts seem like a nightmare. He would rush through a thousand things in lectures and then we didn't end up needing over half of it. 3 exams plus the final and weekly HW (that takes hours) and quiz in recitation. Take a different lecturer!
Professor is not very good at explaining course work. Makes jokes at the end of class but no one cares. I think he just needs to change teaching style and set up notes differntly.

Stone is good, he was very accessible outside of class and receptive. He gave great feedback and was understanding. He's extremely intelligent and honestly seems uninterested in teaching something low like 1130. He would be way better for math majors and upper level classes. Overall, I would take him again, he's a very caring instructor.

It was very obvious that Professor Stone knew what he was talking about, but his teaching methods were not effective whatsoever. I had to learn most of the content myself, despite attending almost every single lecture. If it weren't for my amazing TA, I probably would have gotten a C in this class.
The best Calc 1 professor you could wish for! Loved his riddles!

Prof Stone is a really intelligent guy that you can tell simply needs to be doing something more stimulating than teaching Calc 1. He definitely is super knowledgeable but often times overcomplicates things and makes it hard to explain.
