Calc sucks and has to get done unfortunately and Prof Stone was by no means the worst, just not great.
Gives a riddle EVERY class which gets very annoying. A very smart guy but is not cut out for teaching. Doesn't know how to dumb done topics and just acts too smart for a calc 1 class.
He was a good professor and the lectures made sense for the most part. He can be funny at times.
Easy, but disorganized class. Extremely lenient grading but expect to work to understand the material. Also, if you are reading this, nerf miner.

He provides no materials, recordings, notes, or slides—just writing on anblackboard and a book focused on applying linear algebra in MATLAB. I struggled since I couldn't take notes, and the book was awful. His tests were mathematically easy but conceptually brutal. I don't know how strict he is on grading yet.
Makes algebraic mistakes on problems that a 5th grader could do. Lectures are pointless and expects you to learn the entire course by yourself.

Dr. Krishnan is a bit unorganized and his lectures can be hard to follow at times. The homework can be very challenging without guidance. However, his exams are fair and he grades very leniently. It is obvious he has a deep understanding of the course content, and the class is very interesting. One of the best math classes available.

Lectures were extremely hard to follow. I found it easier to understand concepts by just looking at online videos. 90% of all lectures are about concepts with very few examples of how to apply them to problems. Be ready to spend time outside of class learning. Exams were straightforward and similar to homework. Overall, the class felt disorganized.

I liked Professor Krishnan. He was kind and wanted to help. The homework was harder than the tests, but that was a good thing. He would work in broad terms and was difficult to understand in lecture, so it took a lot of outside studying to understand the content. Tests were generally fair and easier than homework.
He is a wonderful teacher, but a lot of homework Exam is not so hard

Pros: Tests are pretty simple (Same difficulty as easiest HW problems), Goes through many problems in class, Not much HW, Gives plenty of time to do HW, Very energetic Cons: Often made simple algebra mistakes during lectures which made following his lectures difficult sometimes Overall he was great. Study 3-4 hours a week and you should be good.
Clearly explains course material and tests reflected homework exactly. Had some interesting tangents to keep students engaged.

He wasn't great but wasn't bad either. Sometimes hard to contact. I felt that the course material was somewhat difficult but all the tests were extremely fair and to the point, no curveballs were thrown like many past math classes at OSU. Wasn't an excellent lecturer but was well prepared for class everyday. Attendance not mandatory, but helpful.
He is a nice guy and well-prepared.

Prof Krishnan's class was incredible (averages of 80% on midterms), until we got to second order differentials. He had to do some lectures twice because he got so many questions, and no one i talked to got it. Unfortunately, I have to actually apply ODE's in my major, so thats a big problem for me. Final was brutal, I went from a solid A to a B-.

1152- I feel like he knew what he was talking about, but he moves way too fast. He also scheduled a midterm review session on a Saturday night?? The same date and time as the NHL game at the Shoe. Not exactly "wrong" but just very inconvenient and weird timing.
BAD! I would never want to have him as my lecturer again.

his lectures tend to be a bit unorganized but he isn't really that bad esp if you have taken calc before. def do the ximera hws and practice midterms if the lectures aren't making sense, those should be enough to learn the material. he is a very nice guy, not the best lecturer but not bad either.

Lectures are just alright - they weren't too helpful for me, but they weren't really bad per-se. XIMERA Textbook readings are assigned along with the lectures (usually due the day after a lecture) and that's what got me through the class best

Fun professor to have, at some points over complicated things but besides that was great. Not much is up to him since OSU makes 1151 more challenging for no reason. Be prepared for midterms those are curveballs compared to the practice ones given by the department.
Despite looking he just got out of bed he knows his stuff and can be a pretty funny guy.
He is probably the best math professor you'll have all of college. Lectures are very helpful and I recommend going even though they aren't mandatory

Honestly, the course is the same for all the professors—the same lessons, tests, and homework. However, Prof. Katz is the best lecturer for this class at OSU. He has a low rating, but that's based on things he can't control, the class is going to be hard regardless of whoever you choose. He lets you ask questions if lthe ecture finishes early.

He was funny, and I will give him credit for that; however, that is it. He consistently made mistakes and stumbled over himself, constantly confusing not just the class but himself in the process. If you took calculus before, and your TA is good, you should be okay. The midterms are what you need to look out for. Awful with communicating.

Katz is alright. He delivers the content well and can be funny, but he tends to mess up in lectures and say "you get the gist, let's move on". Class felt a lot easier since I had taken AP Calc in HS, but if you didn't so long as you pay attention in recitation (and have a good TA, I didn't), study the practice exams, and attend lecture you're fine.

Justin is a chill dude but he is not a great teacher. I didn't take calc in HS so the entire semester I was teaching myself. He overcomplicated everything and the lectures all made no sense. Im normally good at math but smth about this class made it terrible. The concepts themselves were not hard but the grading was so strict and my TA was awful.

Katz is mad funny. He always seems like he's had a long night of drinking and crying before every lecture. 1151 is not all that bad as long as you study a decent amount for each midterm. Also, remember that all of your real midterms are harder than the practice midterms.

He's a great guy, but honestly the way he teaches never stuck with me. I attended almost every lecture and payed attention, but I still got very confused. I unfortunately did not take a calc class in high school, so I had to teach myself a lot. My TA was also no help, so I had to do a lot of self-studying. I barely passed, it was HARD.

He's a great person but a terrible professor. If you want any chance of success in this class (if you didn't take calc in highschool) you're going to need to teach yourself. He often gets confused and his TA Alexander Habib was also always confused. The way he teaches differs from the way the exams are graded.

Professor Katz' way of explaining concepts does not make sense to me. On top of that, he makes constant mistakes in his practice problems during the lectures. Luckily, I took calculus in high school, but if you didn't, good luck in his class. Very test heavy and bad explanations. My TA was also awful so maybe a good TA would make it manageable.

He's a great guy and gets too much hate. The class is designed to be difficult and is unreasonably hard, but he honestly made it much more manageable and bearable. I'd definitely take another class with him.

Had him for an 8:00am lecture - which isn't the best to begin with but was doable. I've taken calc previously in high school, and the way the department teaches calc is really confusing even to me. If you're reading this as a student wondering if you should take credit for 1151 or retake it, I'd recommend to take the credit and take 1172 instead.

Would not take this class with him again. Math 1151 is already pretty hard, but I would say Katz makes it harder. He makes mistakes often in lecture. Very tough grader and overall, just not the best teacher. The way he teaches can be hard to follow and understand in my opinion. A lot of your time will be spent relearning material outside of class.
Very energetic, great personality (most of the time), and a great teacher.

Really cool prof just a subject OSU makes too difficult. Not the best teacher but still learned things decently from him. Be ready to learn some things on your own time. 5 midterms and a final, 1 midterm gets dropped. Practice midterms to study are not like the actual midterms at times but that's just the math department at OSU.
n/a n/a n/a n/a
Linus Ge is my goat. Justin gets too much hate.
Taught the course like everyone took calc in high school, but still was a chill guy. TA Dennis however...not so chill.
Justin lowkey a goat and funny. Overhated, your TA will get you right.

Justin's a nice guy. He knows what he's doing, and he's honestly pretty funny, but I wouldn't call him a great teacher. The required work in this class is light, but it's math, so it's worth your time to do the extra stuff. As long as you have a solid TA and make an effort to stay on top of the material, this class will suck, but you'll be fine.

I was always decent at math in this class, but I swear when I come into his lectures I cant understand half the stuff he shows. He shows the hard way and then shows the easy way saying how we should know the hard way anyway. TF. Buddy can never answer emails at all. I emailed him many times that I had to go after class just to talk to the guy.

Dude seems like a great guy, but he doesn't really know what he's doing. I believe this is his first class he's taught so I'll cut him some slack but I pretty much taught myself the entire semester. *If you did not take AP Calc in high school, good luck!*

Katz is very incompetent when it comes to teaching material. Exams are worth 85% of your grade and there is no extra credit given in the class. The only reason I passed this class with a B is because of my amazing TA. If you have Katz as your prof you better hope and pray that your TA is good. Avoid him if you can though.

DO NOT TAKE JUSTIN KATZ.  He constantly makes errors in lecture and the students literally have to scream in a big lecture hall to correct him. The class is 85% exams the graders barely give any partial credit on exams. If you are taking other heavy classes, you will not succeed as you have to teach yourself everything in this class.

I've heard he is new so I will cut him some slack, but he does seem rather disorganized when it comes to the content in class. He is a super funny, laid-back, chill guy but I found it really difficult to grasp the information through his lectures and basically taught myself the entire semester.

I highly recommend avoiding Mr. Katz as your prof. His lectures will NOT prepare for the exam at all (85% of grade). You would think Mr. Katz is a local junkie rather than an educator due to the amount of errors he accidentally teaches before the class complains and he finds his mistakes. Teaching yourself is key to passing this atrocity.

Comes to class high but is way too by the textbook. Uses big math-y words that confuse everyone but when we go to our recitation to talk to the TA, he's like, "oh yeah, it's just *this*" and it all makes so much sense. So Katz just makes everything a lot harder than it really needs to be. But he makes out of pocket jokes that make the class laugh.

Dr. Li is incredibly knowledgeable and patient with students. The grade is based on weekly homework, 3 midterm exams, and a final exam, and she always reviews before exams. She explains the material well and genuinely cares about students' understanding. She also answers emails quickly and extends office hours. Amazing professor for Diff Eq!

Very kind professor, extremely organized. Everything was thoroughly planned and lectures always made sense and were very clear. Numerous midterms and weekly graded homework gave a nice cushion. Good review guides provided. Really good for OSU math.

Very compassionate professor and a good lecturer. She remembers names, has prizes for participation, always stays after class to answer questions, and answers emails quickly. Only 1 homework assignment a week and the 3 lowest scores are dropped. Very lenient grader. I would recommend anyone who is interested in taking MATH 2415 to take her class.
Very nice teacher, patiently answer all the questions after class.
I learned so much from this processor and I would 100% take another math course with her. She is an expert in her field as well as a gifted teacher.
she was amazing!!! i actually took math 1116, but she was so helpful and kind and funny. i would take any of her classes; she's just so good!!!!!

She was by far the best professor i've had at Ohio State, she was very caring about all of her students and would always respond to her emails within an hour or two. What really stood out to me was that she knew every persons name in my lecture hall which was very unique of any lecture i've had. I would recommend going to office hours often.

Never have I ever in any school had such a good professor that cared so much about her students. She is funny and responds to emails immediately, weekdays or weekends. She has no problem spending extra time of her own to meet up with students to help or go over things. She honestly carried the difficult class and made it enjoyable.

She is honestly one of the best professors here. She understands these are hard concepts, and not everyone understands them right away. What impressed me is that she remembers her students' names. Her lectures really help and she's fun! Don't be afraid to ask her questions, even by email, she will help you to make sure you understand.

Marvelous! The BEST math instructor I've ever had. The inverted classroom approach enables you to go at your own pace and ask questions during class with crystal-clear explanations from Dr. Rudman! She will respond to e-mails at pretty much any time seemingly, even late at night. Incredible.
She is an absolute gem! makes sure everyone truly understands the concepts and memorizes everyone's name, even in a 200 person lecture hall.

Amazing professor! You can tell she really cares about her students. She made Calc 3 feel easy because of how well she taught it. She is always willing to talk and help if you need it. 10/10 best professor I have ever had.
Fantastic professor. I would absolutely recommend taking her class.

okay so this was for trig math 1149 but it didnt give me that option to select. but she was amazing!!!! she really takes her time and cares for students. Her exams are exactly what she says they are going to be. No sneaky tricks and she helps outside of class. She has a great caring side about her. just 10/10

Best professor I've had at OSU, I cannot recommend her enough! Great person, funny, and care so much for her students. Lectures were well organized, easy to understand, and had lots of good examples. Weekly homework was sometimes tedious, but prepares you extremely well for midterms and the final (which were always straightforward).

Professor Rudman is literally the best professor I've ever had (and probably ever will have). Calc III is certainly not an easy class, but she explains the material extremely well. She cares so much about teaching and makes sure every single person understands the content. I really hope OSU hires her after her Ross contract ends in a few years.

I wish I could have her for every math class! she makes sure she is teaching everything the best way she can/genuinely wants us to understand everything. The homework wasn't the easiest but over-prepared us for the tests. If you go to the lectures you don't really have to do much outside studying because they're similar to the in-class examples.

The best math instructor I've had. Always willing to help outside of class, phenomenal lectures with great explanations. Homework was fair (if not time consuming), and exams were straight forward and fair. No tricks in this class - you come to class, you do the homework, and you ask questions when you don't understand, you get an A. Take her class!
One of the best professors I've had at OSU and definitely the best I've had in the math department!

Dr. Rudman is an amazing professor and a really nice lady. She really cares about her students. Attendance is not mandatory, but her lectures make subjects easy to understand and are worth it. She interacts with her class and is always available for extra help. There is one homework each week that is pretty long, but the tests are much easier.
One of the best professors in the math department at OSU. Homework is hard but you are allowed wolfram. Exams are straightforward. honestly learned a lot from her and her teaching style.

Could not imagine a better math professor. Interesting lectures, goes out of her way to answer questions thoroughly, and makes sure you never feel stupid for asking a question. Always taught in a way that just clicked. Exams never had unexpected questions or tried to trick you. Cannot recommend enough.
She's one of the best, if not the best professors in the Math department. She's the angel of Math

Legit the best math prof at OSU. AMAZING lectures, makes the content easy to understand and enjoyable. Tests were very straightforward, not trying to trick you or anything. A lot of homework but you get unlimited attempts so its not too bad. Highly recommend her for calc 3!

Not accessible outside of class and office hours AT ALL. Her exams are harshly graded, homeworks are fine but long and tedious. She's very old fashioned and doesn't provide practice exams or study guides or allow cheat sheets. She's a bit intimidating but is nice if you try and ask questions. She could have done more for her students though

Although this was one of the most difficult courses I have taken, I feel like I learned a lot about both Algebra as well as being a better mathematician. Dr. Cueto is a fantastic professor and cares about how her students perform. It is because of this the course was challenging, however if you put in the effort you will do well in the course.

this is your sign if you are reading this to not take this professor. I have gotten an A in every single math class I have taken until I took 3345 with her and failed. She is the most harsh grader I have ever seen and is rude. If you show up to office hours/ask questions she acts mad. She will give you a 0 on an exam question if you miss 1 part.

This course was challenging, but the tests were not too hard. The lectures focus on the theory instead of practice questions. something I dont like: 50% of the final is series (23AU), but the series was only 2/13 of everything we learned. (2) We do not have enough time to review for tests; the Instructor didn't pay much attention on review sections

Avoid at all costs. I already took the equivilant of 1181H and she still manages to make the easiest concepts incredibly difficult to understand. If you take her class get ready for math with no numbers and only letters. Tells us tests will be easier than practice tests but they're actually way harder. Very inaccessible outside class.

Tough but doable. First suggestion- READ THE BOOK. Her lectures are extremely hard to follow at times (not always), but the book covers everything you need to know. If you study the book very thoroughly, you'll be good.  3 exams, 4 quizzes, weekly homework. She gives optional homework questions too- do those when you have the time, or to review.

I absolutely loved having Professor Cueto this semester. Her class was tough -- probably the toughest I have ever taken. However, if you put in the work, you get so much out of it. She really inspires the whole class to love calculus and understand the underlying concepts. Exams were hard and make up most of your grade, though. Would recommend.

Cueto Is a nice person out of class. Her teaching style though seems to lack when it comes to an introductory class. Sometimes lectures are helpful sometimes not. The textbook is a brick wall and the proof she does is not related to the homework/test itself, except for specific types of problems. Self-study and try to work more efficiently in math.

Prof. Cueto was unapproachable. She was clearly annoyed when you asked questions in class. Her exams are unnecessarily difficult. If she is teaching this class, just pass out of it with the qualifying test instead because you will have a terrible time in her class.

Professor Cueto is a really nice professor. Her lectures were decent and the midterms weren't hard at all but for the final it felt like she shot a death cannon at everyone. Averages were an 85% and then the final average was like a 60. Read the textbook along with her lectures and the class is not bad

I found her to be intimidating and difficult to approach. I was afraid to ask questions because I felt that she was being judgmental. If I take another class I'll tale my chances with a different prof

Prof Cueto is very willing to meet with you. She is very understanding about extensions and stuff like that, just make sure to show her that you are putting effort in. Her lectures are very close to the book, but she does a good job illustrating theorems. There's a reasonable amount of homework due about once a week. Overall, great prof!

Overall she was a very forgiving grader on both the homework and the exams. She wanted the whole class to succeed and do well. The first exam was a lil rough, but all the ones after were not hard. She adapted to the classes abilities and the class as a whole was successful.

She is very lecture heavy and I do not find her lectures to be very helpful.  The homework is optional, but to do well you really have to do it.  She provides very few examples (and even the examples seemed pretty abstract to me).  She says the tests are easy, but I did not think so.

Cueto is willing to meet outside of class to answer questions. Teaching is heavily based in theory with few examples (in recitation challenging examples). I had to read and re-read the text to understand. TONS Of HW and tests are challenging and too long.  Noticed several errors in her online keys. I'd avoid.  My class ended up with a big curve.
You have to be the next einstein to get an A in her class

Prof Cueto is one of the most confusing professors I've had to date. She only teaches conceptual ideas and never does numerical problems. If you ask a question in class she talks down to you and never fully explains the topic. Her exams are very difficult and she assigns very long homework assignments. AVOID HER AT ALL COSTS.

Wow this class was awful. she's so robotic when teaching, you can tell she's taking phrases right from the book and she never does examples so you learn nothing in lecture. She also talks to students like they are dumb when they ask questions. Try and avoid having her as your teacher.

Try your best to avoid this professor you will not learn majority of the material because you will be overwhelmed with the way she tries to explain the materials and the amount of homework she assigns

If you have to take this class, i would recommend taking it with another professor. Her lectures are very long and confusing and she doesn't give a lot of examples. I didn't really understand the topics until i did the homework. The homework is also pretty long , and took (at least for me) a long time to complete.
Makes the class way harder than it needs to be. Do yourself a favor and take any other section of calculus 3.
she use course percentage to determine your final grade.. tough grader
She has long pointless lectures and shows mostly proofs which dont really help me. said the tests weren't hard but she was clearly lying cause I failed the first exam...
awful TA, wearing a microphone that has no effect

I ended up dropping the class but for the classes I went to, it sucked. Classes were so boring and she speaks very fast and not clear; very hard to follow along with. She also seems unsure of herself for anything she talks about for the most part, otherwise she seemed sweet. Wouldn't recommend though.

Her "teaching" is just standing at the front of the room, mumbling as she works her way through math problems. She's also incredibly rude. She publicly scolds and shames students when they're wrong. She once incorrectly docked points from my assignment, and tried to bully me out of emailing the professor to fix it. So many more examples, DONT TAKE!
He was my recitation instructor. He is amazing! His recitations were actually very helpful and he is good at teaching. He is definitely nerdy and a little awkward, but he made the class kind of silly
so hard, a half class cannot pass. most of student will retake.

Very poor at teaching the material. A lot of times it seemed like he didnt even know the material. Often he would start a practice problem, then not know how to solve it and say he would send out the answer later that day.

I had a hard time learning from his lectures and it felt like a lot of the time he was not prepared and struggled to even finish one example problem in his notes. His lectures were unorganized and I had to heavily rely on the recitations and math tutoring services to get me through this course.

I feel bad rating him a 3 because I think he genuinely tries and cares about his students, but his English is not perfect, and he struggles to relay the message sometimes. In addition to recitation, there are thousands of outside resources to help you succeed in the class, though. The exams are standardized and fair. No excuse to not do well.

He is constantly cracking jokes in class which did a lot to keep me engaged and entertained. He is willing to work with students with extenuating circumstances as long as he is informed well enough in advance. His lectures are very detailed and interesting and he always posted the lecture notes. He is am excellent professor I would recommend.
The class is hard if you never learn Cal befor, but the professors is great, he will help you with everything, if you have anything you don't know ask him after class or go to his office hour.

Clear and worthwhile lectures. He posts slides online and says that it's so you don't need to take careful notes, but he sometimes forgets to post them in a timely manner so take good notes anyway. Responds to regrade requests for tests and is a fair grader. Helpful in office hours. Great person who cares about students learning.
Made the lectures interesting. Broke down information in an easily absorbable manner. Very willing to help students outside of class.
The class is very hard, but professor Anup was awesome, go to office hours.

Makes lecture interesting, relates the material to different real life examples, office hours are great. Calc will always be difficult especially at OSU, but he made the class bearable. If you have to take calc to understand another class like physics, I recommend him because he gives very detailed and understandable explanations. Cool dude.

Calculus is hard course regardless, but Anup is a great professor!  He makes calculus content understandable and comprehendible. He has great notes, examples and directions, keeps lecture interesting and is overall a great guy and professor. I recommend taking 1151 with him.
I love Anup

There weren't fill in the blank slides given you had to write what he wrote down. Most of the time you couldn't even see what he was writing cuz his hand writing was impossible to read. Half way through the semester went to a different professor's lecture. AVOID HIS CLASS IF YOU CAN'T DECODE BAD HAND WRITING.

Anup is actually an amazing professor, guy is super knowledgeable and makes jokes during class that keep lecture entertaining. It's easy to pay attention and he makes lots of connections to previous material so you always understand the WHY as well as the HOW. If you pay attention, you will learn a lot.

Really great at reading the room and asking students their opinions on the material being covered in lecture. Very available for questions outside of class during office hours. Makes great analogies and jokes during lecture that help students think about math in a different way.

good sense of humor, but man, calculus is not easy. 

confusing at times, but i could have utilized office hours and i chose not to :p

He kept class interesting by joking around and connecting back to old lessons. Lectures always seems to build on each other as the semester progressed. The material was hard to understand at times, but studying outside of class, practice problems/exams, and attending lecture were super helpful and important.
Good lectures that don't go crazy fast and are good about tying back previous concepts. Likes to interact with the class and make jokes to keep the lecture interesting.

Overall great person and professor. Cons are he has in cases a thick accent that makes hard to understand him, and he moves at a very fast pace expecting that all students know the material. But other than that he has a good sense of humor and trys to keep students involved.
Goes through material fast which keeps you engaged if you keep up with it. Very chill, runs good office hours, would take again.
I recommend taking the course of Dr. Yao.

Really a bad lecturer, extremely unclear. You can tell he knows what he's doing but is so so bad at explaining things. I got through it by skipping lectures. Just read the textbook, watch some videos online and study hard for the exams which are the vast majority of the grade. Grading is lenient and his review guides basically mirror the exams.

Makes this class way harder than it has to be. He teaches like a graduate class, exams are a race against the clock, no point in showing up to lecture (about 1/3 of my class does, I am one of them), no curve, 45% final exam 30% midterm 25% tedious weekly homework. His lectures don't correlate to anything, homework won't prep for exam. Don't take it

Really cares about linear algebra and a super nice guy but not the best at communicating it. Lectures are kind of useless because he just does proofs and abstract concepts and he barely gives any examples. not much homework but very loosly align with his lectures. Tests are hard but his sample exams are almost identical to the actuals exams.

Honestly if he didn't give us so much homework then I wouldn't be rating this class so low. The textbook is pretty ok at explaining stuff, proofs do get somewhat confusing though. I also wish the homework had less proofs.

He takes no care in explaining concepts, with abstract examples/definitions with no simplifications to help. He talks too fast for information to digest as well. HW does not line up with his lectures, sometimes touching on topics he discusses the next week over. He genuinely loves linear algebra but cannot communicate that love to others.

Yao's vast knowledge extends beyond textbooks. He introduces improved proofs and offers extra help outside class. His review sessions and study guides aid exams, making challenging material manageable. Can talk fast in lectures, would recommend following his logic rather than taking notes, as he posts all his lecture notes after lectures.

Solid professor for analysis, explains the theory well and was able to answer questions satisfactorily. Homework's not too hard but does require you to think hard and/or go to office hours, for the most part definitely harder than proofs done in class.  Spent a lot of time on exam reviews, do think could've done it more rigorously/learn more stuff.

To put it bluntly, Yao was the worst math professor I have had. He spoke way too quickly and incomprehensibly during lecture and his hand writing was extremely difficult to read. His examples were very unhelpful and had a very difficult time answering students' questions clearly. You would be better off learning through the textbook on your own.

Nice and smart guy, but not a good lecturer. Sped through lectures with lots of complex, unhelpful examples and concepts Also was not very well organized, gave us the wrong (more difficult) midterm 1 and an excessively difficult final (both were then curved, but not enough IMO). I learned 99% of material from the textbook and practice exams.

I really wish I could give Yao a better rating, because he is a nice, caring, and smart person. Unfortunately his way of teaching is very confusing, and I found myself lost more often than not, having to rely on the textbook and YouTube videos to learn. I think with experience, he will become a better professor, but for now, I wouldn't recommend.

BFR don't take Linear Algebra with Liding, he will only lessen your understanding of the content with a combination of bad handwriting, poor word choice, useless abstract examples, inconclusive answers to student questions, and the inability to explain basic concepts.

A nice guy, but introduces concepts in a very poor manner. Introduces variables, and words that nobody in the class is familiar with and fails to elaborate on them. You're basically lost in the class until the practice exam comes out (which is very similar to the actual exam). No curve either. I don't know how anyone got an A.

Prof Yao is incredibly smart and caring, but he cannot teach. His lectures are disorganized and incomprehensible, and the examples are complex not relevant. His practice exams are EXACTLY like the actual exam, which is the only thing that will get you through this course, but other than that the students do not know what is going on in the class.

Legitimately probably one of the worst teachers I've ever had. I've never seen a teacher so woefully unprepared to teach a course. For the first Midterm, he gave us the WRONG exam and his lecture notes were nearly unreadable. This may explain why his lectures are disorganized and only consist of abstract examples and theories.

This may be the first semester that Liding Yao has taught Linear Algebra, but this class has been nearly impossible without reading the textbook. Yao's lectures are mid at best, and his notes are nearly unreadable. He is an unconfident lecturer and should take some time to learn how to teach better before he has any more sections of Linear Algebra.
Not a bad teacher, but the hw and exams are VERY difficult. The median was a 51.
This is undeniably the hardest math class you will take as an engineering major.

Class is taught in a way that makes it more difficult than it has to be. Homeworks were returned with only vague suggestions on what was incorrect and took forever as there was a gap of knowledge that she assumes that we know between her teaching and the textbook (which is incomplete and basically worthless questions. I only passed due to a tutor.
Very Great professor. I learned a lot from her throughout this course. She's super patient and elaborate to answer any questions I have.

By far the hardest professor that teaches this course. Run if you have her. She is very sweet and clearly cares but shes goes WAY too fast in class to where its impossible to follow along, and gives no absolutely no examples of the types of questions that will appear on exams so there is no set way to study. Drop the class if you can
GET OUT OF HER CLASS WHILE YOU CAN!!

Natalia's class is very difficult, made more so by the awful textbook she teaches with. All homework relied on question sets from the textbook, some of which were worded very poorly. However, if you have a strong background in functions, how to transform them, as well as Calculus and Algebra, you will do fine. Office hours are definitely a must.

She is an awesome teacher but the textbook SUCKS. The course is VERY hard and so are the homework. Go to her office hours and you are saved. She is caring and will break down math concepts so you understand and help you learn. But the class is very hard so be warned if you do not have time for office hours. Exams are curved, which is a plus.
Evil professor, do not choose her!

The class is exceptionally challenging yet doable. Prof Natalia is very intelligent and very accessible through multiple approaches to support students. To well handle this course, ensure you don't miss any exams that are 80% of the total grade. There was a slight grading curve that led me to an 'A'  as the final grade.
Really thorough professor, you will learn a lot. Keep in mind the work is very intense, plan on 3-7 hour homework on any given homework.
My life was better before it.

80% of your grade id determined by exams, which have ~4 questions on them. From my experience, the questions on the first exam were much harder than anything she ever covered in class. I ended up withdrawing after the first exam because I did not see myself being able to pass the class.

RUN!!

- Lecture notes are very scattered so it is hard to understand the development of the concepts. 
-  Doesn't take or explain all questions seriously because she understands the material and assumes it is easy for students.
- Office hours is where she actually teaches
- homework is long and your grade depends on 1 question.

This class was very poorly organized and I would recommend that you drop the class if you see her name. She held alot of office hours but the homework was impossible if you didn't go. She was a fair grader for the exams however the average was often around 60-65%. The book was near impossible to understand and all the lectures relied off the book.

The class is almost all graded on tests (about 80%), but they are fair, and reflective of lecture material. The textbook is horrible, and the HW legit takes like 8-12 hrs a week, and is impossible without going to office hours. She has a lot of office hours, and is very willing to help though. The work for this feels more like a 4-5 credit class.

Prof. Golubeva truly cares for helping students succeed and is accessible outside of class (go to office hours), but the course is poorly structured. The Baker textbook tries to teach differential equations from an engineering perspective but is not very good at it. Homeworks are long, graded by a single question for accuracy, and graded harshly.

Dr. Golubeva is nothing but helpful and passionate about this topic and helping students get through it. However, the textbook is bad. The lectures are based off of the textbook as well, and there seems to be a lack of direction in the material for the first few weeks. I would take any other class she teaches, but not one with the Baker book.

Definitely the hardest course I've ever taken. Baker book is atrocious. Teaches using many engineering-related examples and then core concepts, which I'm not sure I enjoy. There was a 9%-11% curve for my section (both MT grades averaged ~65% and final averaged ~70%). Good professor? Sure. Content/roadmap/book? Horribly structured.

Her section for Math 2415 is one of the hardest classes I have ever taken. The homework is long, and you only get graded for pre-lectures, homework, two exams, and the final. However, Golubeva is incredibly caring and very willing to help with any questions you have. Office hours are essential. Her class is tough, but stick it out.

She's knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the subject, but it's extremely hard to get everything. The lectures are sometimes helpful, but the textbook used in this class is unintelligible, only one homework problem is graded out of the many assigned each time (and no feedback is given, just the grade), and no exam prep material is provided at all.

Good gosh don't take her class. She's smart and knows her stuff, sure. I'm writing this review as I slave over 8+ hrs of homework that is only going to be graded by 1 out of 6 problems. If you don't understand one concept out of the many covered by the homework, you're screwed. Homework feedback/learning from mistakes is basically non-existent too.

yes this class is naturally difficult, but dr golubeva is incredible. she's more than accessible outside of class, and her office hours are truly a lifesaver. her tests are fair but challenging, so if you do the homework and go to class you should be fine for the exams. however, the exams make up 80% of your grade in the class so beware

Very good professor. Her lectures are kind of boring but very understandable. I had a conflict during her office hours, but whenever I emailed her with a question I got a helpful response pretty quickly. The homeworks she assigns are very hard and take lots of time to solve, but if you work hard on them you will be well prepared for the exams.

Professor Golubeva makes differential equations at Ohio State as bearable as possible. That said, this is not an easy class. There is a large amount of difficult homework for this class, and the textbook that it comes from is one of the worst I've ever seen. However, Natalia is amazing in office hours to ensure you can complete the homework.

The homework was insanely hard so office hour attendance is mandatory. She is overall a caring professor and you will succeed as long as you put the work in. The lectures were pretty easy to fall asleep or space out in but it is math so. Exams can be tough but she is good with partial credit. Overall a great experience for a tough class.

She is a good professor who gives out TONS of homework. My advice is to find someone in the class who you can do the hw with (this is allowed) because it will be easier. She has a ton of office hours and will help you out in those office hours, please go to them if you are confused.

Avoid her like the plague.The Textbook is unreadable. Her lectures are unintelligible(like the book). She'll say 1 sentence and proceed to copy her notes in silence w/o explaining herself at all.If you show up to office hours half of the lecture hall is there too so she is unable to give you any helpful amount of 1-1 attention to answer questions.

This class is a stupid amount of work but you learn a lot and if you put in the work you will do alright. The homework takes a lot of time each week, but she will ALWAYS help, I've never had a professor who cares more about their students success. The exam questions are much easier than homework and if you understand the homework you will do fine.

Natalia is extremely smart, and is great in her lectures. This class is basically just weekly homework, two midterms, and a final. The midterms and final make up a majority of your grade, but if you do the homework you'll be prepared for the exams. The homework is hard, but she tells you how to solve the problems if you go to her office hours.

Her homework is hard to do by yourself so go to her office hours. She goes fast during lecture and can be a little overwhelming. However, in office hours she is super willing to help. The homework has 1 random problem graded for accuracy and 1 for completion. Tests are very similar to the homework and with 2 midterms and a final are weighted 80%.

Pretty intimidating to me, but actually very willing to help especially during office hours. I never could finish homework by myself but able to figure it out as long as I attended ALL the office hours. Lots of HW, weighted 2 midterms and final heavy, but exams aren't nearly as bad as homework. Very generous grader overall, small curve.

Great professor, but don't even bother doing the homework outside of office hours, you'll waste your life away in misery. It's based off one of the worst textbooks in history that makes Ximera look like candy.

If you do the homework and understand how to do each problem, you will do well on the exams. If you don't understand a problem, you have to talk to her to understand it. At first, the class will be confusing, but at one point she will bring it all together and it will make sense. You will learn a lot from the class and can do well if you try.

Natalia is one of the best instructors I've ever had. Math tends to come a bit easy to me, so combined with her teaching, I didn't find the material hard. However, for those who do, her office hours are extremely helpful and she's super willing to help anyone who asks. Great lecturer.

The homework can be rather long and tedious. However, if you go to her office hours she walks you through the problem to make it easy to understand. Her lectures follow the textbook, so if you miss one class you can read the textbook and figure it out. Her texts are extremely fair, and pretty simple if you understand the material and study.

Homework is ridiculously hard and tedious, so dont wait til the last minute like I did. If you can logic your way through homework problems, exams will be a breeze. If you can visualize what the question is asking graphically, solving the problems will be a breeze

Natalia is a solid choice for Math 2415. Go to class and take notes; she gives you all the tools you need to be successful in the course. I would only recommend the textbook as supplementary material. Homework is a long drag, but go to her office hours and she will help you with any problems. Not an easy A (its diff equations!) but fair exams.
Natalia is a great professor, and she explains problems very clearly in lectures. The exams are easy. Easy A !!!

Terrific Lecturer! The best thing is she is always accessible outside of class through email and separate appointments. The homework(s) are too long and annoying but the midterms are easy. Just make sure to attend class, take notes, go to her office hours with problems, and this class should be a breeze.

She was an average instructor. She was really slow at explaining things and had to rush the harder topics at the end. She is more about the trivial operations than the big picture. Pretty boring repetitive lectures. You can skip a class once in a while and not notice anything different the next class. Also 4 midterms, seriously?

One of the best Math teachers at OSU. If you are planning to take math 2415, I would definitely recommend her. If you show to the class, pay a lot of attention, and do all the home works  this class is an easy A.

Really nice teacher. Seems like one of the better choices for 2415. Even though the class is uniform across all sections, she does a good job teaching diff eq and does helpful example problems. Her accent wasn't an issue for me.
Super nice. I was in a night class, so she taught both lecture and recitation. Explain theories or principles clearly, very patient. Interact a lot with students. Very generous on scores.

I found Natalia to be kind and helpful, and wish she taught ALL my math classes. She always made sure we understood everything, and she explained the material quite well. I had no trouble with her accent. I would recommend her!

Over all she is a nice teacher but I found it very hard to understand her and understand her teaching methods. If you try to ask her a question that may seem that she is wrong she gets very frustrated. Over all I would not recommend her as a teacher. Switch classes.
She gives very clear, concise lectures and good review problems.  I had no trouble understanding her accent.  One of the best profs teaching the 151-153 series.
easy to understand
Lectures are kinda boring, but if you stay awake you'll get the material, but the tests were tough.
Hated this professor. She was broad did not speak very clear English at all. Avoid at all costs.

OSU math sucks, so this class naturally sucked.  She has been my best lecturer thus far, but my first two were pretty bad.  On the upside, she's very helpful if you go to her during office hours.  She kinda hard to understand, but not too bad compared to most.

She was a very good teacher.  One of the best you can get when it comes to math classes at OSU.  Very helpful and very clear.  Her notes were very organized and she was very friendly and sympathetic towards the students.  Her midterms and final were also quite fair.  I would recommend her.

I did not like this class at all. She goes way too fast in lecture and doesn't give you time to think. I went to MSLC 3 times a week just to understand her lectures. I do not wish her upon anyone. If you don't have to take this class, DON'T. If you have to take this class, avoid her like the plague!
lectures move extremely fast, and follow straight from the book... shes friendly and will do her best to answer your questions.. compared to other professors.. i wouldnt complain if i got her again

She is the worst teacher at OSU. Her lectures are extremelly quick and unclear. She always makes mistakes on the board. Her exam reviews are nothing like her exams. Her homework assignments are nothing like her exams. She focuses on theory way too much. She's confusing. Class average 54% on exams.

Dr. Golubeva is very good at explaining both practical problem solving techniques and the concepts behind them, and gives fair exams.  I never had a problem understanding her accent; it's actually rather pleasant.
She was friendly but out of class but hard to follow in class. She had a Russian accent which was a little hard to follow at times.
No Comments
I agree, tests are fairly easy but lecture is confusing. Especially when "pi" is pronounced "pee." :)
i liked her, tests are fair, and she bellydances

Apparently, going to school in the U.S.A. doesn't always warrant having a teacher capaple of speaking English.  The only point to going to lecture would maybe be to catch up on some sleep.  She tries hard but its difficult to understand

I didn't put much effort into the class so can't speak for her helpfulness but the test were alright i thought (though our first exam average was a 38...i got a 69), she also was russian or something so was somewhat hard to understand
easy tests... teaches well...

I love M3816 because it helps me prepare for the SOA-FM exam. Additionally, Professor Molloy is super kind with his students—he provides extra resources for us to study, and he is always willing to help us.

Molloy is the best professor I have ever had. He genuinely cares about his students and is almost always available. The course was decently hard, but he teaches it very well and is always looking for ways to improve student's grades. Wish he taught more of the classes that I have to take.

Molloy is the best professor I have ever met at OSU. Please take his course. He will try his best to improve your grade. Every time I go during office hours, he is always patient. He replied to the emails so quickly.

This was a difficult class material-wise but Molloy is a great professor and really cares about his students. He wanted students to do well, and he curved all exams by around 10-15 percent. He offers office hours a lot and is always available over email. He is also willing to discuss the actuarial industry with students. Take 3618 with him!!

Martin is one of my favorite professors at OSU so far. Too many of my professors have "office hours" for 1 hour a week (not sure how you can consider it office hours plural if it's a singular hour), but Professor Molloy has office hours for multiple hours/day at least 3 days per week. Go to lecture and study the material and you'll do fine.

Martin is the best math proffesor I have ever had at OSU. He is so kind, helpful, and is great at explaining. If you participate in class, whether right or wrong, you get credit for it. He is always available on zoom if you need help. Go to class, pay attention, ask questions, you will get an A. If you are taking MATH 3618, take it with him!!!

Terrible at teaching, goes extremely quickly and assumes you understand the material. Goal to pass the class is to see how little you can fail every exam so that other grades keep you with a high enough score.

For being pre-calc with review she did a good job re-teaching things to help you understand pre calculus. However, sometimes she over complicates things and goes into problems way too far. The hardest part was the amount of work to keep up with. Exams weren't that bad, but still had to study- quizzes are what dropped my grade.

Lots of homework, and lots of quizzes in recitation. Most of the time, the exams would have questions I have never seen before. The reason I got a good grade was because I was always in office hours and the tutor room. In lectures, she would go on tangents about a small detail that made a confusing concept impossible to understand by the end.

Over-complicates simple math to confuse students and calls it "understanding the theory." Her lectures are far too fast and impossible to complete on paper. Wrote her own textbook that's just as confusing as her lectures. Office hours are essential because she gives away answers there. Learned far more from recitation teacher and Organic Chem Tutor
takes problems that could be solved in two steps and turns them into 5 steps
Post answer keys with incorrect answers, never gets through a full lecture. Unwilling to work with students to help them succeed. Annoying voice.

Nothing stressed me out more last semester than this class. I was less busy with my core major classes than this prerequisite class. So much studying needs to be done just to receive a decent grade. The tests never match what we learn in class. Professor Miller often confuses herself in class and we never get through the entire lecture.

She's not good. We hardly ever got through our notes in lecture, she would frequently confuse herself and then everyone else. She actually told one of my classmates that her job is to confuse us in lecture and get everyone lost because it "makes us think". I could keep going, its all bad. Save yourself and your GPA. Don't take her.

If you would like to do well or maintain a good GPA, I would not recommend taking Professor Miller's class. She goes fast, and never finishes her lecture notes. If you have questions, she will give you what she believes is the right answer, but then mark it as incorrect when she grades it. The homework and tests are never on what is taught in class

Worst math teacher ever. You can attend every lecture and ask so many questions and it still won't make sense. Ask her for help on the homework and she will tell you what she believes is the right answer but then will take points off even though she just told you it was correct. Don't take this class if you care about your GPA.

If I could rate her zero, I would. She is the worst professor Ive ever had. She says we are not allowed to have tutoring help on assignments. The majority of the class is failing but she will not slow down the material. She confuses herself with her questions but expects us to solve them. If you care about your grade, dont take her courses.

She sometimes would start problems during lecture and not know or forget how to finish them. Overall, I think that she was a good lecturer and if you put in the work, you can receive a good grade in the class.
Great lecturer. Dont be afraid to ask questions during or after lecture.

Do not recommend. Going to lecture in person feels like a waste of time. Prof. Miller was unable to do certain example problems without giving up due to mistakes. She then had us go home and do them ourselves and put these questions on exams.
I thought there may have been an issue in grading my final exam and emailed her to ask for some clarification and she never replied. My grade was entered and I failed the course.

took her hybrid class, terrible decision. had to retake math1152. if you like online classes then this is your best bet. go to recitation, dont cram for exams, work on problems from the textbook and do not rely on her lectures. the math department makes the exams much harder than her actual class.

If you have not taken Calculus before I recommend taking it in person. Online is less clear but Elizabeth does a great job with it. This semester it was made much easier than before. All points were scaled down heavily to make getting an A very attainable. Very helpful and nice professor

This was the bridge course (the equivalent to 152).  She did the lecture online and then recitation was in person with a TA.  My TA was wonderful! However, I can't say the same for doctor miller.  Upon contacting her with a question, she was incredibly rude and short- not helpful at all.  Her exams were very difficult and there was hardly a curve.

This was the quarter semester bridge for 151 and 153.  Basically 152, but in 7 weeks, and all online with hybrid recitation.  Math department makes sure that the midterm and final exam make you sweat and feel less than empty in 50 minutes.

Best teacher I have had at OSU. She is so clear and so nice.  She explains everything perfectly and trumps the whole math department in teaching style.. she was perfect.  People from other 152 sections would watch her lectures cause she was so good.
Loved Dr. Miller...she actually wasnt my lectureer but I went to her class because she taught the material well and I could understad it better. One of the best math teachers at OSU by far!

I'd probably consider her to be the best teacher I've ever had.  Exams are written by the department, so the difficulty is not up to her, but she'll do everything in her power to teach what she anticipates what will be on the exam and is usually right.  Just listen to all her tricks and study old exams and you'll ace the class.

I'd probably consider this professor to be the best teacher I've ever had.  Exams are written by the department, so the difficulty of those exams are not up to the math professors, but Miller will do her best to prepare you for what she anticipates to be on the exams.  Pay attention to all the tricks she teaches because they always help on tests.
I like her teaching very much. She is the most clear teacher I've ever met so far.

Dr. Miller is by far the most clear math lecturer I have had at OSU.  She knows how to teach the material to her students in a way that they can more easily comprehend it.  Her lectures are posted online and are by far more helpful than most professors' actual lectures. Highly recommended.

She is actually no longer my professor, but I attend her lectures instead of my real professors. She is great at explanations, really tries to get students involved, and always keeps up on date of quizzes, workshops, and events. I learned a lot from her, and the online lectures are super convenient, if you feel like revisting material or skipping.

Couldn't understand my first calc prof. so I switched to her class and she was much better! Helpful and clear, however the material in general is very difficult. Once you get behind it's extremely hard to catch up. Only take this class if you are VERY GOOD AT MATH! Took calc in HS but it didn't even compare to how hard this class was.
A pretty good teacher. She talks very fast and covers a lot of info quickly, but if you stay up on your work you can get ahead and easily get an A

Very kind and optimistic professor.She helps at the MSLC reviews,so she knows how to explain pretty well.Because she always uploaded the completed lecture notes,I stopped going to class about 4 weeks in.I wouldn't recommend this,but I went into the final exam over 100%, and finished with an A.This took a lot of independent learning though.

Dr. Miller is actually a good professor. The test averages in our class were always higher than the other classes.  But the tests are hard in general.  The lectures are good, but the examples are always much easier than the questions on tests.  She is very helpful and she makes sure than you understand the material.

I liked her alot, she was very clear, and helped you out in any way. She sent you the slides after every lecture, and was always at her office for help. I would definatly recommand her for Math 151. Plus she's not bad looking either.
Great professor! Is very clear and helpful. I dont know why there are negative comments, I found her to be a very useful lecturer and I hope she will be my professor again.
Terrible Teacher

Have fun. Her class's are extensive and you will feel like you just waisted an hour of your time.  She rushes through the material, thank god she puts the material up on Carmen.  Her examples rarely ever help and she is always moving on to the next section.
"I weep for you" - Adrian

Professor Lam was a good lecturer but nothing super special. He knew his stuff and got us prepared for the exam. Lectures were a little bit boring but overall a good professor. The homework wasn't all that difficult they just took a while sometimes. There was a ton of midterms though 5 in total which was not very fun.

I didn't enjoy the content of the class.  The professor lacked energy and looked like he was always tired, which in turn made me tired.  I was an ok class but it really took a lot for me to get motivated to attend classes.

Easily the best lecturer I've had in the math department. Dr. Tien does a good job balancing application, computation, and theory, and motivates all the topics covered. His exams are fair if you study a normal amount, and he is very available outside of class.

Tien changed my life. Amazing lectures, starts with motivating examples to show how whatever we're learning is useful then goes on to do some examples. Lectures are super structured and easy to follow. Homework was significantly harder than the exams and exams were very fair. Best math teacher i have had ever!
His sample exam is very helpful for students to prepare for midterm and final. If I have a chance, I like to take his course again.

OSU needs to clone Joesph and make his clones teach math. Thats how good he is at teaching. He also cares so much about people and is willing to answer even the dumbest questions. Its clear he wants people to learn and I should have realized this sooner. Its not about getting a good grade, its about learning how diffy Q works. LET HIM COOK!!!

BEST lectures I've had from the math department. He cares a lot about students and will go out of his way to help/ accommodate you. He explains confusing concepts clearly and answers questions thoroughly. Lots of examples in lecture which were super helpful.
he is very considerate for students. I would definitely take his class again

The greatest Math professors in Math department. He explains math concepts clearly and did many examples in class which helps a lot. Exams are fair and he graded it fairly. Just do the homework you will do well in this class.

100% the best professor I've ever had in the Math Dept at OSU. Genuinely cares about his students, even past their understanding of the material. Always happy to meet outside class/office hours if you ask, always answers questions during lecture, and cares about the students learning and enjoying the class. No harsh grading either. 12/10.
Professor Tien makes the content of the course much more easier than I expected. His lectures are inspirational and informative, and he is also a very approachable person.
The best professor I've ever had. Informative lectures, quick responses, and clear explanations. Take him if you want to pass the course and truly learn something.

Dr. Tien is who you want for this class. Easily one of the best professors I've ever had. He could not have explained the content of this course in a more clear, easy-to-understand way. Very friendly and caring person as well. Overall, 10/10 professor

Prof. Tien is a gem, probably the best math teacher I've had. He's down-to-Earth and really cares about you understanding the material. Everything he says makes sense and if you still don't get it, he's pretty accessible outside of class. Highly recommend him!
Amazing professor. Would definitely recommend. Take him!!!!

Informative lectures that help clarify material from the textbook. Cares about students a lot and is helpful in office hours. I disliked the class itself but the professor was so good that he made it bearable.

Joe made a relatively difficult subject very easy to understand. This was my first exposure to mathematical proofs and I'm very glad I had Joe as a lecturer. The exams were very fair and he's a caring person in general so I would definitely recommend.

Professor Tien is a great math teacher. This class is all proofs and could be very challenging with the wrong professor. Joe will go over the same proof 5 times if he thinks the class doesn't understand it. Very caring and wants everyone in the class to enjoy math (he does math riddles in class sometimes). Book for the class is helpful and only $10

Dr. Tien is a caring and passionate teacher and makes sure his students stay engaged and succeed. Math 3345 content is very proof-based and not always the most interesting for non-math majors, but he does his best. His lectures are very helpful and exams and homework is fair. Class may be difficult if it's your first time doing proofs.

You really don't need to go to lecture because he just derives equations and it makes everything seem so confusing. If you just do the homework and make sure you understand it all you are truly guaranteed an A on the exams.
WAY TOO MUCH THEORY!! He never did examples which were helpful. Could have skipped lecture every day and just read the textbook.

Joe is a decent professor. His lectures aren't super helpful because he goes into too much theory.  However, he does try to "dumb down" differential equations for the class, which helps a lot. His exams are fair, with some being pretty easy and others being pretty challenging. Overall, he is a good professor and you should do fine in the class

Joe Tien is by far the best math teacher I have had. His explanations to differential equations start basic, and he gradually increases the complexity. He keeps students engaged, and prepares you for applied Diff EQ. Test are very fair. Differential Eqns are a difficult topic regardless of the teacher, but Tien makes it as easy as possible.
sucked. please dont take this your gpa will drop TT
DO NOT TAKE THIS PLEASSEE UGH
Avoid this guy. Average on the midterm was a 40% and highest was 80. Doesn't care about teaching and his lectures are incoherent.

Homeworks are graded a little harsh but aside from that he seems reasonable. Usually replies fast to emails and tests aren't too difficult if you understand the material. At times difficult to understand. The recent midterm wasn't difficult to finish in the time given, and most questions were extremely similar to those posted on the practice exam.

Honestly don't understand the hate for this guy. He comes in every day with a smile on his face and laughs when no one will laugh at his jokes. He teaches all the content thoroughly and posts multiple practice midterms along with pages and pages of notes. The practice exams were very similar to the midterm too, and there's usually a curve.

Zeshen 's exams are a LITERAL NIGHTMARE. No joke, his teaching is exactly like Jackie Chu from SuperMarioLogan. His exams are way way too long for the time you have. Please drop, I have no idea why he is still employed at OSU.
He is the toughest grader I ever met, linear algebra is supposed to be trivial, but he decided to make it my hardest class. If you have him, prepare for a very, very tough semester ahead.

Right before a midterm worth 30% of our grade, he said that he doesn't expect people to be able to finish in time and he will be happy if the average is above 65%. He doesn't care about teaching. His lectures consist of him reading out his sloppy pre written notes and going through examples incoherently.
drop the class

Zeshen Gu is worst lecturer I have ever had in my entire life. HIS TESTS ARE MUCH MUCH HARDER THAN HIS CLASS MATERIAL. Do not be fooled by the practice exams, switch sections or drop this class immediately.
Impossible to reach, impossible midterms. HE WILL FAIL YOU.
Professor is a really smart person. I love his lectures.

Extremely difficult midterms and little feedback. Tests were based more on fast computations than on understanding the material. If you can integrate by parts fast, you will succeed. If not, good luck. Tests were based on homework, just way too long to finish. I feel my grade didn't match my understanding. Avoid.

AVOID THIS PROFESSOR AT ALL COSTS. DROP OUT IF YOU HAVE HIM, EVEN IF IT TAKES AN EXTRA SEMESTER TO GRADUATE (just do the EM exam instead if no section works). Taking Gu is signing up for the worst semester of your life.

He is pretty funny in class as he randomly laughs out of nowhere, however, he is not so good at teaching though he is a teacher. He has more room for improvement than the cardinality of the real number set. Linear algebra is supposed to be an easy class, but not!!! No such thing as bad student, only a bad teacher.
WORST TEACHING, IMPOSSIBLE EXAMS, DO NOT TANK, YOU CAN QUALIFY FOR AIME/USAMO AND STILL FAIL THIS CLASS. FIND SOMEONE ELSE ASAP!

genuinely the most awful professor i have ever had the displeasure of having in my entire college career. handwriting = horrible. lecture notes arent even his. give up and throw in the towel with this prof, get out while you still can. bro comes to lecture in the same green shirt every day for weeks and the same sandals. he isnt professional.
make sense to all?

For your own mental health, drop this class. For the brave souls: don't bother attending lectures other than for the exams. Grind study the material on the practice exams and you'll get by.

The GTA, Natalia, is the only reason this class is survivable. She is an easy grader, so just put down ANY work for problems and you'll get pity points.

Not one to bash profs but my goodness. Lectures are awful. Bad notes and his handwriting is chicken scratch. First exam was near impossible to complete in time. To be fair, exams got slightly easier after the first but avgs. were still in the 60s. Just made the class harder than necessary. Textbook has lecture videos that were solid, use those!!

Drop this class if you have Zeshen Gu. Awful lecturer, moves too fast and expects you to know everything. His handwriting is illegible and he makes mistakes on half his problems. Tests are hard. Midterms were just 55 minutes and had about 5 long questions--averages were around 60%. Do the homework well, you'll need any grade help you can get

Dr. Zeshen Gu is an intelligent person but not very good at teaching. His lectures are very hard to follow and I learned little to nothing from them. However the homework is good and teaches the material effectively. The midterms and finals are fair and there is plenty of review material for the exams.

Horrible lecturer and even worse hand writing and explanations. Went through everything too quick. YouTube explained everything better once I stopped going to lectures. I'd drop the class and take it at cscc if you can. Grades are mostly determined by exams.
Worst lecturer at OSU, notorious for ruining students' perfect 4.0 status. If you get this professor, change IMMEDIATELY before it's too late.

Dr. Gu was clearly very smart and very passionate. He knew math very well, but just did not teach it very effectively. His lectures were always quite fast-paced, which made content quite difficult to understand. I don't think he really knew how to best communicate with students, which caused a lot of confusion on my end.

Do not take his class! He is a terrible professor and doesn't teach anything. He makes mistakes all the time and his writing is very messy. He is also very hard to understand. He will ruin your grade!!!

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. His handwriting is illegible, he is unable to concisely and effectively communicate answers. This professor wrote our final, took it himself, scored below an 80% on it, and took 50 minutes to complete the test (students get an hour). Completely unrealistic expectations for all of his students. Do not take Dr. Gu!!!

His lectures have no structure. Zeshen only reads off of slides (which aren't even his own). On the 1st day, I witnessed 20 people leave within the first 10 minutes. My favorite announcement from Zeshen was when he pushed back an assignment bc "he felt lazy" and didn't want to grade it "that weekend" (this was less than two days before it was due).

Going to this professor's lectures is like having to watch a toddler waddle around and spew incoherent garbage for 55 minutes. On top of that, the exams and quizzes were many times harder than was necessary, and the professor posts no notes on the Carmen webpage. If at all possible, either change lecturers or drop this class. You will hate it here.

Dr Gu  was clearly very smart, but this was the issue. He didn't explain things as if he was teaching them to students he explained them as if we were all on his level. He also spent a very long time on each topic but didnt really go over them in a way we could learn them. Grades took forever to come out. Midterm averages were slightly above 50.

While he is obviously very smart, he lectures incredibly fast and he is extremely difficult to follow, and he struggles to answer many students' questions in a clear or concise matter. You look away for 2 seconds and you have missed 10 pages of his lecture.
Cannot teach to save his life. Midterms are easy, final was impossible.

Incomprehensible voice and incoherent lecturing back when I took the class. The real issue is, his tests were EXTREMELY EXTREMELY HARD. People got D's on quizzes simple units such as cross products and vectors, and the final had an average grade being an F. Do yourself a favor and AVOID THIS GUY!!! Take literally anyone else and it will be better.

I had him in AU23 and he was a pretty terrible lecturer. He moved so fast through lectures and was hard to understand, so I always had to go back and rewrite notes later. He lectured us like we all had mathmetician brains that worked like his. Tests are VERY hard, so take as many practice tests/questions beforehand as possible. Test heavy course!

Miserable class. This quiz was simply atrocious and no one knew or could learn what they had to know (I know people in his section). I'm so glad I switched sections (more about that in a previous review). Avoid this guy at all costs.

Zeshen Gu is a nice guy, but not a great professor. Let's just say after the first lecture of my section of the semester, 43 people dropped out of the class. He doesn't teach well and goes too fast. He also doesn't tell you what content is being asked before a quiz/test. I wouldn't recommend him at all.
Bro doesn't want to teach, find another section asap

By far the hardest class you will ever take at OSU. Worst teaching and infamous for ruining people's straight A status. You will not get an A in this class. Be fortunate if you pass; the average student failed the final.
EXTREMELY HARD. Like running before you know how to walk. Avoid at all costs!
Very difficult tests, the students are very uncomfortable to take his course.

He is the hardest math grader and the worst math teacher. Im pretty sure the average grade for his final was a fail. He is the worst professor at ohio state and everyone knows not to take him, so avoid zeshen and you will be fine
the GOD AFWUL WORST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY ENTIRE LIFE DONT DO IT

He is the worst professor I have ever had in my life the average grade on his final was an F. He made the material significantly harder than it needed to be for literally no reason. He enjoyed showing off his understanding of math to students but at the expense of their learning and grades
He was very funny, the tests were easy, and you didn't even have to go to class to get an A. 5/5 recommend again. Dr. Gu is one of the the most intelligent teachers I have ever had.

His teaching style isn't for everyone, but personally I enjoyed it. He goes through lectures very quickly, but if you can keep up, and are thoughtful of which parts of the lecture to pay more attention to, they can be very informative. The only truly awful thing is that you won't know your grade until after the final exam due to the large curve.

It was his first semester teaching afaik, but I thought he was decent. Often got confused when students asked him questions, but overall taught the material that was required and posted notes online for easy review. Homework is easy to get 100% on, and I thought the exams were fair, but maybe a bit too long for the time we had to do them.

Zeshen Gu was very distant and did not seem to care much about the preformance of his students. He was obviously very interested in math and the challenges that came with it and would try to flaunt his understanding and intelligence over the students rather than actually teaching.
I hated this class so much, I dont want to do math ever again

Zeshen Gu is the worst math professor in the entire department. If you have him, you will have a very very tough semester ahead of you. He does not teach well at all, and he grades very very tough. The average for his final was an F. He is by far the worst combination in a teacher, bad at teaching, tough on grading.

While professor Gu did they indeed have a sense of humor from my experience, that is the one of the only two positive things from this class. The other being that homework assignments were relatively simple. However, the tests were very difficult, and he lectured at a lightning quick pace. The standard of teaching at Zeshen Gu is deficient, and students are not recommended to enroll in Zeshen Gu classes. easily the worst professor I have ever had. In the end, he refused to give students their grades back because final exam grades were so low, the average student failed, so he simply didnt even give the exams back

One of the greatest professors ever. He is very good at teaching the concepts he talks about and is always willing to help students. There is also a lot of extra credit for students and you get a full sheet of paper as a cheat sheet so it is relatively difficult to fail the class.

Dr. Talamo is AMAZING. I struggled BADLY in 1151 and was buckling up for another hard semester. He does an amazing job of teaching the material in a practical way. Talamo is a great prof. You can pretty much fully take the class from home on your own time if you want. Every midterm there are corrections, as well as extra credit opportunities.
Great teacher, makes all lecture material available online. No curve hurts, but the group portion of the class makes it up.

Great professor, actually cares about his students learning the material instead of them getting a grade. Jim is a very good professor. He explains concepts very clearly and the class is extremely organized which is very nice. However, this class is definitely challenging and time consuming. There is a lot of work, but it prepares you well for the exams.

Best Math Professor ever. If James teach any other math courses, I will choose him without a second thought. All the hard parts are clearly explained by Jim‘s intuitive lecture notes, which made my study go smoothly throughout this course.

1000/10

actually one of the best professors I've ever had for math

After 1151, I was scared I would struggle a lot with this class, but Talamo provided every single resource and opportunity necessary to succeed. I did every team-midterm on my own and only really bothered watching the lectures for studying, and I did great.

There are tons of opportunities to raise your grade with test revisions and extra credit. His tests are very similar to the samples he gives out. The group midterms can be challenging so start them before the day they're due.

Currently in this course, one of my all time favorite professors. He posts so much content for you to use depending on your learning style (lecture vids, online interactive free textbook, guided notes, practice questions & exams) and is a fantastic lecturer. Lectures are optional, but go. Cheat sheets on exams & midterm test corrections is a plus.
