Talamo just grabs your attention the moment he begins and it just helps me pay more attention to his lectures and understand what is going on throughout the semester. Best calc teacher I have had.
the goat

Can be extremely biased and has favorites despite what all the other ratings say. Helpful to some but unhelpful to those who he doesn't look highly upon based on his own opinion. Exams are difficult and are usually harder than any practice exam. We had no test corrections but I heard the students now do so i'm not totally sure what that is like.

1172 is definitely a difficult class because of how much stuff there is to do throughout, but the grading scheme is extremely fair and provides a million chances to get back up if grades slip. Just please don't COAM. Jim is a great guy. Sometimes his lectures get a bit slow, so just watch on a higher speed. First class where I actually enjoyed math

Hands down the best professor I'll ever encounter at this University. Lectures are awesome; they're in-person, online, and prerecorded. Exams are online and you get to complete a portion of it with a team of 4. You can also revise your exam. This guy takes teaching to a whole new level!
What a great Pro. He really knows what he's doing and has a fantastic way of teaching and conveying the new concepts.
great, just make sure to stay up to date and not to fall behind. Lot's of opportunity for success.

Great at teaching content. Also, I liked that he made online lecture videos and the class was more of a review and ask questions about the videos. It really helped me learn the content well. Overall, Talamo is a great professor.

Hated how the class is set up-flipped classroom-had to everything on your own. Lecture videos are long and boring. The team exams were very annoying and took an excessive amount of time. The actual exams were hard but you can use notes, which would help a bit. You can revise for up to 50% back on exams (but usually you don't get the full 50% back).

BEST MATH PROFESSOR! Definitely try to take his course because he is one of the best professors out there. The next semester, I had a question about the math class I was taking then and my professor was unavailable, and he still helped. 
Incredible professor who is insanely smart, and his exam problems are funny.
Highly highly recommend.

Absolutely amazing. Along with Dr. Rudman, they deliver the BEST math class I've taken. The flipped classroom model is PERFECT for math and makes learning YOUR responsibility. Class time is about asking questions on homework and time for homework is lecture time. Midterms are straightforward and group midterms are a nice challenge.
He is an excellent professor. His lecture videos are very thorough and he ensures the content is clearly explained.

He's a good professor and has a great personality. 

The course is a classic Engineering weed-out course that is designed to break you. yeah, they may teach a+b=c but they'll be very creative in turning it into an impossible question, especially in the take-home midterms. Just keep at it and don't give up. He's always available to help.

Talamo gives you everything you need to succeed (practice exams) and has great lectures. He has a great personality.The class grade is the 4 midterms and final. Ximera homeworks are too long and due every other day. I didn't do well on the midterms (~60%) and final but had a good team on the team midterms and because of corrections, got a B+.
Organized and what is covered in class is what you are tested on

This instructor is great as same as the rate! I took his 1172 last semester. His grader always give clear and detail comments about why the points losing in the midterm, and you got chance to make revision to get up to 50% lost points back.
So many resources available to succeed. Talamo does a great job at explaining topics and offering different ways for students to learn.

He does "Reverse Classroom Style" which did not work for me. You can easily get 100% on homework. But the tests are really hard. This semester had 4 midterms, which felt like a lot. There is a timed part (which I could never finish) and home (which can get insanely hard). He lets you do revisions on the test after. He is a great guy- wholesome.

Professor gives students option to learn according to their learning style. Each topic is discussed in person, via videos, through an online text book, and reviewed through homework. Exams have individual timed portion which can be revised for half credit back, and a group portion which the group has a few days to complete.

Jim is one of the best math professors I've had. He truly has a passion for what he teaches and he explains the concept really well and he always answered my questions. There are 4 midterms  and each one is split into a timed and take home part all of which are virtual. The take home exam can take 4-5 hours long but you take it with a group.
Professor Talamo is very good at what he teaches

Jim does pretty well with the lectures and helps his students understand the material. All of the lectures can be attended over zoom if desired and all of the recordings are posted. The tests are challenging and they are split into a timed and take-home portion (which can sometimes take 4+ hours) It is a lot of work, but otherwise he is great

Jim is an AMAZING professor. He was always providing as many resources as possible to help on exams and quizzes. He was very understanding and accommodating to students. He is one of the few bright spots in the Math department.

Tough class! Had him before COVID and then he was extremely arrogant when I had him and didn't like me asking him questions! Tests were hard and you gotta make sure you study hard since there weren't "corrections"   you could do

Talamo was a good professor. He makes it really difficult to not succeed in his 1172 course. There are plenty of EC opportunities and you can correct your tests for 1/2 credit back. Best prof I've had for math thus far at osu.

Jim Talamo was a really great math teacher. His lectures explain the material very well and make it understandable. The tests are hard, but he allows test corrections so you can learn from your mistakes and improve your grade. Half of the tests are with a group but are long.

Dr. Talamo is the best professor I have had. He made difficult conceptual concepts easy to grasp. He abswers questions very well and is super accessible outside of class. There are 1 to 2 pre-lecture videos to watch which normally are around an hour, and then he asks that you attempt the ximera homework prior to class to ask informed questions.

Talamo is a great teacher. His pre-recorded lectures are super informative and he let's you take group tests which helps to boost the grade. However, the class is quite difficult so be prepared to put some work in.
Professor Talamo is great. He explains concepts in an easy to understand manner. Tests are long but reasonable and you can make revisions for half credit back.
The professor is very helpful and the course is set up very reasonably. As long as you do your work, this professor makes it so you can succeed.
This class completely sucks and Jim is extremely arrogant with a superior attitude. He also didn't teach much when I had him! Exams are difficult and TAs blatantly make mistakes while grading!

Great professor, tough class.

Be prepared for low initial exam grades, you are able to correct exams for half credit back which improves course grades. There is no curve, but he offers 2% extra credit.
One of the best math professors I've ever had. You have to go to class and put effort in, the material isn't easy, but as long as you try and ask questions when you need it you'll do well.

The content itself was not bad, especially if you have already taken AP in high school. I often relied more on the recitations than watching the lectures themselves--sometimes they were very long and not useful to me. The take home exams took hours (4+), so make sure to get a good group and set aside time to complete them. Overall, not bad.

God awful online class. Your entire grade is based on 5 separate 5+ hour long written exams that are graded by TAs who could care less. Also, they made consistent and blatant errors in their grading throughout the entire semester. If that sounds like a good class to you then go ahead.

Dr. Talamo does a good job teaching this course. Lectures are specific and convey the content well to prepare you for exams. Exams are hard but the availability of corrections provide a good opportunity to increase your test grades. He is always willing to assist you when he can and is clearly passionate about teaching this course.
Great guy, his class was great even though 1172 itself is hard. His TAs on the other hand, they really sucked overall

Talamo was simply amazing, always responded to your emails and was always understanding of what situations you had going on. Never wen't to a live lecture or recitation and still managed an A in this class. Just choose whatever works the best for you, for me it was pre-recorded lectures and studying the practice problems:)
Math 1172 is one of the hardest math classes ever. Talamo tries his best to make it fun and easy to understand. Cares a lot about his students.

Talamo is probably the best math teacher I've ever had. You can tell he's passionate about teaching and his lectures make difficult material easy to understand. Tests are challenging but fair, and you're guaranteed to have seen similar problems in class. Even if you do bad, group exams are averaged with individual exams and will boost your grade.

Jim is always available for his students and cares about student understanding. He goes above and beyond in order to make sure students are understanding his lecture content. He is definitely a fair teacher and offers tons of opportunities to improve within his class. The contents is extremely hard but he makes the class worth it.

James Talamo is the best math professor you could have. I took 1172 instead of 1152, an objectively easier class, so I would have him. I came in with AP credit and didn't know if I should retake Calc 1 or take 1172. He sent me a practice midterm so I could see the difficulty. Extra credit given, fair exams, great in office hours. Take this class!
Hard class, but GREAT PROFESSOR
Professor Talamo is the goat

Just the best math professor I could've asked for here at Ohio State. He cares about every student and always makes himself available to help. He always posts his notes on time and even before class so you can ask questions on what you don't understand. Exams are hard so study hard for them. Quizzes and homeworks offer some buffer.

Jim is one of the best teachers I've had at OSU and I wish I could have taken his class in person this past fall semester. The class is difficult and there are a lot of tests (midterm every 2-3 weeks), but he was extremely fair and let us do them with groups. Definitely cares about his students and wants you to learn.

This class is definitely the most difficult class that I've taken but Jim is just the coolest guy and always posts his notes on time for everyone to follow. Explains very well in lecture. I would say there were times that I didn't understand the material in lecture and the exams were tough but that wasn't even his fault its the department.

This class is very difficult and is considered a "weed out" but he literally did his absolute best the make the experience as smooth and easy as possible. Explains lectures in detail and is always available through office hours or email.

His lectures and guided notes are very easy to understand and learn from. Although the class itself is very difficult, he makes it easy. I liked how his lectures were structured and how the reading was optional. My only gripe with the class is that although you get 5 credit hours, you put in a lot more time. Though, that' not Talamo's fault.

Really cares about your learning, and is always willing to answer questions. The tests are very hard, but generally reflected what you learn in lecture pretty well. Make sure to good on quizzes and homework cause that'll save your grade from the midterms and final.

Jim is a great guy, and his lectures are amazing. This class is difficult, but Jim is definitely the professor you want to have. I took this class online, and I only attend asynchronous lectures. I do not even need to attend live lectures because he explains the concepts so well in the pre-recorded classes! He is always there for his students!
THE GREATEST PROFESSOR OF ALL TIME. He forces us to think logically and really helps us understand math rather than just memorize things.
Great professor
Easy to follow lectures and notes, posted all on time

He's the best math professor I've ever had. He was able to design the midterms and final so that you could work with a group and use the internet and take the test over a 24 hour period, but created each question so that you couldn't cheat, since all of the questions were so unique. This process really fostered collaboration.

Jim is an amazing professor. He understands both that math is almost never a scenario where you cant collaborate with other and use the internet, as well as virtual learning is not the best way to learn. By allowing us to work in groups for the entire course, he turned it from one of the most dreaded courses into one of the best.

Talamo is easily one of the best professors / teachers I have ever had. He is extremely knowledgeable and intelligent, and actually cares about your understanding of the subject. Even with a class of almost a 1000 students (there was like 900 something in Fall 2020)! Definitely the best calc professor at OSU.

Jim's the best math professor I've ever had. The course content itself is pretty difficult but the way Jim structured the class made an A definitely achievable. His lectures are clear a relevant to exam questions. He also writes all graded material himself which is definitely a positive, however, TAs did exam grades and sometimes graded harshly
He is a great guy who cares about his students.
Greatest teacher I've had. Very good lectures and explanations of a hard topic.
Best prof I have ever met in OSU so far!
Great with explaining Calc and teaches it very well. Highly recommend this professor to any one who needs to take Calc 2.

He's the best professor for 1172 which really isn't saying much. The class is ridiculously hard and he does the best with what he has. The math department is really at fault for having such an awfully structured class to try to weed freshmen out. Use all the recitation worksheets they give you and watch youtube videos if you want to pass.
Very very very good math professor. Definitely go to office hours if you have questions.
He is the only good professor for 1172. Take him if you can. He is accessible outside of class, and is generous in giving back exam points.

Jim is a fantastic professor! He genuinely cares how everyone in the class is doing. Notability lecture notes are are available at the end of class on Carmen. I frequented Jim's office hours, and he was great help. There was also at least a 4.5% curve.

James is a great math professor. His lectures were extremely organized and straightforward. The practice exams were close to the actual exam and great study material. The most important thing about this class is actually going to lecture. I think it would be very hard to do well in class if you skipped lecture often and didn't actively take notes.

Don't let my grade fool you, it's just that the class itself is hard. I had a different professor in the beginning of the semester, but I switched to James mid semester and he helped boost my grade. All he wants is to help you out and make sure you understand everything, but overall, he was really helpful to me and making sure I didn't fail

He is an amazing professor. He always uses the easiest way to explain those difficult concepts. He is extremely patient. Definitely should go to his office hours or set up an appointment with him if you need any help.

He's a pretty good lecturer. He's been teaching 1172 for so long that he has a very good insight on what can and will be on the exams. His lecture notes are actually useful for solving the homework problems, which the exams are heavily based on. 1172 is a hard class but he will give you all his tips on how to succeed.
Very clear notes. Respected. He is one of the best maths instructors. You just need to listen to his lecture then you understand everything.

Jim is honestly such a gem. Calc 2 (especially at OSU) will be very hard--the exams are made by the department and all classes/sections are standardized, but Jim does a good job preparing you for them. I had friends in other sections that came to his lectures because they were so good. You need to do more than just the assigned work to do well tho.

Talamo is definitely a great professor, and does a terrific job making the content of 1172, which can be dry and difficult at times, very easy to understand. Without a doubt the best math professor I've had. The class is mostly easy if you took Calc BC, if not it'll be more difficult, but there was a 4% curve when I took it, and was fine.
He's a fantastic professor in a very hard class. He gets straight to what you'll need to know, but he makes even the hardest of material understandable.
Has great lectures, great worksheets, and a great sense of humor. Also, he is one of the few professors that actually cares about his students.

Jim is by far the best teacher I've ever had at OSU, and potentially one of the best teachers in my entire education. He is very patient, very approachable and very responsive to questions. He makes himself available outside of class, clearly presents what's expected of the students for exams, and just in general makes taking his class be a joy.

Jim is the absolute best lecturer you can have for 1172, I went to his lectures even though he wasn't my prof (Had Diego Penta, he was alright but taught in a quite conceptual way that could be confusing at times), I emailed him and got his lecture times and building. He gave awesome notes and remarks regarding upcoming exams/quizzes, he's the best

I was terrified to take this class at OSU (not to mention I did not take CalcBC in high school). I cried over this class multiple times and it was a ton of work, but I got an A and that's all thanks to Jim. He has GREAT lectures, he's funny, and he is always happy to meet outside of class. If you take this course, you NEED Jim.

Never realized how much Jimbo was a gem until having 2 terrible Math professors directly after. Very easy to understand, goes at a great pace and is extremely organized in his lectures. 1172 is a beast regardless but he'll make it much easier to handle. Also very easy on the eyes.

I took 1172 as a first-semester freshman after coming in from AP Calc AB. That wasn't the best choice I've ever made. The class is rigorous at best and tear-inducing at worst. The tests and quizzes are made by the department, not Jim, but Jim is easily the only reason I did as well as I did. He breaks things down and explains things well. Premium.
He is a good teacher but the tests are extremely tough.

Jim is by far the best teacher I've ever had at OSU. Math 1172 is a notorious weed-out course, but his teaching method is really great. The final exam was VERY difficult with a class average of 59%. Overall grade curved about +5%. ANYONE TAKING 1172 NEEDS JIM AS THEIR LECTURER. OSU math department, please give him a raise. Or clone him. Or both.

Jim is a fantastic Calc II professor. He's great at explaining concepts and breaking them down in a way that's easy to understand, and he is also good at teaching the mechanical side of solving problems too. He's so good, in fact, that I didn't find the content any more difficult when we started learning content that I didn't learn in AP Calc BC.

Thank goodness he posts his lecture notes online because this allows me to skip almost every lecture. When I do go, he's very clear about the content and he actually teaches you how to do the problems. This is mainly a review of AP Calc BC.

Hands down the most friendly and understandable lecturer in the Department of Mathematics. His notes are the best quality I've ever seen and truly helps you succeed and understand math if you go to his Office Hours.
He's just awesome!

Talamo makes math interesting and fun. He's very quirky and intelligent and I really enjoyed his lectures. I was told Calc 2 was the hardest math class at OSU. Talamo made it more than bearable and would suggest that anyone who has the opportunity to have him, DO IT.

Jim by far made taking Calc two more bearable than I've heard. I took the summer course so it was a little faster than the regular semester, but doable. I would highly suggest paying attention to series and what he wants for series. I would also recommend using the worksheets. Overall, the course isn't that bad.

Talamo is a great lecturer but the bottom line is that math 1172 is just a hard class. You have to keep up with the worksheets and prepare for every exam  heavily by doing the practice exams until you clearly understand everything. In his lecturers he points out a lot of past exam questions to note and common mistakes made on exams, which was huge

Most people advised me not to take calc 2 at OSU. I'm glad I stuck with my gut and had Talamo as a teacher. He was phenomenal. He made learning so easy. Of course you have to put in time after class to learn. His math shirts were hilarious. The curve in the class was huge. Also he was quite charming ;). What more could you ask from a professor!

I have hated math since high school, and calculus was no exception last semester. This semester however, I learned to enjoy  calculus 2 thanks to Talamo. Most people say that Calc 2 at OSU is one of the hardest math courses available, but he made it bearable and, dare I say it, understandable. Great examples and well thought out explanations.
He really cares about the material he is teaching. Really encourages me to learn

Jim is hands down the best math professor I've had in Ohio's State's notoriously difficult math department. His lectures are amazing and he explains everything very clearly. He wants you to do well and will take feedback and go over things again. The class is gonna be hard no matter what, but he makes it bearable.
Great Lecturer!

Jim was a fantastic lecturer. He explained concepts clearly and gave proof for all major ideas. On the days leading up to exams, he would hold review sessions during his free time after class. 1172 is as a difficult course, and not having Calc BC in highschool (like me) makes it even harder, but Jim made the material easy to understand.

Calc II was honestly one of the hardest classes I've ever taken. The workload is not easy. I spent a lot of time going to office hours or asking questions after class. He was very helpful and really seemed to care about me and my understanding of the subject material. Could not have asked for a better professor.

Calc II is not an easy class, but you wont have a better prof. than Talamo. He is immensely smart, and explains complex topics extremely well. Due to the nature of the class lectures will fly, but absolutely talk to him if you need some extra help. Hard but absolutely doable.

Best math department teacher at OSU. Seriously... students in other classes or even other courses would come to his lectures or review sessions. 1172 was an insanely hard class to stay afloat in. Beware: I didnt read the method of grading online homework closely enough and barely prepped for the final bc of Ochem. Dropped from solid C to C-

James Talamo is THE MAN. Best math teacher I have ever had. Class is definitely not easy, but he makes it better by always explaining things thoroughly and being there for students. He also wears super funny math shirts. For a tough subject you really cannot get a better professor than him. Class wise: 1 final, 3 exams, 10 quizzes, and hw each week

Jim is the BEST. He really loves math and is amazing at explaining it. He is very willing to work with you if you aren't understanding. By far the best math professor I have had and quite possibly the best professor I have had. Really great person. The class is difficult but he makes it very manageable.
HE DEVOTES ON MATH VERY MUCH,so many times after the class I go to ask him questions and he will continue explaining to me along the walking path for a mile!Feel go on to take an extra whole lecture

Dr. Talamo is hands down the best math professor! His lectures are very clear for the most part (he derives some of the theorems and can get kinda boring). The content for 1172 is tough in general (thanks to the math and engineering departments), but you're not gonna get a better professor than Dr. Talamo.

Professor Talamo is probably one of the best and inspiring I ever had. I would have a discussion about Calculus' application in real life with him after class and he is very good at getting people to like Calculus. Awesome professor, definitely take his class.

Prof. Talamo saved my calculus experience. After being with an unclear lecturer, he helped me to achieve far higher grades on tests through his clear lectures and after-class help. His examples in class were valuable for the tests, and I didn't miss any sessions of the class because they guaranteed I understood the material. A splendid math teacher

Jim is honestly the best math teacher/professor I've ever had. He's really great at thoroughly explaining everything and does his best to be available to help everyone. Go to his review sessions! He's also an adorable nerd. He wears math t-shirts all the time and likes to make math jokes. Take his class if you can!
Best professor I have ever had.

This guy really is the man very very helpful No lie gives the best lectures I will probably ever get in college Hes funny, cool, confident He cares a lot he created tons of practice problems (worksheets) for students to practice Take notes in class! and review them
Best lecturer ever. Makes a hard class much easier. Is also passionate about math and also teaching.
One of the best lecturers I have ever had. Super clear and easy to understand. Loves math and is very helpful to students. If you do not do well it is your fault not his

He is a very good lecturer who takes time to explain his steps while still moving at a steady pace. You could tell he wanted his students to do well. Offered many pre-midterm/final review days that were very helpful. Highly Recommend. Also wears funny calc-pun t-shirts

Take this Professor if you can! Crystal clear lectures and answers any question asked.  Does his best to prepare students for the difficult tests the math department writes. Highly recommend Professor Talamo.

He gives AMAZING lectures. Filled in for McGinnis after he left, and he was so much better (McGinnis used to be the best teacher for this class, at least so they say). His notes are good, and its not hard to focus. Total nerd, but adorable. Would have had at least a B+ if he was my lecturer all along.
Great guy, actually cares for students. Nice math shirts.

Fantastic math professor. Is crystal clear with his explanations of sometimes difficult concepts, and his passion for math rubs off on everyone. I'm not saying that 1172 is an easy class, but he makes it as manageable as it can be. If you do his homeworksquizzes and go to his office hours with questions, you will be in a position to succeed.

Jim has been a great lecturer. He explains everything pretty clearly and is ALWAYS trying to help students understand better. He's very willing to go over related material that isn't technically in the course if you want to understand better (during office hours). He expects a lot but he gives you everything you need to excel if you work hard.

this class is VERY difficult. 40% on first midterm i thought i understood the material. many have failed calc 1 at osu. i may have to drop. not sure one can come back from this. he seems like a nice guy but he literally writes paragraphs on the board instead of actual problems with numbers, so he always runs out of time and doesn't finish lecture
Great guy. Really good at explaining concepts and going through hw problems. Also likes to wear math shirts, so def take his recitation. Hard class, but would've gotten lower grade without his help.

Jim is the best teacher I've ever had. So helpful, and he would do anything to help his students understand the material. He has a unique way to make you curious about math. His class was amazing and I can definitely say it was he best class I took at OSU.

Best math TA anyone could ask for. The lecturer was not always clear, but he laid out all of his material clearly and in a way that made math easy to understand. Really cares and goes over anything people are stuck on.
Jim is a great TA! He loves math and makes the material as clear as he can.
Jim is great! He is passionate about what he teaches and is extremely helpful. Gives thorough lectures and worksheets to practice.

Jim is great. He is an amazing t.a and makes everything so easy to understand. Hes interesting as well, not a boring old t.a who cant hold your attention. If you just try hard in his class you'll get a good grade.

Best math TA I've had at Ohio State. The lecturer was not the best teacher, but going to recitation with Jim helped me learn everything. He's nice, understanding, a fair grader, and makes the material crystal clear and easy to understand. If anyone gives him below a 5 for helpfulness or clarity, they're insane.
Best TA in the world.  He always wears amazing math shirts.

Jim is an exceptional, friendly, intelligent, and patient instructor/TA. He explains concepts clearly, and his teaching style is exemplary. I was mad at him once for not having the answer key to one of his homework or classwork assignments during the week of a fast-approaching exam so that I could have more time to compare thoroughly my solutions t

nicest guy ever, lets you retake missed quizzes as long as you email him.  explains everything perfectly,  one of the few TA's on campus that wants you to do well in his course. HE SHOULD BE TEACHING THE CLASS HIMSELF!
Excellent teacher, should teach as a career.  Very clear in explaining concepts and problems step by step.
Awsome! Could not ask for a better math t.a.  He should be a professor and not just a t.a.

He's not a bad person and his lectures aren't that bad, but his midterms (worth 20% of our grade each) are completely multiple choice and true/false. The high on our midterm was a B and the median was an F because of trick questions. If you need a high GPA for a scholarship, switch profs ASAP because the HW does not prep you for the exam.

Ok lectures, but struggled to answer questions from "lost" students. Do not take if you do not have *strong* calc foundations. He also assigned interesting but difficult add'l problems that weren't from the book. Not tech savvy and didn't predictably update lecture notes. Hw was sometimes assigned late eg 2 days before exam. Disagree w/ "5" ratings
really good professor have many extra contents you can enjoy math

Dr Casian was a bit fast-paced but his lectures and lecture notes were excellent in quality. He also covered exam problems and explained them very well, which was very helpful for preparing for exams. Him missing minus signs and mis-writing stuff also brought some levity to the lectures.

He is very passionate about teaching us as much math as possible, and his lecture notes are very detailed and helpful. He does go off on tangents frequently, often ending up teaching us analysis proofs even though they are not part of the curriculum. His classes are fun to attend and the homework and exams are only moderately challenging.

Calc 1 honors is very theoretical/analysis heavy. Dr. Casian is nice, responsive, and an ok lecturer but there is no opportunity to work on problems in class. You just watch him scribble on the chalkboard for an hour at lightning speed and leave the class confused. There is no recitation, just lecture 5 days a week. Take 1152 if you can.

Don't skip lectures. Most of the material will be learned through lectures and he doesn't do that good a job of posting his notes online. His lectures are okay but hard to follow sometimes and it doesn't help the class is quite difficult.

His lectures are informative, but usually hard to follow, so extra studying is required. His tests and homework are relatively easy, but also very easy to make punishing mistakes on. He often will ask for questions, then not look for raised hands, and answer questions badly. These factors make the class uninteresting, stressful, and not enjoyable.

Very fast lectures and a bad grading system. Most of the grade was based on multiple choice questions that are very easy to mess up from tiny mistakes and they can ruin your grade. Prof Casian provided very detailed lecture notes of everything he covered in order which was very helpful. He was always willing to stay late or meet for office hours.

Signed up for 2568, he taught the much harder 4568 in its place, got credit for 2568. The material taught in lectures is missing parts that help you with the exams and mini homework. Idk how I got a b.

He is a nice enough guy, but cannot lecture at all. By the end of the year no one would go because lecture was so useless. Also, it is practically impossible to get a good grade in his class. Exams are way harder than they need to be, and missing one question on an exam drops you a letter grade becasue of how it is set up. Homeworks way too long.

Nothing against the guy, but I was no fan of his teaching style. It feels like he just brushed over really important, foundational concepts, and then dived into some of the more technical/theoretical aspects of linear algebra. His lectures often jumped from on subject to another. Also, the homework do not prepare you well for quizzes/exams.

Dr. Casian, does not really care about the students at all. I went to his office hours to ask him questions about the homework, which had nothing to do with the Lectures he gave, and he denied help when there wasn't a single student in the zoom call. His lectures are terrible. The only helpful thing is the email he sends the night before the exam.
Hes actually bad at teaching. If you bother him enough you can bend the course to be more practical. Drop the class and take it with someone else.

He isn't the worst at teaching material but he makes his tests absurdly hard to the point where you're just guessing on 50% of questions. He gives a lot of extra credit so you will think you'll be fine but the extra credit doesn't matter because they're impossible. He adds on so much extra content compared to other professors. Do not take from him.
Avoid this man at all costs. He does not let you see your old quizzes, or exams. He holds office hours on Fridays after both of the weekly quizzes and homework are due. Not helpful at all.

The class covered fairly difficult material, but Dr. Casian did a generally very good job of teaching things and incorporating both good intuitive reasoning and insights into some higher-level math. Grading was also very lenient overall, and the online transition was handled in a very generous way with regards to exams. Would recommend.

Taking this class (linear algebra) was legitimately one of the worst experiences Ive had in college. His lectures were very confusing and only seemed vaguely connected so they were largely not helpful. The textbook was free and somewhat helpful but also failed to explain many very important concepts. He seems like a decent guy but not a good prof

Avoid, I'd say. The book (Golubitsky) is quite terrible, most commands don't work & it doesn't go into enough detail to teach yourself reliably. He uploads lectures that are vaguely related to each other & don't follow the book at all, but the HW is from the book He'll do reviews before exams but they don't help. He's seems like an OK guy generally

Prof. Casian would be great for someone serious about going in-depth into math. He often gives questions not standard in textbooks or proves things that other instructors would just give as formulas, which makes his class interesting but also very difficult/time-consuming. Fast lecturer, brilliant guy but not 100% at replying to emails

This could be because it was online lectures, but worst math lectures I've had. There are no online notes to download before lecture and this guy plows through all the material with little explanation. The lectures are pre-recorded and he gives almost no time to write what he has written before scrolling past it. 55 min lectures take me 3 hours.

Good mathematics professor, excellent for those with an interest in math. Sometimes quick to speak and has an accent, but very clear in lectures. I do not, however, recommend Honors 190 with him for those who do not want to be math majors. It is an involved class with a good deal of work and it didn't much help me in the end as a Chem major.

Pretty awful teacher. Refused help many times, and was compeltely unclear in his explanations. I am a math major with a 3.8 in-major GPA, and his class was so poorly taught, I got a C. Continued the series with a different prof and it was MUCH MUCH better. 2nd worst teacher of my life.
Very good.
He is so smart...sigh. i think i'm kinda attracted to him too,  *blush*
Ok, as others said, he flies.  But he's willing to help if you ask, and his grading is easy.  And dangit i know Kevin wrote that about the fly and shotgun; i thought he said that in h520 though.
He is the best thing that happened to math. He is an awesome teacher and very sexy too. All ladies should have the honor of having him as a teacher.  He is badass man!!!
he talks fast with this european/mexian accent but clear and straightfoward with the grading easy grade

Grades based on curve because he basically makes up his own material. If you feel comfortable with the h.w. you still could not do good on test because it is not like the tests and the quizzes. He should just write his own math book.

The class was always graded on a curve with quizes and test, but be careful because the extra credit assigned is hard and sometimes you can put in alot of work on it and get 0 points. Test three was hard and final is hard as well, most folks got a c or d.

He is the fastest thing with big hair and a piece of chalk. His board writing is something from the matrix, so come equipped with a video camera. His speed defies his huge hair. Oh yeah, killing fly with shotgun?
good prof.

Overall a good professor! Lectures can be confusing, especially when he's going really fast over new material. Good thing is quizzes and tests are fairly easy, straight from the homework. Uses a lot of weird analogies in lecture: balloon, lions, fireflies
Perhaps no professor is worse than him, he gives the impression that it is his task to fail or bring troubles to the students, if there is another professor, do not choose him.

Didn't teach himself, posted videos of other people explaining the topics. Extremely strict with the syllabus, didn't give me some points even though it was a technological error instead of a human error.

I had Connor for recitation as part of a flipped and flexible section of MATH1151, and he was great. His recitations were helpful in recapping and practicing some material in the lectures. You can tell he has a very good understanding of the subject and is genuinely wanting to be helpful. He is also understanding that the class is difficult.

Dr. Cassady made Calculus 1 feel like elementary Algebra. Truely one of the easiest math classes i've ever taken. And it's not because of the content, but rather how Dr.Cassady presented and taught the material.
Took the class in person and had him as lecturer and TA. Not much HW if you space it out correctly. He responds to emails fast!

Took Math 1151 hybrid, so lectures online and he was my recitation TA. When I visited office hours he was pretty informative. He didn't make the curriculum but the class itself is set up to be extremely difficult and his recitations didn't help nearly as much as my own studying. Really depends on how comfortable you are with calculus.

Pretty decent guy, all things considered. Seemed like he cared about teaching and his students. Gave lectures at a pace that I could follow and would stay after class to answer questions (even ~20 min after lecture ended), although obviously this may have been unique to our Math 1148 class specifically. Cracked a funny joke every now and then, too!

I hated this class. I gave up on the lectures as it was so hard to follow him. I really do not recommend this course. The class is midterm and final heavy and It makes it hard to learn with how the teaching is set up. It was hard to see anything or hear him in the lectures and he believes you need to teach yourself math and that he can't do it.

I gave up on attending this lecture. He seems like a nice guy, but I could not follow anything he taught. I did better just attending recitations and learning through the homework. If you can not learn things without a teacher- choose another professor. Attendance is not mandatory. There is a quiz every single week. Exams are weighted heavily.

He has no sense of direciton in his lectures.He writes random things on the chalk baord with no lesson plans. I tried my very best to pay attention but genuiley couldn't follow along. After the first midterm,I started going to another lectuere,Tony Nance. I wouldnt have passed without him. If you get this lectuer  switch out or just go to another.
The instructor was very challenging and lazy don't take his class !!!

Overall very mid teacher. Not bad not great. Found myself getting lost in lectures because of lack of direction, but still did alright. Seemed to genuinely care about his students and made a few jokes that made lectures better.
I think he is really good at lectures and gives information clearly and explains things well. Grades very fairly and is very understanding. Really funny guy! Overall, a great teacher.

You think this would be an easy class because it's college algebra, but not with this professor. He bases most of your grade off exams. If you even get an 100 percent on hw, quizzes and attendance, it will do nothing. He is a horrible lecturer and only went through like one problem in class. Exams are nothing like the recitations. Don't recommend.

Lectures were on the chalkboard (no PowerPoint presentation, which is a plus) and easy to understand as long as you attend all lectures. Professor is hilarious and respected by his students. He will always help students or lecture extra topics after class. You are also given PowerPoints of each lecture and recordings of each recitation on Canvas.

His teaching style is difficult to adjust to since he uses primarily powerpoints but they are given to students outside of class and he was flexible in adjusting his teaching style when students asked to have him write on the board instead. he cares about his students and is very funny - class not mandatory but i dont recommend skipping often.

Very nice, but a horrible lecture professor. He just talks numbers at you on a slideshow/powerpoint instead of using the board and actually doing the problems so we can see where he got the answers. Very frustrating especially when students have given suggestions like using the board more, he just ignores us.

Okay so math is a subject that you need to write out on the board. Not literally talk numbers at us. He is a nice man but he does'nt write on the board. HE JUST TALKS WITH POWERPOINT SLIDES!!!! That is not how math works. SO I do not think he is fit if you're a visual learner. Good Luck!
The nicest professor I have ever had. He likes to joke and he told my lecture about how he was proud of us all which was honestly just so wholesome.

Steer clear of courses taught by Victor if you can. I found him cryptic when asking questions, as he sometimes would just tell you to figure it out yourself when you asked him anything at all. Incredibly frustrating course, and a frustrating experience with him at the helm.

Taught things in a very random order, I never felt like I understood how the previous material connected and because of that I struggled. Random group projects at the end of the class that took so much time, but counted for very little of your grade. Took this class in AU2023 and I needed it to get into my major, but I wouldn't take again.

I feel as though I was teaching myself. The lectures were pointless, and I would not have attended if participation were not a part of the final grade. Save yourself the tears and take math 1126 at a community college.

He is caring and has good intentions, but I would get confused from his lectures because he messes up often and so having a good TA was helpful. I mostly taught myself the material. Tests were not bad, the review guides were super helpful. Overall he is fine but get help if needed and do the homework/reviews!

Vic was incredibly kind and caring when I had a personal emergency that caused me to miss over a week of class (the most accommodating instructor I had for sure), but his lectures are often long, over time, boring, and hard to follow. Homework/quizzes are graded harshly- it has to be worded exactly right or you lose points. Hope for a good TA.

I think that Vic is a nice guy & means well, but he often spends the entire lecture going over one basic problem over & over again. Weekly quizzes should be based on the homework from that week, but they almost never cover the same material & the homework isn't even graded before the quiz so we aren't sure if we did the problem right anyways.

Overall not a good prof. Vic seems nice, but he would rather tell bad jokes than actually teach you the material. If you don't have a good TA, the weekly quizzes will be hard. The exams will kill your grade if you have no background in calc. There's not even a point in going to lecture because he messes up the problems more than he gets them right.

Ferdinand is a nice guy who means well, but he's not that great at explaining the material. This could potentially be because this course covers a lot of material in one semester, so it's hard to thoroughly cover it all. I'm not a math brain, but I had a good TA and the textbook was very helpful. Do the recommended practice problems from the book!
Run away screaming.
He's literally terrible. He shows up late for class and doesn't even teach. He spent one class just talking about kool-aid. There's one homework assignment and one quiz once a week.

Math 1150/Precalc - skip lecture, go to recitation, do your homework and practice problems. I was blessed with an amazing TA (Greg LeVay) and he taught us the class basically. Vic is not a good lecturer, so skip lectures and just work on practice problems or homework.

Ferdinand doesn't really teach students the material. Even if you go to class, you don't really learn anything. This class takes things you know and makes you feel like you don't know them. In addition, if you have a bad TA it's a mess.

Vic is pretty nice but nice does not mean that he is a good professor He mostly relies on online videos that are posted by the math department which you can watch at home and teach yourself He also makes you do all the recitation worksheets by yourself and tries to glaze over the answers Do not recommend if you have not taken calc before
He often made mistakes in lecture, and a lot of students didn't attend the lectures because of that

Ferdinand is kind of bumbling and disorganized, gets on tangets and goes off topic. Makes a lot of dad jokes, literally always goes over class time. Says "here" and "there" a lot. Definitely see your TA!

Knows his stuff, but doesn't really know how to articulate it to students. Made easy simple problems super complex. After a while I stopped showing up to lectures because they were useless. Textbook, TAs and math learning center was much more helpful. Funny, quirky, nice guy though.

Seems like a nice enough guy, but made my pre-calculus experience harder than in needed to be. Often made mistakes in lecture. Knew what he was talking about, didn't know how to explain it to his students in a concise manner. Would not recommend.

Absolutely horrible. Makes terrible jokes, lectures never ends on time, and makes things a million time more confusing than they need to be. Took him 5 steps to show how to convert radians to degrees. Something simple, which he makes so difficult.
The course is hard.
He made mistakes in his lectures.
He often taught the questions wrongly in the lectures. I suppose the recitations by the TA are even more important and useful than the lectures.

Dr. Sirvent was extremely kind and caring, one of the nicest professors I've had at OSU. Though, the PDE course was pretty challenging, so I do suggest going to her office hours. Homework was super hard, but the exams were fine. Exam problems and difficulty matched the level of examples from lectures and exam review days.
Maritza is a very excellent professor. She takes care of all the students. I have a good sense in her course!

Homework in this class is way too hard and not covered at all by the lectures. The exams aren't terrible, but there is nowhere to find similar caliber problems of the exam. Definitely avoid this section if you learn by example like I do.
I love Prof Sirvent with my whole heart! She is so energetic and funny, but also delivers the most concise and educational lectures I've ever heard. I wish I could take her again!
She is not a bad teacher but her exams are so random and not covered in class. Minimal curve at the end. Final was impossible.

The thing with Maritza is that she is an amazing person, but a terrible lecturer. Half the time shell forget what shes talking about in class on the spot. She doesnt give any prep or motivation for the kings were learning so things seems out of nowhere. She does make up for it by giving ridiculously easy exams. Some studying will get you A.

We all know partial differential equation is hard, but Professor Sirvent makes it less suffer. Great lecture, great notes. Plenty of homework help you understand. Exams are fair and a little curve will help you get A

I loved Maritza but hated this class. I originally only went to lectures and was doing poorly but I started regularly attending office hours and she was insanely helpful and really good in the one on one settings. Also, once she gets to know you, she will be more than happy to just chat. A total gem.

Maritza is the kind of professor who loves what she does, and wants to help her students be as successful as possible. Her lectures were never dull, and even if the material was somewhat boring she found a way to make it lively.

Dr. Sirvent-Leon is a wonderful professor. She is very clear in expectations, and the syllabus is laid out well. She assigns homework relevant to the exams which is nice. Her lectures are very clear and she is able to communicate material well. Very willing to help you succeed. I suggest also completing problems in back of book. I learned a ton.

As a person, she's adorable and super sweet. Definitely wants you to do well, but the class is pretty rough. You'll be completely lost in the homework, and the book is totally useless. Exams are simplified down to the most basic examples, which saved my grade. Class is taught exactly the same as Lakos's class, so as teachers they're pretty similar.

Great teacher, patient and willing to help for any reason necessary. The class, however, is not very good, and too much time is spent on really easy topics. MATH 2415 could use some work, but the professor is excellent.

Not a very good teacher. She is often unclear in what she is writing on the board and spends the entire week doing a single example that she starts over at the beginning of each class. She is nice though and will help out when you ask.  The Gregory Baker textbook used is absolutely atrocious.

Maritza made this class a lot easier than it could have been otherwise. Always really clear during lecture and uploaded notes online when other lecturers did not. Available to students. I have negative comments about 2415 but not Maritza as a professor. She is teaching this class the best it can be taught, but the book is awful. Tons of homework.

There was too much homework and they were hard to solve. But, the exams on the other hand were very  easy, and this what made this class to be one of my favorites and easiest even though it was not an easy subject. She was very nice and helpful if you asked her.
Good at explaining things, fair class
lectures are not clear. Hard and a lot of homework. The lecture notes were not helping for the homework. and the homework are nor related to what she and the book explain.

She is so adorable and nice! She has an accent, but it does not distract from her teaching. Sometimes she gets a little confused with what she's doing, but she always figures it out. She's a good teacher! Just make sure to take notes, do the homework, do the take home quizzes, go to recitation to take the quizzes, and study! Need textbook to study!
I felt like she was sometimes hard to understand and when teaching she often stayed on one topic for a long time then fly through another. And she often got off topic but she is a very sweet lady
Hardest class I have ever taken. Do not take unless 100% necessary. Tests were impossible, quizzes every week, so much homework. Very difficult to understand.
Easy  course and good professor.
She knows here stuff when it comes to calculus. Extremely helpful in all aspects.
If you have to study calculus, I would highly recommend this professor!

She is a very nice professor, you can learn a lot in her lecture. There are 3 midterms and 1 final which are not very hard if you take notes and pay attention to the homework online. And she is very helpful in office hours too.
Maritza is nice and funny, but when it comes to tests they aren't always reflective of what you learned in class.
As long as you keep up with the course via the book,  you should be fine. She is very helpful in office hours

Lovely professor, very easy to approach and ask questions. Very enthusiastic and patient. Will work with you in any way to ensure you are not at risk of failing. Have not heard of a single person in 100 person lecture who did not like her.

No one pays attention in the class, it seems like it's his second year teaching at OSU, maybe he is unexperienced. He just talks and points. I've taken SRM before (and failed) but I know for sure you don't need to know Rstudio, but he focuses on that. Litteraly saw a guy falling asleep like in a movie almost every class. He was the only available.
Best math professor I've had. Had him for algebra for business and he is always willing to help his students understand. His office hours are really helpful. Great guy!
Trent is a kind professor and is actually pretty funny. He does a good job of explaining course material and keeps the reviews very similar to the actual exams. Definitely would recommend.
Review exams are just like the actual exam. Easy hw due once a week. Attendance is not graded. Ended with a 98 in the class.

Overall, he was a great professor. He provided a thorough explanation of the topic with examples. However, sometimes, he made an easy concept seem way harder than it needed to be. Tests are not hard as long as you study using the study guide he provides.

you'll have a quiz every week and the final is cumulative but the class isn't that bad and I didn't go to half the lectures, everything was retaught in recs, but the rec and the lecture didn't always line up or they taught things different ways so it made it more confusing

Overall Dr. Ohl is a great guy but just an okay professor. He easily loses students after 10 minutes into lecture. Simply reads off slides and can't go into detail on why or how things are. Office hours is somewhat helpful. Your grade is mostly based on weekly quizzes (very loosely based on homework), your exams, and weekly homework (completion).

Prof Ohl is amazing. He explains everything super slow so that even a baby could understand, but not too slow its annoying. nothing has mandatory attendance. Very easy to access outside of class and seems really happy to help you understand. Makes a decently easy class VERY easy. 100% would recommend.
Amazing lecturer, super nice guy and unbelievably overqualified to teach this class. 100% take

Dr. Ohl is probably one of my favorite professors I've had! He explains concepts extremely well. He is very accessible outside of class; he always took the time during office hours to make sure I understood something when I wasn't sure. He cares about his students, and his exams are exactly like the homework (very reasonable for a 2 credit class).

Trent Ohl is easily the best professor I have had from the math department. He explains the material well and the homework is straightforward. He is very helpful in his office hours. If you can take MATH 4578 with him, do it.

Always Wrote and explained every step he took while doing a problem. He does multiple examples for each topic which is awesome. Get partial credit for showing work so it hedges points if you get the wrong answer on exams.
Great professor! Excellent lecture. 80% of lecture have slides. Not very much homework and have unlimited attempts.
Dr. Ohl overall was a amazing professor, went through each units thoroughly and explained the concepts clearly, plus he responds to emails pretty quick.

He's a great lecturer and a lot of challenging math concepts seemed easy after going to class and listening to his lectures! He explains things very well and is such a sweet guy and seems like he genuinely cares about his students!
Actually the sweetest cutest guy ever. Class is hard but it is math so it like should be. Would not want to take it with anyone else!

He cares about you and is passionate about what he is teaching. Class is hard and harder homework questions every week, along with quizzes every week. But he sometimes pushes back homework dates an extra day if he knows he is behind. Tough material.
Great Class, amazing teacher, just listen in lecture and you will succeed.

I have nothing bad to say about Professor Ohl. He has an amazing layout for the class, and everything on the exams is material he gives you in lecture and the study guides. He genuinely is a great person and makes for an awesome teacher.

He has clear expectations and his homework comes directly from examples in his lectures. His exams are take home  with problems similar to those of the homework. He records all his lectures, so it is not a big deal if you miss them. He is also flexible and always willing to help.

Hands down the best math professor I've ever had. Trent does a great job explaining content clearly during lectures and ensuring students understand it. If you ever have questions on homework he is more than willing to help guide you on how to set up problems and work through to the solution. He also had lots of fun with our class during lab!
Great guy! very clear on homework and exams. lots of fun in the lab where we play contexto!

Trent has been undeniably my favorite professor that I have taken math with at all of Ohio State. He cares about your success, and he helps you to succeed by making the class enjoyable. I don't think there is a better professor at all of Ohio State. He is very open to extensions on homeworks. I recommend everyone take him.

Ohl is a great lecturer and explains concepts well. That being said, the homework assignments are usually quite time consuming and difficult, as well as the quizzes he makes. However, the math department makes the midterms, and the midterms are typically much easier than his homework, quizzes, and review guides. He's very nice and accommodating.

- nice person
- love math and sometime he getting really into it and confuse me
- kinda confusing something
- wished he used guide notes 
3/5
Professor Ohl is a great professor. He is clear in his lectures and explains material very well. He is kind and helps all the students he can. I highly recommend taking a class with him.

I wish he had taught me calc 2. Foundations of Higher Mathematics is what I took with Dr. Trent and his Ph.D. was in it so he taught it incredibly as you imagined. He's a fair teacher who's easy to reach outside class with lots of feedback on every homework.

Mr. Ohl is a great professor, as long as you go to lecture and try on homework you will do great in this class. Homeworks can be lengthy at time (20 questions on average) but are not very difficult. Would highly recommend Mr. Ohl though.
The class was taught pretty well, isn't difficult to pass as long as you pay attention
The content isn't great, but he was always very prepared and collected when he was explaining the concepts. The final exam was cumulative though, but pretty fair overall.
this class was hard but he didnt make it any more difficult or any easier

In my opinion, professor Ohl did a good job thoroughly explaining the material during lectures, and even records all of them in case you aren't able to attend. There's a good amount of quizzes and homework throughout the semester, as well as 5 total exams. Bottom line - it's calculus, so don't expect anything easy.

Lecture and recitation are not mandatory, but you should definitely at least watch the lectures back. You will have to watch the lectures in order to pass the class. Dr. Ohl makes everything very clear, but the class is still decently difficult.
Terrible class

I have already taken calculus before, so this class shouldve been easy. Instead, the final exam will now determine whether or not I have to take the class again. I went to recitation and lecture basically everyday, yet I will probably have to retake the class because the test and exam questions are too difficult. My effort isnt the issue, he is.

An issue with this class is the number of tests! Test every single Monday, and each one has a huge impact on your grade, which is based almost solely on tests. There is no partial credit given on written exams but you must show all work. All exams have a very constraining time limit, which is short and unfair.

Prof. Ohl is a great lecturer, especially if you're easily confused with math. His class is super organized and structured and there are lots of assignments other than exams to buff your grade. Super fair, smart, and approachable. He made a harder math class very manageable but you have to actually go to class and do the homework.

He made concepts very easy to understand and throughly covered topics so that you were prepared for exams. Exam reviews were very similar to the exams. Very good at answering questions and clearing confusion

Prof Ohls class and lectures are very organized. If you watch the lectures and do the homework its pretty easy. The lectures and quizzes sometimes have questions that I never remember learning, and since each question is worth a lot of points one missed question lowers your grade a lot. But I would still recommend taking the class.

Dr. Ohl has been one of my favorite professors! GO to his office hours! He is willing to help, and I would strongly recommend it. Math is NOT my strong subject, and while I did struggle at times in this class, Dr. Ohl was very kind in answering questions and meeting with me. Top class professor.

By far the most organized professor I've had here. He is a great teacher, and explains concepts in lecture very well. However, he speeds through the material so prepare to be learning a lot throughout the weeks. He covers many examples during lecture, and make sure you GO TO RECITATION!

I dropped his class after the second week, hes disorganized and goes way too fast on his online lectures. His quizzes are timed to the point that youre struggling to make sure you answer all the questions. I couldnt do it, Ill take this class another semester with a different professor

Professor Ohl had very clear and easy to read slides that he would go over in lecture. I feel like he explained things well, and was great about answering questions. The only downside is that he would announce if there was a hw the week of, and didn't release exam dates or times until only a few weeks beforehand, so it was hard to plan ahead.

He has been my favorite professor that I've had so far. He was an amazing lecturer and I never got bored during his classes. He was very thorough and explained the material very well. I totally recommend him as a professor.

I LOVED Professor Ohl. He's so sweet and actually cares about you passing. If you want to pass this class with an A, do ALL the homework practice problems and GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS! I have NEVER passed a math class higher than C and this is the first math class I've EVER passed with an A! Attend lectures & write good detailed notes & pass. Easy.

Trent was incredible. Before this class, I cannot remember the last time I got an A on a math test. I aced two of the midterms, and ended up with a B+ for the course, which is amazing for me. Trent's lectures are crystal clear, and the material he covered seemed extraordinarily easy to me thanks to him. Big props to Trent. Highly recommend.

Genuinely enjoyed going to lecture. He is SO cute and cares so much. He goes everything so thoroughly I barley had to study for midterms and finished with an easy A. Lectures dont take attendance so a lot of people didnt go, and they struggled a lot. Just make sure you go to lecture and do the homework problems and youll be good.

I have him for business calculus and I feel like I do not learn a thing from his lectures. I hate to say it but going to lectures is a waste of a time a lot of days... luckily, I took calc senior year of hs and was good at it so I have a good baseline but people who struggle in math definitely have a challenge ahead.

He's great, his lectures on the blackboard are absolutely amazing. I went from hating maths in High School and performing poorly to excelling thanks to Trent. The class is graded very well and reflects your understanding of the concepts. He goes above and beyond when teaching you the principles of Calculus.

He was the most genuine of my professors and definitely acknowledged the fast pace which accompanied 1161.02 and made the lecture similar to the midterms. However, the final was a shock for most people I talked to. But he is overall a great guy and he takes time in class to answer questions while moving as efficiently as possible. HE ROUNDS UP.
Was very approachable and gives good help in office hours. Explained topics well and work was easy to understand. 1172 is a tough class that he made easier to understand.

Trent's class will be difficult, but not impossible. You really have to work at it if you want a good grade. A lot of times he over explains the theory behind concepts and not how to apply them. Do all of your homework problems and make sure you understand them, and you'll be fine.

Big T is a real G. He explains everything really well and has super helpful office hours. He's a really nice guy and rounded up my borderline grade without me even asking him!!! Also, he gave candy to the people who showed up for Friday lectures

Had Trent for the Calc 1/Intro to calc 2 class for Honors Engineers. Really nice guy, total Dad in every way. Class wasnt too hard, homework helped reinforce subject matter a lot and wasn't crazy hard. Helped with any questions I had, easy midterms and final with medians >80% every time. I recommend!

Dr. Ohl is a fine professor. He does excellent jobs of representing visually and conceptually what is happening in terms of topic material, his office hours are also helpful. The only qualm i had with him was that his lectures were very dry and it was extremely easy to lose focus, however this is just a slight mark from an otherwise good prof.

I had Trent Ohl for Math 1172. Great Lecturer, gives good examples and explained concepts clearly. I felt prepared going into exams based on his lectures. I wasn't a huge fan of how the course was organized (organized by Department, not lecturer), but he was definitely a positive aspect of the course.

This was a 2 credit hour discrete math class that moved faster/was more work than the discrete class for my math major friends. Lectures were just reading off the textbook (slides were literally screenshots of the book). Homework assignments were 11-14 pages each with only a few days to complete. Grades sometimes took over a month to come back.

I really want to like Professor Ohl because he just seems like a nice guy who likes math. However, the lectures are very dry and don't stick with me (especially because we can't have the slides and the book takes forever to describe the simplist thing) and it's a 2-credit course that feels like a 5-credit course

Quite possibly the driest lectures I've ever been to. Homeworks are ridiculously long, does not do a good job of preparing you for exams. If you really want a good grade in this class, be prepared to treat it as a 5 credit hour course. Awful.

Be prepared to self learn a lot of material. Homework was almost nothing like the problems in the book. A large portion of homework solutions were uploaded Sunday when the exam was the VERY NEXT day, so you better hope you have a good understanding of the material beforehand. Its a 2 credit hour class that I spent 20+ hours a week on.
His lectures were terrible. Very dry and boring. Examples given in class were nothing like homework or exams. Homeworks were unnecessarily long and he would change the due date every week.
A great teacher.
Good class.

He made many simple things more complicated than they had to be. Be prepared to figure things out on your own because he's not much help.  I have had some very good & very bad math professors & he is leans close to the bad. He is a friendly guy but I wouldn't take him if you can help it .

i really like Ohl's class. I took his Summer section of Calc 3, so it was probably a bit more fast paced than during the regular school year due to time constraints. His quizzes and exams were very reasonable, and you should be able to do well on them if you do practice problems from the book and work to understand the material.

Ohl understands math, but he does not understand how to teach math. He spends most of lecture time writing down long sentences, instead of going through examples. He will not tell you what section the quizzes are over, and will find minuscule problems hidden in the side margins in the book, and call it "fair material" for quizzes. Depend on your TA

The syllabus, exams, quizzes, and homework are administered by the math department and can be hectic to follow... just to clarify. Trent is a much better instructor than Sherry. This class is for people who need a slower and a much more specific approach at math. I love his teaching style. My TA is the best. If you can, choose Dylan Wood.

The lectures are super dry and unclear. He just writes on the chalk board and talks at the same time. If you don't keep up or miss something you are completely lost. He makes no attempt to actually clarify anything.

Often complicates the material and speeds through lectures because he often runs out of time. He offers no extra study material such as  (specific)practice problems or review handouts for quizzes and exams which others lecturers did do. Nice guy but doesn't go the extra mile for students.

Ohl is a nice nice guy, but his lectures are often confusing and he makes the material more complicated than it actually is. Recitation made the lessons much more understandable. Do the homework and study for exams.

If you took Precalc in high school you should be okay, it's mostly review.. The class wasn't terrible but professor Ohl made the content much harder than it really was. Thankfully I had notes from high school and a good TA. Overall, don't cram for the midterms and you will be fine. They also curve the whole class at the end of the semester

He goes through the material incredibly quickly. If you didn't take precalc in high school, then it may be a little hard to keep up. I relied heavily on my amazing TA to clarify the material in recitation. Also, he ALWAYS goes over time in his lecture.

I am not a fan of math, but college algebra with Trent was clear and, almost, interesting. Do the homework (and definitely visit the Math help lab) and you will be golden. He is also quite flexible on grading (just go to his office hours if you have any grading questions).
the nicest professor at OSU

Pretty much a class where you need to teach yourself stuff. Two midterms and a final make up a big chunk of your grade. Exams are long and nothing like homework of quizzes. David doesn't make the exams and tried to help but the math department at OSU doesn't set you up for success.
Only understood this class and got a B- because he had a good TA; review sheets don't fully match to what's on the exam

I really enjoyed Professor Kish. I am not the greatest in math, but his lectures are easy to understand and he truly knows how to break down a problem. Plus he records all of his lectures, in case you miss a day. His office hours were extremely helpful so I'd advise to take advantage of them when you can. He's a sweet guy overall!

Prof. Kish is an exceptional and caring professor. I had him for 1148 and he is great at explaining concepts and answering questions. He posts most of the lectures online, but I would go to class in case of questions. He prepares you well for the exams, which are mostly multiple choice, so they are easier than you would think as long as you study.
He taught the material in a great way! I was able to understand everything and apply it to quizzes and tests. He is also cares about what he is teaching and about his students!

I am in my first year at OSU and I am positive that Dr. Kish will end up being my favorite professor that I will have. He is a very kind man and gives very helpful lectures. He responds quickly and cares about all of his students. He extends deadlines and makes accommodations. I highly recommend Dr. Kish.
Nice guy but its a math class so expect to be bored.
He is very good with explaining hard concepts and is a very nice person overall. He puts things into dumb dumb terms which was great for me lol

LOVED Professor Kish! He's such a nice guy and always goes over the material in a good way! I'm not the brightest at math but I found with his lecture style, I did well! Highly recommend him for any math!

David was awesome, as someone who is bad at math he truly cared about my success, making time one on one to help. He's the reason I passed, when taking the same course at other colleges I did poorly. Attendance wasn't mandatory, but if you're on the edge of passing or failing attendance is taken into consideration with grading.

Prof. Kish is an excellent choice and you can really tell that he loves his students. He is always very willing to explain or reexplain and clears any fog of confusion for the lessons. He brings a very positive attitude to class every day. He makes the difference between trying to learn the concepts on your own and going to class night and day.

KISH IS SO AMAZING 100/10 IF I CAN RATE HIM. Having Kish in your schedule = Great Semester/Year

trust.

Professor Kish was amazing! He was the kindest professor I've ever had. He has so many office hours and will add extra ones during exam weeks. He is always willing to answer questions during lectures and genuinely cares about student's well-being. He provides guided notes which is also super helpful.

Had him for 1075 and 1148. Amazing guy, can't say enough good things about him. Always had office hours and was always accommodating and caring. One of the best profs I've had, by far. Clearly conveys the material and answers questions. Always available to help and posts the lectures. Just amazing overall.

I absolutely love David Kish. I had him for math 1075 and now for 1148. He goes above and beyond to help students understand the material, even offering different methods to make sure everyone understands. He is super understanding when sick and missing assignments, quizzes, and exams. Genuinely the best math teacher I have ever had.
Really nice professor, very flexible and his way of explaining concepts is comprehensible.
I really dislike math but Professor Kish was extremely kind and wholesome. Great teacher to be around even if the course material didn't interest me.

David was great, I'm not good at math and started the course nearly failing. David helped and supported through every step, I also used tutoring in the Math basement. Take advantage of office hours and tutoring. If David sees you trying and investing, he will invest in you.

Professor Kish is the literal definition of a dream professor! He is so caring and genuinely wants all of his students to succeed. His teaching style is very easy to follow and he tries his best to be as engaging as possible during lectures. Don't be afraid to ask questions because he will be more than happy to answer them.

Professor Kish is an amazing lecturer. He is so chill and genuinely cares about students! He is really patient with questions as well (doesn't make you feel stupid). Although math itself could get a bit dry but his humor kept it fun and the lectures are entertaining! Easy to talk to as well.
Such a genuine guy, really cares about his students and explains everything very well. I would take this class over again just to have him be my professor again.

This professor is one of the worst professors I have ever had.
Extremely fast lectures. Rarely pauses to take student questions. Does not upload any slides or problems in advance. Assumes students know content when content was not yet covered. Summarily: be prepared to teach yourself the coursework OR use the math tutors.
Fire this woman.
Horrible Professor. If you end up with her, attend a different lecturer because you will learn nothing.

I didn't have her for a class, she was my advisor unfortunately. Never let me talk, talked endlessly about things I didn't ask, screwed me into taking calculus twice (on top of AP calc i took in highscool), not responsive to emails, makes it hard for me to follow my religion. 

Seriously dislike her, she should be fired.

STAY AWAY!!! All she does is mumble to the board the whole time. She doesn't face the class at all, and she writes way too fast. It's impossible to learn anything from her. I had to rely solely on my TA to pass this class. Don't bother going to lectures, you'll learn nothing.
literally just mumbled to herself the whole time for every lecture. i never actually learned anything in lecture so it's pointless to go. had to teach myself everything.
For your own sanity, do not take this professor.

every lecture she faces the board and mumbles to herself and says yes we know this so then we do this for the whole time no one asks questions because she doesnt look up. Absolutely no notes or calendar. The notes you get are photos she emails of the board hours after lecture.I have to use the book and teach myself lecture is pretty much pointless

do NOT take any class with Barbu if you have SLDS accommodations.
