I provided my accommodations before the semester started and discussed with the professor before lecture and she would not accommodate me. it was so bad i had to petition to waive math 1149 as a graduation requirement bc i was being denied my right to an equitable classroom.

I genuinely felt like I was going to have an aneurysm in this class. She wrote way too fast, didn't explain topics or label them, and assumed you knew all of the material. I was told that questions weren't for the classroom and to ask the TA but the TA got mad when I asked questions or said they were going too fast.I learned nothing. Switch classes

oh my god...AVOID THIS CLASS. if you can take this class over the summer PLEASE consider. Basically...The whole department is awful. She uses a chalkboard, can never tell what shes writing, no notes that are on canvas. I utilized the textbook and taught myself everything. actually the most horrendous class ever and i did very well in 1148.
Terrible

She flies through material and does not take questions or look at students. I stopped going after the first week. Attending lecture is extra credit. The tests are awful and so are the exams. I tried to teach myself from the book because her and my TA were unhelpful. This class is near impossible to pass. Do not take it if you can.
Did not even look back at students. Stopped going to lectures after the first couple of weeks. TA as a life saver and the only reason I passed the in-person quizzes.
Literally is just talking to herself

Honestly it's not her fault, OSU's math department just sucks for math1148 & math1149. She crammed a lot of info during lecture and went very fast but she does seem very nice when you speak to her 1 on 1. You'll have to rely on your TA if you want to do good. Exams were open book so use google all you want but it's not easy questions.

Steer clear. She wrote and spoke extremely quickly (and mumbled much of the material) and I ended up not getting a thing out of the lectures despite attending every time. No questions were taken. Neither core concepts or the thought process behind what we were doing was explained. My worst academic experience to date.
She turned her back to us the whole time. She spoke very fast and it seemed like she did not want to be there.

Lol. She's nice when talking to her one-on-one, but she literally can't teach. 

1. Like others have mentioned, she has her back turned the ENTIRE duration of class like she's talking to herself.

3. She never asks if students have any questions. 

Should I keep the list going...?

shes seems like she doesnt want to teach us. she keeps her back to us the whole time while reading off of a paper. no real reason to even go to lecture you wont get anything. make use of your TA and connect math resources
Nice professor, but goes way to fast to even comprehend lecture material. Your TA is the best way to understand the material.

Literally the worse professor I have ever had. Lectures are pointless. The TA I had was 100x better than the actual professor. Professor doesnt know what shes doing 95% of the time. I had to teach myself everything. Definitely read all the chapters on the midterms and do the practice problems

TERRIBLE!!!! -Dont Go To Lectures -Do All Your Homework/work ahead -Quizzes are from textbook so look through it before ever Quiz -Your TA is your best bet -DO GOOD ON MIDTERMS!!!!!!! Final Exam is brutal so after the last midterm start going to lectures.

She is a horrendous teacher, worst math teacher I have had in my life. Writes the textbook on the board for lecture with little to no explanation on how or why she get's her answers. Highly recommend you do not take her math class, especially if it is Trig because it is brutal.
Shes just bad. no one goes to lecture because its beyond pointless and you won't learn anything anyway.
Reads the textbook out loud as lecture and likes to talk to the board. You would be better off going to the TAs office hours than sitting in her class.
A bad teacher and the worst advisor
Dont take her classuseless. Unless you are ready to study by yourself.
she think she is wellactually her teaching is very boring and useless.

Barbu is hands down the worst professor I've had at OSU. She talks at the chalkboard, answers her own questions, and doesn't get the class involved. Made going to an 8am 1000x harder, but she takes attendance so you have to go. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HER!! I ended up teaching myself all of the material
I learned everything from my T.A. It is really hard to follow the information presented during her lectures.
Do not take her class. She teaches extremely quickly and never really takes questions.  It is almost pointless to go to class I teach myself everything and go to the tutor rooms.

It's really difficult to understand her with her accent. She doesn't teach the material the same way the book does. She never turns around from the black board, never makes eye contact with the class, and never asks if we understand. I stopped going to lecture and learned everything from my recitation teacher.

She taught the material HER WAY rather than the way in the BOOK. She talked way too fast and barely made any eye contact. When aske da question, the answer was still never clear. By the second week of class, no one ever attended lecture because we found we understood more by our TA's
She talked very FAST and you could barley understand her but she was a nice lady. Also she did not write clearly.

She can't teach, but she is very nice outside lectures. I once had a big mistake on my exam, she was willing to fix that, so it pretty much shows that she is nice and really wants you to pass. i had a good TA, so math 131 was much more bearable for me.

Terrible. Talks way too fast and writes on the board like she is insane. I don't think you could even ask a question because she never stops writing on the board or talking to it. Maybe if she slowed down a little and took time to explain what she will do she could even be a mediocre educator.

Ms. Barbu did not teach very well. Her accent is hard to understand, her handwriting isn't clear, and she does not explain things very well at all. I stopped going to lectures because they were useless and just learned from my TA.

Ms. Barbu was really nice and lighthearted, but she did teach quickly. She also didn't use the microphone or the overheads until near the end of the quarter, so it was hard to hear and see since everything was on the chalkboard. Her accent was sometimes hard to understand. But she is not a bad choice.

It's true she teaches quick. But the material isn't exactly a walk in the park. If you really want the A in here, you gotta earn by going to MSLC. Midterms are a bit tricky though, make sure you know the material well
eh
Lecture didn't help much because of her accent and her sloppy handwriting. if it weren't for the TA i wouldn't have passed the class
Speaks incredibly quickly, doesn't answer questions, assumes students understand everything.  Very unhelpful, had to go to MSLC all the time to get by.  Don't take her.
Take her if you can :)

I have never been fond of calc but she made it fascinating. She had a great Romanian accent but she really liked to teach and provided so many examples. Do the homework, practice exams, and you won't have to study too much because you'll know it if you do as she says. Amazing teacher and really cares for her students. I got 100s on all her exams.

Probably the best professor I have had. He cares about his students and has very fair tests. Lectures are the most important aspect so while attendance is not mandatory make sure you go to class, if you do you will get an A.

I couldnt even finish this class, I am already horrible at math.. lectures were 1 hour long and not helpful at all, he would speed through it and skip over some steps. the TA's are amazing. Had to drop.

Prof Nance was an average professor. I felt he was not very accessible outside of the lecture. Lecture was focused on him talking about an already written out slideshow. It felt difficult to follow along since he was not actually writing anything during class. 
3 midterms and a cumulative final which you will find in any 1148 class.
I don't like this professor wasn't being reasonable and made me taking my final exam later than everyone so hard for no reason

Please note my poor grade came from me missing a lot of class this semester due to a death in the family. Professor Nance did his best to help me through a difficult time, is caring & does his best to help students learn math. Has a lot of students so don't expect a great rapport, but he is a good math prof.

Tony was a good professor, I was never good at math but he made math bearable and not so bad. I didn't like the material but he was a good professor who explained material well. One thing I didn't like was that he went too fast sometimes. Class has 3 midterms and final, weekly quizzes and homework. Success also depends on your TA.

He is so kind and clearly cares about everyone even though the lecture size is so big. Homework is due at same time same day every week which is easy and manageable. There is a quiz once a week in recitation but they weren't too bad. Kinda sped through lecture to keep time but overall his class was very manageable

Professor Nance is caring, but your TA plays a big role. I had a knowledgeable TA who struggled to explain things clearly because he was a forgein exchange student.  Homework is easy, but quizzes meant to be harder than exams. If you're struggling from the start, tutoring is very helpful—don't hesitate to go!
Great Professor
Good prof. Easy class. He has so many students in lecture so make sure you sign up for a good TA.

Excellent professor and really nice person. I'm glad I got his class.

You may have seen some of the math in 1148 before in high school but this course is very thorough and a good refresher to get started with math in college.
If you've never taken math 1148 before I would say you'll need some extra videos on youtube. I think he goes to fast sometimes and does not explain step by step for difficult things.
Professor Nance is great. His lectures are very straight-forward, as well is the criteria for the class. Paired with a good TA, 1131 should be easy for most.
Probably the best professor I have ever had.

Tony is the best math professor I've ever had. This is a difficult class, but if you show up to class, take good notes, and put effort into the homework you are in good shape for his exams. I wasn't a big fan of the grading scale since I'm not always a perfect test taker, but I can admit the exams were fair and borrow many proofs from lecture/hw.

Hands down the best professor I've ever had out of all the STEM classes I've taken so far, he is one of the few professors who's truly passionate about teaching the material. This class is HARD by all means but Tony makes it much easier by the way he explains proofs. 3 HW per week on average, but they sure help you be ready for the exams

Dr. Nance was a great professor. He explains the material very well and organizes the class very well. He is one of the few gems in the math department. The exams are fair and the questions are similar to examples from homework or in class. Overall, I am very glad I took this class with him.

Does a great job keeping lectures engaging even when dealing with dry material. Very clearly outlines what will be on exams. Exams are very fair and usually follow in class examples and homework. If you can take him for this class, I would highly recommend it.

Tony is probably the best lecturer you could get for this class. That being said, he is still a very dry lecturer. I found his tests to be very fair. Make sure to understand all the problems done in class and on the homework and you will do fine.
Great guy. Great teacher. If you don't like math, Tony will make you like it. Not sure if I'll meet a better teacher in college. A great math class to end on.

Tony Nance is the best mathematics professor at Ohio State for MATH 3345. The lectures are great, homework is mostly from the textbook. Exams are fair: most of the questions are from the homework and textbook/in-class examples.
Tony is such a cool dude. He wears a different sweater everyday in the fall and it makes me so happy. He also does a great job explaining content in class.

I have professor Nance for business calc and he's a great teacher. His lectures move extremely fast with little clarification, and exams are nothing like lecture/homeworks. He has tons of students so it takes awhile to get an email reply, but overall he's very helpful and cares about your success. Calculus is just a tough class!

Prof. Nance gives some of the most passionate and interesting lectures on what most would consider a relatively uninteresting aspect of math. He clearly loves math and wants to share that love for math with his students. His positive energy is infectious. He gives great feedback on exams and HW. If you have the option, TAKE HIS COURSE.

Grade heavily depends on exams, but they're fair and his lectures + hw is a good representation of the content. Good lecturer, can explain well and clearly cares about student's success. Highly recommend.

While the content itself is very dry, Dr. Nance is one of the best professors I've ever had. Clearly cares about students, is genuinely funny and super kind, is very clear about his expectations, comes to lectures with a plan, and just seems genuinely happy to be there. Class average around a B/B+; Decent, but reasonable amount of work.

Dr. Nance is my favorite professor at OSU hands down. He genuinely cares about his students, and he shows it through his lectures. Attendance is not mandatory but highly encouraged. He is really funny and finds a way to incorporate his humor into class while staying on topic, which is really cool. Cool dude. 10/10 would recommend.

Nance is a great dude. He explained the concepts in the book well and made class fun for everyone. Exam questions were directly from the HW and the book. If you do the work, there is not reason you should not get at least an A-.

He was a very good teacher, and he seemed to really want us to understand the material. The midterms were tricky sometimes but they were fair overall. The final was, I think, the easiest of them all. He said the final was meant to give us a second chance at doing well. If you have to take math, take him.

I loved Tony!  He is so helpful and nice.  He was easy to understand as well.  The midterms are a little difficult, but the final was exactly like the midterms, so you knew what was coming.  Study the midterms for the final and you will do fine.
Homework is hard, but the exams are harder. He thought a 79 average was way too high for an exam.

Plz avoid, if take this class be prepared for lot of outside studying. Vry poor lectures, often unable to answer questions if asked. Good guy, but horrid prof. Vry test heavy, but luckily test is 80% same as prctic exam. Final is hvy, can succeed in class, but need to do lot of self study. Exmples r helpful but not many done in class. Gl w Chao!

Take another professor. He doesn't curve exams no matter if the averages are low, and doesn't even grade all your homework problems, making your time spent on a problem basically useless. He'll assign 10, but will only grade 3 and won't tell you which ones he's grading or not. just be prepared to learn everything on your own.
Dr. Lin was a chiller but the class itself is difficult to teach. The class tries to fit 5 credit hours of content into a 3 credit hour class.

This is by far the worst professor I have ever taken a course from. He often made mistakes when teaching, but never corrected them making the class confused. Purposefully assigned the hardest homework and exam questions. Nobody was able to finish exams on time. Often made comments about hating his job and even was racist at times. PLEASE AVOID HIM!
No curve even though averages were low 70s or 60s.

Lin was a horrible professor. He was nice, but he couldn't teach if his life depended on it. He wasted so much time explaining his prewritten PowerPoint notes that we barely got to the examples. No curves, no extra credit. Midterms 1 and 2 were 50% and the final was worth 35%. Told us to drop the class after the dropping deadline. Avoid!

Get a different professor if you can. His lectures are very difficult to understand and do not prepare you for how difficult the exams are. This is the first time I struggled in a math class. I went to his office hours for help and was told "you just need to understand the math". I'm retaking the class right now with Sharma and have an A no problem

The worst professor I ever has, shows no remorse and told students who are not doing good in the class to just drop it near the end of the semester because it will be "Good for him and us". He doesn't know how to explain things and constantly messes up. Exams are worth 85% of the grade and he will double dock for algebraic mistake.

Not finished with Business Calc yet. This is my first calculus class, so the material is relatively difficult, but Professor Lin does everything he can for his students to succeed. I wish I could give him a 10; he's a super down-to-Earth dude. The class is very doable if you put the time in and attend lectures and some office hours.

This class was absurdly ridiciulous. There were times in class when this professor did the problem wrong and taught extremely important material (almost 1/4 of the exam) three days before. Exams are 85% of your grade and if you do bad on one exam it is difficult to bounce back. If you have him, I recommend taking online through different university
Super friendly and explains topics well. Would definitely recommend

Wouldnt let me add linear algebra but - Horrible grader, horrible tests, horrible grading policy. Incredibly lazy. He grades & gives answers for 2 questions  per 30 question homework. Lectures nearly impossible to follow. Doesnt listen to students. Do not take.

DO NOT TAKE LINEAR ALGEBRA WITH SOVAN. Tests were 90% of grade. Super harsh grader. Lectures almost impossible to follow. He does not know how to be a teacher. Talked to him COUNTLESS times after class, asking how to improve my grade, and he did not care or give helpful advice.
Very easy grader.
Very easy class, never attended recitation, very easy A. Just do the hw and practice exam if needed. Let us drop a midterm

He could not clearly convey information, and he usually made it seem more confusing than it actually was. I am not sure if he understood the content himself, and he would make multiple mistakes in every lecture. The TA was very helpful though.

Sure he's nice, but that does not make him a good teacher. He continuously taught us incorrectly (which had to be corrected by students). Multiple times a lecture, a student would ask a question, and he would be derailed for at least 10 minutes trying to understand how to do a concept, ending our classes early because he couldn't figure it out.

Professors are happy to answer questions, so office hours are valuable. But only if you have a clear purpose. He also enjoys talking to students about things that are at a higher level than textbooks. He's willing to help the whole class maintain their GPA

Pretty much what everyone else said.  Very nice and caring professor but the lectures are hard to follow. He really cares and seems like he enjoys teaching but the lectures are a little complicated and I ended up learning more from online videos.

Somewhat caring professor, but I've noticed he's pretty lazy. Have to beg to have solutions to study guides just for him to skip multiple steps of work to where it ends up confusing you even more. Not to mention his handwriting is very difficult to read, and his accent is hard to understand at points. Exam and study guide difficulty were not equal.

Sovan is a nice guy and cares greatly for his students. However, lectures are more complicated than needed and online videos were more useful so I stopped going to lecture. Study guides are very useful to studying for exams. Written homework's aren't terrible. You will have to study the concepts on your own though. Good luck.

He's sweet and obviously is passionate about math, but his lectures personally didn't help me, I feel like I got more out of YouTube videos than his lectures sometimes. The midterms were okay if you did the study guide but the final was tough. I do think he overcomplicated some concepts and the exams were way tougher than they needed to be.

While Dr Mondal is very passionate about mathimatics, i feel that he weighs the exams a bit too heavily. I was at a A until my final and somehow managed to drop 6 percent due to getting a 76 on the final. A bit salty but life's tough

This guy is a really good professor. The exams were very easy if you studied (I did not). Focus on going to lectures and doing the practice problems, and study the study guides thoroughly. If you do that you can get an A.

Sometimes the lecture is lacking in detail, but that may be because he doesn't want to confuse everyone. But you can go to professor's office hours and he helps. He is very kind and wants you to do well. He prioritizes your mental health and only tests you on stuff done in lecture. Take a class with him if he is available!

Professor Mondal is really very sweet, but his course takes a lot of time and effort. Currently, the professor follows a math 2153 syllabus that is a bit more unique. I would probably take this course with a different professor if possible.
He tries his best. Super nice. Always available in office hours. Knows what he is doing.

Dr. Mondal cares a lot about teaching. He's super nice and despite a bit of an accent, you can usually understand him. Exams are pretty tough. If you like math and are interested in learning, this is a great class; he a handful of proofs, so you really understand everything. If you're just trying to knock out a graduation credit... maybe stay away.

He's a kind person, but I can say he's new here and doesn't really know what's going on. Calculus 3 is a tough course but mostly it's still common calculus. Not to mention his accent, he doesn't explain things well. It can take a long time for him just to explain some straightforward points. Better off focusing on the textbook and recitation.
She is smart and willing to help students. The exam is not hard as long as you do the homework and have classes.

Class difficulty wasn't bad. Liu graded by VERY few things. She doesn't curve, so don't expect it. Grading can be very picky. She often paused & asked us Qs during lectures, it can be very distracting. Many students found her to be impatient & easily annoyed if we asked too many Qs. I think it's just her personality, but it truly has to improve.

Her lectures are VERY fast paced, but all good information (could be overwhelming though cause if there's 1 piece you don't understand then the rest of that lecture will make 0 sense). She does want to help students to do good, but sometimes feel scary to approach. Very smart, knows the material well. Class average turned out to be high B+ / low A-

Great professor, very sweet and helpful. The version I took is a new format where online lectures are provided with assignments. he understood the material very well. Most of your grade is built on "standards" (36 different topics, once you answer a question on a quiz or test correctly, you don't have to answer a question from that topic again)

I took Math 1152 Active which was different than normal lecture and recitation. In this version of calc 2, you learn the materials on your own before class and in class you go over practice problems. I would recommend taking this class if you prefer learning on your own. Dr. Kim was an amazing professor, but it was a non traditional calc 2 class.
Really nice guy, understands what he teaches do the homework and practice exams and you'll do great.

His lectures were as entertaining as he could make them for an 8am class, and he really tried to engage us. The exams are a bit difficult if you don't understand it, obviously, but there are so many resources to help you if you need it. Show up to recitation and you'll be fine!
Great professor. Funny. Course wasn't too hard. Posts the annotated lecture slides in case you miss. Show up to recitation

Dr. Kim is very nice for a class that is extremely difficult. I didn't get above a 50 on any exam and still passed because every other assignment is pretty straightforward. The lectures are just YouTube videos found online, so recitation is really important and mandatory attendance. That being said, he is very nice and provides a lot of resources.

Kim was a great recitation teacher. I learned a ton from him. Most problems I had with the course have to do with the math department, which he had not control over. Calc 1 at OSU has a ton of midterms (5), a ton of hw, and a ton of quizzes. They set it up to try and make you fail. However, just study hard and you'll pass.
My favorite professor at OSU. Finally made me understand math.

Very nice professor. Taught the content very well compared to what I heard about the other professors teaching Calc1151. The exams were still very difficult but that is the Math department's fault not his.
Dr. Kim was very passionate about teaching us and put things much more simply than the textbook would. The class moves so fast, but he was great.
If you end up with him for any course I highly recommend switching sections so you have a different professor

Kim was a good lecturer who genuinely cared about the success of his students. This was his first year teaching this class, so the first exam was difficult, but he corrected this and the other 3 seemed reasonable. Overall very reasonable professor that just had to teach a lot of material in a short amount of time.

Professor Kim is a very nice guy who genuinely wants his students to succeed in class. Overall his lectures were helpful, but the exams were oftentimes very difficult. Along with this, the class is not curved so doing poorly on the exam can greatly impact your overall grade.

Extremely nice professor and always accessible outside of class but his midterms and finals can be difficult. Be prepared to spend hours upon hours studying for this class. Go to office hours and the tutor room because they will help

He was the first professor I had in math that I legitimately wanted to study the material because he taught it in such an interesting way. The tests were difficult but not impossible. He genuinely cared whether you understood a topic or not and was very helpful during office hours and during lecture.

I had professor kim for math 3607. Overall a shitty professor. I had asked for help several times throughout the semester and he did nothing. Only office hours are your only way of help. The midterms are brutal, and he does not curve. Save your GPA and don't take this class from him.

Kim is very nice, his notes from class is very detailed. But his homework is very hard. You need to spend tons of time on it. The test is also very hard, the mean of the first midterm is around 40/100 and the second is around 60/100. No curve. My classmates just give up the final since they think they cannot pass the class.

The class was challenging. Straight up he did not teach effectively, spending too much time explaining something that did not need to be understood. The dude's a good person, but don't expect any curving for the test, which is the absolute HARDEST part of this class. The homework due date was at an awkward time too. Expect to fight.

Dr. Kim is an awesome professor. I had him for math 1151 and math 2177, and throughout both courses, his lectures were incredibly helpful and informative. Dr. Kim is also very understanding and forgiving. He writes hard tests though!

Dr. Kim did a great job at teaching the complex concepts that Math 2177 has to offer. While some of the content can be boring, he does a great job at making lecture interactive and understandable. His assignments are challenging yet rewarding. And he is always willing to help students in office hours or review sessions!

Tae is a great guy, and tries hard to make this very difficult course understandable. But try to avoid this section of 3607. I don't know if the other ones are like this, but the hw takes hours on hours each week. You'd think that completing the hours of homework each week would prepare you for the exam, not at all. 1st exam was comically hard.

I take in person class. The professor does not offer any  recordings of the lecture, and the PPT is really difficult to understand if you do not attend the class. Before the exam, the practice exam is useless for the exam, since it is so hard that even I see the answer, I still cannot understand.

The average score of the exam is approximately 45 of 100, the highest score is just 90/100, and the lowest score is 0. However, the professor still does not offer any curve!!!! And he even does not give the chance to redo the problem to get some point back. He is the toughest professor I have ever met in university.

Dr. Kim really cares about students beyond just the classroom. Doesn't always get through all of the content in lecture, but makes efficient use of the entire period. Sometimes there was just too much to be covered in the timeframe but he put the effort in to make a difficult class doable.

You will have to teach yourself. He moves way too fast, but still never makes it through any of his lectures. If you learn by examples, don't take this class. There are no examples to go off of. You either know the content or you don't. The grader given to this class is very harsh. There is barley any feedback to what you missed.

Class is seen as one of the tougher classes, but Prof Kim is a fantastic teacher. Everything is neatly organized on carmen, and lectures are posted along with notes every class. He is always open to questions and cares about the students. Exams are v fair and if you know your stuff you should get a B or above with some effort. Great dude overall
Very well organized lectures and prepares helpful review videos for exams. You can tell how much he cares about students and wants to help us learn.
An amazing calc 1 professor. His lectures made me actually feel like I had command of the subject. Impeccable organization of class materials and extremely well thought out lectures.

Hes great! Had this class online. He posts all the lectures so you do not have to attend class when you actually have it. He goes slowly in the lectures and makes it easy to understand. The tests the math departments writes are tough, but he publishes review videos for his students that certainly help (pretty sure other 1151 prof do not).

Great professor, reply to email quickly. The grader assigned to this course is terrible with no clear grading criteria and grades harshly. He/she would took points off whenever she/he wants and nearly gave no feedbacks, which makes it hard for you to realize your faults. Definitely a GPA killer because of poor designed grading system.

Heavy lectures, time-consuming homework, and four terrible exams. His office hours are extremely helpful. You will be struggling if not having code experience before. You must need tons of hours for a good grade. The final average was about 53 and he curved slightly.

Prof. Kim cares tremendously about his students. He frequently extended deadlines, was very helpful in office hours, and even cancelled one assignment completely. Asked about how we are doing frequently and wanted everyone to do well in the course. Plus he's a good, clean lecturer. This class is not easy though. Expect very long and tedious HWs.

Don't know if Dr. Kim used to be like this. But this semester, the final time was way too short to finish the exam. What's even confusing is, the final exam duration of his different sessions are different. A lot of homework, and each homework takes several days. And he never check his email. Hard and time consuming class!
Its a hard class in general but Tae Eun Kim is very caring and understanding about difficult subjects and tries to do his best to teach in different ways to better everyones understanding.
Great professor. Funny and effective with teaching
Concepts are hard, but if you do homework well, you will get a good grade

Took Professor Kim for Math3607 SU20. He is a nice person but he makes the material harder to grasp. This class is lecture heavy and homework does take a lot of time. The quizzes are tricky and confusing. The final was hard and he graded that harshly too.

He might be a good instructor for calculus class and ODE class, but he cannot be a good professor for scientific computing class. We find it difficult to understand lecture material because his speaking is too fast. It takes several days to finish our homework and the exam is difficult. We should take too much time in this course.

Avoid his online. Took on SU20 No hw solution posted No specific feedback on wich question you did wrong on hw. Unwilling answer questions. "Work on yourself more before asking" quiz graded on average of 3 atmpt instead of highest 3days before final, still 2 videos not psted a matlab course w/ heavy hand calculation final
He might be a good researcher or worker. But he is never a good professor you should try since his course is typically reading the ppt.

Tae is an absolutely wonderful professor! His lectures were fantastic and he goes out of his way to try to reach out and get to know his students. Students from other lectures would skip their lectures to attend Tae's because he was THAT good. The math department writes really difficult tests, so my grade wasn't great, but that wasn't on him.
One of the best lecturers for 1151. Explains concepts so they are easy to understand.

Really good lecturer and really cares about whether or not his students succeed. Did not expect to do well at calc in college but his lectures made it very easy to understand. He can be difficult to contact outside of class but I utilized the tutoring rather than office hours. He reviews a lot. I would definitely take him again.

Hilarious and personable, very knowledgeable about subject matter and genuinely cares about students and their success in the course. Exams are worth most of the grade but Dr. Kim provides plenty of review materials, including past exams. Content and difficulty of exams are pretty reflective of review materials so you know what to expect.

Dr. Kim is a really cool guy that makes Calc 1 as fun as it can be. He cracks jokes every now and then and he wants his students to like the class. He has a very clear lecture/class structure and is really on top of uploading things on Carmen. The examples he does are usually pretty close to test questions. Your grade is made of like 75% exams.

He went over the material very thoroughly and he was very personable. I went to his office hours a few times and he was always very respectful of his students. Additionally, he was always willing to go step by step through problems to make sure that everyone understood the processes behind solving them.
Publish all the notes he take during the class on Carmen, its helpful for me to review before the quizzes and tests. Good teaching skill, is a really awesome teacher.

Dr. Kim was one of my favorite professors! He is very funny during lectures and you can tell he really likes to teach. The content was a little difficult but if you do all of the homework and practice exams it's pretty manageable.

Professor Kim is so great! I just switched from another professor who doesnt suits me. This one really cares about his students. He gives us the slides he used in the class so you dont have to worried you wont see what he wrote. Besides, he uses the microphone so that every students in the classroom can hear him. And he has a sense of humor

Dr. Kim was one of my favorite professors that I've ever had. He is so knowledgeable of the material he teaches and cares about his students. Even asked us questions about what we study and where we are from. Really cares to get students names correct too. Class is tough and it is a lot of work but doable if you show him you care and want to learn

Dr Kim is one of the most caring professors at OSU. His lectures are extremely organized and he is VERY intelligent. Just beware, you will have to work hard in this class. Homeworks take forever and are not easy. He's very straightforward about what is on his exams (EXCEPT for the final cause that was hard).

Tae Eun Kim has been one of my favorite math professors thus far at OSU. He is very thorough during lecture and is VERY fair on what you are tested on in exams. He genuinely cares about your learning and performance in the course.

Tae is the best Calc professor OSU has to offer. He is funny and is very organized with his notes. He is always tring to help and give tips on what he thinks will be on the exams. Id recommend him to anyone.

Dr. Kim is one of those professors who knows so much about the subject that he doesnt slow down and actually TEACH students. He assumes you already know the material and skips lots of steps. He also has a really dry sense of humor, and a monotone voice so its hard to stay awake in the morning. Also not on him but warning that exams are HARD.

Dr. Kim is a pretty good teacher, but he goes too fast in lectures. I think this problem is more due to OSU's Math department, seeing as information we're taught for Friday shows up on our exam Tuesday. Quizzes are also VERY unfair, but they are written by the Math department, so not really his fault. His sections typically have higher averages

Dr. Kim was an amazing professor; he was charismatic, taught hard concepts in simple terms, and genuinely cared about his students. He really worked to provide as much practice material as possible for students. He would tell interesting stories in class and tell jokes to lighten the mood. I feel extremely grateful to have had him as my professor.

Dr. Kim provides the class with slides in order to follow along in lectures, he provides extra reviews for midterms and the final, and he regularly extends his office hours during those times. You can tell he genuinely cares about the success of his students. His classes always had the highest averages on midterms as well. Best professor I've had.
Good teacher provide PPT for students

Tae Eun is the best professor you can find. Whoever said he doesn't care about his students must not have gone to class. Tae Eun Kim makes up extra reviews, posts answers, and emails students if he notices a problem. He also stayed extra office hours for me since I had a class conflict. He also makes lectures interactive!
Calculus is already pretty hard, I don't think having Tae helped very much. He's a nice guy, but his exam average was a 60 when I had him with no curve in the class. Which is whack

I felt like Tae did actually care about us and how we did, but honestly his lectures didnt really correspond at all to the quizzes and tests which I think is really more of a reflection on the math department as a whole. I did not enjoy the class and would probably not recommend tae.

Tae grows on you through the semester. He is one of the few math professors at OSU that cares about his students. He is super smart and good at explaining things. Very straightforward about what's on the exams. You really have to put in A LOT of time and effort to do well in his class. Homework assignments are a weekly marathon and quizzes are hard

Dr. Kim is a great professor, very helpful and is genuinely interested in math and in helping students with what can be difficult subject material. Always finds a way to make lectures interesting and funny. Always gives example problems that will be on the exam and quizzes. Lectures are structured very well

This teacher is not as good as I thought, he has a problem with structure. He doesn't have a good structure for his class and he confuses you in the way he teaches. I won't take him again and yes you should not take him!

The homework is ridiculously long and difficult (usually 10-20 hours a week to complete decently). Gives obscure weekly quizzes on oddly specific topics that you think are rather irrelevant. Pretty sure the (free) textbook is for PhD students and not undergraduates. Exams are a usually a step up from the practice one he gives.

Dr. Kim is amazing at explaining concepts. 1152 covers concepts that people in higher math classes say are the most difficult that they've learned. He doesn't take attendance but if you don't show up you're going to fail because you'll have no idea whats going on. He's also very funny and he's jacked so I mean why not take his class?

This guy treates undergraduate students as if they are PHD students. His homework is impossiblelecture is boring. He will try his best to trick you and tell you this is learning. Definitely won't recommand this guy if you have other options.
Professor Dain is extremely easy to follow in lectures, he is very kind and easy to reach outside of class. I wish he could be my math professor for all levels.

Mr. Dain knows the material he teaches well. He does a good job at keeping people as engaged as possible. I'm a student who has returned to college after many years. Math was the class I was most concerned about, as I did not get good grades when I took the same class at another college before. The professor matters and he's a good one.

He was a great lecturer and very accessible. Midterms/exams were a little tricky but as long as you study and pay attention, you will do well. Homework was never too excessive and he made the lectures fun and simple.
great professor would take again

This class was super easy even though he teaches fairly quickly. He's a great professor and makes sense just make sure to keep up with notes. Everything is straightforward and easygoing but there are a lot of tests so make sure you study. The midterms are simple as long as you know the material.

Dain was an amazing professor for 1050. There was a lot of homework from the book, but he gave you the due dates at the very beginning and you knew when they were due, along with exams. Homework was completion based and no accuracy based, but he would leave feedback. Very open for questions and office hours and helps students as much as he can!

He's super nice! I'm just not a math person so it was kind of difficult for me to understand just generally, but he delivered the material in the most fun and clear way I think anyone could've done. I'd take him for 1148 if I could !

Pretty easy class. I stopped going to lectures and recitations and watched the videos on ALEKS instead and still got an A. When I did go to lectures, Dain made them interesting and fun. Midterms are a bit tricky but multiple choice and a few short answer and weekly recitation quizzes are only 2 questions.

Homework is graded for accuracy, but you're able to correct the ones you missed (as long as it's submitted before the due date!). Textbook is provided online. Lectures were clear and easy to follow, and he posts his completed notes to canvas after every lecture.

I love his class. He was able to explain little details in an essay way. He will have time for extra classes to help you if needed. Besides we have recorded all the classes! That was the best and his jokes :)

Dain was super kind and a great professor. I struggle with math a lot, so I didn't do too great in his class. His lectures were often very boring and dry, but he's a really good educator. If you struggle with math, your TA and/or office hours will be your best friend.

He is one of the nicest professors I've ever had. Genuinely such a sweet man who cares for all of his students. He really wants everyone to succeed. I'm not good at math but this class was relatively not too bad for me! Take him if you can he is so nice 10/10

Literally, the nicest man I've ever met, and also one of the BEST math teachers I've ever had. I'm not even exaggerating. He's a very sweet guy, who takes his time in lectures to explain things. Very understanding, and explains concepts thoroughly. His tests aren't hard, he genuinely wants you to succeed. 10/10

Professor Dain was awesome, he is very sweet and understanding. He was prepared each lecture with notes that were understandable. Also very forgiving, he allowed me to make up assignments and take an exam late since I was unable to at the scheduled time. Final exam was kind of hard for me which knocked me down to a B+. Great professor!
This course is super easy, but he is a great lecturer and explains math so well. He makes jokes here and there which lightens the mood. A very good professor!
Great

This class was fast paced, but he would slow down and go back if u asked. He would actually answer questions we had and would really go through them step by step. Math is usually torture for me, but he kind of made it enjoyable as he cracked jokes in class to lighten the mood. Wouldnt take again because it was a bit too fast, but i do recommend.
I really enjoy the way he goes over the material during class. he leaves homework twice a week and one quiz per week about the things we have learned.
Professor Dain is so caring and nice. His lectures are pretty interesting and he loves talking to his students. He also does a superb job on teaching.
I love Professor Dain! He is literally so sweet and funny. He truly cares about his students and tries to make math fun. I highly recommend taking any of his classes. It is an easy class as well.
Best math teacher Ive ever had. I would take every single math class he teaches. Very funny and will take time to answer any questions.
Super nice, very helpful. If you can take him for any math class, do it!

Dr. Szczesny makes MATH 1172 very approachable, and does an amazing job teaching concepts in a way that gives you an understanding as to why they work. The class has a focus on actually learning the concepts over getting the grade, with exam corrections for half-credit back instead of curves. Would highly recommend for 1172

Overall nice guy and decent lectures but he does not teach anything that is on the midterms. The midterms make or break your grade so if you have him, you're gonna have to teach yourself the material or you will fail. Have fun if you're stuck with him.

Math 1151 is a hard course. However this professor was especially challenging because he didn't cover content on the midterms. The midterms make or break your grade so you cannot afford to do bad on them if you want a good grade. However this professor did not teach me what I needed to know to succeed, I had to teach myself the whole course.

IF YOU GET THIS PROFESSOR FOR MATH 1151, SWITCH OUT. I'm not kidding, I worked my butt off for class and I still ended with a C+. The lecturer taught content that was NOT ON THE MIDTERMS and considering the midterms have such a heavy weight, it sent my grade to hell. He was a bad teacher and I had to teach EVERYTHING to myself. Save yourself.

He was always very engaging in lectures despite the large number of students. He frequently used TopHat and a thumbs up/mid/down system to gauge the students understanding. He also provided worksheets and had a "pet of the day" at the beginning of class featuring a students submitted pictures!
He cares about how we interpret his content and is very open to feedback and adjusting to his students

I had him as a TA and professor for 1172 and it was beneficial to me because I could ask him to explain the lecture content during recitation. He wants the best for his students and cares about us learning the content. He likes to show off his cats and his students' pets.

Rlly easy class, but not a great teacher. Was consistently 5-20 minutes late to lecture, and would only talk over pre-written notes. Wish he had worksheets to follow along with his lectures. You could look at his notes at home & get the same out of it. Sad bc he's a rlly kind, funny & willing guy who just doesn't teach efficiently :(

He's okay when it comes to explaining math but his attitude towards us was just lazy and disrespectful. 10 to 15 minutes late every single time to a class that costs my family 1000s of dollars. Never replies to emails. Just talks over prewritten notes instead of working out problems in class. The OSU math dept. should pay students back their money.
If you do the homework in this class you will get an A. It is optional, but to study for exams I did the homework and my lowest exam grade was a 95 of all 4 exams. Super easy class, great professor!

I love this guy. When learning any math, you need a good teacher and this is your guy. I would retake calc anytime, anywhere if I always had him. He's really funny and cracks jokes. Exams are HUGE for your grade so study before them or you'll probs fail. Hw is super easy and recitation is easier. If you're nervous abt calc, take this guy.

Craig Franze is an amazing teacher. He is by far the best professor I have had thus far, as he was tasked with making the dry calculus material interesting. He was engaging in all his lectures, and always did everything in his power to make sure everyone was prepared for exams. Nothing but high praise for Professor Franze.

I genuinely think this is one of the best math professors I will ever have at OSU, this professor knows how to lecture and is always willing to explain further if you need it, just ask. My TA was great too, and I definitely recommend going to lectures and recitations. The only bad thing about him is that he takes a long time to respond to emails.

I found the lectures to be easy to follow and pretty helpful. The class is only composed of homework, quizzes, and exams, so there's not a lot of room for error. I think my TA really helped with my understanding of the material, but the homeworks weren't hard and neither were the quizzes. The exams were moderate but I never got below a B.

Good professor overall as long as you actually show up to class and recitation with your TA. Lecture time doesn't have mandatory attendance, however highly recommend being there as much as possible. He is very relaxed and appreciates those who participate. Also, be sure to go to math tutoring or your TAs office hours if you need help!

Great professor who really enjoys teaching and explaining things thoroughly. Also a really funny guy. Exams are worth 85% so it is very test heavy but he does his best to prepare you for each exam with practice tests that are helpful.

Could tell that he was new to lecturing this year. But, got more comfortable as the year went on. Tries his best in the big lecture hall to help everyone and answer questions. He is hilarious and makes jokes during class. I've had experience with Calculus in high school, but the way he teaches it clarified a whole bunch of questions. Great person!

I didn't get to pick this professor and was just assigned to the class. He sucks. Exams were worth 85% of final grade and were ridiculously hard. Gives practice exams completely different from actual test. Also writes with white chalk in small print on the chalk board in the 300 seated lecture hall. Could barely see in the front/middle section.

Took two weeks to respond to my email and only after I had to reach out to someone else. Does not truly explain himself when going through problems on the board so make sure you go to recitation

I did most of my learning through youtube videos and recitation

Weekly homework yet I never got anything graded until November. By that time it was almost too late to save my grade, but lowest 2 homework grades were dropped. Midterms were alright, there was somewhat of a curve. Just confusing lectures but office hours are helpful. However, Foundations sequence is inherently difficult.

Professor Estill said he would curve midterm 2 or add an end of the year curve due to poor results, and he just never ended up doing it. Sent multiple emails throughout the semester regarding grading and never responded to a single one. Does not care about his students and their grades whatsoever. Nice guy, but one of the worst professors ever.

He cares for students and has a good sense of humor. However, his lectures are really dry and hard to understand. He also grades homeworks and tests really slow. He is a very nice grader but that is because almost everybody in the class does not understand what is going on.

Super easy grader, unfortunately Estill is also an incredibly slow grader, midterms were graded over a month after just before the next test. Other than that Estill is a great guy who genuinely likes what he does. He is super helpful although lectures be a little hard to follow, the homework definitely helps to solidify things.
Awesome dude and tests are directly from homework. Just make sure you go to office hours for homework's because graders can be harsh. Really nice guy just go to him and he will help you.

He's a very nice man but not a reliable professor. As others said, very slow grader. Classes were canceled or moved to zoom VERY often, and it was hard to learn online. midterm 2 was graded oddly harshly (no partial credit given at all?). I do appreciate his consideration for international students and he is very helpful in office hours.
Not sure why there's so many negative reviews. He's a solid and nice guy who is passionate about the subject. His lectures are helpful in my opinion. He is also very open to questions.
Super Chill Guy. Very helpful in Office hours. Just study his slides and you should be good to go.

If you haven't taken math in a while, it might be a little of an adjustment. But he is an easy grader and gives easy exams (much easier than HW). Not a good set up for Foundations 2, but super accessible for office hours and questions. Doesn't provide lecture slides until after.

Estill is truly a nice guy, but imo cannot lecture to save his life. The final was also oddly difficult compared to the midterms. Not hard to get an A in this class, but I do not feel like I learned much. Office hours are v helpful, which makes up for the mid lectures.

NEVER answer emails. Not a single thing graded until two days before the second midterm, so we didn't have any feedback to know what we were doing wrong. His lectures were way too focused on proofs, even though engineers don't care about proofs. He taught like a math class when it literally is not a math class. His lecture slides are walls of text.

My major concern is that I didn't know what my grade in the course was until after the final exam was taken because he takes forever to grade assignments. Lectures can be a little difficult to follow, but they do directly coincide with exam material which is helpful. He is a fun person, however I do feel that his lectures could be made more clear

This is the WORST professor I've ever had. He can't teach to save his life and is always off topic. I would go to his office hours consistently and leave feeling even more confused. I ended up bombing all of my tests and considered switching majors, but after retaking the class with someone else and getting an A- I realized he was just horrible.

Did not show up for our final exam and did not grade assignments for the entire semester until eventually grading them for completion nearing finals week. He is a nice guy, but I am pretty nervous for foundations II as I am unprepared and will likely have to self-teach and play catch up

Look, if you take his Foundations I class it's an easy A. But you won't learn a thing and won't be prepared for foundations II. His lectures are abysmal and people perform so poorly on certain exam questions that he doesn't grade them at all. Also, for one of his sections he just didn't show up for the final. He's a nice guy, but is unfit to teach.
Good class overall. Lectures are a little hard to follow and confusing but prepares for exams very well, and is very accesible at office hours.

Estill's lectures were pretty subpar. I felt they were unorganized and I didn't think he did a great job of actually teaching us the content that would show up on homework and tests. But I'll admit that his office hours were SUPER HELPFUL, so if you're ever stuck on homework problems definitely attend office hours and he'll help you out.

Not the best lecture format as he would go through presentations of like 70-80 slides and it wasn't always clear what you should take notes on, but he grades leniently and his office hours were always a huge help

Dr. Estill is overall a nice guy, but a terrible teacher. His lectures consisted of him reading over 70+ slide long presentations and were boring and difficult to follow. Seems to have short term memory loss, often forgetting what he's talking about mid-sentence. One week left in the course and 80% of assignments weren't graded yet. Exams were easy

Dr. Estill goes through lecture material very fast, which can be confusing. The organization of the material got messy in the middle of the course, but got cleaner towards the end of the semester. Dr. Estill is extremely helpful during review sessions and office hours though. You can tell he really cares about his students.
His lectures were not the best, but his office hours are very helpful and overall he cares for the students.

Dr. Estill deserves more credit than he's given in his ratings here. He genuinely cares so much about students and while his lectures were more math-oriented than CSE-oriented which could be confusing, he put in so much extra time and effort to anyone who needed it to make sure people understood the content, and his grading was extremely generous.

I enjoyed his mathematical take in this class. The class can be a bit boring at times and the homework hard, but his office hours are super helpful for understanding the material. Exams and hw are fair, and final is not cumulative except for 1 or 2 subjects. I enjoyed learning from Dr. Estill!

You will be completely lost in his lectures and the first half of the class you might wonder how you're gonna make it through, but his homeworks and exams are pretty fair and you'll be fine as long as you take the time to teach yourself the material. His lectures tend to have a lot of random tangents and thoughts to himself

I loved Charles. He was quirky and seemed to really care. Personally I thought lectures were very clear, but if you find that's not the case for you, go to office hours! He will spend a long time going over things with people until they get it.

Professor Estill is not the best but he isn't the worse. His tests are easier than other professors but his lectures are def 100% confusing. I would watch his lectures after I had examples in front of me and would go to office hours regularly. You could perfectly go to office hours and just listen to other's questions and skip lectures.
WORST PROFESSOR EVER! DOESN'T REPLY TO EMAILS AND IS SO HARD TO GET AHOLD OF! AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

I took him for CS2321. Very nice guy but not the best, he spends a long time on examples but it's not always clear what he is trying to teach with them. I found it useful to skip the lectures and watch a week's worth on Monday when the homework was due. Did not try to trick you, and most everything on quizes/hw was taught explicitly in class.

Charles is by far the worst professor I have ever had the displeasure of taking. He is impossible to get ahold of outside of class, and straight-up ignores emails. Beyond that, he doesn't communicate the material at a level beyond "here is how you do this specific problem" - lecture is essentially watching him solve a math problem with no insight.

Dr Estill is easily the worst college professor I have ever had. He failed to communicate the material in an understandable manor, would cancel classes with less than an hour notice, and had powerpoint's with a multitude of mistakes. Pro tip: he barely changes the exam questions from semester to semester. He should not be teaching CSE.

His lectures weren't horrible for me, as others have said, but my advice is to make use of his office hours. His office hours were definitely more helpful to me than lecture, and he was always eager to help. His class is a nice balance between not too hard and not too easy.

He is very lecture heavy, but if you at least show up and kind of listen and pit the effort in to learn the material you don't understand, you'll do fine. The only problem I had was he didn't have the grade weights in till the day of the final.

Charles is a nice guy and tries his best but is a horrible lecturer. The exams arent too bad though (the final was very easy) and the homeworks are graded loosely. I felt like I had no idea what was going on for much of the semester and got an A. Just go to class and learn the material the best you can and youll be fine.

Terrible foundations teacher. When asked for any review problems for an exam he said "no". Complete disconnect in teaching the subject compared to other professors of 2321. Absolutely worst professor I've had. Exams are easy though

Avoid at all costs. Foundations I isn't meant to be hard, Estill makes it hard. The only things to study from are your own notes and hw, so if you skip class you're extremely behind. The grader is also slow, the last two homeworks were only put in after the final. He also never responds to emails, and cancels office hours often.

Don't take Foundations 1 with Estill. There isn't much to study off of for exams except for your notes and previous hw (which the solutions are riddled with mistakes). He's not a bad lecturer but his exams and hw make you wish you didn't even bother taking this class.

There are better professors out there. Estill isn't the end of the world, but his homeworks are sloppy with mistakes he didn't catch and tests can be confusing. He is extremely late in putting in grades and doesn't provide many example problems, as his lectures come out of the textbook verbatim. Try to avoid him..

I personally like the way he teaches the content. The problem I have is the way the class is organized. He's scattered, our grader was constantly late with HWs (and he didn't push him as to why), and it's halfway through winter break and our finals haven't been put in yet...

This is the worst class I've taken at OSU. I'm not sure why they decided to let a math teacher instruct a CSE course, but he's absolutely TERRIBLE. Doesn't post the material on Carmen, and his notes are a hot mess to follow and hardly make sense most of the time. I really do not think he should be teaching CSE courses - he should stick to math.

DO NOT TAKE THIS !! I respect that he is a math professor but I don't think he is qualified to teach this CSE class. This class is designed to help CS major student to understand programming algorithm and logic based on math. But he make this class SO complicated and even out of topic. You want self learn?NO WAY because there is not enough material

Dr. Estill seems to be teaching higher level math (arguably calc II and III aren't even higher level math) yet he seems to struggle with algebra and will make many basic mistakes per lecture to the point it doesn't make sense to take notes till he finishes his writing. He is a nice guy who knew the calculus but seemed lacking in other math skills.
10/10 would recommend for Calc 2 recitation. Perhaps eccentric, but eccentricity is far better than monotony. Excellent at explaining theory, which is good when you have no true lecturer (as I did).

Easy and interesting math class. Watch lecture videos online, show up to online recitation and work in a group to do the problems, do the homework within a week of recitation. As long as you get your work done and can remember to watch the online lecture videos, you'll be fine. Almost no real math, all basic theories.

Math 1151 can be tough. Dr. Estill has frequent office hours, and he is very good at explaining the material. Even if you do all of the homework and study consistently, the exams can still be very tricky. Taking advantage of office hours really helped me succeed in the course. With his help, there was nothing that I did not understand.

Definitely recommend him. he's a little eccentric, but really cool. Definitely recommend attending class, but he confuses himself a little bit sometimes. Very understanding guy, though, and he teaches in a way that makes calculus very very easy to understand. OSU calc department sucks though, still ended with a B (not charles' fault!)

I would recommend him.  He always teaches straight from the book, which can be a little confusing when he uses the definitions, but overall I found lectures to be useful.  He is extremely helpful during office hours, which he has plenty of, and very caring about his students.  Definitely take advantage of his office hours.

Charles is pretty bad at lecturing.  He makes a lot of mistakes that we have to catch for him, and he takes a lot of lecture to write down theorems and proofs from the book.  I did really well on the first exam, and not too good on the second.  But the final exam had stuff that I don't think he ever taught us.  All the quizes were fair though.

Decent Professor, He occasionally confuses himself and often asks unnecessarily about spelling. Most of class is writing down formulas and doing practice problems. Class isn't mandatory. As long as you go to recitation and to most lectures you should be able to get a B.
He isn't capable of reaching a class because he gets lost so easily. I've gotten worse at calc in this class. We had a sub a couple days ago and it was incredibly easier to follow.

His lectures are unbearable for me, he constantly corrects his grammar and asks the class if he spelled something right. As long as you read the book, do practice problems and attend recitation, you'll be fine.

Very nice guy, but not the best teacher. Feel like he couldn't teach the class if he didn't read straight out of the book. Often messes up notes. Gives tough tests with twists you've never seen before that he probably couldn't even do.

I thought that Dr. Estill was a great professor.  He had a very interesting personality that was hilarious, and I never felt overly confused in his class.  You definitely have to work hard for it though.

Estill is a bit eccentric. He constantly corrects his own grammar when it isn't necessary. He confuses himself and doesn't seem to know what is going to be on the exams because he "isn't the one who makes them." If you need to have email correspondence with him, don't bother. He won't reply. Otherwise, if you go to his office hours, he will help.

Charles is a really great professor who really cares about what he is teaching. He is available and willing to help you in office hours if you need it. This class nevertheless is very challenging and you will definitely have to work for the grade you want but Charles does a excellent job at helping you do that. Attend lecture because he moves quick
Honestly, the online lectures found at the course website are just as helpful, if not more, as attending the lecture.
He clearly explained the material ad is rather hot

He listed "lecture note problems" in the syllabus that were basically the tests and quizzes. He doesn't curve, but he builds in extra credit (which is why I got over 100%). He made it super easy, but still taught you everything you needed to know.

My success in the class was mostly due to my Godlike TA, Daniel Glasscock. But Dr. Estill is good too. He lectures straight out of the textbook, so if I missed a lecture, I could just teach myself. He's very helpful during office hours. The practice problems my TA assigned were ridiculously helpful for studying. Pretty easy class if you keep up.
He is a great teacher, and enjoyable to listen to! Math 1172 is very difficult, but he is one to make the class as headache-free as he can.

Charles is wonderful! He wears all black, but is really nice. Go to his office hours, he really likes meeting his students! Exams aren't that bad, just study hard for the quizzes. No homework and not mandatory attendance. Overall, great guy.

Probably the best professor I have this semester. Extremely nice person and very willing to help with anything. He may wear all black and seem intimidating, but he is funny and a nerd in the best kind of way. Extremely passionate about math, but more importantly, passionate about his students as well.

Charles is by far the best math professor I've had at Ohio State. He explains the material decently, he is easy to understand (not foreign), and incredibly nice. As some others have said, don't be put off by the fact that he dresses in all black-- he might just be the nicest professor at OSU. I highly recommend Charles.
I would not recommend him to anyone, but he is bearable.
Easy class but charles in no help at all. Students correct him on the regular, doesnt even know his own material.

Over all a good teacher, and is very nice and helpful. He will go out of his way to help you understand the material, is very generous in grading; will give you some points for at least trying to answer the homework and test questions. Sometimes his lectures can be a bit confusing, as he tends to go through the material a little fast, however; if y

He was the best recitation teacher that I've had. He explains things really well and goes over the homework before it's due sometimes. Don't get put off by him dressing in all black; he's a great guy.
Charles is the cooooooolest guy ever. Who else would sport the full black apparel other than charles? Anyways... he's a good TA will explain whatever you need help with.

confuses himself then confuses students, figures it out eventually but by the time he does everyone's so confused they agree with him just to make him stop talking.  nice guy, bit of a pushover, more times than none will change a quiz or homework grade if you talk to him about it after class.  class was a bit blah, didn't get much out of it.
An interesting guy that you have to meet to understand.  He does sometimes get confused by his own explainations.
He tried, but he could not explain anything very well. He always messed up on the problems and was very unclear and just a bad teacher. He is a nice person though.
Charles is a nice guy.  He'll do whatever he can to help you out.  He can be a little unclear at times but he usually sorts it out by the end.

Really good TA!  I had him for two of the Calculus sequences, and he is not only very good at getting the material across, but is also good at showing little tricks that make the material easier to do.  Great mustache, too!
Charles was awesome, a really fun guy who is willing to spend as much time as you need for you to understand. He does wear black but its at odds with his extremely nice personality. A+ rating!
nice guy, would help you if needed but seemed a little strange, he would come to class dressed in all black and a leather jacket like a hardass but didn't seem that was at all, nice guy though

I was lucky to have Amit for multivariable calc in Summer ‘24. He works very hard into making the class run smoothly, mixing ideas, theory, and real-life examples in his awesome lectures. Super chill and humble! He created a real community where everyone felt welcome and actually learned a lot.

Amit Vutha is one of the best math professors I have ever had. He truly cared for his students and wanted to see them succeed. He held numerous office hours and held online exam review sessions. He was very responsive to his emails and extremely understanding if you needed to reschedule an exam.
nice professor

A combination of best professor, best TA, and best design of course! Helpful lectures, good grading criteria that reduces stress, always patient, explains things clearly, respond quickly. Prof and TAs are really working hard helping you to get a good grade! Feel so lucky to be in this course for my first semester of college.

Prof. Vutha is truly one of the best math teachers around. He explains concepts clearly and genuinely cares about his students' success. Definitely take advantage of his office hours - they're super helpful. For study prep, I found unstuckstudy and the free textbook really useful.
He's awesome. Just take the class, I sucked at pre-calc, and he made me change my approach completely to math. Probably the best professor I'll ever have.

If you are paying attention, it will become clear that Dr. Vutha is a true blessing. He's a wonderful teacher who is extremely humble and selfless of his time.  I was a non traditional veteran student and was stressed about returning to college math. His positive energy and support made me feel seen in a five hundred person class and stick it out.

Super amazing teacher who actually cares about his students and wants to help! Willing to put in extra time and work around your schedule if additional help is needed. No textbook, everything can be learned from the organized notes he posts, and there were no surprises on the midterms. Go to office hours and monopolize on the extra credit offered!
My favorite professor!! Nice hand-writing, clear lecture slides and practice midterms.

Beyond being a gifted teacher, this guy's got a soul that's pure gold. 

He may have hundreds of student each semester, and yet he's got this knack of seeing the best in you and pulling you up, every single day, even if you can't see it yourself.

Whatever they're tossing his way in pay, it's a drop in the ocean for what he's truly worth.
Great guy, great sense of humor, and very reasonable. Definitely one of the best professors I've ever had. He's always looking to help, and cares more about you than the university and his job.

Amit is by far the best professor I have ever had. He is very kind and genuinely cares for all of his students and wants to see them succeed. Going to his office hours is very beneficial, especially for the written homework. He is very lenient with turning in late work and is very understanding.

Amit is the best teacher I have ever had. He is extremely understanding, down to earth, and kind. I actually learned everything I was being taught and understood it at a deeper level. I am so grateful to have had such an awesome experience being his student this year. He truly showed that he cared about each and every student.

Amit is the best math professor I have had. He provided us with clear notes and was thorough when explaining topics in lecture. He had numerous office hours throughout the week but was willing to help you anytime during the week regardless of his posted office hours. Amit wanted to see you succeed and cared for you much more than just a student.
Not many complaints. Amit did a good job being down to earth and making student feel like they are real people. Taught relatively well, but there is a lot of content to remember for the final.

Amit is one of the best professors I've had and really cares about his students. He's very understanding and has a good sense of humor. Weekly quizzes don't impact your grade too much. HW is due every week but overall a great prof and I would 100% take again.

Amit was the best math teacher I have had. He is very organized and uses a consistent format for lectures. He hosted zooms every Monday to prepare students for the weekly quizzes, held in-person exam review sessions, and was always helpful during office hours. Truly wants to see his students do well. Take Amit if possible.

Dr. Vutha is probably the best math professor I will ever have, which is sad for me, but great for you if you're planning to take any of his classes! He explains things thoroughly but in simple ways, and is always willing to help. His office hours are great to go to! He truly cares for you as a person and as a student :)
He was very funny and entertaining during class, he talked really fast though so you had to take notes fast.

Absolutely awesome guy. Incredibly caring and willing to meet with students outside of class, regardless of his office hours. Lectures are fast paced, but that is not his fault. He makes jokes during class and tries to make the content seem less boring. I highly recommend taking his class if you need the math credit!

Prof Vutha was an amazing professor and a great start to my freshman year. His lectures were detailed and helpful. He also hosted zoom reviews for every midterm and for the final which I found extremely helpful. Overall, his lectures made it easy to pass the class despite the material perhaps being difficult for some. I highly recommend him.
best ta ever hes awesome awesome !!!!!
best TA i have ever had in my life amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!!
BEST TA EVER!!!!! Amazing guy very helpful!!!

BEST TA EVER!!!!!!!!!! Amit met up with me before the final exam to help me out because I was struggling and he is the most helpful TA I have ever had! He is very good at explaining things, and genuinely cares about his students. If you have him you will never struggle in math and you will have an easy, fun, and exciting semester!!! Hes a great TA!

I had Amit as a TA and he was incredible. I didn't have the best professor for calc 3, so having Amit during recitation was a life saver. He was funny, interesting, and cares about his students doing their best. He is great at explaining difficult subjects to understand and never makes you feel stupid for being wrong or asking questions.

The way Professor Vutha taught the course made it very easy to understand and internalize the material. He was always ready to help outside of the classroom and took the time to make sure his students felt prepared to take the quizzes and exams.
Does a good job treating you like a person and adult rather than a robot or just some kid. Funny too.
he will take care of you
Caring teacher, easy class.
He was great, and funny.

Nicest and most genuine guy I've ever met. Class was somewhat difficult, but Amit made himself so accessible online and outside of class because he genuinely cared about seeing us succeed. I wish I would've had him as my lecturer instead. He's very laidback and his review sessions were very helpful.

The actual class itself is not bad at all if you go to the lectures and keep up with the homework. There are 10 quizzes, 3 exams, weekly online homework assignments, and 1 final. Amit is such a great professor! He is very kind, caring, and funny. Highly reccomend!
Didn't go to as many lectures as I should have, but he's a good teacher. Always makes himself available and posts good notes. Very funny too.

Always held quiz review sessions and midterm prep sessions outside of class time, during his evenings which was very caring. He uses great symbolism during lectures to help us grasp concepts and always kept me engaged. Was very accessible outside of class. Great professor!

This has to be the best math teacher I've ever had. He's very honest about the material and does a fantastic job explaining it. He responds to emails within the hour, and even quicker the night before quizzes and exams. I would retake his class again if I had to because he made math easy for me when it's always been my least favorite subject!

Best professor ever. He formats his lecture notes very clearly - for each topic you can easily follow his examples and teaching. I definitely recommend him as a professor! If I could take his math class again, I would.
Great professor I missed 3 quizzes from my recitation and he let me take it with him during his own time.
