Amazing professor. He clearly explains math. He is funny and is super caring. He will hold zoom calls for exam and quiz review. He spends a lot of his outside time for the greater good for his students. Exams are hard.
Amazing experience with him. He is hilarious and makes content engaging. Always available to answer questions too, he does reviews constantly and will do individual help for anyone who asks.
good prof for 1131

Fantastic professor in general. If your struggling in the class just ask him for help and he will literally just set up meets with you to help you catch up. Has review sessions for midterms and 2 practice midterms for each one. Grades well. Put in the effort and you will be fine. Also has extra credit opportunities and curves.

Amit Vutha is genuinely a great professor and cares a lot about his students. He hosts exam review sessions that are very helpful, responds quickly to emails, and is easily accessible outside of class. The content of the class is challenging by nature, but he tries his best to help students.

Easily one of the best professor's at OSU. Genuinely cares for his students and cares about his job. The class material may not be the easiest thing in the world but Amit makes sure to help you the best he can. Would definitely recommend taking him. Without a doubt cares more about his students than anything else. Amazing person.
nice!!!
The most awesome professor I ever met!
Dr. Vutha is probably the best math teacher I've had, he actually cares that you do well, and his exam review sessions are super helpful. If you get a chance to take a class with him, do it.
Really great and always willing to help!

Professor Vutha is one of the most kind, compassionate, & caring professors at OSU. I HATE math. I've always struggled with it, and after taking a W in Math 1130 the semester before (with a different professor), he made the class so easy to understand. He remembers students and wants them to succeed. Amazing man with a huge heart!
I had him as a TA and he was really great at giving us extra resources and creating extra study sessions before the final. You can tell he really cares about his students and their sucess.

I wish I could give him a 6/5. He does such a good job of connecting with his students and explaining the concepts well. He is also super understanding and will put the student over absolutely everything except his own son. I would take him for every math class if I could
Amazing professor that integrates conciseness, analogies, and passion into his well-prepared lectures. Accessible outside of class and is understanding of his students.
I loved having him as a professor. Hes very fair and really cares about his students. I didnt do well in math until his class and I learned a lot from him.

Amit Vutha is a great professor. He really cares about his students success and is willing to work with you outside of class. He grades very well and takes into account all work. In math 2174 he did not assign homework, but gives worksheets with good practice problems that prepare you for exams. However, the quizzes and exams were weighted heavily.
he always explains materials clearly, and submits specific notes

Vutha is an amazing professor. He makes his lectures interesting and is extremely accessible outside of class. he made me actually LIKE math which is insane because I've never had a teacher who made a math class interesting. i love his class and hope to get more teachers like him. DEFINITELY choose his class if you can

This professor was the most organized, proficient, and aesthetically pleasing lecturer ever. His lectures are clear, concise, and coherent. I would highly advise this professor for this course. He gives many extra exercises to help prepare for the exams. The course overall is a bit of a tough one, but he makes it so much easier.

Dr. Vutha is the best! He goes above and beyond what exceptional professors would do by offering ample review sessions before exams, times outside of class to discuss material, and more helpful resources which is a game changer for a class like Business Calc. If you get to take Amit, count your blessings because he is a very big one!

Dr. Vutha is one of the best professors I have had here at OSU. He really cares about his students' success, and goes out of his way to help. He held many (optional) review sessions for quizzes and exams, and gave many opportunities for extra credit. This guy is a gem.

Dr. Vutha is incredible. He truly cares for his students and is very encouraging. His lectures are entertaining and he is always open to students. He was many opportunities for office hours and review sessions and is easily accessible. He is one of the best professors I have had by far.

I cannot say enough good things about Dr. Vutha! He is humorous, always willing to meet with students, has great & incredibly helpful lectures, and allows for a tough subject like Calc to be easily understood. He is the best prof I have ever had at OSU, and if you get him- count your blessings!

Best professor at Ohio State. If you ever need extra help, Amit is always willing to help. The course material is difficult, but he always does his best to help. He gives an ample amount of practice problems and review sessions. Follow his practice problems and the tests will be manageable, but calculus, regardless, is hard.

Professor Vutha makes math quite easy. His lectures keep you engaged and he devotes extra time on the weekends for review sessions where you can ask him to cover the more difficult concepts. By far the best math professor I've ever had. The math department needs to promote him.

Registered for calc expecting to end up with a B. The exceptional Dr. Vutha is the reason I have an A, a newfound interest in math, and much-developed skills. He breaks down the most complicated concepts, keeps you engaged, & gives you countless opportunities to improve. Abundant review sessions. Will tailor his help to your needs if you reach out.

Dr. Vutha is an amazing professor. He is very accessible outside lectures and genuinely cares about your success. Do the homework, utilize office hours to ask questions, and the class will go well, thanks to Dr. Vutha.

Amit has got to be my favorite professor thus far. He is incredibly caring and takes time to help each of his students. He goes above and beyond by offering extra homework or problems and even holding multiple review sessions. He truly cares that his students succeed. Explains difficult concepts very easily too.
GOAT

The best professor I will probably ever have. I personally had to change to P/NP, but if you do your work on and over time, you shouldn't have to. The class is hard, but Vutha makes it really easy to understand and he's very open and easy to access. He has reviews before every quiz and exam and is always willing to answer every question. Test heavy
Great lecturer and easy to follow notes. Simplifies complex material to make it easier to understand.

He was a very nice professor always ready to help his students. He genuinely cared about the well being of the students during this hard time and he always tried his best to simplify things down for students. Office hours are very helpful attend them.

Dr. Vutha has been one of the best professors I have ever had. The class is tough but Dr. Vutha does everything in his power to help you through it. He is very funny and personable. He holds review sessions before every quiz and exam and he is willing to meet with you anytime about any questions you have and explain them to you. Awesome dude!

Dr. Vutha is a professor that genuinely cares about each and every one of his students, and wants everyone to succeed. His lectures are very easy to understand, and he is a very clever and witty person. I would absolutely recommend him for this class.

Dr. Vutha is not only able to make a very difficult subject like calculus digestible, he will take his time to make sure every student understands what he is demonstrating. I took this course during COVID and every week, multiple times a week, Dr. Vutha would run a study session for any student to attend. He is very king and genuine.

This was my first semester at OSU, and I'm extremely confident that this will be the best professor I will ever have. He is very caring and wants his students to succeed. He has weekend review sessions before midterms, and review sessions before quizzes. You won't be left hanging if you put in effort. He's a GREAT professor and an amazing person!

Dr. Vutha is one of the best professors at OSU. He holds many review sessions outside of class and makes sure you are ready for every single weekly quiz and exam (every 3 weeks). Class is weighted 70% on the exams so be sure to do well. Final exam was tough but all other exams were quite easy.
Amit is an amazing professor and you can tell he wants his students to be successful. He knows what he's talking about and his lectures are very helpful so I recommend attending as many as you can.

Dr. Vutha is by far my favorite professor ever. He honestly cares about each and every student and wants them to succeed. The class is difficult due to the math department. A weekly quiz, homework, and five exams made up the course. Dr. Vutha does everything he can to prepare you for exams. We need more teachers like him. Take this course with him.

Absolutely amazing professor. You can tell he genuinely cares a lot about the success of his students; he holds many review sessions and is always open to help even in the middle of a lecture. His lectures are very easy to understand and actually quite interesting. He is an amazing person and teacher... 10/10 would recommend taking his class!

Because classes moved online the math dep. was very strict about time limits for quizzes and tests which heavily affected my grade. That being said, Dr. Vutha was amazing and did everything he could to make this semester easier. The notes he makes for his lectures are absolutely incredible and he is very funny. He replies fast and willingto help.

Very funny professor. He is very knowledgable and the notes he makes are very aesthetic. The notes themselves make you want to be good at calculus. The extra revision sessions are a great asset. Never leaves you hanging. Answers all questions in lectures even if youre interrupting the flow

Amit was a great guy. His lectures were extremely well done with plenty of example problems. He held a few (optional) review lectures outside of class time. More over for Calc 1156 using the online/MyLab resources really helped. Overall really nice guy who makes sure you understand the material one way or another :) 10/10 would take again!!

Professor Vutha is the best math teacher I've ever had in my life. He legitimitaly cares about students understanding the material and he holds review sessions where you can ask about anything and he explains it in full detail until you understand. I struggled with calculus in high school but now calc is one of my favorite subjects!

Dr. Vutha is a fantastic professor and he really helps you learn the material. In lecture he keeps the content interesting with some random facts/interesting one liners, and you can tell he genuinely cares about his students. Amit is a sweetheart as a person, and the course is the same content/less rigorous than the MATH 1151 course I've been told.

Dr. Vutha is, by far, the best math professor I have EVER had. He explains things very well and thoroughly, he is easily available outside of class to answer any questions, and he's funny, so it makes learning calculus bearable. Also, dare I say, kinda fun? If you are taking calc for the first time ever, DEFINITELY take it with Dr. Vutha!

So glad I had Vutha after I failed this course the previous semester. He explains the material very well, was easily accessible outside of lectures, and he truly cares about his students. Homeworks do include some harder questions that you won't be tested on.

It's really nice for me to have Professor Vutha for Calc 3. You all know that this course won't be easy. However, Dr. Vutha makes it relatively easier. Great lecturer with plenty of patience in explaining everything you wondered. I took the online version of this course. He's course definitely stands out among all the other online courses.
Great professor for calculus.

This was the first calculus class that I had ever taken so I was worried. However, Dr. Vutha made the work as easy as possible. He cares about his students and really wants everyone to succeed. He keeps lectures interesting with some light humor, he has his funny moments. I would recommend Dr. Vutha to anybody, he is a great professor.

Amit is so sweet and inspirational. He believes greatly in his students and wants them to do well; he is always readily available to help. Clearly very knowledgeable about the course material. 10/10 recommend.
He is a great person. One of my favorite teachers ever.

I have never really used office hours, but between my second and third midterm I did not go to a single lecture, so right before the third midterm, I attended office hours. Vutha went above and beyond to make sure I understood the material and does this for all his students. The content is very easy, and the tests are even easier.

Vutha is such an amazing professor and got me through so much my first semester at OSU. He will spend a lot of time working with you outside of the classroom and will bend over backwards to make sure that you really understand the material. His class is pretty straight forward. Do the homework and show up to lecture! 12/10 would recommend this man!
Dr. Vutha was hands down the best math professor I've ever had. He is always willing to provide extra help on his own time. He truly wants the best for his students.

It's college calc, so it won't be easy, but Amit is willing to move deadlines and is always available for office hours or at the very least an e-mail. He was funny and understanding and did a good job of explaining everything. Only reason I struggled was a poor TA. Plus he fought for us to have calculators on the exams, so.

For MATH1148, he is a great and organized professor. Guided notes are provided and he clearly moves through at a good pace. Don't miss lecture, quizzes are given every week, homework is due every week, and final exam is cumulative. He's a great professor and wants to help his students outside of class-time. Also he has the best dry humor ever.

I had him for recitation, and I could see how he would definitely be a better lecture prof. He seems pretty cool and has a dry sense of humor that makes him relatable, but can come across as pretty rude and condescending when you ask a question during class. I would leave recitation more confused than when i came bc his teaching can be confusing.
No complaints here. Great professor and extremely nice guy who conveys information clearly to students.
He is a Very helpful teacher. If you ask, he is aways willing to help you even on a Sunday afternoon. Gives clear , coherent and logic lectures.

Super great class. Professor Vutha lays it all out and makes its super easy to follow with tons of examples and a step by step procedure. He really cuts the fat out of teaching and gets to the point. He's not a very personable person, but he doesn't really need to be for this class. Tough because I don't like math, but a very good class to take

Prof Vutha is the reason I did well in this class. He was always available to meet if you sent him an e-mail, even outside of his regular office hours. His exam reviews were thorough and clear, and he was genuinely interested in helping us understand the material. I remember before the final he held an open study session that went until 2am.

Homework due online and a quiz every week. He has an accent but its not that bad to understand. The material is easy but sometimes he can make it confusing. He is very nice and helpful if you go to him one on one though. Tests are tough, make sure you do the practice midterms. I skipped lecture a lot but I took the class in high school so...
Personally went out of his way to offer me an extra study session when he saw my second midterm grade take a dip.

This guy is absolutely amazing. I wasn't even in his class, but Vutha subbed in once and I loved him so I attended his office hours. He treated me like a son. He spent hours upon hours tutoring me before every exam. One night, he opened up the math building and sat with us from 9PM-5AM to study for an exam.  Quality human being.

Great professor, he is always willing to meet with you and help. Also if you go to him with your midterms he'll walk you through them and might even give you points back! Make sure you get to know him, he is an amazing guy as well

Amit is one of the best math professors I have ever had, always willing to help and arrange office hours to help you, it was 1172 so it is NOT an easy class by any means but his teaching is wonderful and he is a great guy.

He is probably the most dedicated math prof at OSU. He is very easy to approach and made a hard class like Math 1172 doable. He is very knowledgeable and interested in what he does. Honestly he helped me change the way I look at math.

Very clear and organized lecturer. Nice and helpful. Midterms & finals are taken with other 1131 sessions. The lectures are pretty easy but the midterms can be challenging because they're only 50 min. You'll be fine if you go to Amit's lectures and attend recitations.
Its a calculus class, it's supposed to be tough. Three exams, one final and weekly homeworks and quizzes. Very smart guy and accommodating of any issues you have in class.
Very tough class, but the professor is good

Prof Sutherland is great and cracks jokes in class making the class engaging. Don't miss lecture or you will fall behind!! Three midterms and a final. Make sure to utilize the practice exams as they benefit a lot for the exams in the class!!
Great professor very prompt and helpful with any issues

Solid choice for 1148. I wasn't even in his section but attended his lectures because my friend was in his class. He's very thorough and his notes cover  all the tiny details that are hard to pick up on your own. His exam reviews are also excellent.

I felt he went very fast during the lecture. It was too rushed in my opinion. I also didn't understand his notes. He wrote all his notes by hand and sometimes didn't understand what he was writing. He was an okay professor.

Excellent teacher and not your average math professor. I am by no means a math person and was scared about this class. He keeps lectures lively, and his office hours are great as well to go work with other students in the class. 10/10 would take again!
Super smart guy and passionate teacher. He'll work with you if you put in the work and are serious about learning and doing well in the class.

Great professor! College Algebra is not easy but he made it a class that I looked forward to. The course moves fast and the quizzes can get tricky. Make sure you attend office hours and any review sessions for super useful feedback and tips.

His lectures are easy to follow along and organized. Everything that's done in class (notes/worksheets) are uploaded on carmen. Although lectures aren't required, go to lectures! His lectures and especially his review sessions are very helpful to prepare for the exams. He's easy to talk to and really helps you understand things you need help on.
I liked this professor, but he was kind of hard to read and it was hard for me to come to him with questions because I felt stupid.

The class was easy and this professor was very helpful! All of the notes taken in lecture were posted on Carmen which made it super easy to follow along. He stops and answers questions when needed. Overall recommend!

He is a truly wonderful and caring professor who is passionate about teaching. He said that 1148 is his favorite class to teach because of the different math backgrounds student come from, and you can tell. He color codes the math problems and breaks them down into super simple steps. I really loved his class and cannot recommend him enough!
Hes pretty chill and nice! He also is really good at responding to emails and questions!

The set up of this class is awful. The professor does not make, see, grade the exams. The 4 exams make up nearly the entire grade. Quizzes & MMLs have no impact on grades. My TA was great and the only reason my class survived the course. James was quite rude and very unapproachable to students. People refused to meet with him knowing it didn't help

This class is difficult, and you really need to go to as many office hours as you can to get a good grade. As a TA, James was great!! He expected a lot out of us, but was encouraging for the most part. He took a bit of time to grade our weekly homeworks, but he was always very busy. Overall, a great guy and very helpful.
Great math teacher. Explains really well, and makes sure that the classs success is his priority.

James was a great TA! He was always willing to help us with our homework (we needed a lot of help lol). Sometimes he didnt know the answers to stuff, but he always tried his best. He is a tough grader when he grades the homework, so make sure that you are extremely detailed in your responses.

James was the bomb! The class can be difficult but it's an appropriate amount of work for a five credit hour class, you'll get out of it what you put in. James is committed to helping his students who reach out to him and is very available for questions and help. He's also very quirky and fun!
He's a good boy.

James is great! He's really responsive when it comes to email and he's an excellent TA. He goes over the material in detail, he works hard to ensure that everyone understands, and he's a very forgiving grader. I knew someone who had a different TA for math1148 and she was scoring lower on tests than I was despite answering the same way.
Horrible professor who puts in no effort to help students, and extremely tough and unreasonable grader. AVOID AT ALL COSTS I don't know how he is still teaching.

Some weeks he would assign six hours of lecture videos that are just him reading the textbook to you. I stopped watching them after a while and just read the book to do the homework. Practice exams were either extremely helpful or nearly useless, exams usually cover concepts much more complicated than any homework problems.
Homeworks are a little length but easy grader. You are given the entire day to work on exams and exams are easy.

12 assignments, 2 exams and 10 hw.  Exams are much harder than homework and use different terminology than the lectures and homework. The "lectures" are practically just the prof reading the book to you. Office hours are always the day after hw is due, discouraging hw questions I assume.

His office hours are random so he's hard to access. His lectures are prerecorded from years ago with a bad mic, the book is more helpful. The test questions he gives are higher level concepts that the homework doesn't tackle. He grades pretty softly, the test averages were always mid 80s but I left feeling unsatisfied with how little I learned.
My grade went up when I stopped watching his lectures. Not impossible to succeed with, but isn't a professor's job to teach? Unclear grading guidelines for exams, too.

If you have no experience with a proof based math class, this will be tough for you. Take Math 3345 first to get more comfortable with it. I pretty much never watched the lectures and read only from the textbook and found the hws/exams easy. The homeworks can get very long and tedious, but only 2 or so q's are graded.
Very knowledgeable, and helpful to students when they need help.

If you want to learn, don't take him he does not teach. If you want a good grade, he is a total unknown since he has a random curve it seems so you are at his mercy. Honestly don't know how they let this guy keep teaching. Literally (not figuratively) an 8th grader using resources on the internet could do a better job.

He does not do a thing. Avoid at all costs. The department has admitted that the course is a mess. The professor puts in no effort; the textbook does all the teaching. Very little partial credit and very particular. The first exam was mostly problems of a type we had no exposure to. The worst and most apathetic professor I've ever seen.
The exams are weighted a lot and the final was really hard. He also rarely responded to emails and never engaged with our class.

No lecture online after transforming to online courses. Ask as to study on our own. Don't do it. There is no grading scale on why you earn such a grade at the end. Everything seems to be assigned on your own, and you will obtain a random grade.

I can tell that professor Tseng is a very knowledgeable mathematics guy. However, probably he may want to put more effort into teaching in the future since it seemed like he did not really care about his students.

I had her for both 2173 and 1172 math courses. I liked her teaching style and how she explained hard topics. She also gave a lot of resources that were very helpful like videos, animations to visualize hard concepts and had a lot of opportunities to get points back. Her office hours are where I learned the most and she was very helpful overall.

She was very helpful for questions and easy to talk to. Lectures aren't required since she posts the material afterwards and she does write fast in lectures. I had a family emergency and wasn't able to take the 2nd Midterm, and she was able to exempt me from it and help with any questions I had for the final.

I would give her a 5 compared to the other professor in 1149, but in reality Professor Sharma is good. 1149 can be difficult, but she is super helpful. Be mindful in her lectures, she WILL call you out for ignorance and distractions. She can go fast in the lectures, however, so I recommend gradually doing the homework to fully process the subject.
Struggled with explaining content during lecture, mostly test/quiz heavy class, much better learning when you visit her office hours and ask for help there

Bad at explaining the content in lectures, the only reason I was able to succeed was by doing practice problems in McGraw Hill. She expects people to respond to questions in a full lecture hall after not explaining and gets irritated when no one answers.
Not helpful and does not explain material well.

1172 is a challenging course, but I think Vaishavi did a good job teaching alongside Jim. Don't be like me and skip going to lectures because if you do, your grades will tank. 1172 requires you to tryhard, but if you do, Vaishavi should be there to help you do good.
Make sure you are doing assignments to fully understand course work!`

Dr. Sharma is a good teacher. Math 1172 is a hard class regardless of who the professor is. She utilizes a reverse classroom philosophy. Students are encouraged to watch lecture videos/read textbook before coming to class as lectures are example problems. I would recommend going to the free tutoring at the MSLC and utilizing all resources.

Professor Sharma is very kind and wants you to succeed. She is available outside of class if you need help. The class is very test heavy but you can revise midterms to get points back. Professor Sharma gave great examples in class but sometimes the lectures felt pointless because of the flipped classroom model where we watch lecture videos at home

Vaishavi gives good practice problems and work-throughs in class, but other than that lectures aren't super helpful. She expects all students to learn the material for that class beforehand, which makes going to lecture feel pointless sometimes. As for the class, it was unorganized and grades werent given back until much later than they tell you.
Does not spoon feed.
Overall she is a great professor.  I found Calculus to be very challenging but I found our classroom instruction extremely valuable.
he's funny, relaxed, and engaging. it's comfortable asking him questions and cares about helping students.
Nik is a funny guy and is very laid back but he speeds through practice problems and is not very good at explaining topics. Kind of expects you to already be great at calc before taking the class.

I haven't even finished this course yet but I wanna come on here and say avoid Nik as a TA for math 1151. He lectures in recitation like you are math prodigy in calc. To me that is the worst teacher you can have especially if you are not very great math. He also doesn't answer your questions properly and instead leaves you hanging.
This man is so nonchalant and constantly joking. Lectures aren't mandatory but definitely go or you'll be lost at the next lecture. There are extra credit assignments, too.

Nik is awesome! He doesn't take attendence but you will probably fall behind if you miss a lecture or two, so I'd recommend being there as often as possible. I would take 20 more classes with him if I could.

The most boring lecturer I have ever had to endure. Writes on the chalkboard for the entire time with little to no explanantions. Does not teach how to use financial calculator, which would make the class much easier. If you want an A and/or to pass Exam FM, take any other professor!
Even though the material is hard to grasp at first, he makes it really easy to learn. Definitely would take his class again if possible!!!

Prof Poole is a good lecturer, he writes clean notes that are easy to follow and lots of good examples. I dont care for the online homework, and the class was generally fairly tough. That said, he has good online material to help you prepare and he is a good professor. Can be boring, but its hard to make this material exiting.

Prof. Poole always came to class very prepared. He gave lectures while writing incredibly detailed notes. While the lectures were very informational, they were also very monotonous making it a bit boring. The HW, tests, and quizzes are all pretty simple as long as you stay up to date. Tests questions were exactly like the quizzes.

Homework does not reflect quizzes or exams. Only one try for homework and are not shown correct answer immediately. (No examples) I found his lectures somewhat confusing, I bought the coaching actuaries FM exam prep. It helped some but I felt I did not correlate with the class enough so I had to drop.
Most monotonous professor Ive ever had. Hate his demeanor. Harder than other section with different professor.

Dr. Poole was in my opinion a very good professor. If you stay up to date with the hw and show up to class, then the quizzes and exams aren't bad at all. His tests basically focus on the lecture notes and the exam reviews. I worked hard and had no problem doing well. Dan is also a pretty nice guy and lowkey pretty funny. These reviews are too harsh

If you want to learn something and willing to do some practice for an A, he is your best choice, his lecture is all you need to know,well explained and helpful example, unlike other professor in OSU math department, at least in his class, you work hard you get a good grade, and that is a rare thing in OSU higher level math class
His lecture style is beyond boring (lots of writing paragraphs and long examples on the board), but he actually knows the concepts and explains them decently well. His tests are very fair.

Might be the worst professor I have ever had. There was no partial credit, no grey area when it comes to doing a problem with him. If you have any doubt in your mind about a problem with him chances are its going to be wrong. I could say with confidence that if he is your only option,wait a semester. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. VERY DIFFICULT AND NO HELP

Poole is very slightly above average at explaining everything but not the best. You will most likely understand what is going on but not have a true grasp of why everything works like some professors can give you. His exams aren't too hard but the quizzes usually require a lot of algebra which can make it easy to make mistakes.
Did not explain the material well at all.  Left students more confused after the lecture than they were before.

Taking this class with Dan Poole was an absolute nightmare. He is pretty good at lecturing but when he is he uses the most abstract examples to explain the material. Often he would be going to fast for me to comprehend which was really discouraging. The exams were insanely hard. This was worst experience i have had in College.

His lectures are exhausting and he writes on a chalkboard and talks at the same time so it's a bit hard to take notes and retain the information. He is pretty helpful if you attend his office hours. However, he makes calculus harder than it needs to  be. AVOID HIM!!
Easy to understand. Lectures were explained in a clear manner.

Poole was an awesome calc professor. He explains material well, and he was super helpful for me in office hours. All of his examples came from the book, which was fine with me especially if you need to skip class. Lecturerecitation examples and homework were much harder than the actual exams, so if you understand those you will be good to go.

Good professor, talks about what he needs to in lecture. If you go to lecture, listen and take notes you will know all you need to know for the exams, especially if you follow along with the example problems. If you have any background in calculus the class will almost be boring for you.

He's kind of awkward but very nice and extremely helpful if you ask him direct questions. Lecture is pretty good, he mostly regurgitates material from the book but some of the examples and explanations are quite helpful. My biggest critique: not very available. Office hours on monday and friday 10-11? come on man.
Easy A. He is cute!

Honestly, he just takes the notes from the books. However, he does do some examples which are helpful. Lectures are long and boring but he actually gives good information, he is just boring. If you need help, he can explain concepts pretty well and go over practice problems with you.

Took college algebra and trigpre-calc. at OSU and got very high A's in both. Then, I enrolled in Poole's class and had to withdraw to save my GPA. I took away nothing from the lectures, and spent more time trying to figure out how he got from one step to the next than actually listening. He knows the material well,but doesn't convey it effectively
Very boring and doesn't engage the class, find myself going to other lecturers because he is so boring and I feel like I don't learn anything
Took everything from his lecture straight from the book but didn't even explain it as well as the book. Might as well not go to class because the lectures are usually useless.
Lecture is very clear and helpful. Most of the time I don't even need to go to recitation.
Very good professor. Explains material clearly and is always willing to answer questions. Exams were easy too. I highly recommend trying to get him as a professor
He was very helpful in recitation. Was willing to go over any problem you needed. Ask any questions you need.
He was my T.A. For math 151 and he explained things so well, I learned more from him in recitation than I did in lecture for sure.  Get this T.A. if you can!
He is a GREAT TA! He isnt clear 100% of the time, but will work with you to let you know what he expects from you. He is also a TA for Math.

She structures her lectures very well, and the exams are largely based off of the in class examples and homework (a lot of the questions on exams are hw questions). She also allowed a cheat sheet for all exams which made life much easier. She also does make mistakes during lectures frequently, but corrects them. Good teacher and good lectures

Professor Costin's class was strange.  You had lecture 5 days a week, where recitation is just another lecture.  This class is busy, and the homeworks become difficult as you progress in the course.  You can not use the textbook to help you because she copies her lecture exactly from the textbook.  Not a bad calc class if you have a light schedule.

This course consists of basically 5 lectures a week covering huge swaths of material at a time, basically the course covers all of calc 1 and the first half of calc 2. Thankfully she gives fantastic lectures so the textbook is mostly only used for getting the hw problems. While its fairly easy to get an A, the content is still very difficult.

In-person: Her lectures are great and she wants to help students during class and office hours. Homeworks can be difficult, but understanding them helps for tests since tests are similar to homework/notes. Online: No recorded lecture (read from book), limited office hour, a lot more work given. You are essentially learning from the book.

Rodica is so sweet & brilliant! Although she is a bit unclear in her explanations in lecture at times, she was always available for help outside of class. And she is super patient with you! i was at office hours 2-3 times per week & she was always happy to see me. never annoyed. Tests are actually easier than you'd expect and she is a easy grader.
She cares a lot about her students but she is not effective at explaining the material. She makes a non-trivial number of mistakes during lectures which can throw you off.

Even though she crazy, but Dr. Costin is real nice. She willing to help if you holla at her during her office hours. Real helpful, even though class was aigh. But if you want A in your grad classes, take Costin!

Very helpfull instructor. Explains linear mappings, finite dimensional vector spaces very well. Always answers e-mails, i have never seen an instructor more helpful than R. Costin. I recommend Dr. Costin to all students studying dynamical systems, her specialty is differential equations.
Very nice lady, but very poor lecturer. Didn't follow what the class was suppose to be. Class is easy but you'll get more out of it if you take it with someone else (and you wont be bored to tears)
She knows maths but she is quite boring. And her notes are not too great either.

I really liked her as a professor.  She explained stuff well and her exams were fair.  She goes pretty slow too and her lectures are well organized, so you can follow easily and understand what's going on.

Rodica is a great teacher. She is super excited about math and knows what she's talking about. Her midterms stayed true to the review sessions she gave in class.  Office hours weren't the greatest--I felt like we were annoying her more than getting help. Other than that, I would recommend her!
The class itself was pretty boring but Rodica was a very relaxed teacher, and made class casual. The midterms were take home, and therefore almost guaranteed As. Do your homework, though!!

Rodica is one of the best math teachers I have every had.  She knows what shes doing and class was always fun because we could joke around with her. Theres homework everynight and if you want an A in the class you better do your homework that night. DO NOT WAIT UNTIL THE WEEKEND TO TO HOMEWORK! Exams are easy if you pay attention. Good luck!

Rodica is a decent teacher.  She goes over the homework everyday in class and does most problems you don't understand on the board. The midterms are relatively easy and there are lots of bonus points. The only thing I didn't like about the class is that I felt I wasn't really learning the concepts because they weren't explained very clearly.

Convinced me not to take the H160 series.  She's interested in the subject, but it doesn't transfer to you.  Ridiculously easy midterms (over 100% on all three), no quizzes, easy class, but boring.  Take to pad the grade, not to learn anything.
No Comments
No Comments

Very nice but not a very good teacher. Sometimes messes up with her english. Goes over all homework on fridays. Wait until the end to decide if you want to write down the notes, most are just useless.

Ogle's class is quite challenging, but unstuckstudy can be a helpful study tool alongside the textbook. Stay engaged, as his lectures can be dry. Expect tough exams, but the content is manageable with consistent effort.
Not much to say, I think all of these reviews speak for themselves. Avoid at all costs

Ogle knows the material extremely well and does an excellent job explaining it. Apparently his online lectures are low quality so I recommend in-person. He's very technical, but his class is easier than others I've seen. I also recommend finding intuitive explanations online. Also very test heavy but they were at least take-home exams in my case

His lectures consisted of reading directly off slides pulled directly from his unofficial online textbook full of errors. Lots of T/F questions on hw & exams were graded all or nothing. Very cruel in office hours & berated students all the time. I performed better in class after ditching his lecture videos & learning the content on my own.

Ogle's lectures were terrible. He read directly off the slides and did not provide any examples of concepts. The midterm and final were worth 25 and 50% of the grade and he graded them very harsh. True/false questions are worth lots of points, they are extremely confusing and no partial credit is given. Do not take this class if you can avoid it.

Worst teacher I have ever had at Ohio State. Horrible lectures where you can barely understand what he is saying. Homework and exams are graded very hard and the small amount of feedback you do get takes about a month for them to submit. Also only about half of the problems you do for homework actually get graded.

Wouldn't recommend, teaches in a very theoretical way that is difficult to understand and doesn't do many examples. I was teaching myself and homework felt like a scavenger hunt in the textbook he wrote himself. Has office hours, but isn't helpful. Grading on homework and midterms is harsh and unhelpful and the final is worth 50% of your grade.

The professor gave short lectures with a variety of sound issues that were difficult to understand. He used his own textbook which had syntax errors that prevented a variety of figures from appearing. The midterm and final were absurdly long. Only about a quarter of homework problems are graded and those didn't tell you what you did wrong.

If you're going to take this class with Ogle I recommend getting a different textbook than the one he wrote and provided. Funny guy, but terrible lectures that don't help with the homework. Says that as long as you do all the assignments and exams you'll be fine 2 pass. Had a 65 that he rounded to a C-, but I have to retake because I needed a C.
Don't take with Ogle, online or in person.
A perfect example of the minimum effort put into teaching a class. Basically what others said, don't take this class because it's online. It is worse than you think.

His section of this class uses a textbook that he wrote, so it is just as confusing as the notes. He explains everything in a very technical way that you need a Ph.D in Linear Algebra to understand. He makes you feel bad for getting questions wrong in class and is a very strict grader. Final exam is worth 50% of your grade

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS, SERIOUSLY! I read reviews and said, eh, how bad can it be? This class is impossible to do well in and I even with tutoring. I do well on homework, but I bombed the midterm and went from an A to a C. Want to know why I bombed the exam? Three true of false questions, graded with no mercy and also no feedback. Horrible prof.

This guy's a real stick in the bum. Grades no more than half your homework only to draw giant X's across your homework. Exams lengthy and time-consuming that, whilst at home over multiple days, requires you to dedicate a stupid amount of time. Lectures suck too. Horrible.

Worst Professor Ive ever had! His class consists of him ignoring all of your Carmen messages and emails, only posting lectures at either the afternoon or at 10pm on a Friday night, grading 2/6 problems on homework assignments that take hours, and not helping with homework for office hours. His lectures are just reading slides and doing no examples

Horrible lecturer who just reads from the textbook and does no helpful example problems. The other lectures he links to on youtube are better, but don't cover everything in the class. The homeworks and exams are extremely time consuming and impossible to get good grades on because of a ton of true/false questions that are graded very harshly.

Listen to everyone else: dont take this class with him. 4 HWs that take hours to do and only 25% of it is graded with no feedback. Lectures are read straight off the terrible ximera book he wrote. No examples at all. Office hours are little to no help. Similar HW problems cant be found anywhere. Even other textbooks dont help how hard this is

Avoid Professor Ogle AT ALL COSTS! His class is insanely difficult because his lectures are not helpful at all. He does not work through practice problems during lecture, but expects us to be able to solve hw problems without any help. He refuses to help with hw problems even when you show up to office hours at 6PM on a Friday - I do NOT recommend!

This was the worst class I have ever taken and the only class I have ever failed. The professor didn't care to help at all, he graded 5/20 questions on every homework with no partial credit, and the final exam, which he forgot to post, was worth half of the final grade. Can't recommend that you don't take this class enough. Ogle is the worst.

I took his class online during the spring 2021 term and his class was easily the worst I've taken at OSU. It seemed like it was his goal to interact with students as little as humanly possible. His textbook is just essentially a list of theorems and the homeworks are scavengers hunts from the book. On top of that he's the toughest grader I've had.

If I could get him a negative rating I would. This is everything I've endured this semester: 1) A ridiculous amount of true false questions for no partial credit 2) Doesn't explain what you miss on homework 3) Literally forgot to post our FINAL EXAM 4) 1 midterm with a d average 5) Final exam took 3 days to complete and was 50% of my grade

Probably the worst professor I've ever had (at least in an online class.) He barely even teaches, preferring to just read the textbook word for word in a monotone while barely explaining any of the concepts or definitions he comes across. Homeworks are too complex, and there's barely any partial credit. Also, the final is worth half the grade.

Honestly, classes were a drag. Your only available resource to learn is either the book, or the audio version of the book in which the professor reads word for word from slides directly ripped from the book. If you were hoping to get feedback on your homework, you better hope its one of the questions he grades and doesnt write ???. Dont take.

The worst online class I've ever taken. "Lectures" consisted of reading slides dragged straight from the textbook. He never does any examples that use actual numbers and each lecture was only about 15 minutes so it's not like he didn't have time. Grading was rough and no feedback was given. I learned more from Google and StackExchange than class

I took his class during the summer. You had to finish 20 written questions in each homework and only 5 questions would be randomly selected to grade. On the midterm or final exam, a T/F problem has the same point with a handwritten question including 5 small questions. which means if you got wrong with all T/F problems, you may lose the exam.

The lectures for this class are simply the prof reading the book. The book was awful, sometimes words essential for understanding were redacted or blocked by a yellow box? Absolutely no partial credit. No explanation for the grade you receive. Very very few points in the class overall. Rude in office hours. Seems not to have read the book at all.
He does not try. Drop this class and beg to take it with someone else.

Not good at teaching. His textbook is very dry and difficult to understand. Lectures are just the textbook read in a infuriatingly monotone voice. Focuses far too much on abstract, making it difficult to learn. Final had material that we had never actually worked on before, only read briefly. Feel like I didnt learn anything about linear algebra.

Everything is messed up! You get no good resource for learning linear algebra. The recorded lectures are just him reading the textbook on Ximera. Gradings rubrics are unclear. For Homework, they only graded random questions rather than grading every problems. DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE is the best choice.
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS AT ALL!!
the lecture is not helpful, you need to use the textbook

Bad, everything was so bad. There was no clear communication throughout the entire course. Grades rolled in weeks later, which was nice since we received no instructor responses for the majority of the semester. The lectures were so bad. He literally read the textbook word for word, and there were little to no examples in a MATH class. Do not take

This man is very unorganized, says he will upload a lecture one night then finally get around to us 4 days later. Day of the mid term exam, says he will upload it this evening. The man doesnt upload it till almost midnight EST. The finally exam had material that were not covered by his horrible lectures or the lectures he linked on YouTube

Drop any class you have with this prof. The lectures were online and he read straight off of his PowerPoint which was all theory with 0 concrete examples. Get ready to learn everything in your own as half the time he doesnt even upload the lectures and you have to beg him to teach the class. Exams are tough, homeworks take 5-10 hours to complete

Homework is due once a week, but they are pretty long problems. He doesnt even record his own lectures. He takes someone elses YouTube videos and posts them to a platform that we access to do this class. The YouTube dude isnt that great of a teacher (he basically teaches Ogles online class).

This class is for the kind of person who learns better by learning how to do things on their own. The textbook is hard to understand and the only video lectures he posts are of another professor that don't line up with the class. The info is easy enough to find online though and the exam questions are much easier than the homework questions.

Let me start by saying that I took this class in person rather than online. While his online class is rather infamous (avoid it), I'd say that he is an excellent lecturer in person. He can be a little mean sometimes but students that participate in the in-class discussions (i.e. he calls on students randomly and frequently) actually learn a lot.

He shouldn't "teach" an online class if he doesn't feel like actually teaching it. All he did was give us videos by some random guy from another school which didn't relate to the topics we were learning at all and give us the link to the textbook (which he wrote himself and has very few examples and is extremely difficult to understand).
Not the best teacher but not the worst either. He can have an interesting sense of humor if you get to know him. Put in some effort and you'll do fine.

I took Dr. Ogle's online class for 2568 (Linear algebra). My problems with this class: -Method of teaching is 1.) watch some videos from another prof 2.) read the textbook then 3.) do the homework. Literally did not give us any other resources -This guy wrote the textbook and it's awful. Impossible to learn from -Told me to teach myself everything

He is an old school professor. He never engaged the online class except reviewing the homework and exam. He use some lecture videos from YouTube. He does have math talent, I just feel he is poor at teaching.

The online textbook was very complex, had little relevance to the material, and had few examples. He also did not teach, but rather posted online lectures from a random lecturer that did not line up with the course. Only communication was though piazza, where he would respond very late and post homework very late. No feedback on homework or exams.

So he had an online textbook for this class with no examples, didn't point out what you did wrong on homework, only what you missed. There were online lectures from another random professor from a different school that barely lined up with the textbook or the order of the homework. Would not take his online class again.

Honestly speaking, if you don't have a solid mathematics standard like a graduate student or upperclass mathematics major student, you might find his lecture and textbook to be super-tough and hard to understand. Even if you are a math major student, you might not want to choose his class.

This class itself is awful and the material is entirely up to the professor, but if you can keep up with what is being said in lectures and meet with him a couple times to go over HW, you might actually learn something, which cannot be said for most professors in this course.

honestly i have never struggled in math before. taking this class as a freshman has ripped me apart and is the hardest thing ive taken. i am confused all the time and feel like he doesnt explain anything well at all. i would not recommend this professor at all.

He has great lectures where he clearly identifies how problems are solved from the beginning, and gives good example problems that will help you with homework and tests. The homework is heavy and very long but it helps you learn the material. Tests are very straightforward - he gives you review problem that will help you do well.

I had him for 2568. Tough class, even tougher grader. However, I found that even though he wasn't the nicest professor, he pushed me to be better. He emphasizes knowing your definitions, which is crucial for beginners in proofs. His lectures are cool. Good stories, really insightful. This professor changed the way I think about a lot of things.
Tons of homework. Tough exams. No curve.
Tough grader who did not willing to give partial credit!! DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR'S CLASS

I can tell that he professor is very intelligent, but he is kind of old school. There are a lot of homework, but you should expect that for a math course. The exam is not tough, and the grader is cool, but the average is a low 60. The lecture is not that useful, and you will definitely need to read the book. Otherwise you will not get the concept.

He has to be the most condescending professor I've ever had. He will interrupt you when you're trying to ask questions, and always has to be the loudest. He thinks you should just "get it" right away, it should be easy, when in fact he's just blabbering straight theory at you the whole class, and he wonders why no one gets it. NOT RECOMMENDED!

This teacher totally have no idea how to arrange the homework and test. I took his math2568 in Summer and we have to do at least 30 problems per week and we even have to hand in it in midterm week. The exam was not too hard but it's super time-consuming. He talked a lot of theories in the class but get lot of impossible matrix  transform problem .

This Teacher is not someone you should take if you are a student that depends on lectures. If you are good at reading the book and learning then its best not to attend class as he is extremely confusing and goes off-topic quite often. Overall he doesn't care about his students grades, and best if you take another teacher.

This class was the bane of my existence.  I was a math major at the time (haha) and to be honest I learned a ton of great stuff but and am thankful I took it but the homework is absurd in difficulty and time consumption.  The teacher is brilliant and does try to share his knowledge but he's not very good at actually teaching and helping the student

Crichton lacks respect for students and the teaching process in general. He will boil in frustration when you struggle. He will blame you for your bad note taking, attendance, heritage, ignorance, etc. At no point will it occur to him that he is a bad teacher.  Crichton, if you are reading this, please consider another profession.

The course is tough but he makes the class harder than it needs to be. He moved extremely fast through the material and most lectures were confusing. Would often show up 30 or more minutes late to his office hours, and even then those weren't very helpful. He once yelled at me for not knowing something I had never seen before. Don't take him.

2 weeks in and I dropped it as fast as I could. He will never answer your email- so don't even try ask him about office hours. When you finally get to office hours he tries to rush you out of there asap. Lastly, if you're a girl- good luck! Get ready to be ignored & undervalued compared to the rest of the boys in your class. Find a different prof!

If you take his summer Linear Algebra class, you WILL learn the material. His lectures are very participatory in that he expects students to be able to complete his sentences. Many times it's easy to do if you're paying attention. Sometimes not. His lectures are like having a textbook read aloud. He is very precise and specific. He's good but hard.

TERRIBLE TEACHER. DOES MORE DEFINITIONS THAN EXAMPLES IN CLASS. TALKS RANDOMLY MORE THAN HE TEACHES. ASSIGNS A BUNCH OF HOMEWORK BOOK PROBLEMS BUT ONLY GRADES 4 QUESTIONS PER HOMEWORK. EXAMS ARE IMPOSSIBLE. HE BARELY CURVES FINAL GRADES. OFFICE HOURS ARE USELESS, BECAUSE HE MAKES THE MATERIAL EVEN MORE CONFUSING. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS !!!!

SWITCH OUT OF HIS CLASS AT ALL COSTS IF YOU CAN. this guy is the absolute worst! This class is hard enough without him being an awful professor. Time consuming/impossible HW's and boring abstract lectures that leave you more confused then you were. Take someone else if you want your sanity.

Awful professor. Gives you a condescending look for every question you ask or wrong answer you give in class. Learned nothing in lecture, had to rely completely on the book and homeworks to learn the material.
Absolutely horrid. He assumes you know the material very well and does not explain all of the steps he takes. He is also very boring and monotoned.
Lectures were very boring and difficult to keep attention during. Sometimes lectures were useful, but usually he covered only the easiest of the material that most of the class already knew.

Continuously rambles through class, with a monotone demeanor. Tries to lighten up class with dry humor and overcomplicated math puns. Does a poor job of relaying examples to students and continuously goes against his own grading scale. I highly advise you not to take Dr. Ogle's class.

Fast paced (summer) class. It get really tough if you get even a day behind, but if something's not making sense he's able to explain it in a different way that it'll make sense to you either after class or in office hours (someone's always at his office hours). The grader's cool, too (though I don't know if this changes every term).
He always seemed annoyed with students. He didn't seem to handle questions well and was unhelpful preparing for exams. His version of review is basically reading the text book to the class.
Very monotone. He is an OK lecturer and tries to inspire class participation, but many of his explanations in lecture are abstract versus concrete examples.

He has a very dry sense of humor but is actually extremely funny.  Once you get used to how he teaches you will find the class very easy.  He doesn't show much emotion but he loves mathematics.  If you saw him outside of the classroom and didn't know him you would think he was mad at the world. Good teacher and the tests are exactly how he teaches.

Lecture is completely useless. Go to recitation, write down all the practice problems, do the odds in the back of each section you learn, get help with ones you can't figure out from your recitation teacher, and you will ace every midterm. I guarantee if you put the effort in, you'll do great. Really not a difficult class, way overrated.
Lectures were nearly pointless and I learned very little from them. Strongly recommend doing practice problems. Midterms are very difficult, but department makes them so he really can't be blamed.

Only uses theorems and variables to teach his class. Gives really easy examples during lecture and puts the most difficult ones on the exam, would not recommend taking him unless you have a lot of experience in calculus already
He's the realist og I know
Very difficult but you will really understand linear algebra if you can keep up.
He was very helpful if you went to his office hours. Also his classes encouraged participation, which in a math course, is very rare.

Some exams were impossible for me because I had never taken calculus and it didn't click until halfway into the course(retook it and got a B because I never went to class because I thought I knew the material already)Departmental exam difficulty wasn't his fault, but him showing up in the last 5 minutes of his office hours just to shirk me off was.

He really knows his stuff but this class is super hard esp because of the midterms and final.  Do the hw and ask as many questions as you can. if you dont procrastinate too much then you should walk out with a B or so.
A really nice professor! I love his lecture. he is so smart and lecture was very informative.

The only good thing about his lecture was that it will put you to sleep. He uses big words and tries to make himself sound smart, rather than teach. I went to him for help once and he made me feel like an idiot. It is possible to do decent in his class if you took Calculus in high school but I would NOT RECOMMEND this guy at all.
Doesn't give a lot of examples in class. Monotonous voice. I had to rely on my TA A LOT.
does not teach well only uses theorems and definitions to teach however does not back it up with examples. find another teacher if you can prepare to fail final exam
His lecture does match with his extremely difficult exam!!!

He's an interesting teacher. Interesting in the way that I cannot describe him. He does have some unfair grading (i.e. little partial credit on exams) and his lecture is hard to follow. It is a bunch of words, theorems, and definitions. But overall, it isn't too terrible, if you have a good TA.
He gives alot of words and not alot of examples. He is an alright professor. If you can change the way you learn math, he'd be a great professor.
Awful

This professor is just so-so. His writing on the board makes me hard to identify. His class is kind of boring, but he sometimes gets a little funny too.(Just A LITTLE!) So I suggest you that if you don't want to go to his class, just read the book and maybe you can get an A(MAYBE!).

Took him in the summer for 571. Very, very difficult class. Moved extremely quickly. Graded very strict. Little partial credit on exams. The pace of the class made it considerably more difficult than it should have been, and it was not helped by his teaching style.
This professor makes Linear "Algebra" more complicated than it needs to be and goes over the materials too fast. I won't recommend taking him.

This is the most difficult math class I have ever taken.  The exams are not difficult, however there is not enough time to solve every question and then check your answers.  Never say "like", it is sandpaper to his ears.

Assigns a lot of homework.  Tests are tough.  However, he explains topics very well.  He's very "to the point".  Overall, he's a good teacher.  Do the homework, and study hard for tests and you'll be fine.

Clear and was able to explain topics well. Also very boring and tests were tough. Doesn't do very many examples so unless you have a good TA (I didn't) you'll be teaching yourself a lot of the material.
VERY hard exams.....class averages were usually around a 50...sometimes lower, one time higher... Unfair for the most part (coming from a student who had a 4.1 in high school)
Very good teacher.  Good at explaining all topics.  Overall a very smart guy.  I would definitely suggest him.

Difficult but fair professor.  I'm a fairly good student and I got a B, but I learned a ton of linear algebra.  Uses notation different than the book, so attendance is pretty critical.  As commented, earlier tests are about speed the final is very cumulative.  Tests were true to the (long) homeworks.  No major surprises.
Lots of examples and good explaination....tests were hard though

I thought this class was easy. He gave bonus exercises, which really helped a lot. Even with that, there was still a big curve. The only thing that sucked was that his tests usually had one question that involved definitions.

He's good. Very clear and _professional_. One problem is that his explanations become complicated for the sake of clarity. Somewhat dubious relation to engineering after the first chapter, but the class is still very interesting. Homework assignments are long, especially in the beginning, and exams are a time crunch. Very difficult, but good class.

he does not explain anything at a student's level of understanding. Very intelligent but do NOT take him especially if you are taking calculus for the first time. He wastes time going into irrelevent details and by no means prepares students for the standardized final.

Tough Teacher.  Definitely knows what he is teaching, has an incredible ability to reason through extremely complicated concepts.  If you go to class and really try and learn what he is saying, the class will be fine.  That being said, probably better off with another teacher.  Ogle is pretty tough.
Late to Class, assigned overzealous amounts of homework combined with a lack of teaching makes him the worst teacher I have ever seen. Avoid taking his class at all costs.
Boring, Late to Class, ridiculous amounts of homework.40 problems a week from 5 sections, thats at least 1 section a night, thanks for wasting every waking moment of my free time.
Very bad teacher ! Please dont take him....he's not helpful and takes pleasure in failing students.
Decent teacher, teaches alot of theories, and little examples.  Test are rather simple.  Very monotonic in his lectures.

He often spoke over our heads and seemed to take pleasure in doing so. Most of us got 5's on the AP Calc class but you wouldn't know it by our grades. He was available to "answer" questions,but made the material more confusing. He knows that the class is really difficult, so as long as you get at least 50%. you'l probably escape with a C.

I had a mixed experience. I wasn't really a fan of him originally because the class is so hard and he is sometimes confusing.  What's good about him though is that he really does want his students to succeed.  If you email him asking for help, he will be very good about helping in class or his office hours.  He understands that  the class is hard.

Terrible teacher.  He won't help you at all when you ask him a question. Does not always seem like he knows what he is talking about.  He works half way through the proof than has to erase it because he did it wrong.  If you can, drop him immediately and get another professor.

Hard to say whether or not he's a good teacher. Some days he's really nice and other days he bites your head off. Assigns a lot of homework and tries hard not to answer any homework questions directly, although he's fine with lecture questions. Tries to make the class hard when people are doing really well. He seems like a nice guy, but isn't easy.

This class can be hard or easy...he made it ridiculously hard.  Assigned at least 15 problems every week that had 2-5 parts to them so they took forever to do.  Will not help with homework and won't even give answers AFTER you've turned it in.  If the class does well on the first exam, he just makes the next one harder...take someone else!

Drop now, you pour soul. The homework is ridiculously time consuming, and the exam is too long for the time allotted. Uses a notation that is different from the book -- his notation makes more sense, but this will only confuse you more on hw. Doesn't seem to care if half the class fails. Stops lecture when he feels like it (25 after sometimes).
He presented the material well and was alway willing to help.  However he is a very hard grader.
No Comments

This is a difficult class compounded by an overly difficult teacher.  Lessons are convoluted and they stray from the book heavily.  DO NOT TAKE CLASS FROM THIS PROFESSOR IF YOU ARE AN ENGINEER!!!  This class has absolutely no relevance to engineering after the 2nd chapter.

I didn't think the guy was that bad. He is a little boring. Although, he does crack the occasional joke (albeit dry humor). His curve is minimal at best. For example, the cutoff for an A is 92 or something like that. But, you can do much worse than Prof. Ogle (see Dynin, Alexander) for math.

That dude sucked.  He looks like Agent Smith from the Matrix.  Always good for a linear algebra guy.  I always wanted him to say Mr Anderson but he never did...   DON'T TAKE HIM!!!!  Oh, he used the exact tests from previous years.

I thought his explanations were clear and his presentation methodical.  He was helpful outside of class as well.  His grading is unforgiving and somewhat harsh, but at least it was consistent with everyone.  I would take him again.

Absolutely terrible teacher.  Gave no curve in the class where a large number were failing.  Gave almost no examples in class. This combined with his lectures being completely different from the book both in notation and content made homeworks impossible. Very condescending and degrading to students

The subject matter is quite difficult, but he makes it relatively clear.  His style and notation differs from that in the book, but he still assigns book problems that are often too tough to handle.  Very easy to mess up on the 2 midterms.  Unfortunately, he doesn't curve.  Good luck getting an A.
It's a hard class, no curve. Unless ur really good with the material, don't take this class.  It's hard to get an A.
I think he is great, his tests were not that hard, and though he might seem booring, his lectures do give out really good ideas that saves you a bunch of time if you apply it to homework and tests.

Absolute worst Math teacher ever!  Both times I've had him are the two worst grades I have ever gotten in Math.  He strays from the book, is boring as hell, and comes to class late.  Unless you are forced to take his class, DON'T!!!
Unclear in his teachings and hardly showed any care in student's progress.

Three  midterms .  I ACED every one (one perfect).  average of them was in the 50%'s.  Then was unfair and made final too hard.  got a D.  Ended class with a B because of NO CURVE.  He failed over half the class. I deserved an A, others deserved to pass!
Always late to class, and he wasn't even very helpful.
BORING AS HELL, I couldn't even go to lecture.
This man's more boring than an Al Gore interview.  He's quite peculiar looking.
blahhh
No Comments
Handsome, willing to help, with a chill classroom vibe, good experience, would take again
Bart made class very enjoyable and easy to learn for very hard concepts. He always gave feedback and was eager to help students.

Bart has a very unique teaching method, from my experience, and I think if it works for you, you'll do great and enjoy the class, and if it doesn't, you can get a bit frustrated. Bart is very willing to help you succeed in the course, and gives you everything you need to do so. If you take this course, you cannot afford to skip class.

I took Bart's geometry 4507 class, which contained many very difficult concepts. Although the class was hard, Bart did a phenominal job teaching it and neatly organizing and building up the content to make it understandable. Made class fun with his great humor. Only con I have is nothing is online to learn from so if you miss class then ur screwed.

Nice guy, high energy and keen to help but really bad at explaining things so there's really no point in asking. I often left class confused. Pros are that quizzes are online and open note, workload is light and attendance isn't mandatory.
If you are not a native speaker don't take this class. Sometimes he says fast and it can be hard to catch up with him. Exams are unpredictable and may include lots of handwriting.

Bart Snapp is a great professor. Funny and quirky. He does make a difficult math class actually enjoyable. He provides lecture notes and will work with the whole class to fill out the notes. You submit the notes for homework grades. He will solve all homework problems in class if you attend lectures and ask questions. Exams can be unpredictable.

Math for Architects with Dr. Snapp was probably my easiest class in college. Homework is generally completed in class and he will provide plenty of help. If you get problems wrong on an assignment, you have another few days to fix the issue and he'll give you the points back. He's a hilarious teacher too!

It was a tough class (it broke my 4.0) but I really enjoyed having Bart for 4580. I'm sure he is just as excellent for other classes, but abstract algebra is clearly a topic close to his heart. I would recommend Bart for any class; he is clearly very smart, but also funny and accessible. He also adapts lectures based on student questions.
Fantastic professor and fantastic class, if you get the opportunity to have Dr. Snapp as a lecturer, do it.
Lectures are insightful and entertaining. He provides textbook-quality lecture notes, so there's no paying for a textbook. Try to get him for any math class you can!

Hands down the best math professor I had in OSU. He is very passionate about teaching. He also gave us a Ximera online textbook for practice and understanding the material. Although he tried to make the materials easier to understand, calculus 3 is still very difficult. Be sure to do the practice exams before the midterms and final.
Great professor. Lectures were always interesting and funny. Very helpful office hours before exam.
Bart is a very hilarious and passionate professor, and he did his best to make a hard course easier and more interesting. Also, he curves the grade after the final was graded.
Good fun guy in lecture. If you like math and do they work then youll like this class and do fine. There is usually a curve though.
Go to his office hour to ask about the group projects. He is a great lecturer.
Great guy, everything he said made perfect sense.
Bart is hilarious and genuiely interested in teaching. However the class is extremely hard. It's LIKELY to get a bad grade even under such a great 2153 professor.

Professor Snapp is not only brilliant when it comes to Calculus, but he keeps lectures entertaining. He is also one of the minds and developers behind Ximera, a free online textbook service, so students don't have to pay for the textbook. A print copy can be obtained for $5.
Best I've had so far.

Bart made me actually like calculus! He makes his own online, interactive textbook that is FREE! There is homework due every lecture day, but if you follow in class and in the textbook, it's not bad. Also, he gives practice exams that are 50% of the real exam! He is funny, and wants you to understand the material.

Fantastic teacher! I enjoyed every lecture thoroughly and was fully engaged from start to finish. Classes are taught in a unique, fun and engaging way, and help alot with the material. Bart himself is comical and kind, and is a amazing teacher who cares about the success of his students. 11/10 would take again
Great guy, truly cares.

Bart was the nicest professor. The material is difficult but he tries to teach it in a way that is easy to learn and he consistently adds humor to both his slides and lectures to keep the class interesting.

So much good to say about him. His lectures are amazing as he goes over tough subjects while sprinkling in humor. This makes the lectures so much more enjoyable. Great teacher, and encourages questions, giving back great responses. Uploads lectures online, so if you miss class don't worry. If you put in the work, you won't regret it. A+ teacher.
Bart's lectures are so interesting and he gives out many examples to help you understand the concepts. Exams hold heavily in the proportion of the grade.

Bart was definitely one of the best teachers Ive ever had. His lectures were interesting and helpful with the homwork and exams.. The most important part of his class was to pay attention in lecture during the example problems and do the textbook assignment , because thats where all the homework and exam questions come from.

Dr. Snapp was one of my favorite professors at OSU. He made me actually kind of enjoy calculus! Lectures were engaging, homework was reasonable, and Dr Snapp made it very apparent how much he loves his subject, which always is good to see. He was very accessible outside of class too, with office hours 4/5 weekdays. He wants his students to succeed.

Hands-down one of the best professors Ive ever had. Lecture times explained major concepts in bite-sized pieces. Advice: go to class. He wrote the textbook(Ximera), knows all the stuff. I SUCK at math at OSU, and Ive never had a higher grade until this class. Relatable, 10/10, you actually become interested in math even if its not your major.

Bart is easily the most entertaining professor I've ever had. He is great at making math interesting and grabbing the attention of the whole class. Really cool guy who makes me excited to go to class. If you are a student who prefers slow, methodical, and organized professors, it may take a bit to adjust to energetic/impromptu teaching style.

Really incredible teacher, and freaking awesome person too. You can tell he's constantly doing what he loves: doing math and teaching math (he also is a guitarist in a band, but you didn't hear it from me). Easily my favorite professor I've had here at OSU so far. Enjoyed learning Calc 3 because of him  honestly can't recommend enough.
Best Professor Ever!!! He is the reason I choose to minor in Math!

Dr. Snapp is by far the best math professor I've ever had. He teaches you how to think for yourself and makes high-level math jargon really accessible. He's very encouraging but definitely makes you work for your grade. He's got a great sense of humor and really cares about teaching math instead of just doing math.
His homework almost has nothing to do with your exams. He is intelligent, but he is not a good teacher.

The lectures are fairly large, so you will most likely never interact with Bart himself. The lectures are well executed, and along with the assigned homeworks and practice exams should prepare you well. There are two midterms and a final that make up your grade. I found the two midterms to be easy with the final being somewhat difficult.
Love Bart

He records all the lectures and puts them on Carmen which is great. Online textbook (Ximera) is part of the homework and it's free. It might seem confusing at first but if you spend LOTS of time reading over and practicing it and re-watch the lectures, you'll get the materials eventually since Calc 3 is not meant to be easy. Huge curve at the end.

This was one of the worst classes I have taken. The online textbook that he wrote with Jim Fowler was not very helpful in actually reinforcing material or just being a extra resource that I could use when confused. Exams are difficult that are all conceptual, and the homework gives no sort of practice with those types of questions.

Take a 90's teen guitar hero.
