His practice exams were pretty much the same as the real exams and I think if you attend every lecture and recitation it would be hard to not get close to an A.

Prof Kunz has been one of my favorite lecturers. His handwriting and notation is confusing at times. There were plenty of classes I left feeling like nothing made sense but the following class, recitations, and the online textbook were very helpful. Exams are straightforward and the class is an easy B if you study and attend lecture/recitation.

Was an okay professor, he has a very thick accent and his handwriting is super hard to read. Exams were exactly like the practice, and he posted all of his notes online. We had a few homework assignments, but were super helpful and an easy way to boost your grade. There is a slight curve at the end of the class.

Great professor, definitely cared about your success in the class and how he was able to make his lectures better. The quizzes in recitation were fairly easy and so were the exams. Only complaint is that he usually starts a few min early for lectures and some of the way he writes greek letters are a bit difficult to read.

Jim is a good professor. Take his class if you have the chance. There is extra credit offered on the midterms and separate extra credit later in the semester so take advantage of it. The team portion of tests and the written homework take some time (2-4 hours) so plan accordingly. Jim is a legend.
Nothing to complain about, good structure to the course. Will say the "team" part of the exams are pretty hard, so make sure you get a good group.
simply the goat

He knows what he is talking about but I found it hard to focus in his lectures. There is a lot of homework and the format of Ximera sucks but it is manageable. Exams have so much built in extra-credit and revision opportunities so it is really hard to fail (which is good cause they pretty much make up your entire grade)
He teaches very well - many wish that they had him as their teacher in later math courses.

He's a great professor but the structure of the class (which is his brainchild) is ridiculous. The only way to truly succeed is if you dedicate the majority of your week to learning the content because of the sheer amount of it. You're basically learning Calc 2&3 at a summer semester pace while also trying to balancing the rest of your schedule.

The best professor I have!! Responds to questions fast and is willing to help find groups. The extra credit is given generously, allowing you to earn back half of the missing points on the exam, and also a few points for finishing extra homework. Get yourself a good group and practice the practice exam (really similar to the actual exam).

Goated calc professor, lectures were helpful, although I'm sure you can do well without attending them. You get corrections for the midterms which are a life saver. Written homework and team portion of the midterms can be very very time consuming (~3-4 hours). Exams are very reasonable and are very similar to problems from homework/sample exams
Teacher is great, but the amount of assignments and time commitment this class is, is kind of insane.

Chance to get over a 100% on midterms and finals. I ended with over 100% in the class. Corrections for midterms give half credit back per question. Pretty good lectures but I did not really pay attention I just learned it from homework and recitations. Great guy. Team midterms and written homeworks are time consuming.
Literally and biblically him

Great teacher who makes Math 1172 a lot easier to understand and provides a ton of resources for the class. Unfortunately he is a little bit inaccessible because he is so busy and is lowkey kind of mean if you ask a dumb question or for help sometimes. But he made this class pretty easy and very bearable for Calculus 2.5.
really informative lectures, super helpful and accommodating. offers half credit back on exam corrections, so not a difficult class to get a good grade.

I had late senioritis and got a 46/120 after not trying on the first midterm. I got focused and scored 91 and 88 on the next two midterms and got a good score on the final which got me to pass. Definitely go to lectures and recitations. Do his handouts for every topic really gives you insight for his midterms. Great lecturer and explains thingseasy

Currently in this course, one of my all time favorite professors. He posts so much content for you to use depending on your learning style (lecture vids, online interactive free textbook, guided notes, practice questions & exams) and is a fantastic lecturer. Lectures are optional, but go. Cheat sheets on exams & midterm test corrections is a plus.

Can be extremely biased and has favorites despite what all the other ratings say. Helpful to some but unhelpful to those who he doesn't look highly upon based on his own opinion. Exams are difficult and are usually harder than any practice exam. We had no test corrections but I heard the students now do so i'm not totally sure what that is like.

Makes a hard class easy. Open note, open resource midterms. Content is pretty hard. Online lectures are more helpful than in person ones, but I'd probably get a way better grade if I showed up to class. You can do zoom or in person lectures and you're not restricted to your specific lecture time; you can show up to any lecture he does.

Jim was a great professor. I really enjoyed his online format of the class and that made it easy for me to do the work whenever. All exams are online and open note so getting a good grade is very easy.

Jim is the course coordinator for ENGR Calculus 1172 and he post amazing recorded lectures for students to watch before coming to class. The lectures he makes are super clear and super helpful. I enjoyed 1172 even though it could be challenging at times. He also has an obsession with donuts which is entertaining.
Has a very organized class. If you put in a lot of work, you well 100% do well in the class. He has a strange obsession with donuts but is overall a chill dude and easy to talk to.

This class is set up in a way that your grade is almost entirely a function of your effort. Jim provides countless resources to get to know the material and has revisions on exams for half-credit back. While this class is not easy by any means, you WILL pass if you put in effort.

Jim is kinda cool but this class sucks ass. Like who even puts a midterm the day before spring break. This class is low key pretty easy though. I also don't like Jim's voice that much. He seems kinda fruity low key.

Talamo is a great lecturer! 1172 has a lot of homework, but the class is generally easy to do well in. I took AP Calc AB before this class but I have heard that others who took Calc 1151 instead struggled more in 1172. 50% of ur test grades are take-home with a group, and the other 50% are individual and timed but can be redone for half credit back
He taught a very difficult class in a way that made it manageable. Not memorably good but definitely helps students get through the class
Would never take him again and thank god I don't have to. Class is difficult and he is arrogant and clearly has favorites. Ximera our textbook is horrible and the exams are hard!

Talamo is passionate about math and teaching and it shows. Overall, I felt he did a good job explaining topics. The class is very test heavy, and the tests were difficult, but revisions for up to 50% credit were able to be done. There were also group tests. Lectures were asynchronous which took up a lot of time, but they were well done.

Jim Talamo is a great professor and great guy. Very well organized lecture notes and clear recitation lectures. The tests were quite difficult - especially considering the fact that there were 5 - however he tries his best to prepare you. Easy to reach outside of class.

This course is horribly set up and lacks a clear structure to support student learning. I passed this class by being carried by other students. It was extremely difficult and time consuming. Definitely did establish a basis of knowledge, but get ready to do a TON of studying. The class is made up of 85% midterms and final.

He had very clear lectures that had neat notes to follow along with. Truly cares about students understanding the material and is SUPER kind. The homework is the most time consuming but just start it early and it isnt bad at all, most of it will be revisited on the exams. The study guides are always very similar to the exams.

Lazy. Have fun sitting and watching lectures while Jimmy flies through the material expecting you to follow. Live class is just him going through problems which is helpful however this is the closest youll get to him responsively teaching to a group of students. Figure the homework out, and go to the tutor building. You will hate doughnuts after.

Lazy. Reused his prerecorded lectures from during covid instead of having in person class and actually teaching. When I saw his ratings I was excited to take his class because they were so good and everyone described him as such an outstanding professor. He's not.

I loved his lectures, and he was very helpful in explaining difficult topics. This is a hard class, so make sure you put the work in and go to office hours, even if you don't have a question. Dr. Talamo cares a lot about his students' success, and is really nice.

Probably one of the best Math profs. at OSU. His notes are so easy to follow and understand. Exams are difficult but that is because 1172 has standardized department exams but he does a very good job of communicating material when in person.

Talamo is a great teacher. This class is the engineering calculus weed out class, so it is going to be really hard and difficult, but Talamo couldn't do a better job in the lectures. He really does a good job of explaining things and his notes are pretty clear. You have to put in ALL the work to get a good grade, so you'll have to step it up here.

I took 1172 via webinar, so his classes weren't required, and the lectures were posted on carmen. Jim is super nice, funny, and very good at helping students understand the content. I would gladly have again.

Talamo is easily one of the best professors / teachers I have ever had. He is extremely knowledgeable and intelligent, and actually cares about your understanding of the subject. Even with a class of almost a 1000 students (there was like 900 something in Fall 2020)! Definitely the best calc professor at OSU.

The textbook is free. He is a great guy and built the class properly for the pandemic. He is understanding, but they gave him way too much work. Check handouts if stuck on take home tests. The UTAs are terrible and don't grade properly. Often you have to go to him for regrades since the UTAs are incompetent. Great professor overall.

Talamo is a great lecturer. insanely smart and expects a lot our of his students, so be prepared for a fair amount of online homework (XImera, ugh), but he is such a great teacher. Was very helpful every time I went for questions after class and also offered to regrade my midterms when I noticed things were mis-graded. Very entertaining as well

Overall great prof, which is rare for the math department lol. Super nice and really cares about the success of his students. He took a really difficult class and made it easy to learn by offering a lot of additional practice, some extra credit, and exam/quiz revisions. He was always happy to answer questions and flexible to his student's needs.

One of if not the best professors in the math department. Failed 1172 first time and got a B+ my second time around with Talamo. Genuinely wants the students to understand the material and do well. Makes a very difficult class doable.

Very good lecturer. He tends to stare at the board a lot so sometimes will miss if people have a question. Really cares about if his students succeed. He responds very quickly to emails and carmen questions. He has been very helpful during COVID-19, even though the math department has been horrible. Always posts his lecture notes.
Jim is a funny guy who really tried to get the students to understand the math being taught!

Honestly, I really like Professor Nguyen, but I can see why people may not.  His lectures are all the same - straight from the book, but the way he teaches it is very engaging.  If you pay attention in class and properly study, you will be alright.  His teaching is a nice break from other profs who just go through the slideware
the content is hard so any teacher is gonna be hard, exams were similar to homework and quizzes and he let you have a cheat sheet which was a life saver

Dr. Nguyen's lectures are exactly from the book, so if you can understand the book (his slides) then you will be ok. His tests are a lot easier than the quizzes and the homework, and he's a very kind grader (curves generously on tests). He is very accessible outside of class.

I found it hard to learn from Prof. Nguyen. His accent makes his lectures difficult to understand. He also spent too much time proving theorems which was never something we were expected to do. Weekly group HW and quizzes, both tough. I will say he does what he can to help your grade. My grade probably shouldve been a B+ at best, but I got an A.

I did pass fail because this class is hard. It was a hybrid class so you had to show up on fridays. Weekly quizzes which were annoying but helped you stay on track. Group homeworks were nice because you have 3 other people to help. Exams are a little harder than what we studied. Hard to understand with accent but he was caring and willing to help

I really enjoyed his 3345 class. You actually have to go to the lecture to understand some of the material but I think he does a good job explaining and asking if we have questions and what we're confused about. He does have an accent but if you're paying attention it's not hard to understand. His exams are pretty easy too.

Hoi is a good professor, you have to read the book obviously if you want to learn the material in depth as lecture is only 55 minutes long but he does frequently ask if anyone has any questions about the homework and will go over tough questions on the exam more.

For sure the worst professor I have had in college. There has not been one class he let out in time. Does not respect anyone else time and himself has zero time management skills. Lectures are a complete waste of time as he stares at the board while talking and no one can hear him. Not that anything he said made sense in the first place.

Easily the worst professor I have had so far in my collegiate career. Hoi is absolutely clueless, no idea how to run a class. I beg you to ask him a question, not a chance he gives you a satisfying answer, usually makes you look like an idiot for asking one. He really struggles communicating what he wants to teach and glosses over major concepts.

His English is bad, you cannot get what he is saying clearly, because he even cannot say English clearly, you do not know what words he is saying. His lecture has no logic, no central idea. The thing he said most is "hahaha... I don't know hahaha..."
Cant understand half the words he says. He really does not know what is happening in the world.
Good professor, heavy accent but he's a good lecturer and he wants you to do well. He gave out extra credit participation in class. Exams can be hard though.
I enjoyed this class. He is a fine lecturer, and he wants you to get a good grade in his course.
Horrible experience!

The worst professor I have ever met in OSU. No one can understand what he is talking about. The class notes are also unreadable. Everyone in the class have to study by themselves. Dont take the class. You can learn nothing!

Professor Asta is an okay teacher.  Her lectures were kind of confusing for this being an introduction level stats class, but she was very kind and would explain things if they were confusing.  The course is disorganized.  The tests are curved which was helpful.  The homeworks weren't too bad.  You will be okay if you're in her class.

Professor Asta was a solid teacher for Stat 3201, she had a lot of examples in class that were similar to the exams, the class material itself is pretty difficult, she graded on a pretty heavy curve which was nice, office hours were very helpful

She's a nice professor, but there were many issues. She was very disorganized and often didn't upload things she said she would and would sometimes take several days to respond to emails. My biggest issue, though, was not her fault. The course has VERY few grades, and we sometimes wouldn't practice a concept until 2-3 weeks after we learned it.

She's a little disorganized and I think that the content she covers gets covered way too fast to work. Sometimes she doesn't explain concepts too well either. That being said, she is really kind in regards to one-to-one zoom calls. Adjusts the content to what she already covers in class. Be ready to work hard though, this class was difficult for me

She is very nice and really takes time to answer questions and clarify for her students. She can sometimes seem to be disoriented and won't upload homework on time and seems to really rely on her notes instead of doing problems on her own.

A pressing issue I've run into with Prof. Asta is lack of organization. We receive homework back over 3 weeks late, get exam practice problems the day before the exam, etc. Lectures are quite boring, as we follow the same routine each time. Above all, however, she is kind, caring, readily available, and truly wants her students to succeed.

Professor Asta is a kind, caring professor and I recommend her for STAT 5550. HWs not too difficult and tests are fair. My only complaint: Lectures are poorly organized, notes are somewhat haphazard and not easy to follow.
I really enjoyed Dr. Asta's lectures. Dr. Asta is a kind, caring, and understanding professor. I would just prefer if we spent less time on the first two chapters and more time on later ones.
It was an excellent course. She taught the class really well. Her assignments were really helpful in understanding the material. Now, I intend to take the next level too(Stat 6302).
Class was fine, but the midterms were too difficult.

Genuinely, nobody loves mathematics more than Cesar. The content of this course is difficult, but don't confuse it with Cesar's teaching ability. His lectures are clear and to the point. He's an extremely nice guy who simply loves math. He is a strict grader, but he does adjust and curve the exam grades. He's extremely helpful in his office hours.

One of my favorite Math profs at OSU. The class content is very challenging but he breaks it down and explains it very well. I attended all of his office hours and he was very kind and supportive. He's a tough grader and rather blunt but a great professor. Very open to suggestions and helping students succeed. Go to office hours if you need help!!

If you have to take Intro to Analysis, do not take it with Cesar Cuenca. His midterms are difficult and weighted heavily. He also doesn't care about student feedback. His lectures are hard to follow and he insists on letting the textbook be the primary resource for the class. This intro class shouldn't have been as hard as it was. Avoid.

Has to be one of the worst profs I have ever had in the three years that I have been at OSU. There are only two midterms and they were both extremely difficult and worth a lot of your grade. The class average on the first exam was a 50%. He says that he might have made things too hard but then does nothing about it and rarely gives partial credit.

She was very helpful when I actually attended class. Now, at the end of the semester, I didn't go to class for the entire last month and still finished with an A. I did miss points because of attendance, but the way she grades tests with the partial credit allowed me to score high on every test. My class was a hybrid class, so lectures on your own.
Would highly recommend, great at lectures and instructing, though it might depend on how you learn. Personally   I like how she grades exams

Dr. Tiglay was a very kind, and understanding professor. I am not the best source when it comes to her teaching since I had already taken this class in high school, but she was always good at answering questions about problems and being flexible if you had to miss class even though it was mandatory.

Dont take her class. Shes not helpful when you ask questions she just rambles and doesnt answer - exams are so difficult cause of how she grades - notes and lectures are just jumbled and confusing! The final project is so much work but only 16 points. Dont recommend although shes a nice lady.

Lectures are very good, with many examples. I would suggest going to all lectures and reading the book prior to class. Homework is from the book and is optional, but I highly recommend doing it, as test questions look very similar to homework/lecture questions. She is available often for office hours, in fact I would go there as often as I could.

AVOID AVOID AVOID. Lectures are very unorganized and she completes multiple steps in her head without telling the class why or how to complete certain steps. Does not explain concepts in a manner that is easy to understand. I've been an "A" student all through college math classes until this class. I will be lucky to end with a C.

The first time I took this class with Rao Vidynath and personally I think she blew him out the water. She gives hw problems from the book that you arent required to do but its a good practice. She tries to give you as much points as possible on exams questions you got wrong. Gave extra credit in my class.

AVOID. I took Dr. Tiglay's class to polish my Calc skills (haven't done Calc since senior year of HS). Everything was a breeze since I took AP Calc, however her Final Exam. Terrible. Class average was a 45%. Highest grade in the class was a 54% with the 15% grade curve. She literally puts new material on the final that you never cover in class.
honestly a really good teacher!

DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS! Although she is a very nice person, she is a horrible teacher. Her notes are all over the place and her example problems are completely different from the questions on the test. She is always confused and when asked a question gets more confused. She awards little to no partial credit and is a very hard grader. Stay Away!!!

LISTEN! She is an extremely tough grader and gives little to no partial credit. She does not give very good feedback at all, and when she does, questions were not answered and more were added into the mix. When you have to add A thirty point curve to the final exam you know something went wrong. AVOID AT ALL COSTS! LISTEN TO THIS WEBSITE'S COMMENTS

She is  extremely passionate about the courses she teaches. In favor of this professor, she really does care about the student. She makes herself available for the student and takes time out to answer questions about homework. Unfortunately, her teaching style is extremely confusing and her tests are pretty moderate if you study. Good luck!

She always seems very confused. Students had to correct her almost every day. She tries to answer your questions, but does not answer them well. Sometimes she would forget until the end of class to hand out notes after lecture is done. Very unorganized. Does not do well with explaining things. Would not recommend her to anyone.

Awful teacher. messed up multiple times while teaching and had to start all over and had to be corrected by students. seemed confused most of the time and didn't teach in an organized way. went through lectures fast and not very nice.

Giovanni is one of the recitation profs for Sean Sanford. Gio is the best! He is so helpful and explains everything in detail. He was easier to understand that the actual prof. Quizzes every other week usually consisting of 1-3 questions in 15 min. He prepares you for each quiz very well. It is very easy to get 10/10 on most quizzes.

Professor Wagner is a very nice professor and made hard concepts easier to understand. While this class is very test-heavy, most tests are generally easy. The one issue is with the homework assignments, which are graded extremely toughly.

I took linear algebra with Professor Wagner and it was the most difficult class I've taken here at OSU. The professor was nice and helpful outside class. However, exams were super difficult. 70% of your grade is based on midterms and a final (30%). The final exam average was 50%. I studied a lot for his exams but ended up with a bad grade.

Weichen Gu is an easygoing professor, and he makes generally complex concepts seem easy to understand. The tests are mostly easy, and he is a lenient grader. One thing he doesn't do is post online lecture notes, which means you have to attend his class in order to get the material. In addition, homework submissions are paper copies, not on canvas.
This is a class that starts with 1, the homework score is very low, the test score is very low.

Worst class and professor at OSU. This is a 1000-level class; the first exam mean was a 57. That is absurd. It is math you learned in 4th grade (4th grade is generous), and you are expected to write out 500 steps to find x in y=mx+b. A, you should not take this class. B, If you take this class and get Vic, drop it immediately.

I feel like I ended up teaching myself more the content than he did, spent lectures lost and confused. We also never got clear definitions for the content we were expected to know and incorporate into the homework and exams. Exams are timed and typically at night on the computer which became very stressful. Do not recommend!

Cons: If you want a review math class, just find a different course. Difficult grader on homework- you have to explain why you did every single step in every problem. Attendance graded every day. Talks a lot. Class long for no reason

Pros: Exams resemble study guides. He seems to care. Don't really need to pay attention. Homework ~every two weeks.

Good intentions. Yapper. Bad jokes and a little out of touch. Makes easy things so confusing. I excelled in HS math thru calc, took this as a GPA boost- I feel like I understand math less after talking his class. Homeworks are graded on explaining the obvious and unnecessary. Never got a 10/10 on HW. Attendance graded out of 3 for every class.

Vic is a nice guy but not the best professor. I took the class because I wanted an easier math class, but it wasn't what I expected. There is a weekly homework packet that is due every week. Exams can get complicated because you have to over-explain everything in this class. I recommend taking this class online and avoiding this professor.
Really disappointed with this professor. He is more interested in telling jokes than teaching. Every problem with the class he said is the fault of the "department". Avoid at all costs

If you are neurodivergent, I don't recommend taking a class with Vic. He is an incredibly kind person and it is clear that he cares about his students, but the way the course was set up was very limiting and explanations could be very confusing at times.

Worst teacher or professor I have ever had. I am only a few weeks in to be honest but it is awful. The class is super easy material but we are expected to write 7 steps out for super simple questions. It is tedious and graded really harshly. Avoid this professor.

Horrible professor. Nice guy, but does not know how to teach a math class. Extremely unorganized with his notes. Luckily I had many past experiences with math so I pretty much knew the material, but if it wasnt for that I wouldve failed this class due to the terrible and unorganized way of teaching. Do not recommend

Dr. Ferdinand is incredibly difficult to understand, he spend the entire class period making jokes about math and tries to teach content in the last minute. So hard to follow, will say things like watch out for this about how the tests are graded but is never clear enough to be helpful. If youre not naturally good at math, DONT TAKE HIS CLASS.

He's really cheesy Dr ferdinand is not the best professor but definitely not the worst he genuinely cares about students and wants all of them to be able to understand the content the hardest thing honestly is the class just make sure you're understanding everything You can bomb one of the midterms but you need to make sure you can bounce back

He's really dorky and tells a lot of jokes during his lectures, but he cares about his students and tries to explain things as simply as possible. His lectures mostly consist of him writing out problems on an overhead and talking them through. Online homework once a week, and a short quiz every week in recitation.

Vic is a great guy and you can tell he really truly enjoys teaching math, but he is so hard to follow. If you aren't great at understanding conceptual math I would look for someone else. Vic is great at going on long metaphorical tangents that explain why math stuff works, but without my recitation & textbook I would've probably failed the class.

Vic was an absolutely incredible professor in my class of 11 people. He could get off topic and loved to make jokes that were confusing, but in a smaller class setting, it was easy to get back on topic. Still, I've never known someone who cares so much about his students and their success. If you put in the effort you will learn so much from him.

Vic is very condescending and will make you feel like a complete idiot. He contradicts himself constantly; I never really knew what terminology I was/wasn't allowed to use in the class which was very frustrating.  If you participate in class and go to the tutor room you may get out with a B but it will be very difficult.

I did not rate this professor because he was HORRIBLE!! jokes weren't funny, off topic often, boring and anything else you can think of that is really bad! Pros- he is a really nice person genuine, and the class didn't take attendance because of the class size

He is confusing but is helpful if you ask for it.  Lectures get boring and he tries to fit in what he wants in the last 2 minutes.  He gets off topic sometimes. Overall I didn't mind him as much as everyone else did and did fairly well in his class, you just have to know exactly what he is looking for as he is a tough grader.

Vic makes it hard to understand the material. He is unclear with what he is teaching at times. I passed the class with an A, but I taught myself the information more than he taught me. When you ask questions, he makes you feel stupid at times and doesn't even answer them for you. This class was only frustrating because I had Vic as the professor.

He is probably the strictest grader out of all the professors that teach MATH 1125. Also he doesn't really explain anything and I feel like when i go to lecture I end up more confused. The T.A is more helpful.
Vic is a very confusing when he tries to explain stuff. But his jokes are so unique. Don't count your hatches before they chicken!

Good guy and a good TA. He really cared about students and tried to make sure the material was understandable. The class isn't the easiest but Vic did make it a bit easier by showing us a lot of examples during recitation.  He would also work out any problem you would ask.
Not helpful at all. I dreaded going to this class daily. He is a really harsh grader and the midterms/finals are difficult. Also his jokes are NOT FUNNY! If you have the option try and get Betsy.
Very picky when explaining. I still have not found what he wants from the homework.  Jokes are really not that funny. Makes simple things seem extremely confusing.
Vic is the MAN. Great professor, awesome guy!

Vic is a very poor professor.  We mainly taught ourselves in groups how to do the problems with very little guidence from him.  It was a boring class that I dreaded going to everyday.  I had to google concepts to do math homework.  His test are extremely difficult.  Afford him if all possible.

Vic really cares about each student.  He would be willing to stay after class or meet before class with people to make sure they were understanding material.  While the information is not the most exciting ever, Vic tries his best to make his side interesting.

Had him a few years ago for Math 151. He's a very good professor, but man, sometimes he is just excruciatingly boring. I really struggled to pay attention sometimes (although that was more my fault than his). He has a really weird sense of humor and tells jokes that are so bad that they are hilarious. Very helpful to stay after class/office hours.

He is awful, If you can avoid getting him do it. His lectures are so incredibly boring and he makes no sense. we were ALWAYS behind, and we would take quizes on information we learned 2 weeks prior. Bottom line is try your hardest to not get him, he is a nightmare.

Had him during winter quarter. Kind of a weird guy, but he tells some jokes that are usually so bad that they're funny. He was decent at teaching the content and answering questions, but he sometimes overcomplicated simple questions, and he was a very picky grader (you HAD to write down every step you took). Other than that, he was great.

I have a love hate relationship with Vic. I love that he was genuinely interested in helping students if you came to him. I hate that he was such a tough grader and expected so much. He was hard to understand in class, and made dumb jokes. Love Vic as person, not as a teacher.

He is very helpful! I was going to miss a class before the final and he stayed after class and went over all of what was to be covered the next class. I had him at 8:30AM so, the jokes really didn't go over to well, but it could have been because everyone was still tired. :)

Vic is a very friendly guy that teaches extremely well! As a student taking an OSU course for the first time, he taught really well, and was very helpful. His funny jokes and stories helped reduce the stress, and he's a very fair grader. GREAT PROFESSOR! Wouldn't mind for Math 152. I don't know what these people mean, never had a bad experience.

Vic is a great teacher, I dont know what these other people are talking about. Sure sometimes when he gets talking its a little difficult to get him to stop but he teaches the material well, and tells really funny/corny jokes. I really recommend him
Great teacher! Amazing teaching techniques, keeps you really engaged! I love his jokes! Great guy and an amazing teacher, I just finish Math 101 and I'm really going to miss it!

What a great guy. He does a great job teaching theories. Makes himself available for help in the lab and really does a great job. Very nice guy and tells ridiculous jokes. Sit in the front of class and participate to really do well

Vic is a horrible professor.  Can't get his point across and wastes time trying to.  Pickiest grader I have ever had. Althought he is funny, its useless to be in the class but yo have to because attendance is mandatory. Overall=horrible.

Vic overall is just not good at staying on topic and clearly stating what he means. Just cannot get his meaning across because he gets lost on pointless tangents. I simply ignore him when he is lecturing and pay attention only when he's finally addressing the problem at hand. That and I learn mostly from my group members when we word together.

I took Vic for both 105 & 106, and have miss him during 107.  At first, he seems like a very hard teacher but once you get to know him you will appreciate him.  He is very willing to help you, even if you are not in his secion of the class.  Go to him when you need help.
very picky
picky grader

I wrote the last comment but wasn't finished with what I wanted to say. Vic's style of teaching is exactly what every classroom needs!! He doesn't talk about useless things or waste anyone's time. His classes are worth taking and I plan to take more of his classes even though they are not required for my major b/c Vic is awesome and I learned a LOT

He is NOT a bad teacher. He is trying to get people to think how their explanations sounds to children. He is very specific on word use and if you go to class and use the words he likes, he grades quizzes and tests very fairly. Homework is a lot of busy work, but not class. I learned a lot.
The class is very boring and he can deff confuse you when it is not needed. Must go to class and do homework.

He's boring and talks too much about nonsubject related things. His class is mostly busywork. I learn everything I need from resitation (don't skip it, it's the only time you'll figure out what's going on). Lots of homework and lecture will seem to drag on forever. Would never ever choose to take a class taught by him.
He is an awesome professor, but I had to work.  I wanted to try whining and crying to get my grade, but he would not tolerate that, I actually had to work

Vic is a nice guy who does not communicate his thoughts well.  He doesn't explain things well and he gives out a ridiculous amount of homework.  If you have a good TA that will help, and taking advantage of the tutor room makes a huge difference.  All I can say is good luck, because this class will be your life for the duration of the quarter.

I worked my butt of in this class and still struggled. I never had a problem w/ math til now. I'm not great but come on!! Somehow w/ a D on the midterm and a C- on the final, I ended w/ a B for my final grade. Whatever...I needed that grade
This class was very difficult...He was not a good teacher...He did not prepare our class for Midterms or Finals...
This class is so hard
had a wonderful way of confusing the crap out of students.  complicated simple problems, and didn't prepare well for exams or homeworks.  if you get him, pray for a really good TA
I saw him on the street and he was pretty cool then, so i am giving a good rating. You're soooo cool dude!!!!
Has an interest in teaching, but tends to way overcomplicate very simple math problems.  He'll keep going an going on the same topic.  The class does make you think and he's always willing to help.
Not as bad as his reputation if you do his work and go to classes.  The curve is unreal and if you do the work you'll do fine.  People don't do well because they won't do the homework.

Don't take him for this course. Go to CSCC and take it. You feel like you understand the material and then the test comes and it is completely different. Tests are so long that you will not finish in time. The tests are all theories.
zzzzzzz
His lecture's sucked, expected way too much without giving time to work up to those expectations, did not give nearly enough time for exams... however there was a huge curce.
Awesome. One of the nicest math teachers I've met. He was really good at explaining things and never made you feel dumb. Roxana was an awesome TA. I really liked Ferdinand as a prof.

You do mostly group work, which is good because he doesn't lecture...ever.  He won't give you answers and wants you to explain EVERYTHING in detail.  The tests are hard because of the time limit you have, but there is a great curve.  Go to every class or you will be lost.  Do your homework.
Vic is not a bad teacher, he just makes his tests too long!  Curve is nice, and if you don't let the concepts scare you, the class is not too bad.
teaches concept and can be hard but if you need help he is there to help. Everyone fails his test, but there is a huge cure. I got A's in 117-105-105, but he made me think.
He is crazy!!
Not an easy class, but a great teacher.  Very helpful.  He tries to keep it interesting...but watch out for the final!
This guy is the man.  All you have to do is show up at this class and he breaks everything down very clearly for you.  He tells some bad jokes, but that's ok.

Nice enough guy, but he is not a good professor. He goes through material as if it's review and you already understand it, the hw is much harder and dosent correlate with what we do in class, same with even the exam reviews. He's a nice guy but the way his class is is not at all a breeding ground for success.
Really great at getting into contact with his students. Always there to help.
Although the textbook was helpful it was not required. Lectures were good and if you have any questions he answers them efficiently.
Worst teacher ever. Worst professor, tough to understand, forced to show an unnecessary amount of work.
this is the hardest professor, tough to understand, very insecure...i wouldn't take his class again

Dr. Morton is the best math teacher ever.  The class is fun just take notes and pay attention!!  attend every class.  Tests and quizzes are directly from the class teaching.  He is helpful and willing to answer questions.  Go to his office hours and meet with his, ask questions.  The tutoring center is very helpful.  I would highly recommend him.
Easy grade if you do all the homework and go to all lectures

Do not take this professor unless you already have calculus experience. One of the worst professors I have had. The exams are extremely hard, but the quizzes aren't so bad. He is very uncaring. He wouldn't even give me a half of a percent to bump my grade up to a c-. So now I have to re-take the course.

Prior to go to his class I hated math with a passion. /But some how through his odd way of teaching I'm actually learning how to do different kinds of math. I think he is better than my high school math teacher but sometimes he doesn't make any sense at all....

Hate to be rude, but he was the worst math instructor I've ever had. He was sarcastic to students with questions and he never explained anything. He lacked interest and he made quite a lot of students' grades suffer, mine included.
BOOOO!!!!!!! He sucks! That simple!

This class was a review for me, but you haven't take any of the material before, then I'd suggest finding another TA. The few questions I asked, weren't answered clearly and he could be confusing. To his credit, he graded quizzes fairly. Overall, thumbs down.
Terrible TA. Does not know how to answer questions or explain. It is useless to go to class if you get him. The only reason I went was for attendance. He is very insecure and it shows!
Horrible! and very very unhelpful

Sherry has a structured teaching style, but can be a challenging professor. Recitation with the TA is key to learning the concepts. Utilize Unstuck study AI and other study tools to supplement the course materials.
In hindsight I'm glad Sherry was the first college professor I took because it opened my eyes to how bad professors can make a class way harder than it actually is.

Sherry was alright, she liked talking to students, answering questions and connecting material to the real world. She made print out copies of the lecture to fill in which helped me a lot. She did try to insert her opinions a lot, she related a math concept to how a boy can have multiple girls but a girl can't have multiple guys. She was weird.

At first I thought sherry was terrible. Then I took another math class here and missed her class. She prints out notes and actually does a range of problems during lectures. Even though there is a lot of material in a short amount of time, she makes it easy to learn.Homework (2 a week) and a quiz every week but she makes it east to understand!
The worst teacher I ever had.

Sherry was professional and accommodating when I had a few issues come up. She has a lot of material to get through in the short amount of time during the lectures. She does a good job of showing the steps if you follow along. Use recitation as a time to really cement these concepts and that will help you to go far in this class.

She was alright. I thought she taught the material well. I wouldn't search for her to take her class again but I wouldn't mind if I had to. I had a couple one-on-one interactions with her and she was slightly cold. If you don't attend her lecture you won't know what's going on because her posted notes are very messy.

please, Please do not take this professor's course. she IS NOT understanding, helpful or flexible even if you have disability accommodations.She is very condescending, my way or the highway and if you are like me and have sucked at math your entire life DON'T ask her any questions because she will humiliate you and make you feel stupid
She's not only rude and boring but just bad at teaching math. She teaches simple math in the most complicated way possible, leaving everyone in the room confused. Avoid her if you can.

Honestly, she wasn't that bad of an instructor. The lectures consisted of a small packet of notes that she did with the class. You need to buy ConnectMath to be able to do the homework. The homework ranges from 10-30 problems, depending on the section, and was pretty simple. She wasn't that energetic, but it still seemed like she cared.

I am not exaggerating when I say that this is EASILY the worst professer I've ever had.

I stopped attending lectures after the first week and *only* learned the material from Recitation (Caleb Dilsavor is an amazing TA!) and YouTube. She's an incredibly difficult professor to learn material from, don't bother going to lecture.

Sherry was a very difficult and stubborn professor to work with-- she is not very flexible or understanding. Her lectures are so hard to go through, she talks really fast and does not really explain things very well. Her handwriting is also very hard to read. I was able to pass the class because I had a good TA. Would not retake her class again.

Weekly quizzes that are one question and graded out of 10 points. Exams being 8 or less questions. Lecture was optional but hated when people missed - recitation is mandatory. She is not a good professor - barely gives explanations and when students have questions she tells them to ask during rec periods. Get ready to teach yourself the content.

It's true that Sherry is rude and acts like she's uninterested in teaching, but it's not bad if you have a good TA. There are two homework assignments per week, 1 weekly quiz, 3 midterms, and a final. Make sure to take advantage of your recitations because that's really where you learn the content since Sherry is not a great lecturer.

I was hesitant to even take this course after reading the reviews over the summer. While I don't think she is AS bad as the reviews stay, she is a difficult and stubborn professor. It's her way or the high way and she often goes on rants that are irrelevant to the material learned in class. She gave me a hard time wit accommodations and flexibility

she is incredibly rude and abrasive and often went on rants that had nothing to do with math. it honestly made more sense to not attend lecture and just go to recitation if you had a good TA. there is not many grades in this class so doing average on the midterms and final still gets you a poor grade. would not recommend.

Honestly, before the semester started I was a bit scared by other reviews, but the class and the teaching were NOT awful.  I recommend never skipping lectures because that's where you learn most of the information.  Plus the information found in these classes is not overly complicated or complex along with exams and especially the quizzes.
Her lectures are useless and teaches us how to do things the hardest way possible for no reason. Honestly has no clue what she is doing and a terrible teacher overall.

Genuinely one of the least helpful professors I've ever had. Unpleasant and will make you feel bad about having questions or not understanding something. Skipped the lectures most of the time because she is so unorganized and unclear. Class isn't too hard, but do not rely on her for anything.

Aggressive learner. Do not take this class if you're not fast-paced. She runs through the lecture quickly so be the person to ask questions if you don't understand. She runs through problems quickly and doesn't give you time to understand what she taught you before moving on to the next question. Expects you to know everything from start to end.

She is just awful. Passive aggressive, difficult to understand, very fast paced, horrible communication with students, and downright not friendly. She made what should have been a simple, straight forward class extremely difficult. Gives a ton of homework. Exams are easy on ConnectMath, but the quizzes are very exceptionally difficult.

As simple as college algebra should have been, Sherry made it nearly impossible to connect to the subject due to her terrible teaching tactics. She is a "my way or the highway" professor. She refuses to adapt to the simple technological advancements although they were literally needed to accommodate sick or disabled students (covid era). Avoid her!

Terrible terrible professor. Rude. I literally had to go back home to take care of my father who had been in a terrible car accident and so i missed a few assignments. I emailed her to ask if I could still complete them for some sort of credit and she fought me about! The old girl needs to retired. I do not think she cares about the students.

Quizzes are much harder than the practice problems we have for homework. You cannot makeup for any lecture participation points either, even if you are sick and provide a dr note. However, the teaching assistants were very helpful.

I had COVID and she made it impossible to get notes. She flies through the notes and just wants you to be able to regurgitate info. Quizzes are only 30 mins and very hard not anything like what is shown. The tests are online and open note so they are easier. Ignores when people have questions but gets mad when no one answers her questions.

Seemed annoyed when students had questions or wanted her to slow down in the lecture. Notes were often hard to read when she showed work in class and only sporadically accessible later on to review. Was not at all accommodating to COVID concerns and quarantines, and usually did not answer any emails sent to her about these things either.

Very passive aggressive lecturer. I did not like the environment created. Quizzes were hard, we only had 30 minutes, so review! However, mid-terms and finals are online through connect math so those were pretty easy.
Do not recommend going to lectures, they harm more than help.

Sherry is not the most amazing lecturer. She often goes quite quickly, and if you ask her to slow down, she can be pretty mean about it. She does often post the notes as long as people attend the lectures. But it can be super confusing to follow, and you end up having to do a lot of studying on your own.

This course is a nightmare. Recitation is mandatory and it is a waste of time. Midterms/Final are extremely easy, but quizzes are exceptionally difficult. You basically fend for yourself. Grade is curved but still not an easy course at all. Lecturer is not approachable and environment is uncomfortable. Things are explained horribly. Good luck.

She gives tons of homework and it seems to be way easier than the lecture worksheets so you never know what to expect on the quizzes or exams. Everything is very confusing and it’s nearly impossible to learn from this class.

I am very disappointed with this Professor.  I’ve never felt so under prepared going into an exam during  my time so far in university. Every exam so far there are problems you haven’t seen before or discussed in class. She skips steps often while working out problems which makes it difficult to follow.

Though the recitation is mandatory this isn't the problem with the class. The lectures aren't worth showing up either because the information that she does explain doesn't make sense for the majority of the class or due to the constant technical problems. Midterms were a breeze, but the quizzes are very difficult. Good luck

Recitation attendance is only mandatory, however, if you miss any lectures and email her for any recorded lectures, she will not email you back, ever. She is terrible at explaining any material and cannot use technology to save her life.
She doesnt explain how she solves the questions and gets straight to the point which confuses everyone in class
awful just straight up awful.

Her lectures were boring and confused me more than helped me. I started skipping the lectures halfway through the semester and just went to recitation. I think I learned more from recitation than the lectures.

extremely unhelpful. during my third lecture with sherri she told the class ill explain the things that are easy, but not the things that are hard. shes also very passive aggressive with her teaching and with people who ask her questions or send her emails. she also chooses to fill out the notes with a black sharpie on paper. no one can see.

It shouldnt matter how you get a math answer as long as the answers correct but she cares you have to do it her way. She said Ill explain it to you when its easy but not whens its hard overall not very good professor would not recommend her to anyone.

Professor never responded to my emails. Went in to go over my exams with her and she made me feel very uneducated. I would rely on my TA a lot to teach the materials because Seress does NOT explain anything.

I strongly recommend attending recitations and taking some time to study before tests. The lecturer tends to make simple topics sound hard and complex. Recitation helped simplify a lot of the content. Very easy to get a good grade as long as you do the online homework (usually very easy) and take time to review the material.

Professor Seress tries her best to answer any questions you might have, but she's always hard-pressed for time, so I always go to my TA. Her lectures are fast-paced as she assumes you already know previous topics, which can trip some people up. Other than that, she does a solid job making sure you know the material and it's up to you to practice.

Professor Seress was okay. Although the online lectures were not mandatory, if you miss just 1 lecture you will immediately be behind and confused. She never answered any of my emails and also her in person quizzes were so so difficult. Overall, okay professor. Got a 95 on my midterm and a 100 on final. Easy class you just have to put work into it.

Go to recitation they count attendance. Quizzes are pretty easy because its highschool review. Midterms are open note and online so pretty easy. Study for the quizzes and midterms though because they make up most of your grade. She records lectures which is nice to go back if you don't understand because sometimes she goes really fast.

I hated Sherry's teaching methods and learned more from my TA in recitation. I went to probably 3 of her online lectures and didn't retain anything so I turned to my TA and friends to learn from. She's not very accomodating.

The lectures were incredibly dense. The professor also went pretty fast in lectures and didn't have a lot of time to answer questions. The exams were very easy to miss points on since we couldn't show work or receive partial credit on any of the questions. I found the recitations to be helpful though.

Professor Seress is incredibly passive aggressive in lecture, through emails, saying things to students like, "I have no idea what you could even be asking that about", etc. Or when students must take a makeup quiz she referred to helping the students as something she unfortunately has to deal with tomorrow.

not the hardest but you definitely need to put in the work. there is a ton of homework and the quizzes are difficult to complete in time. would recommend going to the tutors, they are free and they saved my grade. also she is weirdly passive-aggressive during lectures?

Math 1148 was not the best, and a lot of it has to do with Lecturer Seress. Quizzes are fairly easy if you understand the material, but Sherry was not the most warm person and lectures were extremely boring and I had to teach myself the material myself. Honestly, not a great experience.

Sherry was an average professor. She didnt like students asking questions though, and would single you out for the entire lecture if you ended up asking one. Lectures were pretty boring and I learned more from recitation and connectmath. Attend recitation! Your TA will help it connect.

This class is a mix of material you definitely learned in high school and material that feels irrelevant and is oddly specific. Midterms and final are online, so its easy to miss points, and theyre also weighted quite a bit. TAs are good, homework easy and flexible.
Shes very uhhhpassive aggressive. Doesnt respond to emails half the time. Quizzes are barely reflective of the homework.

Definitely not a class that you can not pay attention in, but if you do you will get by. There is a lot of opportunity for homework to boost your grade and the midterms are rather easy compared to the quizzes which was the hardest part for me.

It seemed like everything in this class was explained in the most complicated way possible. The recitation quizzes are graded very tough and almost impossible to complete in time. So much material was crammed into a single lecture and I wouldnt have understood anything if my recitation TA wasnt good. The only good thing is the exams are online.
She wasn't horrible, but she goes WAY too fast in lectures. My recitation was the only reason I passed.

Honestly, the class itself is easy but Sherry is just so hard to respect which makes it hard to want to do the classwork. I recommend watching the lectures after she posts them to Carmen so you can skip through them since she doesn't explain things but rather just shows them. Just try to keep up and do good on quizzes bc thats the bulk of the grade

Horrible, horrible teacher. I learned all of this stuff in highschool and passed fine, but she's made it 10000x more confusing and is nitpicky about the exact method you use to get your answers on quizzes. Additionally, she has a horrible attitude and will berate students both on the zoom calls and during office hours. Do not recommend at all

This class just sucks, there's not other way of putting it. Sherry is fine. She's not amazing, but not awful. The quizzes in recitation are super hard and nothing at all like the notes or homework we do. The exams are pretty easy. I haven't gone on the zoom for a Sherry lecture since August and I'm doing just fine, the class just sucks.
Professor Seress prepares pre-lecture notes for students to use before each lecture. This is very useful for taking notes on exactly what we need to know. The class was by no means difficult.

The main reason I rated Sherry with a 3/5 is because if you have any extenuating circumstances, she is willing to work with you and help you get back on track. While her lectures weren't the best, if you go to her office hours you'll be fine. Just be prepared to take matters into your own hands in this class.
Pretty easy to pass if you have previous algebra experience. If you do the review PDFs that she gives then the tests are very easy to pass.

Math isn't my thing, but her lectures are too fast to learn anything, and she still doesn't have time to go over everything in the section. This happens daily. She doesn't seem personable at all. I don't feel like she cares about her students and teaches too many students for you to feel important to her.

Rarely ever answers her email or questions in class, moves through notes too quickly during lecture and calls out people rudely and by their name. Quizzes, midterms, and exams are the bulk of your grade, which means there is barely any wiggle room to fail. Despite assigning a lot of homework, its only worth 5% of your grade. The TA is great.
Terrible professor that does not care about you at all, literally listened to her call a student embarrasing

Not a good Professor. Math is usually hard for a lot of individuals and to ignore people's questions or not wanting to answer because " we should already know" isn't a professor that you should go for. If you struggle with math this is not a professor you should choose.

Sherry is quite possibly the worst professor I have experienced in all four years of my undergrad. She acts like she is put out by students asking questions and doesn't make any adaptations when students express they aren't understanding a concept. Her response is simply "I have to get through x amount of material in a day, sorry about your luck".

She teaches like someone who hates being stuck at a lower level. Math 1148 covers content that was taught in high school, but she makes it so much harder than it needs to be. Lectures are an hour long but you could get the same info in 5 minutes on khan academy. Im more confused about most of the math procedures now than before I took this class.

worst professor ever. She doesn't care about her students even though we were in the middle of a pandemic. Would usually cut people off when they asked questions. Quizzes and Test were too detailed . Also was very strict on turning in test on time, if you were having a wifi- issue she wouldn't care 10% off the test right automatically.

She grades so harshly and her quizzes are in person for me (during recitation). You have to show all work and there is too much nitpicking in how you show your work. Her lecturing is a bore and she will turn down your questions in the chat very frequently. I cant say she really cares about how you do in her class.

Professor Seress provides PDF files of the lecture notes before every class. She is the best math teacher I have ever had and truly cares about the quality of her teaching. She would reach out to the students not doing too hot and expect them to come to her office hours so she could better teach. Well-rounded awesome professor.

Pretty good professor for level of math taught. Goes painfully slow for the material you learned in 8th/9th grade. Somehow got an A- because the final was cumulative and i didnt really study. Very easy teacher and easy A, if you have to take than I recommend her. Write down due dates.

Sherry was a terrible teacher in my opinion, she was bad at communicating and did not want her students to succeed. She made all the exams way harder then they needed to be and didnt teach most of what was on them. She has given no extra credit or curves when they are clearly needed.
probably the worst, most confusing professor I've ever had

Sherry's lecturing left a lot to be desired. I heavily relied on tutoring to get me through this class. Anything that came out of Sherry's mouth felt incomprehensible. She wasn't very lax on disability accommodations, either. Prepare to do a bunch of assignments and feel confused the entire time.

Wish I could give a 0. She has a horrible attitude& is honestly just bad @ teaching. She doesn't take the time to answer student's questions & expects us to know everything. Goes through problems like she is doing it herself & barely teaches. Tests were brutal and stuff we never learned was on it. Would rather drop out then take this class again

She honestly made this class 1000% more difficult than it needed to me. On top of that, she lacked empathy and was not very understanding. We are in a pandemic and she did not care one bit. Puts you on the spot if you ask a question and goes way too fast. Hard to keep up with and speeds through without giving time to ask questions. Horrible.

She is a nice person, but as a professor- no good. Starts before class even started and finish way after it was supposed to end. Sometimes when u ask questions (when she got to them) she almost scolds u and puts u on the spot. She also teaches VERY fast. Hard to keep up. Tough grader& takes points off for every little thing. if you get her, switch.

She teaches quite fast, so she is hard to keep up with sometimes. As long as you show up the lectures and ask questions for recitations you should pass the class easily. Show up and take notes, ask questions, and you'll pass.

Sherry wasnt very understanding considering we are all in a pandemic. Also, her lectures are very heavy and full of content. She also leaves a lot of work on her TAs which arent very great either. She doesnt always get through stuff in class and added some stuff that she never touched base on in the exams.

Sherry isnt really a great teacher but you understand everything if you follow along with the examples. Shes quick sometimes in lecture. Go to recitation! And do all of your homework and LP/RPs its easy. Do practice exams and youll pass. Its not bad at all. I maybe put in 2-3 hours outside of class time at Most

This professors taught at fast speeds and expected us to know certain things without going into details. Her lectures were content heavy and if we didn't have enough time she said to do it on your own. like that's not what i am paying you for. She also had 4 exams and a final which was brutal on us. The exams were timed and the problems were hard.
Awful professor, not accommodating.
She is the least useful part of Math 1148, she's less of a teacher than google images explaining equations in my opinion.

She would not answer student's questions. She would go over material extremely fast, and ignore an in-class questions. Would not recommend her or take this class again. If I could give her a zero I would.

Professor Sherry was great! I took her class AU20 and it was very well organized and very straight forward. I dont know why so many people complain about her, but if you put assignments and exam dates into your calendar from the syllabus you should be just fine.
She was open to always helping anyone

A lot of people complained about her during the semester but honestly if you actually read the syllabus and go to lecture and recitation and actually practice the homework they give you like you're supposed to you'll do fine.

Absolutely awful. She has an attitude and gives simple problems during lectures but difficult and advanced ones in the homework. Teaches very fast and doesn't accommodate well with technology issues on both ends. I'm sure if the lectures were in person she'd be a lot better professor. Learned more from recitation than the actual lectures.

Sherry really tries to help her students. Sometimes her lectures can be kind of boring. I preferred this course online instead of in-person as you can fast-forward and pause lectures. Online homework was very annoying and time-consuming.
She is not nearly as bad as people say. She is very willing to help during her office hours and gives out helpful practice problems for the tests.

Sherry gets a bad rep for some reason. The class is easy, she explains the concepts in a dumbed down way, and you know what you have to do to pass. She holds a lot of office hours and is always willing to talk about your grades and other things. Shes sassy but in all honesty it is quite funny.

The class was pretty easy, but Sherry was an okay prof. She gets really sassy and rude sometimes and she doesn't explain things well sometimes, but recitation clears up info so its pretty easy. I got As on all exams and did not really pay attention. The only thing I hated was the amount of homework. It was a lot sometimes. overall she's fine.

Sherry is awesome! Her lectures are very clear and she records them and posts them on Carmen so you can go back to them if you dont understand something. Test questions are just like questions on the notes. just be sure to show all your work on exams and midterms cuz if you skip one small step in showing your work she will mark the whole problem.

I hate math, but algebra is easy for me. I never attended lectures or recitations. ConnectMath was my teacher and I did well on the exams. She makes you do stupid pointless discussion posts where you ask a question about the lecture to get credit. It was hard to come up with questions sometimes and they were easy to accidentally forget about...

Very fair teacher, a little heavy on the connectmath homework but other than that she goes over the material very well. She records her (online) lectures but if I didn't go to the live one I wouldn't end up watching it. But she also doesn't give us our class grades which drives me insane. She wants us to calculate it ourselves with the syllabus.

Lemme put it out here first that I absolutely suck at math and was actually placed in the math class below this but got bumped up by my advisor. Im really confused as to why she has such a low rating shes an excellent teacher and the class was so easy. The work load is bigger but not really that bad. Dont do Sherry like that yall.
bad

Sherry Seress is an okay teacher, she does a decent job explaining the concepts and I usually caught on pretty well. The homework is usually tedious The real problem was with her being online- she is completely inept. Disconnections, lag, saying she's "being hacked", not knowing how to do stuff, etc. Would probably be fine in-person, avoid online.
gives cookie cutter problems in the lecture that a brain damaged toddler could solve but on the homework its ten times more advanced and half the stuff we didn't go over
Was very rude, notes were illegible
basically doesn't teaches, uses connect math and it will grade you wrong if you breath in the wrong direction, concepts are easy but if you a sped in math, good luck lmao.

Genuinely the worst class that I have ever taken. Somehow makes simple algebraic concepts seem as hard as calculus. EXTREMELY condescending and never elaborates on challenging topics that need further detail. Basically inaccessible outside of class and she'll respond to your email (if you're lucky to even get a response) within 2 weeks.
Its a pretty easy class if youve taken algebra before. However all she does is do a problem and doesnt take any questions. She can also be condescending and her voice gives me a headache.

She speeds through an hour of lecture covering 5 different topics giving all the answers without taking questions and at the very end be like "so you guys understand that, right?" 2 seconds later - "Okay, great well I'll end the recording here and see you guys next time." Every. Single. Lecture. It's just awful. Make your TA your best friend.

If you struggle with math, I would recommend avoiding this professor. Her "lectures" are just her doing the problems for you and she expects you to memorize the steps ("I'm doing for this for your sake, not mine"). She's virtually inaccessible outside of the lectures. If you send her an email, you'll never get a response.

The "teacher" who I refuse to call a professor is so "matter of fact" in her lectures that anything other than her word is wrong. If I could put the "DOES THE PROBLEM FOR YOU" tag I would. There is no learning here other than what you can memorize on your own. Avoid if you really struggle at math.
Hello homework every week! Some of the stuff in the homework we didnt learn until the next week so I had to Photomath hella of the problems and the theres quizzes every Wednesday.

So I am not good at math, at all. It is difficult to have a professor that does the problem for you and expects you to follow those steps. That is not teaching. If you are slow with math as I am, be careful with the professors you choose. Always have one that's more supportive and understands your learning ability. Not everyone is the same.

Horrible Horrible Horrible. I dont know whats wrong with her. Avoid her at all costs, shes just another type of human being. Shes rude, cant teach and probably doesnt know what shes talking about. Honestly if you get stuck with her, I would advise you to work on connect and talk with your TAs. Shes honestly the worst.

Her lectures aren't anything bad or special, I don't understand the bad reviews. She does guided notes which are super helpful and outlines all the info you need to know. Make sure you go to class for the midterm reviews, she throws in random never before covered questions that will be on the test.

This class is not as hard as people are making it out to be. If you are decent or good at math, don't worry because you will do well even if you don't like the professor. Just make sure to go over her notes before exams and quizzes because if you can do them without looking at the answers, the exams should be easy. TAs can be a helpful source too.

She's not as bad as others may think, but she definitely can be snippy at times in lecture. The first couple exams were easy but the third exam and final were not the easiest. Definitely a do able class if you attend lecture and recitation!

If you can avoid this professor, do so. She is very vague and extremely lecture heavy. She basically does the problems for you and then you have to go from there. There are not very many outside resources to help with exam prep (study guides, practices problems, etc.). Overall, the class was poorly organized and hard to follow.

I have never been great at math however in all my years at OSU Ive never just flunked out of a math course until I had Sherry as a teacher. She is AWFUL the best advice I can give you is to really use your resources. Go to the math center and try not to skip recitation because that is the only reason Im getting through it this time. Good luck.

Her lectures were not helpful as she did a poor job of explaining things and constantly made mistakes that students had to catch. She's the type of person that doesn't answer the question you emailed her. Constantly had to remind her to upload notes (for those who take electronic notes). You're better off skipping lectures and going to recitation.

Horrible instructor DO NOT TAKE HER!! Does NOT explain any of the material well. Talks down to students as if we are children. Focuses more on basic concepts than difficult to understand ones. Is not helpful AT ALL when preparing for exams.

Lectures are optional, recitation saves me. Her notes are easy to follow but she sometimes goes too fast during more difficult material. She is fine besides being snippy sometimes which I personally find hilarious. Online homework every week and quiz every week. Grade mostly dependent on midterm and final.
Rude, Unclear, Confusing. Made me struggle in a class I breezed through in high school. Would recommend otherwise.

Very condescending when it comes to questions in lecture, doesn't let TAs give you examples of what you will be tested & quizzed on (you must provide examples on your own, stupid), & seems to not care about your grade. I used to love math & I was in advanced math all through high school & she confused me about things I already knew. dont take her.
Super confusing, test content wasnt clear

Condescending, explains concepts in the most difficult ways. I came in being pretty good at math and already having taken pre-calc before but the way that she explains concepts makes it incredibly difficult to understand even if you've come across it before. Go to the math help center every day if you can, they are far better teachers .

Sherry is by far the worst lecturer in the math department, and every other instructor knows it. The terrible thing about OSU, is that you cannot chosen tour Math instructor. If you end up with her, Im sorry. Sherry is rude, mean-spirited, and honestly doesnt explain anything well. Overall, she doesnt care about us, just her paycheck.
Worst math professor ever. Not clear on what's going to be on the exam. PLEASE DO NOT TAKE HER IF YOU CARE ABOUT YOUR GRADE!
Sherry is literally the worst. Thats all you need to know.

So so so so so bad. Horrible hand writing but more importantly she explains simple things in the hardest most complex way possible which confused the whole class and made us all feel defeated. She lies about what to expect on tests- especially the final... Get OUT if you have her as your math professor.

The sloppiest hand writing i have ever seen - you fill in the lectures notes so you actually need to see what she's writing, but you can't make it out. Goes so quickly through the content and hands down one of the worst prof ive ever had. do not recommend
You are better off transferring than taking a course with her

Sherry gets a really bad reputation but she is very clear on what you need to do in order to succeed. This is probably the most Ive ever worked in a math class to get an A but it is doable if you follow her advice which is foremost to review her lecture notes. If you can re-fill out her notes without help before each exam, you WILL get an A.

I was often so frustrated with this prof. bc I would be completely confused when she was teaching only to figure out, wait I already KNOW this, and I know how to do this in a simpler way. lectures are boring but the only reason to go is for the word problems, I really tried to like this prof. just too fast during lecture and too confusing.

She gives out good notes but will teach you like you've never learned how to add 2 + 2 before. She also tends to be really fast during lecture. Her one motto is to "always look at my paper notes, not the online homework" even though much of the exam questions come from homework. The tests are also designed to trick you and mess you up.

Good luck keeping up-quizzes are every week and Youll have about two or three days to learn whats covered in the lectures. The book you have to buy because its for the online HW but it doesnt corispond with what you work on in lecture. You we have to hope On getting a good TA but with the lack of communication Sherry levees them in the dark also

Sherry really knew how to make herself come off as snarky and pompous. Listening to her speak, one would think she was Einstein in a room full of Patrick Stars, however Einstein had to constantly prove his superior intelligence. The word condescending does not do it justice.

Sherry's style helped me understand concepts pretty well. You must pay attention the entire lecture and skipping her lectures will almost certainly lead to exam failures. She is good at leading students through problems and the guided notes are almost exam "cheat sheets", which is nice. She organized content well and gave solid explanations.
Success in this class came from my TA and the free tutor room. Use outside resources because the material isn't hard to understand, it just needs to be taught. Study and practice the homework.

Sherry is a very condescending person and if you ask her any questions she will look at you like you don't have brain. If you get a good TA this class isnt that bad but Sherry rushes through topics that are more difficult and takes the whole lecture on simple topics.

The lectures are fast paced; she does provide guided notes which is helpful. Online homework and weekly quizzes are essential for a good grade. She is a bit of a tough cookie, prepare to work hard. You need the textbook for the online homework code and not much else.

Easily one of the worst teachers I have ever had. Very condescending and explains easy concepts in confusing ways. The only reason I did well in this class was because I learned a lot of the material in high school

Ive never been that bad at math and I went into the class feeling pretty prepared because I thought I knew the content. Well she makes math so complicated, honestly half of the time I had no idea what she was talking about. Also the homework and midterms are hard because she doesnt prepare you for them. Take it with another professor if you can.

Sherry makes the easiest tasks hard. She expects you to know as much about math as she does and treats the class as such. Topics are simple topics however sherry has an incredible knack for making things more difficult than need be. Unless you are a math person DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH SHERRY. She has a condescending attitude and is not a good prof
