If you are like me and math is your worst subject then DO NOT take a class with sherry. Her lectures feel very fast paced and she is incredibly hard to keep up with. When someone asks her to slow down she very condescendingly states that we should be able to keep up and is overall not a good professor. Your better off watching videos on YouTube.

Makes easy concepts hard, speeds through concepts. Has a slight attitude when you ask questions in class and when you rephrase it, still doesn't answer it. I have previously taken Calculus and the way she explains material is confusing for College Algebra.

I came from college calculus to college algebra because of placement. I literally went to 2 lectures at the beginning and never showed up again other than quizzes once a week. The night before exams I would review homework and do the online practice questions and I got an A on everything. Tip: YouTube is 100% better than going to the lectures.

Doesn't explain concepts very well. In lecture, she provides packets that you follow along/ fill out but she writes fast. My TA wasn't the best so I went to the tutoring center to meet with a different TA (s/o to Aidan) in order to pass. E-textbook comes with access code for weekly online hw but I never used it. Online hw can be like 50 problems/wk
Pretty easy honestly, she will cut you slack if you need it with homework. I never did it and also didn't study enough for tests, they're not hard but I didn't really know anything.

We had a midterm where the average was 52, and she said she wouldn't curve it unless we all failed all the other exams, not cool. Her lectures are very boring, half the people fall asleep. She doesn't explain things in detail, so if you struggle with math like me, I would advise against taking her.

The course can be challenging and it is very fasted paced. I personally struggled with the course especially towards the end. Just remember to utilize all the resources. Go to the math center and your TA office hours as much as possible.(Serious) Also don't be afraid to ask questions if you don't understand the material, trust me it will help!

She gets a lot of bad grades on here talking about exam averages and what not. It's like any math course, where the lecturer only has 55 minutes to cover an entire section or chapter. Really, your TA that teaches the Recitation is more important as far as learning goes, so if you're nervous you won't learn from that TA, find another.

I went into the course confident bc I took calc in high school, did well on the first midterm, then stopped going to class. Big mistake. The midterms are pretty challenging if you don't go to class, so make sure to study and do the homework. Sherry isn't the best, but not the worst. Don't feel discouraged if you get her for math. Ask q's during rec

fast-paced professor, but that wasn't really a problem because the material was basic algebra that most people took in HS. Don't get too cocky & think that bc you learned it before that you don't have to show up bc a lot of what you thought you know you've probably forgotten since hs algebra. one flaw is that she made made many mistakes in her work

If you read & take notes from your textbook before lecture then Sherry's lecture will basically serve as a cognitive reinforcer instead of being a hour of confusion & frustration. Sherry is a great lecturer just come prepared.

I agree with everyone else. Sherry takes concepts you learned in high school and makes them a million times more confusing. If you have a great TA for recitation like I did, you'll be fine. If not, get ready to learn a lot of the material on your own.

Pointless lectures. Pace is too fast for math and acts like you should already know everything. Things I learned years ago, she taught in an entirely different manner, making concepts very confusing. I decided to drop out after a few weeks. I felt like I spent hours on homework only to receive very little points. Most points come from exams.

Everything that she covered in the lectures just made concepts I had already learned in previous classes much more difficult to understand. The only reason this class was manageable was because of the recitation .

I'm with everyone else on sherry. She makes everything so so so confusing. Worst math teacher ever. You basically have to teach yourself everything after class unless your a math major. She also refuses to slow down when the whole class tells her she's going too fast. She told us we need to learn faster.

Sherry moves with the rapid pace of a NASCAR race. By the time you have copied everything down from the board, she is on to the next problem, which leaves you with little-to-no time to understand what was just taught. I never thought that such a basic level algebra class could be so difficult, but she ensures that you leave each lecture confused.
PSA: AVOID HER AT ALL cost. Professor Seress could make the problem 2 + 2 seem like a NASA engineering problem. Horrible teacher and acts like every student should know as much as her.

During the lectures she when way to fast for me, i understand we only have 55 mins but she could slow down some. I also didn't like the way she explained things. I felt like i learn more from the TA than i did from here. Also the class is worth the most points in the class, so i you  get an E or D you drop a few letter grades. DON'T TAKE  WITH HER.
Very nice and willing to help. STUDY HER LECTURE NOTES they are basically the exam questions.

Definitely cares about your grade in the class. She's very clear about her availability and wants to make sure you get the help you need to succeed. Lectures are pretty clear and she goes over material on review days that will be on midterms.

Sherry is not a bad professor whatsoever, she just is not personable in any way, shape, or form. I tried to approach her and she immediately became defensive even when I was being completely respectful. If you don't care to interact with a professor, she's a good teacher just not my favorite person.
She teaches the stuff ok, but I stopped going to lectures. Unless you struggle in math, recitation will cover everything you need.

I learned all of the content in high school but Sherry made it impossible to understand. She is awful at explaining things in simple terms. Attendance isn't taken, so honestly if you have her I would just find someone to get the notes from and just go to recitation.

If you are not a math person, do not take Sherry's class. She thinks you know just as much as her but were not all math majors, Sherry! Probably going yo have to retake this class and you better believe I won't be taking it with her.

The material in this class shouldn't be hard but Sherry makes sure that it is. She goes way too fast in lecture so you barely have time to write everything down let alone actually comprehend it. Find someone who doesn't mind sending you the notes and just go to recitation.

This professor sends out notes with gaps in them that you print off and just fill in the gaps as she fills out her paper on the projector. If you struggle with math Sherry explains it in a very clear way. She specifically tells you how problems are expected to be completed. Attendance isnt mandatory but doing so probably would have gotten me that A

worst professor ever. I learned this stuff in High school and the content is pretty easy but the way she teachers you it is absolutely horrendous!! She makes it so much more difficult that it needs to be. Get another professor if you have her. Worst choice I ever made taking her. She does not help you prepare for the exams. absolute waste!

This class was review for me and I still struggled in it. She talks super fast and assumes everyone already knows the content. I was confused by almost everything she said. You could probably pass the class by just going to recitation..

This class was an interesting one. You really need to keep up with Sherry and pay attention or else you will fall behind. All homework is online. There are multiplier 10-point questions, but they're easy. There are a few midterms and one final. Just study and ask questions if needed, and you'll do well in the class.

Probably one of the worst professors Ive ever had. Was not helpful at all during office hours and was very snippy with you. she didn't seem like she was there to help students just wanted to get the class over with. Horrible professor.

Worst professor ever. I am a very strong math student and I struggled to understand her lectures. Honestly never went to class and just came to recitation.  Had I not already learned the material in high school I probably would have struggled a lot. Terrible lectures, but at least had printable notes she followed with structured problems. DONT TAKE

She's absolutely terrible. I am an excellent math student and ever since i've been in her class, I have not done well. She over complicates things, and barely writes anything done, but expects you to for the exams. I have emailed her asking for help, and she also doesn't respond.

Great professor who prints out notes for you to go along with during the lecture. Midterms are challenging, but not a problem if you understand the material and how it works, not necessarily just having memorized the steps. She's always willing to help and provide comical relief when necessary.

Sherry is a wonderful person, but I stopped going to lectures second week into school. I teach myself the material now and go to recitations only.  Sure it's an easy class if you study and AVOID lectures. She makes easy things soooooo complicated and confusing. She has a great Great personality though !
I have no idea what this woman is even saying ... I know algebra . and day one she made the easiest stuff seem so much harder than it had to be I dont know how she did it.

The class was very easy. If you are good at math at all, then you will get an A no problem. However, Sherry is very scatter brained. She did not explain the material in a very effective way. The quizzes in recitation are easy and usually two questions.

I thought this class was super easy, as I'd learned everything previously. I felt Sherry was very direct with her examples and told us exactly what to expect on exams. I did very well in this class and liked her a lot, but I'm not sure if that's just because I understood the subject matter from earlier years. Over all, easy class, liked her a lot!
She is an awesome teacher and awesome person.  She really cares about every student and she is fun!

She's nice, but unfortunately not that helpful. I have no idea how a 55-minute lecture can seem longer than all my 80-minute ones.  I will miss her pink sweatsuits when the class ends and how she likened math to playing bridge.  (I still don't understand the analogy.) Exams are honestly easier if you just go to recitation.

The material is really not challenging at all. I found her lectures to be extremely extensive and boring. I went to lecture twice the entire semester and only went to recitation on the days we had quizzes. Don't sweat over the online homework, I did about 14 of the assignments and it did not affect my grade at all.

she goes on long tangents all the time, hard to focus in her class, goes super fast doesn't really explain things because she is so used to the material, says to come in for help but doesnt email you back, homework, lecture and recitation notes are easy, quizzes as well but the midterms and final exams are impossible

The material is really easy and the class isn't hard, but she's confusing at times. She goes on long tangents and gets off topic a lot which is annoying. She talks really quietly, too, so its hard to listen. I rarely go to recitation. Go to the review class the day before exams.

Sherry has been at OSU for over thirty years; her experience and diligence makes lectures and office hours rewarding as a student. She is very thorough when it comes to explaining concepts and test expectations, encouraging learning as it is truly meant to be, an experience, not a chore. As a historyenglish nerd, Sherry made me want to learn math!
She is so confusing.  I skipped every lecture and just went to recitation.  Easy A after that decision.
pretty easy

Class will be very intimidating and hard at first. She sometimes gets scattered with her thoughts, but if you pay attention and go to lecture, you're good. GO TO HER OFFICE HOURS. This is the reason I got an A in this class. She is so much more helpful in person! Ended up liking math more after taking this class!

While she was scattered sometimes, she was always making sure everyone in the lecture was learning and understood the material (not an easy task in a 300 person lecture). I'm not sure why she has such bad reviews. At first I struggled but kept going to her office hours and she was a huge help. The class can be intimidating  but stick with it.

Sherry is SO disorganized and unclear when teaching. The only reason I did alright in the class was because of my TA. I would definitely suggest trying to get a different professor if you end up with her. Lecture is useless.

Sherry was terrible. She did not explain information well at all. The only reason i learned anything from this class was because of my TA. Sherry made things more difficult than they needed to be. She is one of the best math teachers I've had. She gives you print out notes each week, which end up being SO helpful. They're always neat, concise, and make it 10 times easier to study from. She's super sweet and always willing to help you! I'd highly recommend her.

Overall a very nice lady. If you ask questions after lecture she will help you all she can. If you go to lecture prepared to learn then you can learn a lot. She wants you to do well. Go To Lecture, because she uses examples that will be on tests. Also, do all the online homework, because it is very helpful if you miss something during lecture.

Didn't explain what she was doing very well, just breezed through examples. Skipped steps. Expected us to know things we didn't. Not usually available for help, and makes mistakes often. Nice woman, bad teacher. (Re-posted due to site randomly logging me out.)

Didn't explain what she was doing very well, just breezed through examples. Skipped steps. Expected us to know things we didn't. Not usually available for help, and makes mistakes often. Nice woman, bad teacher.

Do the homework, attend recitation, go to your TA's office hours, and go to the tutor room, you'll do fine, don't bother going to lecture unless you want to leave with a headache.

*Facepalm. Learned more from my TA (Rachel Arps, who would certainly get all 5s) and my book than I ever learned from Prof. Seress. Unclear, unsure, and unhelpfull. That 48 minutes every lecture would be much better spent reading the book and trying practice problems. Not an enjoyable experience.

I thought her lectures were almost useless and learned more from my textbook and my TA.  If you study the practice tests online and supplement with the homework problems you'll do fine because they are just like the actual exams.

She is a genuinely nice lady who wants her students to do well. She has great reviews before tests. Definitely go to OFFICE HOURS-she has everyone work problems out on the board and its great practice for you. She's a bit quirky but what math prof isn't?
The woman did not make one bit of sense, nor had any idea what was going on. Once compared math as walking in a winter forest.

she's kindof weird, but definitely nice. she really wants her students to do well. i went to all the lectures and she gives a lot of practice problems that are found on the exam (just slightly different numbers). i hate math, did horribly on the final. but with a little curve, got a B.

Tries to teach and wants her students to do well, even goes out of her way to try and find out why her students don't understand the material, but shes just a bad teacher, she breaks down the material so much that she makes something simple seem difficult

I feel sorry for math that it has to have this woman teaching it. Math 148 is an easy class and she makes very basic math hard, furthermore she does not know what she's doing and is constantly making stupid mistakes and confusing herself as well as her students. DO NOT BY ANY MEANS TAKE HER CLAS!!

FAIL. She made the simplest things very difficult.  She couldn't explain anything well.  She was more interested in covering as much material as possible than making sure all of her students understood the material.  My TA was 234092348 times better than the lecturer herself. She seems nice enough but as a teacher she is just godawful. Theres no other word for it. I started going to another lecture 2 weeks into the quarter and never looked back. I feel bad for all those who stayed...
She is pretty out there. She says very weird things and never makes any sense. If you can, avoid sherry at all costs.
i thought lectures were hard to follow and pay attention to.
The Peach Cobbler was delightful...
sucked.

TERRIBLE!!!!!! NEVVEERRR TAKE HER!!!! she is so ridicuously scatterbrained that it makes your head spin. she is a terrible teacher and makes you just want to die. she cant explain anythinggg!! oh my god i cant stress it enough. she is the worst thing that has ever happened to math

I knew more going into the class than when I came out. She was constantly making mistakes and we always had to erase half the notes because she messed up on something stupid The class isn't hard, she makes it that way.

she goes quickly through the lectures so it is hard to keep up. i learned maybe 1 or 2 things she taught the whole quarter. she is  a very nice lady and genuinely interested in helping you understand the materials, but you have to see her out of class if you want her help. i would recommend going to the math lab or seeing your TA for help

She was just a really annoying teacher. Like some have said before, she made really simple things seem hard. My TA was awesome though! Also, she messes up problems a lot, and the class always had to correct her.

No Comments
wow, i dont know if this class was about learning math, or learning her family history.  her son was mentioned every class.

i swear she taught the same lesson two classes in a row, she does not know how to teach

VERY UNCLEAR THE WORST MATH PROF IVE HAD!!!
Overall good professor, but might be too much for some (you just gotta get used to his personality)

Mr. Murphy stops to ask if anyone has questions, he keeps the recitation short, and is helpful when approaching him one-on-one. However, there are times when he can be unnecessarily short with students who ask questions and he often makes errors in grading & lectures. He has a friendly service dog in class and I like the energy it brings to class.

i appreciated michael for making lectures easier to digest, but his demeanour is definitely one to get used to. he comes off as rude or arrogant which throws students off when trying to ask a question but you j have to learn that its not personal and thats j how he is. he does try to talk abt things like movies, legos, and his dog tho.

He was a good TA and could help if you did not understand the lecture. However he was a bit rude at times and was definitely snappy with the class if he was not satisfied with participation, or even if someone asked a question that he did not like.

Good guy just kind of snippy.  I felt like he did try to connect with students and his recitations did help somewhat but he went about it in not the best way.  Honestly a toss up for me.  He did bring his dog to class once and that was my favorite class.

Rather than going to lectures and learning a topic in a complicated manner, just attend Murphy's recitations. He did his best to connect with his students even in an 8 am class. However, while the quizzes were easy the tests the professor made were extremely different, I hope he changes his quiz questions to fit the tests better.

Mr. Murphy is one of the best recitation professors I have had at OSU. He leads recitations for Calc 1131 and goes through helpful examples during each class. He grades some quizzes, homework, and helps on exams, states he could grade easier if he could and if any of us were struggling he does his best to explain all his examples thoroughly.

He's a great teacher. In this Calc for Business class, he was in charge of grading quizzes and homework. Him & other TA's split grading exams. He would definitely grade easier if he could. Tries to give you points when he can. **Loves when class is energetic and talks to him before class, especially later in the day. Cannot stress this enough.**

Mr. Murphy is the best teacher I had this semester. I'm not very strong in math and was super nervous for this class but Murphy's recitations helped me so much. He actually cares if you understand the material and wants you to succeed in the class. Great guy and super nice as long as you show up to class.

He is a TA, and you will learn a lot from him, but he is a horrible person. At the end of the semester I didnt know one person who wasnt completely fed up with how rude and disrespectful he is. He gets mad at you for asking questions and if you dont understand something he is saying... good luck!
Murphy made the lectures so much easier to understand and if you do the practice problems, doing well in this class is very doable.
He is a TA, but honestly I learned more from him than the lecturer. Really enjoyed being in his recitation.

One of the best math teachers/professors I have ever had and he is only a TA. He explains the material in a very straight forward and simple way thus making the course simpler than it otherwise would be.

He frequently works ahead of the lecturer and makes class very confusing. He is very close-minded and opinionated and makes it hard to focus on the math when he is busy talking about his wife or baseball. Although he is clearly enthusiastic about math and being a scholar, his attitude and mode of teaching is highly undesirable. Teach yourself here
Good Professors, very snappy at times. If you can avoid him, if not it's manageable just study hard.

Everything is in person. No online lecture notes, homework submitted in person. If you attend every lecture and copy her notes exactly as written, the exams are easy (homework require more thought). She teaches the course like a textbook - straight to the point with math proofs and definitions, but no indication of how to apply more thought

Professor Terry was a very fair and good professor for this Math course when compared to other professors. Even though 90% of the grade for this class is exams, the exams are very fair. The questions are mainly from or variants from the review packets she gives out. She also is ironically funny in class which makes the lecture somewhat enjoyable.

Be prepared to go to every lecture (which are snooze fests) if you want to do well in her class because she doesn't post her notes online. Tests make up 90% of your grade but they really aren't too hard and I felt they were quite fair. I know there's way harder profs for this class so she's not a bad choice relative to other options.

Dr. Terry does an okay job presenting the material, but a lack of opportunities for student participation makes the lectures dry. Since there is a grader for homework, there are very few opportunities to get direct feedback from her, making exams a shot in the dark. Her grading scheme is unforgiving (90% from exams), but she does curve.

She cannot give lectures without her note.
Only give the definition without explanation.
Just choose other professors.

Feels like a high school class. This might not be super unreasonable, but our homework is due in person unlike every single other professor which does online submissions. Lectures are vague and seem like her just spewing her thoughts onto the board with no explanation, just "here's how you do this". Also, seems boring and uninspired during lecture.

He doesn't show up a lot, but please go to his office hour, he's amazing.

By the way, an advice to avoid losing points foolishly: don't trust your group members too much --- you will never know if they are humble or honest until you truly check their parts.
Difficult course, good professor, and reasonable curve!
Clear lectures, the exams are uniform but less difficult than written homework.

Very good lectures, but a little slow, stays after class for questions and has office hours. He is very knowledgable and is willing to answer/help any student with their questions. Has great exam review with questions to do in class and at home. Posts all lectures online in case you miss class or want to review.

Professor Miller was overall a good professor, though his lectures could drag. I found that he was far more helpful in his office hours. The tests were fairly hard and there was lots of homework. Pay attention in recitation and definitely see him for office hours.

Like Im awesome so I still did great, but I took an online version of the class and I saw the dude once and never again. It was quite difficult stuff and the lectures took like two hours even though they were online slide things. I just did not feel like he gave much of a crap about us and would not recommend the torture of this class to anyone
Very solid professor!

I loved this professor. While some lectures may have felt a little boring, I really liked how he broke down each topic and explained the reasoning behind it. I also loved going to his office hours. He was very helpful at explaining topics more and talking math behind the course if I wanted to!
Solid professor. He goes over all the concepts super thoroughly and slowly to make sure that we understand, even though the material isn't easy. Much more helpful than the other Calc 2 professor.

Even though his lectures were not fun, when I ask him for help, it was somehow more fun than his lectures.

He gives a review sheet usually one week before midterms and I think they are helpful. Many of the midterm questions are similar to the review sheet problems. I thought the midterms were a bit hard but fair for sure.
Overall he's great

Dr. Miller was nice as a person but my biggest criticism is how long it took him to grade exams as well as put up practice material, which in my opinion there was a lack of. His class is definitely passable but I recommend materials such as Paul's Online Notes if you feel you're not getting enough practice/understanding.

I really liked Miller as a professor. His notes were very organized and legible, which I really appreciated. We also weren't assigned a ton of homework in 2153 which was nice. The midterms are kinda brutal. Just show up to lecture and put time + effort into the homework assignments and you'll do fine in his Calc 3 class.

Good professor. I will say he does sometimes go into proofs and explanations that he doesn't really need to in lecture, which may cause you to drone off and miss some other important stuff. There isn't a curve but he does adjust point value on the test, not sure how it works though. Good guy too and loves math.

Jason Miller is a good professor, while Calculus 2 can be a hard class, his lectures are very well explained. I never went to class because I think he is a bit slow for me, but I would watch his lectures on 2x after and they are very well presented. He also understands students' schedules and can be flexible with due dates if you let him know early
I had math 1152 with him and he was a fine professor, then I took math 2568 and it became my nightmare.

Prof Miller provides lecture notes and extra practice for exams.Lectures are well organized and he stops every now and then for questions.Very accommodating if you can't go to class in person(zoom links, posts recordings).The class is difficult,but not impossible.Stay on top of Ximera assignments, go to office hours, tutoring, or your ta for help!

He is a greate lecturer. He prepared all the materials detailedly and carefully. Actually, I have learned a lot from this class. Everyone konws that Math 1152 which is calculous 2 is difficult, but professor Miller explains every concepts carefully and answer every question patiently. I wish all my lecturers in later classes can treat us like him.

Overall this class had a lot of assignments, but none of them were terribly taxing. I found the class very do-able and the material was very straightforward. I liked that he did not put trick questions on exams. He also rounded my grade up at the end without me even having to ask him. Super reasonable and nice.

math 1116 is okay, but boring. not sure if it is because it was online due to covid or because prof is boring. the homework is kind of difficult and takes a while to complete. it is basically explaining math, so if writing is difficult, let alone math is difficult for you, you might want to reconsider. i know a lot of people pass/failed this class.

Will give out a take home quiz (that takes a lot of work to complete) and makes it due in class 2 days later (Not enough time). His lectures are pointless. Dont go. He goes over proofs and pointless theorys for 85% of the time. The other 15% is useful examples that you can find on Carmen because he posts his notes there. Boring, dont take w Him

He does a good job making a notoriously difficult math class more bearable. The content can be dry, but he does his best to keep you engaged. He's great at answering questions and he posts his notes and videos of his lectures online.

This class?... Not great. Lecture was necessary but it was not always interesting (I do enjoy it when he gets excited about math, however). Our section did consistently below the mean of the entirety of 1172. I don't know what he did with Taylor Series though because those things make more sense than anything else I learned in the course.

Very boring lecturer. I came from a very good math program at my high school and this class was pitiful. There are ways to make math exciting and engaging for people who aren't even that gung-ho about the subject, but Miller made it dry and unrewarding.
Had him for an online class (Excursions in Math), the material is a little weird, but the class is very fair. Definitely do the lessons and keep up with the class so the exams aren't too hard!
Went to lectures, but they assume you've taken Calc in high school and know some stuff
Good

I really enjoyed Jason as a lecturer. If you bring your exams to him, it is possible that he will give you points back. Don't forget about the MSLC tutoring website for practice.

Very boring lecturer that makes you automatically sleep when he starts going over the theory behind different formulas. He complicated the concept 10 times more. No curve for the class and even though the syllabus says that he rounds grades its all bs because I was at 88.6 and didnt get rounded to 89(A-). Keep up with the material or fail.

He is a very nice lecturer who wears the same outfit everyday, but I do not like him very much because his classes are too dry to understand. You have to spend more time on this subject. He never skips class even we had a fire alarm, u know, we took the class in ring-rang. Generally, he is a good choice if you can focus on him in all 55min.

Jason proves to be a good choice for the Calc I teacher. It's a pretty standard course despite the professor but Jason has a good grasp on teaching the concepts behind what will be mostly midterms and quizzes. The lectures can be dry but he does teach what you need to know.
Lectures very boring and repetitive, online lectures much better
He may wear the same outfit everyday but he has a special place in our lecture's heart!

I thought he was very good at explaining calculus, which can be a hard thing to do. 1172 is a hard course but Miller made it easier. Wears the same outfit everyday, and is a really nice dude. Go to his office hours for the projects and he will just give you the answers.

Dr. Miller does fine with lectures. Nothing special, but makes them engaging enough so as to not fall asleep. He does what he can with a "weed-out" class for freshman engineering majors, so most of the course material is not up to him but rather the course coordinator. Still, you won't go wrong with him if you have a choice.
Jason was very clear and if you go to class and actively engage you should have no trouble with this course. Study up because exams are 5/7 of your grade

His lectures are quite boring but he does a decent job at presenting the material clearly. He's kind of a mysterious person, especially considering he wears the same black champion shirt to lecture every day. His tests are difficult, but fair, and the homeworks for the most part are easy points.
Great lecturer, also ready for class and explains things clearly and easy to understand.
1172 is hard with any teacher. Jason made it easy. Great in office hours
I love Jason.  Very good teacher, explains the material well.

Jason is a great lecturer and explains topics really well. Although the course material is really difficult,  his lectures give you a clear picture on how to solve the different types of problems and their variations. He also seems like a genuinely nice guy who loves math.

Jason is awesome. He was easily the best T.A. I've had at OSU. He was the only reason anybody in the class managed to pass (although the generous curve at the end helped as well.) He was extremely knowledgable and always very interested in helping students. Only fault is he sometimes slow in returning homework in a timely manner.

taught me fractions :)
Professor Urick poured water on a female student. He is a funny guy, but way too smart to understand.
Very intelligent guy. However, he has a tendency to make you feel inferior upon asking for help

He is a very nice and great professor, and he knows how to teach. He really wants to let you understand. He encourages you to ask questions in the class and he will even give you a penny for finding his mistake. 
Accessible outside the classroom, and very knowledgeable, will answer your questions in math, physics and engineering.

Professor Gerlach is such a great lecturer and mentor to general relativity. He apperantly has vast knowldege on mathematics and physics. He is trying to help you build solid pictures on physics. You may think the course is lack of examples. But he is super available and willing to help everyone! Talk with him outside of the classroom. Respected!
Outstanding professor, who used to give you a penny if you caught him making a typo/mistake on the whiteboard. Kept you alert!

I took a class in General Relativity from Professor Gerlach in 1973. He set me on a course of learning Physics, in which I previously had no interest. He was the biggest influence on my way of thinking ever.  I have spent 40 years pondering and reviewing the things he taught me. I am very grateful to Professor Gerlach.
Very good teacher.  I learned a lot from him. He makes sure you understand and if he sees the class does not understand a topic well he would revisit it.  His way of teaching is really good also.

The subject matter is not lightweight.  The concepts are difficult to convey in the best of worlds...but if you have the patience to persevere so does the instructor.  I managed to learn more from this instructor than any other at OSU.

I totally agree with the last respondant. Incredibly difficult hw and final. Takes off points without explanation. Very nice guy, but it is hard to connect concepts from day to day as we seem to jump around and dont follow the book
Am I taking crazy pills?  This guy is bad.  Unfair harsh grader, litte-no feedback on hw, impossible take home exam.  knows his stuff and nice guy, but bad proff

As long as you show up and pay attention, you can do quite well in this class, and learn a lot.  However, under NO CIRCUMSTANCES should you EVER ask for a take-home final... He'll eat you alive.

He is an excellent professor and teaches great mathematical techniques. His English is very good. The only thing is that it needs a lot of time and effort on the student's part for the material to sink-in.
The material was very difficult, but he made it easier and was also funny!

Not good. She was understanding and cared, but I think she doesn't teach well. She spoke extremely quickly and quietly, so good luck hearing in the back. Lectures were disorganized and horribly boring. Homework was tedious. Exams were fine. I stopped going after Spring Break, it was easier to read the book/do HW than go to class.
Good professor, difficult course

Dr. Joshua is extremely unorganized and does not use Canvas. He has an HTML website with many broken links. His lectures are very long and quiet. I watched DaveExplains on YouTube instead. We had to ask him to fix a lecture because he reuploaded lecture 5 for 17. Grading system heavily skewed (45% final dropped me from 95% to an A-).
Do not take.
Run! The professor is very irresponsible, if you really want to learn something about linear algebra, go to Fei-Ran Tian's section!

Entirely quizzes and exams with no grade boosters. Horrible at lecturing. Gave misleading information about quizzes leading to me not watching enough lectures for some quizzes despite watching 3 every week and trying to stay ahead. I read this page prior to taking him and thought it'd be fine, don't do what I did and please find another professor.

Does not respond to any emails. Does not show up to office hours. Lectures are confusing. He gives misleading information about upcoming quizzes. For example, he made an announcement that a quiz would cover a specific set of lectures, but when I took the quiz there was material from future lectures for the next week. Worst OSU professor.

Course content is not difficult. However, this professor makes this course very unenjoyable. He is unorganized, does not use Canvas, does not input grades correctly, and does not respond to emails. Additionally, his teaching is not good. His speech is soft and hard to understand, and his handwriting is borderline illegible. Avoid if possible.

This is the worst professor I have ever had throughout my four years in College thus far. He never checked his email and he didn't show up for office hours.

He was dismissive whenever I tried to bring problems up with him. 

He seems to not care about his students at all.

His lecture videos are hard to understand and his handwriting is hard to read. The course grade is ENTIRELY quizzes and exams, with weekly quizzes. He does give partial credit, however. He uses his own website instead of Carmen, and has used the same Carmen page for multiple semesters, removing past students so they can't view the page anymore.
Notes and recorded lectures took some time to understand but overall great teacher and easy class.

I'm only two weeks into him as a professor. Thus far, he A)failed to describe or at the very least failed to emphasize the required format for proctorio quizzes (that is stated in one line on his password protected website he uses instead of carmen) and B) refuses to provide an answer key to the homework that is not turned in nor graded.

I took this class over the summer and he was accommodating and friendly. The grades are just based off quizzes and exams, and they are all insanely if you watch the lectures and do the sample problems (with answers!). Sometimes theyre the exact same questions. He does have an accent and fancy handwriting that can be hard to understand at times.

First of all, this course is asynchronous and there is not such a slide or exact textbook to learn. Everything is from his lecture videos, but it is really hard to understand or keep track of his videos. His writing illegible, which will take you a long time to watch a video. To watch 50 min lecture, took average of 80 minutes for me to understand.

He is the worst professor I've ever had. Having him on zoom didn't help. His mic was low quality and you could not understand a word he was saying. All he does during lecture is read his pre-written notes to us, and his handwriting is impossible to read. Normally I'm good at math, too. Switch out of his class and find a different professor asap.

Does not respond kindly to emails; really doesn't care about feedback from students and takes offense to feedback. Is an asynchronous class, despite that when I signed up for it, it said it was synchronous. This could either be a good or bad thing depending on student. Illegible handwriting, cannot hear his voice in the recorded lectures.

I currently have him for online class because of the pandemic. No one can understand his lectures. The audio is terrible and his handwriting is equally terrible. Please take the class with someone else if you can.

My goodness, I thought I'd seen the worst with Calculus 2. I had Roy Joshua for linear algebra, and I can confidently say that is it the most stressful course I've taken in my entire life. His handwriting is very hard to read, he takes weeks to respond to emails, his lectures are not at all engaging and dull, and his test prep sucks.

AU 19. Sit in the front or else you'll have no idea what he's saying (soft talker). Had his own website where he had links to uploaded notes, quiz answers, etc. but he did not upload a majority of them/links were broken. The midterms were basically a compilation of the quizzes, so not too hard. Read the book and go to lecture to get a decent grade.
Prepare to learn the material on your own

Basically just steps through the proofs without much explanation of thought processes or how you would actually come up with them. Quizzes/tests don't have any big surprises, you'll know what's going to be on them and what to study (i.e. what proofs to remember how to do).

I would give Roy Joshua a worse score, but there are so many terrible math professors here that he was actually fine by comparison. There were weekly quizzes but they were pretty easy. Exams also weren't too bad, and he pretty much told us what the questions would be beforehand. I'm pretty sure the curve was pretty large as well.

Hard to describe him as a professor. His accent & handwriting can be hard to understand, and his quizzes and hws are pretty hard (they're not worth much in the overall grade though). Thought I was gonna get a C the whole semester but somehow ended up with an A-. His midterms aren't bad/ come from practice tests and repeated problems in the notes.
I'm going to have to retake this class. Be ready for proof after proof after proof. Barely can understand his accent. I can never read his notes. Ugh.

Not a terrible class. He can be pretty hard to follow at times but goes over topics several times that are important. Exams aren't impossible and his grading is decent for the most part. Do the homework and take good notes in class. Practice exams, if he posts them, are pretty helpful.
Talks really fast and faces the board when he writes so its hard to takes notes sometimes. Examples that he works out in lecture multiple times will 100% be on the test.

I am taking him for 566 now. Basically the thing about this professor is to check his site and check to see if his old tests are up, he reuses them so you have the answers. If not go through and do as many problems in the book, he takes quiz and test questions directly from it. His grading scale is really easy, 35 gets you a D.

The class was very easy. He was not a tough professor, but he was not the best professor. His handwriting is very illegible sometimes, and he mumbles a lot. More often than not, he would lecture straight from the book, so that the examples in class were the same as they were in the book. However the class was fairly easy!

This class is so bad, he is probabaly the second worst teacher i have ever had. He goes to the board and just goes off in his own little world. At the end of class he is the first to leave. He did not prepare us well for the final.
Sucks, but if you have any old quizes or midterms they will be simular. Final was hard and did not pepare us well!!!!
He doesn't always know what he is doing.  The material on the exams is much harder than the material taught in class.  Be sure to read the book if you take this class.

He does not know what he is doing. He does not speak clearly. If you are a flash note taker, go ahead and try. He is not organized and give extremely hard exams. Please stay away from this prof or else you are going to regret your whole life like me.
An irresponsible professor. Do not recommend for students really want to learn Calculus 3!
Easy tests but irresponsible professor, do not recommend for the students who really want to learn the knowledge of Calculus 3.

Calculus 3 is moderately complex, but Dr. Ko's teaching attitude was problematic. She didn't take her lectures seriously. Her exam questions aren't complicated. I took her class for one month in Spring 2023 and then dropped out and enrolled in Sean Sanford's section in Fall 2023 (I got an A-) because I couldn't learn anything from Dr. Ko's class.

If you have Dr. Liling Ko in your Calculus 3, you are lucky enough compared to your peers. Even though she had trouble explaining some complicated concepts, you can still understand them through her notes. 45% of my peers get an A range as the final grade in AU 23. You will get an easy A as long as you do some practice before her exams.

I truly feel like I learned a lot from Dr. Ko's lectures and would take another class taught by her. Her lecture style is very straightforward, but her notes are very detailed and easy to follow. Do the practice material she gives you and you will do well in this class.

Dr. Ko's class hinges on the willingness to understand the material. The class gets harder and the lectures get faster but are always manageable. At times, I did have to spend time outside class to make sense of the material. Homeworks can get long but are pretty straightforward. Midterms were on the easier side. She wants you to do well.
Professor Ko speaks incredibly fast and breezes through the material without giving students time to understand it. Exams are very theoretical and are graded harshly.

Her lectures are alright, but I felt like I actually learned more in recitation. She talks a bit fast, which makes her hard to understand at times. Also one of our midterms was "accidentally too hard" (oopsie :) ) which tanked a lot of our grades, and we were pretty upset about that as there is no curve in the class.

she got awesome, sound notes that she used to teach the lecture. It's understandable that sometimes she might go too slow but we can finish our course anyway. It won't be a problem to go too slow. It's a problem if she didn't answer students' questions or care about students' interpretations. But she does answer patiently and care

As a person, Dr. Ko is kind and caring. However, her lectures can be a bit dull and the course is structured unforgivingly. We had consecutive exams the last two weeks of class, worth about 40% of our grade. Doing well early is imperative to succeeding in this course as there is no curve. The actual tests and grading are pretty standard.

Ok lecturer, but goes too slow or too fast through material sometimes. The main problem was our final (75 avg), which was a very different format and much more difficult/technical/detailed than the SP22 one and our midterms. Also can be frustrating b/c she makes at least 1 or 2 mistakes on every lecture/exam and has to waste time fixing them.

Ko is a very good professor when it pertains to being straight to the point with content which I respect. The only criticism I had with her class is that she tended to go very fast through her lectures which was very hard to keep up with at times. Overall a solid math professor.

I would not recommend this professor unless you have a large amount of time to spend learning on your own outside of class. OSU's math department and this class are already difficult enough but this professor has little empathy for anyone not keeping up. Tests are graded very harshly with very little work counting for partial credit.
She goes incredible fast when the lecture is hard, and extremely slow when it is easy. And she would not show how to achieve the answer step by step even for the first time.
Great professor to take. She would agree with most of the requests if it is reasonable.

Prof Ko is a very nice and considerate professor. The material is very straightforward and it is what it is, but she obviously has a rich knowledge of mathematics and her deliberative work shows through in her thoughtful lectures. She is a great first time professor and will only get better. If you struggle to follow in class though, watch Youtube.

For a first time professor, pretty good, could have been much worse. Straight-forward lectures with in class examples and blank notes given ahead of time so you can follow her work.  Her exams are very fair and intuitive, with simple calculations and easy numbers. Strict but not unfair. Major downside is she can be hard to follow in class.
Ms. Dutta is an angel. Her lectures are amazing! The homework is difficult but group work is allowed. The tests are very simple.

She is a very nice woman! The lectures were very clear and very good! Homework is a little difficult, but teams are allowed to complete it. There are three midterms, but the lowest grade drop allows trial and error, and the difficulty is not high. The final exam is also easy.

Great professor, every lecture was well prepared and well organized. The homework is a little difficult but teams are allowed, and up to 40% of total grade. Midterm and Final exam questions are very simple, and Midterm has three exams but the lowest drop score. Highly recommend Dutta!

Very solid professor, homework are total of 40% and could be allowed to be completed in groups. Three midterms are very easy and the lowest score would be dropped, which provided room for error. The lectures were well prepared, with written content explaining concepts and projections on the spot. Highly recommended!

Ms. Dutta is an excellent professor. The course itself is challenging, but she pays attention to the explanation of knowledge points so that every student can understand them. I recommend choosing her.

Amazing lecturer that was able to gauge during class time whether students were comfortable with content. She was very good at answering questions and I would frequently stay after class so she could explain concepts more in depth. As a life science major, calculus was never my strong suit, but Prerona made the content much more digestible.

The material is tough but she taught well. She teaches by explaining the concept and then doing practice problems while explaining every step, which is super helpful. There is a lot of homework but the exams were extremely reasonable and were very similar to the practice exams.

She provides students with extremely clear, condensed notes on each topic during lecture but those go really fast, so it's important to review and do the Ximera. Worked great for me because I can't learn math listening to word soup anyway. She responds to emails in 2 seconds and is a caring professor. Very welcoming of questions during lecture.

Considering Calc 2 is one of the hardest required math courses, Dutta did a decent job explaining and showing examples of most concepts. If you actively pay attention in lectures, show up to recitation, and ask questions, you will get through the class. While she does talk fast, if you seek out help and practice(!!), you will be fine in the end.

She talks super fast and sounds very stressed, doesn't help that her accent is very heavy also. She rushes through examples and often leaves most of the students confused. The entire class starts chatting in confusion every time she pauses during a lecture.

Took differential equations with Volkening at Purdue. Very clear lectures and takes time to fully explain questions and get to know students. Her grading started off as unreasonably picky, but she realized that students were being graded too harshly and adjusted her grading style, showing that she wants the best for her students. Would recommend!

I aced all previous calc classes, but cant get past Volkenings Linear Algebra. Her plethora of lecture material make it impossible to take notes. Very little examples done in class, mostly just thms and theoretical things (NOT HELPFUL). HW is graded extremely picky, even compared to my other engineering classes. Take another professor if possible

One of the best professors I have had. Lucky to have her for two courses. Dr. Park is caring and receptive to feedback, ie when a majority of the class struggled on a homework question she would review it in class and would determine if the question was unfair or how to best assist us on the question.

Dr Park has been the best math teacher, let alone professor, that I've had so far. Although her lectures can be confusing at times she always makes sure to allow questions. She is also relatively accessible outside of class times. Given the material in the course she made me understand almost everything. Additionally she uses a heavy curve to help.
Her lecture is always inspring. And we are free to ask her any questions during her office hour and after class. She's super nice and gives large curve for exams. You can learn a lot from her course.

YOU D BETTER DROP FROM THE COURSE! Shes the WORST professor ever. Exams did not cover material from class. Yes, Prepare to getting points off for vague reasons on the exams. Any discussion with her was a torment. Not allowed to learn and use any linear algebraic materials outside the course, or just prepare to receive a warning letter from SOMEONE

There's a disparity between things from the lecture and things from the exams. Be aware of getting points off for vague reasons on the exams and assignments. Avoiding or dropping this class would be recommended for good mental health.

You do not know your actual grade in the class till the end of the semester and she purposely makes exams very hard. Her homework's are much harder than what she teaches in class and is not much help outside of class. She grades very strict and her notes are extremely hard to follow as they are not well organized.

Took AP Calc in high school but wanted to prepare more for calc 2 and 3 so I retook it.  I knew a good portion of the topics and her teaching style eventually made me stop attending lectures as I felt she was confusing everyone.  I learned 10x more from my TA during recitations and from highschool than I did from her lectures.

She was definitely more helpful than most of the linear algebra professors at OSU. She did well explaining really difficult lecture material and was always ready to answer any questions, being super helpful for homework assignments and questions during office hours. Class is still really difficult, but I would recommend taking it with her.

Amazing professor. She is brilliant and it is more than apparent in lecture. She is very helpful in office hours and is willing to meet at other times if you're unable to attend. While attendance wasn't mandatory, going to class can clear up a lot of potential confusion from the notes.

The lectures did not make a lot of sense and confused me more than I already was. She would answer questions but her way of lecturing made the material difficult to understand. Going to recitation and having the TA explain the material was more helpful than the lectures.

She is a pretty decent professor in terms of explaining concepts.  Helps to have a basic calculus understanding coming into this class (AP, high school, something to get your feet on the ground and running). Exams and written HW for this course are graded by TA's who, in my opinion, gave decent feedback.
Soumya just didn't teach very well. That's about it. The material was not well covered.
Was helpful outside of class, however, the lectures made me leave even more confused than when I went in. Khan academy will save you here. Not a fan

I came into Math 1150 already having a transfer credit. Just wanted to review. The lectures are worthless, confusing, goes over time every class. Give yourself adequate time after class to get to the next one, or plan to just walk out during lecture. Be prepared to spend a lot of time on the homework. 1-2 weekly quiz, 5 midterms, 1 final.

Her lectures are awful and a waste of time. I came into college with calc experience and she would just confuse me. she doesn't explain anything and when she does she just explains theories that don't make any sense. The only reason she gets a 2 is because she genuinely cares and is trying to improve her lectures but they just are not good.

Soumya was very nice but not a good lecturer. She explains topics in theory with few practical examples. She also tends to overexplain.  I often left lectures more confused, so its important to have a good TA to explain things a little better.

The lectures aren't very useful. The only negative thing about this class falls mostly on the universities academic curriculum. It's horrible, the information given and how you're expected to learn it is like being force fed cow manure. It's dry, hard to remember and unless you're ready to spend most your time cleaning it up, it becomes a mess.

Although Soumya wasn't my favorite professor, you can tell that she cares about her students and is willing to clarify for you. I learned a lot from the online homework and attending recitation. It's important to learn the material because you will continue to use it throughout the semester.

Soumya is nice enough, but lecture is unbearable to get through. You can tell she is trying hard, but her teaching is confusing and unclear at times. Most people do not bother to go to lecture because of this. If you don't have a good TA, this class will probably be a struggle for you.

This class is easy - each week there's only one homework assignment and one 3 question quiz that we take in person during recitation. Attendance in lectures and recitation is not mandatory, but you have to go to recitation because Soumya cannot teach at all - everyone stopped bothering going on lectures. Lowest 2 quizzes dropped tho

Professor Genao was a great professor for number theory! I took his class as an elective and I really enjoyed it. He was super encouraging in his lectures, and so everyone would participate. Some of his homeworks were challenging but he was always willing to help in office hours. Probably the best math professor I had at OSU, he's a great guy.

If you have to take 1151, take it with Tyler! He is the only reason I did well. Make sure to participate in lecture and the class is super hard, so try to go to office hours as well! He really cares that his students do well and understand the content, which is awesome. Office hours are SO HELPFUL!

Professor Genao is one of the best math teachers I have ever had. He really cares about his student and their engagement in the course. He tries to get students to participate in the lectures. He is very personable and wants to get his students. Go to his office hours and he will love you forever!!

I do not think he goes over enough examples in class that we see on the midterms. I felt unprepared because he also skips explanations of steps. He is knowledgeable in the material but does not care about outside personal life. You get no extensions. This professor said I should "maybe not have a job" and take a loan out and only focus on school.

Despite not doing as well as I would've hoped in the class, that is not at all his fault. He is a phenomenal professor and really cares about individual students. Super personable if you ever get the chance to talk to him 1:1. Any issues I had were with the math department, not Tyler, and he is truly trying his best to help us succeed.

He is very nice and passionate about math. He allows participation in class. The homework is all online including the quizzes and the majority of your grade is midterms and the written homework once a week. The written homework is the same amount of points as the midterms and basically an at home test, so make sure not to blow those off.

Dr. Genao is a fabulous professor. He is super willing to help out and so passionate about math. If you go to his office hours pretty consistently, you'll get to know him really well, and that can be helpful for little grade boosts at the end of the semester (of course aligning with the math department rules on rounding)

Fantastic Calc professor, always willing to help his students out and provides clear analysis on how to solve problems. He is passionate about math and it is reflected in his lectures. Very lowkey and chill guy who does not have overbearing lectures and is always encouraging his students to participate instead of just talking for 55 minutes. 10/10

Professor Genao loves to talk math and theory with his students. His lectures follow the book and his handwriting is a little messy but he takes no offense to students who ask him to clarify his writing.

2415 with him was a goofy experience. The class jumps around a lot in difficulty (partial differential equations are the hardest part-be warned!), and your grade relied mostly on a couple of uncurved exams. There were three exams: an ok first one (mean 74), a way too easy second one (mean 81), and an brutal final that nuked grades (mean 64).
Pre-lecture slides and notes are available online. The final is non-cumulative.

"Does this make sense" is this professors favorite line. If you try asking him to explain something he freezes and never fully explains a problem. With tests, he does not provide explanation on what you did wrong and/or provide feedback, just number grades (typically he messes up grade scores too).

Doesn't know how to teach to students that have never seen the material and can't explain things if you have questions. He is obsessed with theorems & proofs. His tests are completely unpredictable to what is on them and he doesn't give any review or guidance on what to study other than "memorize the lectures and textbook." He is kinda funny tho

For some of the difficult topics, it helps to watch the Pearson videos on the topic before lecture and treat the class as a flipped classroom. He moves a bit fast and teaches using example problems so it might be a bit hard to get used to it but if you study the notes and take time to understand each example, you will do well on the exams.
I like non-cumulative final!

Bottom line: this professor was terrible. The exams were ridiculous, and he was super condescending. I went to his office hours a couple times, and every time he verbally insulted me for not knowing "basic knowledge" of multivariable calculus. The grade I got in this class was not at all representative of my knowledge on the material.

By far one of the worst professors you can have for 2173. Notes and lecture style is usually very disorganized. Exams are by far the worst out all the sections, with a good portion of the exam being proofs & content not directly related to the homework. Is condescending when students ask for help, and is ONLY here for another degree. nothing else.

He's generally likeable and pretty funny but his tests are very concept heavy. The only preparation he will give you for tests is to "study the lecture notes" because his style of exam question is often not found in the homework. Lectures are very confusing so watch the textbook video on the topic beforehand and take very good notes during class.

His lectures aren't great but if u take thorough notes, nothing not covered in lecture will be on the exam. It also really helps to watch the videos from the textbook to give u a good foundation for the content. Also the exam problems are usually the easiest of a certain topic. He will also hint at which problems are going to be tested.
He is really nice, and he is happy to help students.
This is a really nice person, with prepared organized ppt.

He's the least helpful and fair professor I've ever had. He does not explain concepts well, is quite condescending, and doesn't prepare you well for exams. He lets his mood affect his decisions. For example, he got angry and said, "I am going to put an impossible question on the exam that none of you will be able to solve (and he did)" He's awful.
Nice guy. can improve his accent.

Has a very hard time creating a line of reasoning with the course material and it makes it seem as if he is teaching random topics that do not link together at all. Because of this, it was very difficult to understand what will be on the test. Furthermore, the review sheets that are posted are very sporadic and not helpful.

Overall I like him personally, it is clear that he wants us to understand the content. However, we were not given enough practice material that related to quiz/exam content. I would go to lecture and feel so confident afterwards, only to be completely lost on the quiz. It would be beneficial to give out more homework with exam/quiz questions.
love it, big boy knows how to teach
Love it
Avoid.

DO NOT TAKE. Not only his he and his handwriting extremely difficult to understand, he was easily the rudest and most condescending prof I've had, and I don't think anyone ever walked away from lecture having understood anything. Asking questions is futile because he never answers anything directly. Recitation and practice problems saved me.
Felt like I didn't really learn much from the lectures and relied heavily on the textbook.

He's new, so I will cut him some slack, but his lectures were not good. He is not easy to understand, and he kind of puts you down for not understanding the material. He encourages questions, but he judges you for your question if it seems too easy. I never understood anything in the lectures. I only learned trig from my recitation.

Dr. Kiers is a fair instructor. If you go to his lectures and do his homework, you should alright. He gives a fair amount of homework, but it is not too difficult. I thought his exams were fair. However, his explanations in office hours can sometimes be a little hard to follow. He is much more fair than other 2568 instructors though.

Explained the material well & lecture wasn't too boring. Exams are pretty hard and the study material isn't great; end-of-chapter exercises are assigned but are way harder than exam questions. It's not impossible to do well but you need to be prepared to work for it

Dr. Kiers is a very nice guy who explains the concepts well. Majority of your grade is 2 midterms and a final, so its pretty test heavy. However, I believe he prepares you pretty well for them. He's not the most generous with partial credit but he will answer any questions you have. Overall I really liked him

Class wasn't that bad. Her handwriting is pretty bad though but she posts the notes after lecture. It was online homework about once a week which was really easy to get a 100% on. 2 midterms and a final. Do the practice exams and you'll do pretty well on midterms. I didn't do as well on final (slightly on me). Had quizzes about 1 every other week.

Super easy class. Actual lectures were really slow and there honestly wasn't a lot of material that we covered through the entire class. Homework was incredibly easy maybe took 1.5 hours a week at most with the regular homework and a bit more with written homework. Tests also weren't bad just do the practice tests ahead and you'll be good.

Prof. Han Veiga is a decent professor. She explains all the "proof" which is very much skippable, and examples are few. Homework is generally easy. Periodic quizzes are also generally easy. Exams are generally easy, though our final was 40% of our grade, which is crazy. This is an easy class and she will help you if needed at any time.

MATH 2177 professor. Extremely hard to understand in lecture and can barely read handwriting. Only resources are homework solutions and lecture notes. They are extremely hard to read, so they aren't much help anyways. By FAR the worst professor I've had. The average on the final was a 37%. The curve helps, but I would still avoid at all costs.

Do not take this professor. One of the worst I ever had. I had him for MATH 2177, and the lectures are hard to understand, posted notes are extremely difficult to read, and the average score on the final was a 37%.

Dr Pei often begins a topic with its proof (rather than an explanation), then immediately jumps into examples. His handwriting is messy and he doesn't clean the chalkboard before lecture. He enunciates poorly. He sometimes pauses for minutes to figure out the next step in a problem. (I had Dr Pei for MATH 2177, not 2415, but it wasn't an option)

Take my review with a grain of salt, as I dropped his class after the first week, math 2177(not math2415, 2177 just wasn't listed). Makes zero effort to interact with class, post no resources on carmen, gives no time for class questions, lectures are very fast paced and writing is very difficult to read, even towards the front of the class.

One of the worst professors. He's the better option for diffeq but still one of the worst. He just reads tb examples for his messy and boring lectures, and he's an AWFUL grader. He took 15 pts off a question bc I got part a wrong and he "assumed" the rest would be incorrect too- I had to ask for points back. Get ready to self teach the entire sem.

Worst professor I've ever had. Impolite, never seems like he wants to be there, never tries to interact with class. Never has clear instructions when asking for help, grades completely different than any other course help received (Got 10/10 on a homework by grader and tutor, got 5/20 from him on the same problem) AVOID. AT. ALL. COSTS.

dude had a stick shoved up his ass. wouldn't give half a point on my exam to boost my grade from a B+ to an A-. Boring lectures that are hard to focus on, and seemed kind of frustrated sometimes when answering questions after class if you didn't get it. exams weren't too hard, HW wasn't too much, not hard to get a good grade with effort. but still

Julian is rly nice and often asks if students get confused. Calc is a pretty tough subject, but Julian did lots of practice problems in class and posted his lecture notes. Even though I ended with a c+ that is completely my fault because I often skipped lectures and recitations and was also taking other heavy classes.  I recommend Julian!

Dr. Mejia is a good and fair professor. He is good at simplifying concepts and his lectures are a lot more lively than others. It did feel as if the progression of the semester did take a hit on lectures, but Calc 2 is a pretty concept-dense course, so it is understandable. Anything you could see on an exam, he made time for in lecture.

Dr. Mejia-Cordero is a great lecturer and knows his stuff. The material of Calculus 3 can be challenging at times, but its very manageable if you make sure that you close gaps in knowledge early, since a lot of things build off of the earlier concepts quickly. His notes are amazing and extremely organized. But SHOW UP TO CLASS. Its worth your time.
very organized, very prepared, lecture very cohesive, tests not that hard because the tests don't cover that much a ton of material.

Lectures were very clear and intuitive, and he provided guided notes which were clearly organized. Resources were easy to find outside of class, though the homework program used was a bit extreme in length, and difficult to use at times. Even so, the clarity of lectures and quizzes make the drudgery of the homework worth it.
He gives clear lectures and goes through plenty of examples.  His office hours are great and he responds to emails quickly.

This was my second time taking calculus so it was more like a review, but compared to my high school calc teacher this experience was much better. His teaching was efficient and straightforward, so lectures were always engaging and easy to digest. He did plenty of practice problems and was always willing to do more. Absolute Chad if you ask me.

This was my second time taking calculus so I did not have to pay too much attention in his lectures but he is by far the best math teacher i've ever had. He does a lot of practice problems in class and is very clear with his steps and helps you understand why he did what he did in his work.

This guy is very good at introducing new topics to the class and getting them to try simplified practice problems. If you attend lecture and actually pay attention and go along with his in-class participation practice, you should do just fine in this class. I found it to be very helpful. Definitely take Math 1151 with him if you get the chance!

While calculus sucks, this was my second time taking it and he made it much less painful. His lectures are easy to follow and super helpful. He's extremely nice and not at all intimidating. The only bad aspects about the class are things out of his control and decisions made by the department. If you have to take calculus take it w him!

Professor Onofrei's calculus 3 class is very straightforward. Attend lectures, take homework every week / every other week, and there are 5 equally weighted exam grades. If you pay attention in lecture, the homeworks and the exams are very easy, and she doesn't overcomplicate the math when explaining it.

Dr. Onofrei's class was very straightforward - 5 unit tests basically, 17 quizzes(2 dropped), and 10 homework assignments(1 dropped). No weighted grades, so homework is a main contributor to grades. She uses Mastering for everything, so it is pretty easy. She gives out good partial credit; fair grader. Not a bad lecturer, explains content well.

She makes the class fair and doable out of all the other math professors that I've had. Class consists of 5ish exams and none of them are cumulative. Homework is reasonable, covers everything in lecture and quizzes are good review of what is covered in lecture.
Very fair teacher. 5 tests, only on the previous 3ish weeks of material. Not too much homework, and plenty of practice material was given for each exam. True class difficulty was probably around 2.5

Overall, as a prof. she'd be a 3 for me but compared to other profs. I've had/have heard of in OSU math department for Calc 1 & 2 she'd be a 5. Had online class (recorded lectures). Course used Pearson software MyMathLab for homework, quizzes, and exams. About 3-4 hours work a week. 5 exams non-cumulative and no final. Pretty solid overall.
One of the best math professors I've had. Gives lots of examples and the exams are just like the homework.

This course was not bad, definitely depends on if you enjoy calc. You have homework and two quizzes every week. Four times per question on homework and two attempts per quiz. Homework reflects the five non-cumulative exams exactly. Attendance is not mandatory. Homework examples were extremely helpful. (Online with meeting times)

Dr. Onofrei is a fine prof. Expectations for homework & quizzes are clear; due dates rarely ever change. No midterms, instead gives 5 non-cumulative exams that each cover the most recent chapters. Unless you LOVE math, lectures will be boring. My class is online, and her class is not too bad. I imagine her in person section would be more difficult.

Not bad. Perhaps she could've spent more time explaining the conceptual side of things, but I rarely found myself learning outside of class. No midterms or finals, instead there were 5 exams over each unit, none of which were cumulative. Spent like 30min-1hr each day and it was an easy A

She gives clear examples of what you should know for the tests, and homework mirrors the exams almost verbatim. You have a lot of chances to get points, and she's generous with partial credit. Doesn't go into much detail on theory, but I liked that since it wasn't relevant for exams. As long as you stay on top of your work it shouldn't be too hard

Dr. Onofrei is a solid teacher. Her lectures are practice problem heavy, and can be light on concepts. Which I found helpful But the majority of my respect for her came from how flexible she has been due to COVID. Our last test (class had no final) had severe technical issues, and rather than reschedule into finals week, she cancelled the exam.

Do not take it with her. She is egoistic and rude. All she does is write notes in class with no clear explanation. You will not receive any feedback for your homework assignment. I got an A in her class, but I did not learn anything useful. She is the definitely in the group of worst teachers in OSU.

Awful teacher.... dont ever take her for anything. She may know what shes talking about and she tech the information well but she could care less about the students. Homework is graded toughly and the difference between grading on exams is drastic. 5 people could have identical work and no one would get the same grade. Rude/misunderstands often.

Was rude to students asking questions on multiple occasions. She teaches a very well organized course, and is a fantastic lecturer. I cannot tell if she is rude and deliberately obtuse or simply uninterested in fielding student questions.

Great lecturer! Her system of 5 exams and no final is extremely nice. Exams are difficult but extremely fair (average typically a C). Partial credit is almost always given. Accent is perfectly fine. Do not expect a curve - grade is brought up by homework (Ximera) due to the weighting of the course. Always willing to answer questions and help!

Queen. Yeah, she teaches an 8 AM but she teaches it like an 8 AM. Her accent is 100% understandable. Her tests are difficult but there's nothing on them that is a surprise. No final, but 5 exams is actually a huge plus because you get a buffer from the first test. However, I will say that some people in my class definitely needed a shower.
She writes fast and a lot. Uses an old school projector but posts notes online. Attendance not mandatory but encouraged with extra credit. Exams are fair, homework is fair but out of a book.

Good lectures, her TAs graded fairly. No midterms or final - essentially just five chapter tests (which were all very fair). Has a bit of an accent but nothing crazy. Didn't go to office hours so I can't vouch for those. Our class did not have a curve.

Avoid if possible. If you're stuck with her, get help from your TA or go to tutoring because she does not want to help. Once spent 10 min yelling at students for correcting her when she was wrong. After she "convinced us" she was right, she looked back at her notes and confirmed we were correct. Best part of the class is her accent. Tests are hard.

Paying attention to her lectures is very important, and they are very helpful as well, but with the grading scale, every homework assignment is graded somewhat harshly, and without any useful feedback, but they contribute heavily to your final grade. The tests can be difficult, but she does prepare you adequately for them, and write good feedback

Lectures aren't that great. She doesn't allow time for questions but if you're decent at math and you get the homework done and keep up then you'll be fine. If you're not that good at teaching yourself math then she's not the right professor for you because she's not that accessible outside of class and she won't always understand your questions.
Definitely not recommended

I failed the first exam and got an A on the rest of them. It was sort of a wake up call. She teaches directly out of the book and if you go to class you should never be surprised by anything on the exams. Most of the time exam questions are taken directly from lecture.
