good teacher i switched into his class way better than Wong. goes over everything well test are kinda hard but final is easy. i suggest going to MSLC if you want to do good!

It was a hard class.  He sometimes went way too fast and it was hard to catch what he was talking about.  I wish he would do more examples in class.  His tests seem somewhat easier than the quizzes, and he's got a descent curve.

This class was impossible. Exams were impossible. Quizzes were alright. Used to think i was good at math before this class. Probably a really hard class regarless of which professor teaches it though.

Dr. Husen is an excellent professor.  Thanks to him, I understand not only how to do the math but why it works.  Reviews and exams are straightforward, no tricks.  Going to class (imagine that) and seeing examples helped me get an A.
Great lecturer. Learned a lot in his class. Made some hard topics easy.

Husen seems to enjoy teaching. I would say of all the possible lecturers, he truly is one of the best ones in Math. He is interested in what he does and comes prepared. He is willing to help you before or after class. However, do not miss his lectures, because he goes fast and his examples cannot be found in the book.

I really didn't like the subject matter of the class.  Husen spends a lot of time doing theorems and proofs, which went past me.  Fortunately he does examples later, and these are very important.  He's pretty helpful too if you talk to him.  WARNING: the first 3 weeks are like a joke, so get an A while you can.  The material gets abstract and hard.
His tests were qutie difficult but there was a ten percent curve (in my section, at least) I managed to get a B+!  Just don't expect what is on the notes and quizzes to be on the midterms and finals.

He's a good guy, pretty nice and is always trying to look out for the students. However, he goes a really fast pace, so you can't ever expect to have down time or miss a lecture cause he covers so much.

I SUCK @ math...but Dr. Husen was very clear and made me feel like I actually understood what he was talking about. He is very helpful and seems like a pretty cool guy. It seems like he enjoys what he does and that makes it so much easier to pay attention in lecture. Math sucks, but if you have to take it, I would definitely recommend Dr. Husen.

His lectures were very helpful and almost impossible to skip.  Tests wern't a good representation of the material learned in class, however, the test that can be found on his website (they're hidden, so look for them!) are EXACTLY like the ones he gives (same order and everything with a few numbers switched). Overall, wonderful teacher!
Such a good teacher! He made the class easy
AWESOME! I am sooo thankful I got him because some math lecturers make it impossible to pass!
Great professor for math
The class was pretty boring but he explains things very well. He is a really cool guy and a good professor.
He is a really laid back guy, and it's easy to learn off of him. I liked him a whole bunch!
Mr. Husen was a good professor, but by the end of the quarter I hate math now.
Cool guy who teaches well. He's not one that likes to listen to himself talk or make you feel stupid.
No Comments

This guy is the****, probably the best teacher in the unniversity makes everything clear and helps peeps out

This professor is awesome! He explains things better then all the highschool math teachers I had.  If you are taking math 150, or any other course this guy teaches, do what you can to get into his class.  He really is a great professor.
This guy sucks! If you want an example don't expect one from him.

Excellent teacher.  Explains topics clear as day.  I had no calculus experience before college and this guy explained things so well that I hardly tried and got an A-, only because the class was not curved due to the average passing.
Excellent teacher, best Math 152 teacher Ohio State has!  Does example after example during lectures so when tests and quizes roll around you have already seen the questions most of the time!
Great Guy, really good at what he does. Doesn't always look it in his appearence. But good professor.

This was a very hard class and the exams were hard and u need to study alot to pass them. Although he uses alot of examples, he was unclear when he taught    and sometimes hard to follow, nice person though.

A very sincere guy who makes the class half decent.  Although math 152 is hard, he made it a lot better than he could have.  Makes some funny jokes and keeps class interested.  Lots Of Examples!!!! I loved that about him.
Best Math Teacher I have ever had.

A great professor.  The class is hard (as is to be expected) but he is always glad to help.  He's one of the few teachers that *wants* to teach rather than use teaching Calculus as a way to pay for research.
He is extremely hard.  He does go over examples but often goes very fast without taking the time to explain things.  I was good at math until I took this class with this professor.
Best math prof that I have had so far at OSU. Teaches you what you need to know.

He does not explain things in a language I could understand.  If you love math and it comes naturally to you, then you will be fine.  If you stuggle at it, though, and need extra help...choose another prof.!!
Class is standard, but exams kick your BUTT! He makes every concept and picks THE HARDEST problem to do for it...watch out
Easiest math class you'll ever take.  Forget the homework, try to stay awake in class, and DO THE PRACTICE MIDTERMS.  They are exact clones of the tests. oh, and no final!
Best math professor I have had at OSU. Makes the subject very easy. Do the practice exams and you will be fine, and go to class.
No Comments

I've learned a lot more from him than any other professor at OSU. He makes the course challenging, and the exams are horrible, but I learned a lot. I would rather have him than a professor who practically hands the students "A's"

Math 571 is more challenging than Math 568.  Husen teaches both, but I would personally only take him for 571 because he actually proves the theorems that he puts on the board. If you pay attention, you should understand them and do well. Do the homework.

He is lazy. His lectures don't flow because it is obvious he doesn't prepare for them which makes them difficult to follow.  He doesn't work out example problems completely, pure laziness. Class always ended early and he made exams pretty difficult.

Often uses algebraic tricks without explaining how they work. Exams are very very difficult. Pick the hardest parts of the book and learn only that and you nmight get somewhere. Seems annoyed when asked for help.

This guy knows his stuff.  He thinks, speaks and communicates clearly.  I think he might be the best teacher for Math 571.  If you study hard, you can do well (and learn linear algebra) in his class.  He's the best non-honors math prof that I've had here.

He is a horrible teacher. Didn't respond to e-mail. No curve in the class, I got a D despite studying for hours. Very unfair, and gets angry if you ask questions. Expects you to just know everything on yr own. I learned from the book.

Review sheets not at all on par with his midterms.  Usually midterms are too long for the exam period.  It was easier to study from the book than it was from his notes.  Lectures did not prepare you for homework, homework didn't prepare you for midterms.
he got angry at the class when we forgot something we learned back in 10th grade math, gives decent notes, but be sure to study cuz his tests are much harder than his review sheets

He always seems available for help.  Lectures sometimes hard to pay attention to with lots of proofs and such, but gives review which is very difficult.  Tests/homework pretty difficult but pretty big curve to make up for it.
One of the best teachers for Calc. Exams are tough
Straight forward guy.

His lectures were pretty good but he didn't seem to want to challenge his students (for example he didn't give us a final because he didn't want to grade it).  This could be good or bad depending on if you like Math or if you are an Engineer :).

Knows his materials.  Speaks using complex mathematical terms, but somehow you understand exactly what he's trying to say.  Lectures clear and helpful, tests over basic/easy (class avg. around 85%).  Study the review sheets to get an A on every test!  :-)
He's very straight forward.  No trick midterm questions.  A very good teacher overall.  Also his midterm and final review sheets are just about all you need to ace the tests.
confusing
great to talk to if you needed help, very fair

Very straight to the point and, speaks softly.
decent
Good teacher!  Material starts out very easy until the first midterm.

Do NOT be fooled by the math 4547 reviews and think this class is easy with Daniel. Math 4547 is the most hardest and stressful class I took. I did not understand everything Daniel taught right away. However, it is clear Daniel is teaching proofs as simple and effectively as possible. He also gave the most fairest exams and quizzes in my life

Dr. Thompson explains concepts really well and has a grading guide that gives you a 100 on the assignment or quiz if you get above a 93. So getting an A gives you 100. He is really nice and caring and gives fair exams. Definitely prepares you well and makes sure you know the important key concepts. knows what the difficult material is

Dan is the best math professor I've ever had. He made 3345, which is typically really frustrating, really digestible and interesting. the material was boring but he did what he could to make it enjoyable and was great at answering questions. His expectations were clear and reasonable

Professor Dan is the best math professor I have had. He explains the material clearly and he only expects you to understand the basics of the course. The exams are extremely fair and he prepares you very well for them. He's just a super nice guy overall and he's pretty funny too. His British accent is a bonus as well. I highly recommend.

Dan is the best professor I've had at OSU!  He is a great lecturer and the tests and homework have no surprises on them.  During office hours he is extremely helpful.  He is so much better than any other professor for this class! And his British accent is a plus.
Literally the best professor I have ever had. Just go to class and write down everything he says, and you'll know how to do all the homework and everything on the exams. Super nice guy too.
Extremely fair. Everything on the tests is went over in class directly. No surprises at all.
One of the best Math professors at OSU. He's very clear and reasonable. Plus his accent his awesome
Daniel has been one of my favorite instructors I've had at OSU. He is a very thorough lecturer and really seems to enjoy teaching. Take him if you can. You won't regret it.

He really cares about attendance. If you miss one class or late for one class, he will be mad at you. And also he doesn't follow the textbook at all. Instead, he spent all his time talking about his research, which nobody cares. Also his test is super heavy. And you don't get a chance to know your score till the end of the semester.

You will learn a lot and become a better mathematician by taking any Bergelson class. He wants his students to be competitive with others at the highest levels (i.e., schools like Princeton and MIT). Expect no lectures on material from the book, you will be expected to read that independently. Professor Bergelson likes to teach about his work.

Professor Bergelson is somewhat of anomaly. I've taken two courses with him and they were the two best courses I've taken in college. You will need to work very hard to keep up, and will be required to know mathematics not directly involved with the course material. His class isn't for everyone, but you'll learn a great deal from him if you try.
take his class. lots of work, but you'll learn a lot. his class is the class i have learned the most material in in my undergraduate career. yeah, it may be tough, but what class worth taking isn't?
Getting an A in this class was the achievement of my life, no I  am not kidding. Sleeping is a luxury when taking his classes
Took a reading seminar with him, and he regularly insults students, interrupts them, and generally couldn't keep out of the way of the class.  F.

Terrible. We took two midterms and a final, and never found out our grades on any of them. As far as I can tell, his assignment of grades was completely arbitrarily. He assigned tons of homework, checked it only for completion, never lectured about anything in our textbook, assigned "bonus" problems that weren't bonus and did not have office hrs.
Like a Russian Santa Claus, only instead of presents, be gives you homework.

Something of an anomaly. He's able to explain concepts very well, has a sense of humor and works to make students active. However, he commits the cardinal sin of teaching - refusing to teach. He teaches what he wants to teach and nothing leading to it.
Despite the huge workload he requires of his students, he explains concepts clearly and is the most interesting Math professor I have had at OSU.
He is very hard, but in the end, it turned out to be one the best classes I have ever had.

Antichrist. I dropped the class after four all-nighters in the first two weeks. He wants nobody but genuine mathematical geniuses in his class, and uses public insult as a disincentive for all others.
Wonderful sense of humor. Prone to ridicule students who are not at the needed level. May ask student to bring vodka (without extra credit).
This class is very easy and has 13 assignments total. You don't have to attend class but it does help since he gives good lectures

I personally found Professor Xiyuan Wang's class to be well paced. He gives you enough time to digest material and plenty of time to do homework but submit it on time because it's weighed heavily, and no late submissions are accepted. Overall, I recommend his class for 2177, he wants his students to succeed.

He is very kind and cares about how well he explains a subject. Will introduce a topic by breaking it down to its why and how, then expand upon it. He does examples, but then won't do super hard problems. Not a lot of work, just a lot unknown about what you need to know.
His lectures recordings are VERY boring, extremely monotone, and probably about 15 years old. I would recommend not taking this class unless you truly have to.
He is a very boring lecturer.. super monotoned. However, it is a very easy class to pass (not get an A) just can be overwhelming at times.

Very boring to watch lectures. If you have really bad ADD/ADHD like me, DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!!!. It was impossible for me to be able to focus during his recorded lectures, was not able to pick up any information. Talks in a very monotone voice, not someone whos excited about teaching.

He is probably one of the most boring lecturers I have ever had. He speaks in the most monotone dry voice and the lectures are just recordings of him reading off of the power point slides. He posts practice sets with solutions and the quizzes are just the same types of problems so its almost impossible not to pass this class.

His recorded lectures are just him reading the slides word for word with no extra input. Recitations are just him reading off the work from the practice problems with no explanations behind them. His exams are only 40 questions but all the questions are worth 7 points, and he will put questions on there that we were never taught how to do.

I made a last minute switch into his class and it was the WORST idea. He seems like a smart guy but has no idea how to teach. Doesnt come with examples prepared. Confuses himself when trying to make ones up on the spot. Doesnt understand anyones questions and still tells them theyre wrong. Ive learned everything from the textbook. AVOID!!!!!!

YIKE.  He is just not a good teacher, there's no other way of putting it.  He's a nice enough guy and his midterms are fair.  He also gave a take home final and the class had a reasonable curve so I ended up doing alright in the class, but the man is almost always impossible to follow when he's teaching.  His class is a slog.

This man is a horrible teacher. Anything you learn will be from reading the book. However, his midterms and quizzes were pretty fair, although the final was awful. You won't learn anything from lectures, since they are mostly incoherent math related babbling. Read the book and learn your definitions, and you will do ok.

Mike Davis is the wrost professor I have ever had. Every day he shows up late and has nothing prepared for the day. We spend most of the day in silence as he tries to figure out what he wants to try and say. He constantly makes mistakes and doesn't use any grading system, so you never know how you're doing. The tests are close to impossible. avoid.

Absolutely awful. Takes him the entire class to do a problem(incorrectly). True and false questions worth +2,-2, or 0 so you could get negative points on an exam problem. Refuses questions outside of class. Refuses to use carmen or let anyone know their grade. Cant stress how much of a nightmare he is.
Requirements were made clear, easy quizzes and a lot of practice was done through homework.  You'll get out what you put in for this class.
extremely clear and helpful - definitely good
Oh. my. god.  The tests were so. easy.

Simply copies down profs from the textbook, usually word for word.  Provides a few examples in class and will do a couple of HW problems in class.  Will not teach you anything you cannot read in the book which actually works nicely with the independent study based 500 level courses.

One of the worst math professors I've had here at OSU. Pompous, arrogant, etc. Given a 60 page "pamphlet" as a textbook, with no answers to any of the exercises and he gives 0 supplemental material. Prepare to re-read each 2 page section (test over 4 sections at a time) about a thousand times. hard as hell

Switch sections or teachers if you get this guy. He can barely work out the problems in class, and expects you to do insanely hard ones on the midterms. The most annoying thing was right before we'd take a midterm, he'd say "took it easy on you guys.." then it would be the most difficult thing ive ever taken. Scatterbrained, moody, and just bad

Horrible. I still dont know what the cheap tricks were on the midterms and his overall structure of the class is terrible. I suggest you take 153 if you get him as a teacher and skip back into 263 after that class because this could potentially drop your nice GPA because this class is hard.
Mike Davis doesn't give a damn about anything.  Great guy.  You get out what you put in.  period.

He is a smart professor and overall a good guy, but he is terrible at teaching. Many times he never knows how to solve a problem from the beginning. He just makes it up as he goes. His explanations are difficult to follow and often not the easiest way to get to an answer. Lectures are not very helpful. I learned everything I needed in recitation.

Only go to lectures to hear the hilarious things he says. Some include "OK this will blow your mind" or "Don't you want to come to class early so I can answer the questions you have wrong?" Seems like a nice, smart guy, but has very poor teaching skills.
Awful

He is a very intelligent person but doesn't seem to take the class seriously.  He is a decent teacher but everyone that's **** in the previous post probably didn't go to lecture.  It was my first time taking calc and I ended with a near perfect score.  As long as you read the book like every other class you'll be fine.

soo awful and i think i have to have him next quarter too. he looks like santa clause and resets his pocket watch first thing every class. ugh. worst ever. midterm and final questions were ridiculous. we never went over those kinds of examples.
If you have him for a 100 level math course, be prepared to teach yourself. Very poor at communicating.

This man has got to be one of the worst math teachers ever. He is corrected by students all the time in his lectures and gives us studyguides with answer sheets that say, "The answers may not be correct."

Questions himself, and not in the "I want you to catch my mistakes" way. Seems to know what he's teaching, but can't relay the information in an easy-to-learn way. Advice: If you don't have prior calculus experience, learn from the book, your classmates, or ask questions in recitation. Great guy though. Ask the right questions, get good answers.

Attending lecture is absolutely pointless.  Hearing this man speak will cause you to doubt everything you previously knew about mathematics.  Make sure to attend recitation and read the book and you should get through ok.

completely useless to go to lecture.  He doesn't even know what's on the syllabus and he pretty much just teaches whatever he wants and he does so incorrectly.  Stick to the book and attending recitation and you should be fine.

Most generally useless professor you could ever have. The only benefit of going to his lectures is to occasionally copy equations of the board-but he usually copies them down incorrectly, so double check anything you get from him. If you have him for 151A, you should just get used to reading the book and stick to attending recitation.

The least helpful professor I've had since I've been at Ohio State. He rambles on endlessly in class and on the board, is very difficult to communicate with, and his exams were very difficult. He cited in my H161 on our final exam that he took a question off of a graduate level exam and put it on our exam. Not fun.

Professor Davis is a tribute to academia at The Ohio State University.  Incidentally his son, James Davis, is well on his way to becoming as respected and influential in his field, line service, as his father is in his.  Cheers gentlemen.

He would not be the best math professor at OSU, but his quizzes and midterms are fairly easy, and he is so generous about grades.  He is really nice and friendly.  He will also go over homework even number problems which will help your homework grade.  I am pretty sure his class is easier than other honors classes and you will get an A if you workh

He get's stuck in problems pretty often but nothing that he can't get over after a minute, and in general much clearer than the one other calc teacher I've had.  Extremely mellow.  If you ask him during quizzes he tells you if you're wrong or right :) Exams aren't too hard, I got a B in H161 but I aced his second exam.

Awful. He writes examples on the board, only to stop in the middle of the problem and decide that he either doesn't know how to explain or else he doesn't know how to do it. Socially awkward and doesn't connect well with students. Made the class much more difficult than it had to be.
He looks like Santa. He is very mellow. He teaches well, and seems really down to earth.
soooo boring.. fell asleep even when i wasn't tired.  not clear and pretty confusing.  makes a lot of mistakes on the board.  but i've heard other H161 aren't that great either.
everything went well except simple harmonics
very shabby looking, really difficult

Esteban publish notes to carman after every class. It is very helpful to do a review after class.

Esteban is one of the best teachers in OSU. Why? Because he WANTS to help answer your questions during and after lectures.  

The midterms and final can be a bit hard/varying since it can have a question from lectures, quizzes, homeworks, or midterm reviews. So look at all of those in separate days and don't cram and you should be solid.
Mr. Esteban was a good teacher. He was very organized when teaching.
Really good professor. Accent but its not a big deal. Exams and quizzes were pretty chill.

Overall good teacher. He's passionate about math and pretty good at teaching. He's not a native English speaker, so his speaking isn't always fluid, but he does well answering questions and showing concepts.

While the class was extremely difficult, that was not the fault of Esteban, but just the University itself. Esteban himself is a fantastic lecturer, and despite being slightly shy that doesn't stop him from making people's days.

Esteban was by far one of the best teachers I have ever had. I think he really enjoys math and made learning fun for me. As a freshman who took business calculus in high school, I didn't know how Calculus 1 would go, but he tries to really prepare you for the exams. I would take future classes with him again in a heartbeat. GOAT
Esteban gives decent lectures and come midterm and final time he usually shows really good examples and sends out a lot of resources.

I had Esteban as a TA Autumn 2021 for Calc 1, and he was amazing. I learnt more in his recitation about the topic than I did in lectures from the professor. Go to his office hours, he is really helpful 1-on-1.

Esteban was a good professor, but his lecture notes could be found online and were exactly what he said in class, so attendance didn't matter. LOTS of practice problems were given for exams and are identical to the test content. Lots of tests but if you do the practice exams and understand those problems you will do fine.

His lectures aren't very organized and he can be difficult to understand. I stopped attending his lectures and started going to a different Math 1151 professor's lectures, and this helped me a lot more.

Prof. Kautz is one of the most genuine teachers I've ever had. She's caring and fair when grading. Only dilemma was that it was a flipped classroom. I would have done better if she was the one teaching me, not ALEKS or Edpuzzle. This was a CSCC math Department failure, not hers.

Jaime is literally the coolest professor ever. She is super kind, & makes lectures interesting by connecting math topics to completely random things that make it easier to remember on quizzes/tests! There is a weekly quiz/test but in the notes there are clear examples for what to expect.

If you can take math with Professor Kautz, TAKE IT!!! One of my favorite math teachers ever including high school. She is hilarious in lecture and explains things so well. I never had a professor who was such a great explainer. I learned a lot by her lectures and Aleks that I didn't really need to go to recitation. Easy A if you go to lecture.

I loved this professor! She tried her best to engage her students in lecture and was very funny. She was really good at explaining different concepts to our class and I really enjoyed her lectures. Lectures were not mandatory and she always posted the notes online right after, so if you missed it was no big deal. Super kind and helpful, 10/10!!

Im terrible at math, but Jaime always gave lectures that I understood. She is very funny and caring. Shes probably the best professor you could have. My only complaint is that the course is very test heavy. The quizzes usually have only three to four questions on it, so if you mess up on only one problem, you get a bad grade.

Professor Kautz was an amazing teacher. She answers all your questions and is very nice and funny. She knows what she is talking about and i was very lucky to have for for lecture and recitation. The test were directly from class reviews and homework problems. I took her class online, there was a lot of homework but not to bad.

Dr. Jaime is very cool! Although I hate Math, she is still one of my favorite professors. She is very relatable and easy to talk to. Also, very patient&hilarious!. If she wasn't a Math instructor, I would take her class again. Highly recommend!.(The textbooks is only needed for a few quizzes, but it won't help with the majority of the work.)

I absolutely adored Jaime. She's one of my favorite professors so far. She makes the lectures feel incredibly welcoming. I'm not one to ask questions, but I asked plenty questions and they always got answered! She's a wonderful professor and I recommend her to anyone who gets the opportunity to take one of her classes.

This class was easy and she is there to help you if you needed it. Also first day shes like if youre sick dont come youll ok be. So attendance was based on if you wanted extra help. I recommend Lectures, but if you want skip recitations.
she is very cheesy but is honest, and easy to talk too

I failed my 1075 class last semester. But this semester, I learned the same exact material and everything stuck to me and I passed. Jaime is really cool and fun and makes sure you understand the math. Recitation helps a lot, but going to her lectures help.
Jaime can really help you understand math a little more, as long as you go to class and pay attention. I highly recommend her and she connects with the students too.
Best teacher ever. Recommend 10 out of 10 times

The lectures were based on his own lecture notes that was a very helpful complement to the textbook. Homework pacing was good, the homework problems were extremely helpful in grasping the material and preparing for the exams. Attend the lectures, do the homework problems, don't feel shy to ask him questions, and you will be fine.
Very disrespectful in office hours, did not want to help students succeed.

One of the best professors I have had. Taken in math 2568.
Really, really tough for common reasons in STEM. The lectures are pretty theoretical, so I would go to office hours, and ask for examples. If you take initiative, and come up with questions, he will be very helpful.

For 2568 he honestly wasn't a terrible professor. The material presented was difficult but I read the book the entire semester which isn't too long and clears up a lot of things that are left confusing during his lectures. He gives less homework than a lot of the other professors and the exams are almost exactly the homework questions he assigns.

Typical 'bad professor'. Anti-social, gave little feedback, not enough time to take tests. Made worse by that the fact that the professor seemingly avoids communicating with students. He would often tell students with questions "we went over that" and leave them confused. Honestly feels like he doesn't actually want to teach. Avoid him.
Jeff made sure everyone understands the material and breaks it down into steps. He would also color code things and make comical references to help us understand the material.

You won't be graded on attendance, but it is important you go if you are unfamiliar with the coursework. He's specific about the work he wants to see on homework and especially on exams, and the only way you'll know is if you go to class and take notes.

This professor's lectures are pretty boring and tough to stay focused. The material is not anything super difficult and covers general pre-calc concepts. His lectures are basically right out the textbook. His notes are helpful, however you learn more in recitation. In order to do well on tests, do several book problems and practice!

Awful professor. I got an A and did not attend more than 5 lectures the whole semester. If you happen to know the material so exceptionally well that you want to attend a lecture that will certainly confuse anyone who is not a math major, by all means go.

Had him for lecture and he was very clear straight to the point and was great at answering questions.  Basically took the class in high school so was already easy, but he just added to that.  Overall great guy
I don't think I've met a better man, but beware!!!! You'll have trouble paying attention in class

Jeff is the best math teacher I've ever had. I've never gotten an A in math until this past semester. I'm highly impressed with how well he knows the material and how he somehow made the math I never understood so easy. I highly suggest taking Math 1050 from Jeff. Do expect quite a bit of homework, but the homework definitely helps.

Jeff is by far the best math teacher I have ever had. He explains things multiple times in various ways to make sure everyone understands. Being in class everyday is very important as new sections are taught almost every day. I wish he taught higher up math classes because I would most definitely have him as a teacher again!

Jeffery mills is by far the worst instructor (if I may be so bold as to use this term to describe the sub par instruction I received) that I have had at OSU in any department. He has a serious superiority complex in regard to his students. He fosters a hostile classroom environment and I feel its outlandish that he remains employed.
Jeff Mills is by far one of the worst teachers I have ever had in my life. He thinks we are all stupid and refuses to help us with anything. Avoid this teacher if you can!
Worst teacher I've EVER had. Not only was he awful at teaching, but he was extremely not understanding when I became sick and couldn't make it to class and missed a quiz.

The only professor I've ever had that does not review before a test. Gives quizzes the last 15 min. of class leaving nothing but anxiety for the student. Jeff Mills is very snarky with a attitude of superiority towards students with questions about his methods. He is knowledgable about mathematics, but just not much of a people person.

He may be the best math teacher I've ever had. I am not good in math at all, nor do I have any interest in it at all. I always struggled, but I actually felt accomplished in his class. He's very nice, helpful, clear, and fair. If you have trouble in math, he'll be especially great for you.

Jeff was very helpful and really did describe a lot of the material in a way that everyone could understand. He also gave some background information before just explaining things that everybody may not have learned from other classes prior to this one. I do not like math at all but I actually did well in this class.
Great teacher. I had always struggled with math, but Jeff makes it clear and really cares about helping you learn. I highly suggest him if you can get him.

He taught this past summer at Columbus State Community College (part-time).  He was a wonderful teacher and I would highly recommend him.  He is by far the best math teacher I have had at CSCCC.  He tries to help you in how every way he can.  He even gives you review sheets before taking the tests, which were very helpful.

Great teacher if you are not very confident with math. He goes out of his way to answer any questions you may have and has many different ways of attacking a math problems. This is good because you can use the technique that best fits you. If I need to take another math class I would go out of my way to ensure Jeff is my teacher.

Jeff is very dry, and kind of a jerk. He is very VERY picky about how you write your answers, which is annoying. The class itself was very easy, I didn't study and I got an easy A. I didn't attend lecture for the last half of the quarter because he was soooo boring. But he answers any questions that you may have, I just didn't have any.
Jeff is the most dry and boring teacher there is at ohio state. I hate math.. and he just added himself to one of the reasons why. He is way, way WAY too picky.

Im actually very limited when it comes to math, but I aced this class. His strategies for P.R.T.I problems and Mixture problems were pretty fantastic. Definitely gave me the skills for future math classes and helped me break down the barriers that prevented me from putting any effort. It's a lot of work, but it's for the best if you want to succeed

The biggest problem I had was the lack of difficulty in the problems he covered!!  Generally the biggest problem with the course's quiz's and the homework would have been remedied if he would have covered more complex problems in class instead of the examples ALREADY provided in the textbook.

He's nice and can be funny. I found it easier to not attend lecture, and just study from the book before quizzes and exams. Be prepared to take the exams kind of quickly. It seemed like a lot of problems and not a lot of time, if you have trouble solving them fast.

Nice guy, a little strange but overall he's a good teacher. he's a stickler about showing ur work but in the long run thats good because he wants to make sure u dont skip a step on the exam and make a mistake and get points taken away. overall very thorough and is a good teacher.  I'd take another class from him.
This instructors was very helpful. however he does like things done a certain way. I did learn a few new strategies from this class, that make things easier. I recommend Jeff without reservation.

Jeff's a great teacher. He's really helpful and will take his time explaining things to you. I really liked his system of teaching even though I already knew the material. The homework was fair and the quizes were exactly over what you study, so no surprizes.
Jeff was a really nice and funny guy but he graded pretty tough.  This class is frustrating in general, but Jeff does a good job teaching it.
Nice guy, helpful. I failed but passed with a different prof w/ a different approach the next quarter.

Jeff Mills is a very helpful professor. If you ever have a question about something during class, he will answer it for you until you understand what he is talking about. Although there are a lot of homework problems that he assigns to his students, it is very helpful in the end when you need a good review for the Midterms and even the Final Exam.
He was my TA for this course... he was helpful if you needed it, but didn't constantly yell at you if you werent doing your work. Overall a good teacher, much better than Ferdinand.
No Comments

It was my second time taking this awful course so I kind of new the gyst of it, so maybe thats why i felt like he over-explained the simplest steps. Still a nice guy, tried to be interested in the students' well being. I hate math so i cant say i enjoyed the course, but besides the elementary-school like approach to some math concepts he was cool.
This guys is ok as far as TA skills goes. He is good at explaining stuff, but could care less if you missed an assignement or quiz. He is an **** for all intensive purposes.
Marc was one of the worst teachers I have ever had. He was very unorganized and overcomplicated everything even the easy topics. I really recommend not taking any math courses with him.
Teaching style in lecture is very bad. Moves so fast and work is very unorganized.

although i have taken similar math courses, he was really difficult to understand, like he overcomplicated concepts that i have learned before but the way that he teaches made me struggle with these things. but he did give a couple extensions on a few assignments which was nice. also i could attend lecture virtually which was great

He's passionate but his teaching style isn't helpful. It's not the end of the world if you get stuck with him bc the key to passing this class is going over hw and skimming through the textbook. About 90% of the exam/finals material is from the hw and textbooks just a harder version of it so make sure you do a lot of practice problems.
I had absolutely no idea what was happening all year. Exams were difficult and notes were confusing. I only passed because of my TA. Way more difficult than it should have been.
Absolutely couldn't follow anything he taught. Passed thanks to my recitation TA.

Dr. Kim is a great professor. Her notes are very easy to follow along and are outlined well to understand. She explains the concepts very well and is very helpful in office hours. Very lenient grader and knows what she's talking about. You can get a good grade if you put in effort and follow along. Make sure to go to recitation. Those helped a lot.

The midterms can be difficult because there are so few questions but the lectures are always straight forward and she provides completed notes so you can choose to write your own or simply follow along which is nice.

Heejoung was overall a good professor. Tests were tough but fair, and she doesn't curve the class at all. That being said, her lectures and notes were easy to follow, and overall the class was a good experience. She records all of her in-person lectures, so you're not forced to go to lecture all the time.

Professor Kim is a fantastic professor. She was a little difficult to understand at first but after a week of class, I had no problems. The class is set up with two lectures and then a recitation. The recitation has graded group work and is extremely helpful in understanding the material. Exam heavy class but I felt ready for them.

Dr. Kim can be a bit hard to understand during lectures because she talks quietly, but she is an amazing professor who explains the material very well. Her office hours were extremely helpful. Midterms and final are straightforward, similar to problems done in recitation and on homework. Would definitely recommend her to anyone taking this course.

Dr. Kim was awesome. She did a great job conveying the information during class and was alwaying willing to offer more help during recitations, over email, and during office hours. Any time I needed help, she was always willing to sit down and work with me on anything until I understood it. Go to class and you'll do great in Dr. Kim's class.

I actually had Prof Wicke at NJIT & she was an amazing professor. It was intro to probability &  she was an extremely kind teacher. Her exams were clearly communicated with her students so it was hard to fail. As long as you do all the homework &go to every class, it will be super easy. She is the best & super accessible after class for extra help!

I loved Dr. Wicke as a person. She was really nice and really good about answering questions in emails, office hours, and is very accommodating and will meet outside of class and office hours if you need to! She never made me feel dumb for not understanding! She can be very confusing in lecture though, but exams are pretty easy!

Amiable guy. Attendance is not required but you can ask him questions on the lectures and he can answer all your question. He has two lecture notes that are updated almost everyday. Knowledge is abstract and dense but curve generously at the end. Give detailed feedback to email.

Very nice guy. Gives clear explanations in class and good feedback on exams (if you ask) and homework. The majority of the difficulty comes from the class. The content is very hard. The median grade was ~48 on midterm 3(/5). He grades very harshly, but all the tests are reasonable and the curve is very generous. For our class: 46% -> C+, 75% -> B+

Dr. Leibman is an amazing professor. He always made himself available for help. He always seemed to have a deep understanding of topics. Lectures were very clear and the exams always seemed fair. Class is very time consuming and difficult at times but very rewarding. I would recommend taking a class with Dr. Leibman if you ever get the opportunity!

Lecture heavy and very theoretical, but a great professor. Extremely knowledgeable and helpful, would stay after class to answer questions every single day. Great for smaller classes. Curved very generously. Be prepared for lots of exams.
Very caring and responsive to emails. Curved very generously.
Great Professor. Very clear and helpful.

Great professor, among the best in the department. He is well prepared and seems to know everything. He seems to put a great deal of effort into teaching. Assignments are modest and exams are fair; he wants you to learn and enjoy the material not worry about your grade. All around a great lecturer, take any course with him you can.
Great guy, really quiet, good for small classes. Amazing at math and helpful
Had him for two honors math classes. His first one (Math 191H) was very difficult, but once you prove you're smart he goes easier on you. He's one of my favorite math professors at OSU! <3
Extremely intelligent, lectures are very clear, and in general he's a really nice guy. Do all of the homework, study hard for the midterms and the final.
Great professor, teaches well. Class is certainly difficult, but there is a generous curve. If you are interested in math and ready to learn, this is the class for you.

Professor Lakos gives pretty good lectures and seems like she wants to help her students succeed. However, she sometimes gets frustrated when her students don't understand a concept or don't remember a formula after not using it for weeks. Also, she sometimes would discuss private issues with students in front of the whole class.

She was mostly nice and seemed like a good person. Great lecturer, but would sometimes get frustrated with students for not understanding a concept. Read the textbook before class to get a head start. Tests were worth a lot and were graded harshly. Study study study!
The class was very lecture-heavy. Grading is fair, but very test-heavy. Wording and notation is very important in grading, but that's more a matter of the class than the professor.

I had her for both Calc 3 online and Linear Algebra in person. She's very good in person, and was a fair (if tough) grader and also pretty nice. Her lectures are also very helpful in understanding the material, but make sure to look at the textbook beforehand. Do not take any of her online sections though, it will be a very unpleasant experience

The class was taught well and it was very clear what kind of answers/responses were required if you wanted to get good grades on homeworks and exams. Nela is a generally amiable person and it was obvious that she cared about the success of her students. Homeworks were sometimes long but always manageable and they helped immensely for the exams.

Really nice as a person but unforgiving when grading exams. Homework isn't too bad, but can sometimes be VERY long. Grade is composed of 4 midterms and 10 homeworks. Her lectures arent helpful, she just writes word for word from the textbook.

Lakos is a professor that can be funny when she wants to. Overall the class could've been better. As being someone who has always excelled in math this was the worst class I've taken. It was entirely based off Theory and Definition Memorization. If you don't demonstrate concepts the right way you can kiss your grade goodbye.

I would say to avoid Professor Lakos at all costs, but she's currently the only Calc 3 lecturer at OSU. During office hours she once told us there are "no stupid questions," then proceeded to berate a student because "it was already answered in class." I requested a review of my final exam (TA addition error) and she took points OFF other problems.
Worst class I've ever taken. Professor Lakos does not care about her students, if you ask her a question she will simply repeat it back and ask why you don't know it. Avoid her classes!

Rude/shameful responses to questions online, indifference to students having conflicts "because you have drops so it doesn't matter lol", poorly organized notes, bad lectures where you basically just watch her solve practice problems in her head rather than her actually teaching the content to students. Overall, worst teacher I've ever had. Avoid.

Awful experience. Professor was extremely rude, unhelpful, and made you feel bad if you asked questions. Exams are 80% of your grade and are nothing like the lectures that she reuses. Exam time is very short and hard to finish. Do not take her class if at all possible. Does not accept late work under any circumstances or have any sympathy.

She goes really in depth to topics during lectures that, at the end of the day, dont matter (ie, why formulas work when all we need to know is how to apply the formula). She is also pretty rude when you ask questions and kind of acts like youre dumb as if this isnt calc 3.

She recycles her online lectures and doesn't remember them to help you out. If you do end up needing help, she's very rude about it and only points right back to her lecture notes. No real help at all.

Her lectures and homework don't reflect with the quizzes and exams it she is very nasty. If you email her she would help but come as rude or sometimes doesn't help you with what you're asking. Her lectures don't help at all and is very unorganized and she is very lazy and doesn't put a lot of effort into the class.

I really enjoyed having Dr. Lakos. The class itself was tough, there's really no getting around that, but her lectures made it much more engaging. She explained confusing topics very well, and peppered in a few jokes from time to time! As long as you pay attention to the lectures and do the review assignments, you'll be fine!

I took this class during professor Lakos first time teaching asynchronously, and it was very difficult. I feel like I didnt really learn much but did okay on most of the assignments. I think she would be better in person, but online, her recorded lectures were confusing and often too long.

Professor Lakos is a caring person. However, her lectures were complicated and unclear. It seemed like she overcomplicated many concepts because the textbook explanations were a lot simpler. Also, her midterms were especially difficult and fast-paced. Even though exams were open note, I would suggest consolidating your notes into a couple of pages

watch Professor Leonard on YouTube and get ready to teach yourself. although Professor Lakos seems like a kind lady, the best decision I made was to stop watching her lectures because they were confusing as hell
She doesn't like to talk to students outside of class.
Her lectures are very difficult to understand.

Lectures are disorganized. Homeworks and take-home quizes take an insane amount of time to complete. Exams are based on a weeding out process that involve questions that are not covered in the class. The allotted exam times are short. Slow exam-taker? The insufficient exam time can lead you to perform less than your best. She doesn't curve grades.

This class is very easy. Lectures are helpful, and exams are way easier than any of the practice material given out. The textbook is also a good resource to get a deeper understanding. My only wish is that proofs were at least presented on some of the topics (Green's Theorem, Jacobians, etc). Overall, an easy intro to multivariable calculus.

Her lecture has nothing to do with the exam. The example explained in the video is always simpler than the exam, but the exam cannot be used as a review reference based on her lecture. The exam time is too short. It takes a lot of extra time to understand the book. If you listen to or not listen to her lecture video, you will get a poor grade. RUN!

Worst professor in my college life. Extremely disorganized lecture. Basically ended up watching YouTube videos and teaching myself most of the time. She just lectures in a way nobody could understand. Try your best to avoid her if you can.

Professor Lakos has a thick accent, which makes her lecture difficult to understand. She is also not friendly. If you reach out to her outside of class, she would be very rude and do her best to ignore you.

This is the worst math class in my college life. The professors classes is not clear and the sample is useless. Especially the questions in Carmen quiz for midterm are all not mentioned in the class. Better to choice another Professor!
She is a nice person, although the class itself was terrible. She gives you lots of homework and quizzes every week. Her lecture is difficult to understand.
Useless lectures, thick accent

This is an honors class for 5 credits. It goes fast and if you don't pay attention and put it a lot of work outside of class, you'll be in for it. However, that doesn't make it bad. If you put in that work, you will leave this class much better at reasoning about math than you were before. I recommend it, but only for those who want a challenge.

This class is going to give me nightmares for a while. I somehow managed to get an A, no thanks to Dr. Lakos. Her lectures were mediocre at best. I have to thank YT and the MSLC for picking up her slack. She demeans you if you ask her a question at office hours, no matter how courteous you are. If you can, switch to another professor.

Although I thought that she was a very sweet person, I did not think that she was very good at lecturing at all. She also has a thick accent that is hard to get used to. The class is also very hard if you don't put in substantial outside work.

Take this class with another professor. Prof. Lakos tries her best to engage students and keep the class moving, however, her pace is extremely fast and hard to keep up with. I had spent a lot of time on youtube to prepare for her class and tests. Her tests are fair (4-6 questions), however, some questions lack any partial credit.

So I managed to pull an A out of this class somehow, but it was not easy. The lectures to me did not help much, but the online textbook and the math tutoring center picked up her slack. The exams have few questions and were rough, the class average was always at a C- or lower for the exams, compared to the other professors A- exam average. Beware.

Dr. Lakos cares about students, she crafts very clear lectures and allows for student participation. She pays attention to where the class is and pauses for questions and clarification. Best calculus teacher for me. I struggled with other professors at OSU who did not seem tuned into the class.

Unprofessional and condescending. You'd better pray that you understand everything perfectly because if you ask questions she will berate your existence. Expects you to understand everything, so if you're going to office hours better hope you don't have any questions.

Her lectures were fast paced and she assumes we understand all the material when we arrive. I completely understood homework but still struggled to get higher than a D on any of her tests. Posts reviews however the test is Nothing like them. Overall pick a different professor

If you have another option available for this class, Id cease it. Some tested material on exams was only briefly mentioned in lectures and not present in the textbook/homework. Dont expect to ever get a response back via email. Recommend taking with another professor or at CSCC. This has been my worst experience with the OSU math department.

She's good at teaching and explaining math. Her demeanor can come off as condescending but seems like a cultural difference and it's pretty funny. Cares about students and our learning. Standardized system for HW and take-home quizzes. Gave extensive reviews for tests which were similar or easier than reviews. Organized lectures with examples.

Awful. She talks down to students. You're supposed to know everything BEOFRE she teaches. She always says you should know this when someone asks a question after she asks if there any questions. Exams are NOT like the homework or practice exams. Ignores emails and messages. Wasted 60% of semester on group practice problems during recitation.
The worst teacher I have met in OSU, tough exams and useless lecture. Too fast pace in the lecture, you can learn almost nothing in her class.
Math 2153. It becomes pretty difficult after 2nd midterm.
horrible, awful doesn't care about her students. Not helpful during office hours she is mean when you ask her for help. Reviews are nothing like exams. and harsh grader.
Actually took 2153, but there was no option. Most suck midterms I've ever had.
A math professor who genuinely cares about your education. She inspired me to take more math.

I basically went to all her office hours and scraped by with a B. If you dont understand a topic and go to her for help, it is likely that she will snap at you. Overall, I dont think shes a bad professor. If you truly want to understand the concepts, you need to put in the work. The online and written homeworks are essential.
Dr. Lakos has been my favorite professor so far. She really cares about her students and is very good at explaining key concepts.
Great professor, would recommend office hours, very caring.

Diff EQ was  hands down the hardest class I've ever had. I made 1 mistake on a test and she literally failed me over it. Doing the homework was like working a full time job. Literally 35-40 hours a week. She snaps at students. Her office hours were packed with students every time. If you need 2415, save yourself and don't take it with Lakos!
Actually cares about the students. If you put in effort, she'll definitely notice it.

Ridiculous amounts of extremely difficult homework, confusing material (not even math), and uses a completely different textbook than other sections. Even though I got an A, I don't recommend this course; there are easier alternatives. Nela as a professor though isn't terrible, but definitely a tough cookie. If you hang in there tho you will get A.

Not an easy course. She includes many different concepts into her problems so that they relate to the future scientists and engineers in the class. Tests weren't detailed though and she prepares you well for them. Always collects one problem from the assigned homework each week, usually problem #5.

Always do the homework, and you will get an A. I didn't attend many lectures but, I thought Dr. Lakos was very funny sometimes and she would frequently pause in lecture to allow us time to try solving problems before the solution is revealed which helps a lot. I suggest organizing your work well for the most partial credit.

Professor Lakos has to be one of the best lecturers in the math department. She makes everything super easy to understand and has no problem explaining something in a different way if you didn't understand it the first time around. She really tries to connect with her students and foster an interest for the subject in them.
Really great lecturer, kept the class moving at a fast pace and enjoyed the material.  Can be kind of rude sometimes, but she's helpful and an excellent professor.

The absolute BEST math instructor I've had! When starting the course I was doing terrible but after going to office hours, my grade improved a great deal. I truly recommend visiting office hours on a regular bases.

She was a well organized teacher. the examples she gave in class were basically the questions that were on the test. The midterms/final were uniformed across every different teacher so she did not make her own tests. The quizzes in recitation are doable (never really studied). used the book for extra problems DO the hw its helpful. STUDY her notes

She was one of my favorite professors my freshman year. Do the assigned homework and go to class and recitation. On top of that, do the optional review exercises before quizzes and exams. If you prepare well for exams it should be an A or a B type of class.

Sometimes it is hard to understand her as English is her second language. Her notes are posted online so lecture isn't required, you can usually learn everything in recitation and get a better understanding than in lecture. Overall she wasn't bad but not great.

Class is hard as hell, thankfully you have her to this you through it. You will really gain a better understanding of the corce material from her class which leaves you better prepared for other corces

Nela is a great lecturer. Her quizzes are straightforward if you attend lecture, but her exams are very difficult. Although the book is likely never referenced, use it and prepare more than the mandatory homework requires. She is a fair grader, but expect exams to mirror only the content of the quizzes, not the difficulty level.

Best math teacher at OSU!!!  I had no problems understanding her, and she does an excellent job explaining difficult material.  Here quizzes, mid-terms, and final are reasonable.    Study hard and you'll be fine!  If you are going to need to use math a lot, she is for sure the teacher to have because you will really learn the material!

She's definitely a love or hate professor, and personally, I loved her. The class was in general very easy and she makes a notable effort to make sure everyone understands the material. Best way to prepare for the midterms is study the quizzes, and for the final, study the midterms.

Couldn't really understand her a bit. Not helpful, she was never available when she said she would be. Midterms/Final were ridiculous but with immense amount of studying you can pass. She wants people to do well, but I can't say I learned a lot. Be prepared to do a lot on your own.

Wonderful teacher and SMART. Very clear and organized teaching style and very helpful--she wants everyone to get a good grade. Tests and quizzes are difficult but doable if you do practice problems and understand everything crystal clear. Very very fair grading, even if not curved. She replaces midterm grades if you do better on the final.

An awesome professor.  After 162 I made sure to take 263H with her. She was always available after class for help and taught extremely well.  Tests and quizzes were hard, but graded fairly, and there is in fact a curve in all her classes

Worst class EVER. Had a 81% going into the final. Final was insane. Got a F. DOES NOT CURVE THE CLASS, no matter what. She doesn't help if you go to office hours, she yelled at me constantly if I did not understand something. never responds to emails either. another teacher gave out a take home midterm and she didnt. would advise to NOT take her.
Hard as heck. Doesnt give study guides while others do. Tests 200% harder than others from the same class.
She's the sweetest woman. Really nice ans ungodly smart.  Her class is just really hard and rather fast paces.

She's a great professor. Very nice and knowledgeable. Her tests are hard. I thought I failed the second midterm, but I ended up getting a B- on it and an A in the class. So don't freak out about a bad midterm, its not the end of hope.
Very good math teacher!
Great and Enthusiastic Teacher! Pretty clear and straight-forward during lectures, and willing to help with an programs in the course.
she cant be understood if in back of class and her slides are really small
She is by far the best math teacher I have had here at OSU

Go to lectures and you should be fine.  She is always prepared.  However, her tests are different types of problems than her quizzes and homework.  You have to go to the test prep sessions to prepare for those... Good teacher, over all. Sticks to the syllabus.

She's easy to talk to and understand but not necessarily the most helpful at office hours. Asks questions and she will help you though. Her exams aren't easy but you can do quite well if you do the practice problems; she will give opportunities to earn points back if the class struggles though.

Lakos is one of the best in the math department.  She is challenging but very fair.  If you regularly do the practice homework and demonstrate that you're making a good effort, getting a B or higher is not difficult at all.  Moreover, she's very nice, and she genuinely likes teaching.  She dedicates a lot of time to her students.
She is a great prof, if you are willing to work hard and study math regularly. I love her teaching style.
Tough class, but a very sweet and helpful lady.

Good prof, but difficult.  I rarely got finished with exams in time, but I didn't exactly study all that much either.  Interesting accent, and she's passionate about what she teaches.  Good prof overall.

Nela is awesome!  I don't like math and shouldn't have even taken the class, but I'm glad I did.  The material is undoubtedly tough, but Mrs. Lakos is as helpful as you want her to be.  If you go to her office hours, she will do everything she can to help you learn the material and succeed--I did not deserve the A- I got in her class.

It takes a little while to get used to her accent, but okay after you get used to it. Homework can be long/hard, but quizzes aren't too bad. Her tests are very similar to her quizzes so you're well prepared and know about what to expect. A funny lady, but she does have her favorites. Ask questions and pay attention, and you should be set.

I also had her for 161A.  She's very passionate about what she teaches.  However, she goes very fast through the material, so watch out!  Definitely do the homework.  Recitations may not always be the most useful, depends on the TA.  Study study study for the quizzes midterms and final!

Lakos' class is ridiculously hard, and she gives a lot of homework that she thinks easy, but is difficult for those of us who are not geniuses. Still, I loved her! Office hours, she was so helpful, and she is the sweetest woman ever. If you must take H161, definitely take it from Lakos. She won't let you fail if you try really hard.

Many test questions based of quiz questions. She explains things clearly and goes over the theory but never holds you accountable for it. Allows you to replace midterm grades with a portion of your final exam. Great teacher and not a hard class if you put in the effort.
diffacult to understand, and doesnt speak english good.  if in her class i recomend switching to another proffesor becasue it will be extreamly boring.
Difficult to understand, went very fast through material. Hard to bargain for points on exams. Very knowlegeable, though. Do the homework!!

Best teacher I have had at OSU thus far. Only my honors geometry, honors precalculus, and Calc AB teachers in high school were better teachers. Clear and helpful. You will get used to her accent, and once you do, it pays to stick with her for the whole series. She appreciates good students.

Nela knows all the material very very well.  She also is very good at explaining the material and gives great examples in lecture.  She knows when students are struggling and is very willing to help.  Overall Nela is a great professor, probably the best I've had.
Great teacher. I really like Nela

Nela is fantastic. She's one of the best math teachers I have ever had - normally, I struggle with material like this, but Nela made it clear and almost self-explanatory. Very willing to help out students, and she can tell when people aren't getting it.  Nela's great!!
I love her - I understand her well enough (and she can tell when you're having trouble), and she's passionate about what she's teaching and skilled at getting it to you.

She was a little difficult to understand at first but her manner of lecturing was clear and she spoke loud and made attempts to lighten her accent.  She was always willing to help and kept you very informed about what was going on in the class.
Very hard to understand and very hard period.  Not much of an option for FEH, but knew the material, just not how to teach.
Very good professor, but writes difficult exams
i loved her
im pretty sure that nela is the smartest woman alive.  also,  she can communicate that knowledge pretty well.  overall, was a great professor.
An amazing teacher. In fact the best one I have ever had.

DO NOT TAKE 151C!!!  The first thing we learn in the class is that we will not be able to pass a regular math class after taking this class... the teacher tells us to ask questions often, but yells at the students and makes them feel stupid.
Very hard to understand, likes to teach mainly theory in class.
Great Teacher

I had her for my entire math series (161, 162, and 254) and I was pretty glad.  She taught us what we needed to know and didn't waste so much time on thoery like every other math prof out there.  She just understood that engineers don't care about theory
pretty helpful.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

My thing with this professor is that he is a great guy - super friendly and caring. However, his lectures are a waste of time. I feel bad saying it but he is just not a great teacher. His handwriting is super messy and he does not go over topics well. I skipped all the lectures and taught myself what I needed to outside of recitation.

He would get distracted in lecture a lot, meaning he would have to finish the notes after lecture and then post them. His teaching is decent, but it's definitely not fast paced. His handwriting is extremely bad, meaning that I could in no way skip the lecture, even though he would post the notes, because it was so hard to understand.

The content was straightforward, as it was out of an ALEKS textbook and website. The handwriting was sloppy on lecture notes and tangents made it difficult to follow sometimes, however, they were always posted after class. It's not attendance based at all but he will never cancel lectures. One quiz a week, 3 midterms, a final, and homework grades.

His lectures are totally pointless. You would be better off reading the textbook and teaching yourself instead of going to his lectures. The recitations are pointless too, they just do the same problems he did in lecture. My suggestion is to just teach yourself in a way you understand.

It seems as if they try to make the class as hard as possible. Exams are significantly harder than the material they teach in lecture and recitation. TA's are somewhat helpful but you need to study your ass off for an A. Darry is terrible at communicating and gets a lot of his own problems wrong even. Very exam heavy as well. Dont take this section

Darrys a nice guy. Hes not a great professor at all. I learned nothing from attending his lectures. Theyre optional, I wouldnt bother going. You cant read his handwriting, which is hard when hes solving math problems. Dont bother with the textbook either. As long as you go to recitation religiously, youll be fine. Final exam is cumulative.

This class was unreasonably hard. I have always been a strong math student, but I struggled in this class. Lectures are pointless and only go over basic problems, not to mention you can't read his handwriting. Also, the exams on Carmen were nitpicky and destroyed my grade. Do not take this professor.

Definitely the worst professor I've had at OSU. Terrible at teaching and doesn't get through anything in a lecture (maybe 4-5 problems) because he gets so off track. Math 1130 should be an easy class but he made it 10x harder. He tries his best to be a nice professor and teach, but I really think he needs to be reevaluated as an instructor.

Darry is a really nice guy, but not really that great of a professor. He always came late to his lectures, and we weren't even able to get through all of the course material. Be prepared to read the textbook a ton if you want to do well. The tests were extremely difficult, and I've always considered myself good at math. Ask for help if needed.

He's a nice guy and is funny, but that's it. You better have 11/10 self-studying skills cause you will lose knowledge during his lectures. He makes a mountain of mistakes every lecture and he spends half of class arguing with his students about simple addition. We were a month and a half behind other calc classes. Tests were not that hard tho.

Worst prof Ive ever had. Hes constantly making mistakes and doesnt realize until he stares at it for 10 mins. Exams are 80% of the class, and are on things Ive never seen before. Lectures are a desultory attempt to explain concepts, but spends all time on simple problems. Exams look nothing like anything weve done. Dont take this class.

Dr. Andrews's lectures are of absolutely bad quality. He often uses a whole lecture to solve an extremely easy computational problem. If your professor is Dr. Andrews, consider following the same course of Harvard University. That is clearer and deeper than the lectures by Dr. Andrews. I followed it and scored over 95 in two midterms.
Nice guy, but not a great teacher, think it before you take.... and good luck!

Worst teacher I've ever had. He is truly a nice guy and I feel bad saying it, but it's the truth; he is a very bad teacher. When students have questions, I always want to interrupt him and answer myself because he always gives complicated (and sometimes incorrect) answers and the whole class ends up being more confused than before.

Darry Andrews wants students to do well, is understanding and will help you in office hours and is willing to give points back.  Didn't always go to lecture because his handwriting is terrible and couldn't read half the notes.  Should do fine in 1130 if you've had any remotely upper level math in high school, not too hard of a class

Darry Andrews is a nice guy who has absolutely no idea what he is doing. Honestly, his teaching ability is so lacking there is almost no purpose in going to lecture, just try and teach yourself everything and you should be okay.

Andrews is horribly unclear and can never figure out the smart board in the classroom, lucky to do two problems a lecture. Says to ask TA for help, TA says to talk to prof for help, horrible instructor.

Lecture is impossible, so unless you have a good TA, you'll have a difficult time in the course.  However, if you take advantage of math tutoring hours and the study guides he hands out, you should pass.

I've literally never had a worse professor than Dr. Andrews. His lectures are pointless, Doesnt know how to work anything on the computer. Study guides dont cover anything that's actually on the Exam. Stay far, far away from taking his class!!!!!!!!!!!
He is awful at teaching... Students are correcting him often.

Dr. Andrews is a really nice professor, but tends to explain concepts in lecture in very round-about ways. If you have a good TA though, you will be fine. Just make sure you do all the suggested homework problems and go to your recitations.

Darry is a horrible lecturer. He does not know how to use basic tools like powerpoint or the smart board correctly and his handwriting is so bad you can't understand the notes even if you wanted to. I went to a different lecturer for the whole semester and used my book for any additional help and got an A. Avoid this professor if you want an A.

Darry seems like a good guy but v his v lectures are awful.  I haven''t really learned a thing yet and I have attended every lecture since day one and take  notes. He over complicates concepts and examples.  He comes off brash when lecturing and seems to think it''s the TAS job to v teach us everything he''s just reviewing the concepts.

Dr. Andrews was extremely helpful when I went to see him at the MSLC or at his office hours, however, lecture was pretty tough to sit through. He wasn't great at using the computer system and his handwriting is illegible. Not that hard though if you are above average at math.

Andrews is not a good lecturer. His handwriting is atrocious. Study your hardest with hopefully a good TA. Mine was alright and I still did poorly in the course. Trust me, if you can take a different lecture, do it. He sometimes plays music on fridays, and makes jokes in class, but when it comes to teaching, its a rough life.

Quit attending lecture after the first month. It was pointless because he over explained the easiest concepts and didn't even touch on the confusing ones. Avoid this professor unless you are good at teaching yourself. If you are bad at math like I am, he is of absolutely no help. He seems like a good guy, just not a good professor.
Over explains everything. Lecture is pointless because he constantly makes mistakes and make concepts harder to understand.

Hes great at teaching, especially when you go to his office hours. Problem is, he never really tests you on what you were taught. Theres always a minute detail that kills everyone on tests. Last autumns class average was a 55%. Get outta this class, hes a great guy, but he cant test you well.

He's a nice guy, yes.  However, like most people who made comments on here, he is pretty tough.  What upset me most about the class was that he screwed around in lecture and kept getting our class behind.  And when he did problems, he did the most basic general concepts, which you think would be nice, until you saw his exams. Rediculus

This professor spent very little time reviewing the type of problems that appeared on his exams. Most of his class time is spent covering the extreme basics and then he procedes to put the hardest possible problems on the exams. Even the TA's say his exams are almost impossible to get a good grade on. Do not take him!

Very poor professor. Final grade curved to a D+/C-. I did better than average and only got a C-. Very strict grader. Partial credit rarely given on quizzes and homework. Very unfair and unorganized professor
If you really want his help go to his office hours. Yes his handwriting is bad but he makes a lot of sense
Has very bad hand writing. Can't understand what he is writing. Boring lectures.

He is an okay teacher, but his handwriting is absolutely awful. If you are a notes person, don't take him. Also he is more of a big picture math guy. If you need lots of examples to understand, this is not your teacher

The professor clearly is not going over his own notes prior to a lecture.  The results are predictable - struggling with problems chosen for the notes, lecture pacing slows to a crawl, and comprehension of the material by the students does not occur.  Seriously, I learned more from the TA.
its an osu math class so dont expect it to be easy, but if you follow his midterms and hw assignments its not bad

Not a horrible teacher. You can understand him, but the only negative side is that he sometimes makes some errors in the examples he gives and us students catch most of them. Exams aren't too bad, follow the review tests he gives, know a lot of homework problems too, most of them you'll see again. Tests were alright but not super easy.

he knows math, but it doesn't translate in his lectures.  Spends about 5 minutes of each lecture struggling with his computer (rotating the display, choosing the right color, etc), and another 10 going through easy math parts of the real problems.  He does have notes online though, so that's good.
He is a terrible teacher, I've had him twice and both of my bad math scores have come from him, avoid at all costs.
Good teacher.

Professor Andrews undoubtedly knows his math, yet seems to not be able to teach the material as well as he knows it. He would make mistakes while teaching and be corrected by students at times. However, if you are looking to do well in his class then seek help from him because he is helpful.

He has been the best teacher I have ever had in math.  I think most of the people who have been making comments are probably freshman who are used to teachers babysitting them and receiving inflated grades.  Dr. Andrews does not make up the tests and gives us who ATTEND lecture plenty of helpful hints about the midterms. No other lecturer does this
Absolutely the worst lecturer. Very nice man just horrible in conducting a class. Overall class sucks!  Lectures and exams do not coincide. GOOD LUCK!

I did not like this class at all. Darry put people to sleep every time in lecture. He was nice and polite but the man can not teach and he takes forever to get through one problem. If you get him as a teacher just pray for a good TA you're gonna need it. You're better off sleeping in than going to lecture..I wish you luck!

He was incredibly confusing. He didn't work many examples in class, and when he did he would do them in the most complicated way that would take twice as long as it should. He rambled on a lot and if I wouldn't have had an amazing TA I never would have done as well as I did.
He screws up all the time and is hard to understand. Furhtermore, he takes forever to work simple problems and does not do difficult example in class
