He's a very nice person who's willing to help you via office hours and email... but he takes so long to explain things in class and rarely, if ever, did all the examples he had prepared for class in the alloted time (had to look at notes posted on the website for them).  I felt as if the teacher could have been a lot clearer in explaining things.
No Comments

That man put me to sleep almost every class period!! There were lectures that I just didn't go to becuase he was just so boring. And if he just would stop stuttering and repeating himself maybe it would help!

If I hadn't failed the class before and been through the material once before I would have failed again. This guy is unclear, rambles on about unimportant things, doesn't cover the material only copies the explantations out of the books so you have no examples to go off of. Avoid this guy unless you want to have to take the math class again.
My instructor was clear in his presentations. His pace was just right. Plenty of examples were given throughout the class.

Can we say boring! He spends most of the time talking about what is not important and less time talking about what actually matters. He is so unclear about what he is tryin to convay to the class.  Don't not take him!!

Alright, early Winter quarter as it may be, I STILL felt the need to say i think it's going to be a LOOONNNNNGGGG 10 weeks with this guy calling the shots.  easy to understand--but then again he gives it in the Mr. Roger's style, explaining what COLOR buttons to push on the calculator.  Go Bucks!

Even though I utterly failed his class, I can't hate him. A great lecturer, passionate about his work and tries to get the audience involved.  Test are difficult, but reasonable with study.  In this class attendance is not mandatory, but you will not succeed if you skip class. I regularly skipped class and paid the price.
man he was just too good!

Honestly, he is one of the best math professors in the department. He teaches the curriculum clearly, gives loads of extra credit, and is extremely reasonable (he let me off with a late homework). If you are taking Lin Alg, do it with him. You will not regret it.
If you actually show up to lecture your grade will improve by a lot. Lots of extra credit available. Pretty helpful in office hours.
Worst instructor ever.

This has to be the worst math professor I have taken at OSU. The class itself is not hard but his lectures are very confusing, and the method of extra credit is very unfair with the ability for one student to receive all the points and leave the other students struggling. Do not take this class under this professor, not worth it.

He is very condescending and rude. Is not helpful during office hours and seems to not want you there. He has only 3 tests in his class each point on the test is a percent of your grade. The homework is hard and his lectures are fast and confusing. Study the textbook and do your work to pass. You "can" get extra credit on assignments but you won't.

The class is test heavy, but there is a lot of extra credit. Each homework assignment has the potential for extra credit. All exams were curved by 10 percent. You have to go to class to know what proofs you need to memorize, but his lectures are very good. He is reasonable with the amount of homework he gives too. Best OSU Math Professor.

Fantastic professor, truly one of the best professors that I have had so far as an undergraduate. Lectures are always engaging and interesting. You can tell that he truly enjoys the material and offers questions for students to think about in their free time if interested. The class itself was somewhat difficult, but that's due to the material.

Malen is my least favorite professor! If you ask him somewhat of a dumb question, he will definitely be irritated and show signs of anger. He doesn't actually care about his students. Lecture literally seems to be just his "job" that he has to fulfill.

Saved my semester in MATH2162. My lecturer never really did any application problems, but that is all we focused on in recitation. Greg is a great guy and really cares about his students. He makes confusing concepts very clear and easy to understand.
Very Good TA, basically what got me through the course since the lecturer wasn't all that great. More than happy to go out of his way to help. Highly recommend him.

Solid TA- one of the first I've had in the Math Dept. that speaks and understands English. He made a couple of mistakes working problems, but he always caught them and apologized. Good-natured, friendly, helpful.

The secret to finally understanding calculus is having a professor who also happens to be a stand-up comedian at heart. Hermiller will also answer any math-y questions you may have as he clearly wants to see his students understand the underlying concepts without just memorizing a pattern or formula.

I had this professor in Highschool and man was it great to see him again in College, he is easy to follow for a tough class.  His class is very fast pace, and although he give out a lot of hw, they are more so for extra credit.  He is very accessible outside of class, and uses remind to make sure your following along the hw and quizzes and test.

I hate math and I thought I would hate a 2 hour lecture even more but Mr. Hermiller made it enjoyable. This guy moves quick but always makes sure that you're following. His note taking process is amazing and he really does want to see you do well. If you have the chance take 1148 with him. He will teach you better than any professor.
1148 is a tough class, but he is very helpful. He wants yo to succeed. Class pace is fast, but his notes are great.
Amazing teacher.
Great class! I was terrible at math in high school and really nervous to take this class. Mr. Hermiller was very helpful and truly was there for the students.
BEST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD AT OHIO STATE. He literally sets his students up for success. He is a funny guy, yet at the same time you get a lot done. I enjoyed his class throughly.
Hermiller is a great teacher. He's simple, straightforward and takes his time to make sure everyone knows what they are doing.

Mr. Hermiller was an excellent teacher. He also teaches high school during the day and does night classes at OSU. I knew mostly everything he was teaching but he helped me develop other ways of doing the math. He adds humor to the class and his teaching is very thorough

Mr. Hermiller is an exceptional teacher.  I had not taken math in over 25 years and I was very nervous. Mr. Hermiller teaches in a simple manner without making you feel 'dumb.'  It is also obvious that he really wants the students to learn.  I wish he could teach all my classes.  Great teacher!
Absolutely the best math professor that I have ever had.  Very helpful, very knowledgable, and a cool guy overall.  Made math class fun! One of my favorites of all time.

I had not taken a math class in ten years and was not looking forward to this class. Mr. Hermiller was excellent. He tried to get to class early and always answered questions clearly and concisely. I wish I could take all of my math classes with him!
GREAT teacher. I wish he could have taught all of my math classes. Very helpful in and outside of class and made math, dare I say.. fun =P

I honestly HATE math but Mr.Hermiller was an excellent teacher. He was always willing to help in anyway at anytime. He gave sample quizes before every quiz and also provided sample exams. If I had a chance I would absolutely take a class with him again!
I actually had him for 104 first but liked his teaching style so much that I enrolled specifically in his class for 148. Funny (in a dorky kind of way;), energetic, and a great teacher.
Really cool teach.  Learn some stuff, got an A. What more can I ask for?

Professor explained everything very well.  Recomend this instructor for anyone that has a fear of taking math courses at the college level. does a great job breaking everything down.  does most of his lecture with the use of pretty good powerpoint presentation.  Does not take attendance.
great teacher take his class

Dr. Hafuta was very caring and understanding. He always stayed behind if needed, set up zooms if he couldn't stay, and answered my emails even when it was close to the deadline. He explained things readily without being condescending and was very patient. His exams were very reasonable and had no surprises.

Took 3345 with him SP2022 and he was great. Good lectures, funny guy, and would hold reviews before the exams that were similar to the actual exams. 3345 is a notoriously hard class, but with him it was not bad at all. Highly recommend

The class itself is pretty challenging but if you do the homeworks and watch the lectures, you will be just fine. The lectures before the exams he does a review session that more or less tells you exactly what will be on the exam which REALLY helps your grades. He is lenient on grading too.
I absolutely loved this class. Attending lectures really helped me get through this course.

I absolutely can not understand anything he says. If it weren't for the internet, I would have to put the recorded lectures on slow-motion and attempt to decipher the transcript. Has a heavy accent. Quizzes also seem to be on material from the last lecture or two instead of the lectures from a week ago, so prepare to bomb every quiz, every week.

Professor Hafuta was an amazing professor. You could approach him after class if something in lecture didn't make sense. YOU MUST GO TO THE LECTURE BEFORE THE EXAM. He will go over basically what every question on the exam will be but with different numbers. I was able to finish with over a 100 in the class because of this.

I had him for Physics 111 and I absolutely loved him. He was funny and thorough in his lectures. Lectures could be a little long but he covered what was on the exam exactly. He told us exactly what we needed to know and did as many examples as we needed. Easy going grader, lots of partial credit. Always ready to help with anything he can

I loved his class!  The reviews online had me scared, but Chris was one of my favorite teachers.  He is funny and engaging, and if you talk to him he is willing to help.  You will definitely need to study and work hard, but it is worth it.

Worst professor I've ever had. Extremely unprofessional and disorganized. Only 8 homework grades and midterms only had 5 questions with barely any partial credit given. He is unclear and tends to make many confusing mistakes during the few examples he gives. STAY FAR AWAY!

I absolutely loved him as a teacher most people complain about his grades how hard he is but if you look at the classes most classes he teaches are the ones that transition to harder ones so if you don't understand you pass the class you will  do worse next year
Worst professor ever. Cannot give a proper lecture without making mistakes and preparing you for his exams.
Absolute joke of a professor. Awful at his job do not take a class with him.

Arrogant, and just mean in general. Tries to be funny by making sexist comments or whatever and can't stay on topic to save his life. Literally will go through a whole lecture and at the end mention that you don't need to actually know that. DO NOT TAKE

This is for MATH 1118.  He stopped using book half was through to try experiment. Doesn't dress professionally( Pjs). Makes sexist jokes on class and doesn't care. Believes that giving us sample questions for the exam or even telling us what to study degrades or degree.

Showed how to do example problems, but didn't explain the theory very well, which was problematic when the final was (unexpectedly) mostly multiple choice theory questions. Willing to help and answer questions when asked, but it is still often unclear. Study as much as possible, and have drinks ready after each exam.

This course is extremely difficult. You have to want an A in order to get it. If you are not use to the whole "studying thing" get use to it. Without more studying, other than homework and for quizzes, you won't pass. Study more than just the night before. Also he is really funny, but very difficult to follow and understand, goes really fast.

Everyone here is complaining about him, but honestly it's just the class itself that's really tough.  I felt as if he did a good job explaining every required concept for the midterms and final, plus he was funny.  The material itself was very difficult but it was no fault of his, friends w other lecturers struggled as much if not more than I did.

Altomare is indeed a smart individual; he knows what he talks about but he is NOT a good example of what a lecturer should be. In general he stresses about theory over physical applications which in an engineering-based calculus course is not what one should be doing. If you have him, don't drop him unless you NEED a competent lecturer to learn.

Altomare is hands down the worst professor I have ever had. If you end up with him in your schedule, switch ASAP. He is more interested in theories and real life application than actually teaching and preparing you for exams. 1172 is hard enough, don't let this guy make it harder. Hes also a stand up comedian. Lectures are about as bad as his jokes
Probably the worst professor Ive ever had. Makes zero sense. Learn from the book and dont go to lecture.

Switch out!!! Worst prof, especially night classes. Before each quiz he would tell us, "If you look up, I will kill you." Very rude, poor lecture ability, and make concepts more confusing. No help at office hours! Teach yourself from the book to pass the tests. He even emailed my class telling everyone they are going to fail out of college. So BAD.

He is not fantastic by any means. Exams were really easy though. I slept almost every day and still got an A. If you take him for who he is he is pretty ridiculous and funny to listen to. I recommend asking random non-math questions; he will have fantastic answers.
Decided he wasn't going to curve the class to FEH standards...so very few people got A's.

Horrible professor. Ask a question and he wont answer it because he "wants us to develop math sense on our own". Switch out and if you cant rely heavily on your TA. Possibly go to another lecture it helps. Exams are extremely easy though, got a 100 on 2 midterms and final
Not much to like about this guy other than his tests are easy.  Material is confusing at times, and he claims the tests are hard but they're not bad

Had him for linear algebra...he didn't even know the material very well and made mistakes frequently while teaching. Thankfully his exams were super reasonable because attending lecture was basically worthless. I taught myself linear algebra.

His Linear algebra examsinvolved a lot of little details which amounted to a lot of points. Many times on exams a problem that took 30 min was worth the same as a problem that took 2 min. His way of solving problems is much easier but different from the book. However he dosen't teach you the little tricks. You have to ask question then it is ez A.
This man is about as useful as his left arm! At least I think it was his left. It's been a while since I took the class.

Arrogant and unhelpful.  I was optimistic after the first class but it goes downhill really fast. He was never prepared for lecture, had horrible lecture notes, and insults anyone who asks questions.  I recommend attending Ms. Miller's lectures.

Pretty much everything everyone says about this guy is true. You can tell he is extremely intelligent, but he should not be teaching. He often shows up late to his own lectures. He's arrogant, unhelpful and he made an easy class much harder than it should have been. I highly recommend that you avoid him, or hope that you have a great TA.
Just horrible all around. I only went to a couple lectures before I started going to a different lecturer with someone else in my class.

His entire teaching consists of him saying how much better he is than you and rambling about random things. Going to his lectures are useless. Spend the time reading your book instead, and just go to all the recitations.

This guy is absolutely horrible. Switched out of his class promptly after he spent three lectures literally teaching nothing. He ran an extra credit help session in which he didn't help at all, but merely stated that he didn't know how to use excel or complete the assignment. I honestly don't understand why OSU employs this guy.
wow. worst prof ever. stopped attending class within two weeks and improved drastically.

Everything you've heard is true. He starts the first lecturer of the quarter saying everyone tell your best injury story. You think he's funny but he doesn't teach anything. Rambles on and on about other stuff but I'd advise you to switch teachers.

Altomare tries to really hard to teach but i don't think he is just meant to. The guy is should just another occupation in math cuz he is really smart but he just doesn't know how to teach the content. Only went to lecturers when it was exam time. If it weren't for my T.A. i would not have stayed in the course. Hope this helps
ok, in all honesty I though altomare was a god awful lecturer. It was pretty common for his examples in class to be not even close to midterm/final caliber. Also, he is rarely on time for anything.
Worst professor I have ever had, should not teach at all. Switch classes if he's your professor, or go to the lectures of another professor.

if you see this man is teaching your class, run. You will learn absolutely nothing. the first day of class will have 250 plus students. next week maybe 40 if your lucky. you're also lucky if he shows up on time. If he even shows up..
Very hard to understand. Try another professor, unless you have an awesome T.A., you will be out of luck.
Shows up late to class. Lots of rambling
Horrible... he sucks to the extreme...he stay wearing them short shorts....learn to teach

bad really really bad. not helpful at all. always tells us to drill and that we should practice the stuff we are learning, but never actually teaches it to us. he starts out the course all cutsie trying to get your approval but then just confuses you with random crap that he later says is useless. he made me hate math

Horrible lecturer. I was fortunate enough to have an amazing TA and also a tutor, or this class would have ended badly. I only went to lecture about once a week, and always regretted it. I left lecture feeling more confused than when I went in. He rambles on and on about nonsense stuff and is terrible at explaining even the simplest concepts.

Absolutely useless as a professor; if I hadn't covered the most of the material in high school/had a good TA this class would've been very difficult. He is very unprofessional, and spends lectures going on about the importance of math while not teaching the subject. It's not impossible to do well in this class, you just have to do it on your own.
horrible teacher, i stopped going to his lecture after the first week and went to my friends teacher instead. does not explain anything in class. i HIGHLY recommend switching teachers

He knows calculus but cannot teach it. At all. The book is quite useless in examples. I would not have passed on his instruction and the book alone. If you have this professor, the MSLC will be your best friend.
Just absolutely awful.  Did nothing for attending Lectures, rambled on about nothing.  I advise to sign up for another professor.

He is terrible at explaining anything. He spent 20 minutes one day saying infinity = BIG. He either over simplifies things to the point where the concept is lost or tells you that you'll never use something and give a terrible explanation of it. He attempts to be humorous and sometimes is but more often then not it makes him look like a ****.
avoid him at all costs!!!!!

Because of this guy, i have not gone to a math lecture in over a month and my grades have improved in doing so. i highly reccomend skipping the lecture and just spend the time reading the book and attending your ta's office hours

At first I thought I was really going to enjoy Chris.  However, as the quarter comes to a close, I realize I did not enjoy my time spent in lecture and I hardly learned anything.  I learned so much more from my TA.  Chris made many mistakes while teaching and my TA made very few.  I highly recommend finding a different lecturer.

Chris's lectures are impossible to follow, he constantly makes mistakes while doing problems and doesn't realize it until he gets to the end and the answer is wrong, then everybody gets confused as to what is going on. He has made understanding math more difficult for me. I suggest looking through the book and not going to lecture to do well

He rarely introduces general methods for solving a problem. He does an example REALLY fast and then asks "Do you get it now?" Then, when the inevitable "NO!" comes back from the class, he just moves on to a more complicated problem and tells us we need to understand it for the midterm. Going to lecture is almost useless.

Lecturer now, not TA. Currently looking to attend different lecture.  Often reacts with annoyance to any questions.  Makes frequent mistakes in his examples.  Teaches solely through doing problems, but usually doesn't finish them or adequately explain them. Exams very hard  thus far, and he offers no practice tests (other profs do, find them) Avoid

Mr. Altomare is a very bad lecturer. At first he appears to be a fun, interesting teacher, but you soon learn that he is fairly arrogant and terrible at teaching his students. He frequently screws up when teaching math problems, and fails to explain how to do such problems. You are better off teaching the material to yourself.

Let me say, I got an A+, with no help from Chris. I stopped going to his lectures and learned it on my own. He came to class never prepared. On his birthday, he BEGGED us to sing him happy birthday, and was gonna cry if we didnt. Also, if he had a substitute, he would almost cry if we thought they were better, which they were. SWITCH NOW!

He ruined my GPA because he's a miserable man. Even if you have every necessary person on your side he still will not help you. He doesn't care about disability or close deaths. You cannot miss any midterm or final for your best friends funeral. He also does not answer or return calls or answer emails in timely matter.

Chris is the worst teacher you could ever have. He never came to class prepaired.  Always confused on what he was teaching and then would blame the students when he didn't know what to teach because knowone knew what questions to ask.  He may seem funny but for paying big $$$ you learn nothing from him.  Rely on the tutor rooms or your TA

He's a funny guy, but a terrible teacher. He doesn't explain things well at all and a lot of the time he screws up problems. He's likable as a person, but as a teacher he's arrogant and rather unhelpful - I recommend finding someone else.

Smart guy, horrible teacher. He is super-intelligent, and he knows it. He seemed to make up the lecture as he went along. He wore pajamas to class and encouraged students to do it. You're better off learning math from Gabba Gabba.

WASTE OF TIME!! Has to be the worst math prof at OSU. He is never prepared for lecture and all he does is make mistakes. If there is another lecturer available SWITCH NOW! If I didnt take calc in High school I would have failed out of this class. Very cocky and not funny at all. Also never posted office hours the whole quarter
Math lectures are pretty terrible no matter who your professor is. At least he has a decent sense of humor.

Arrogant is an understatement. Does not have time for students, continuously freaked out when ppl whispered. Always threatened to kill the person that was whispering, but usually just kicked them out of the classroom. He thought he was SOOOO funny, but ended up wasting a lot of my time. I self-taught myself the material since the TA was worthless.

Worst TA I have ever had hands down. He is so arrogant and cocky and never helps students. Every class he would go through problems half way and not finish because he thinks that we can do  the problems on our own. Also he will ramble on about how he runs marathons and swims, which have nothing to do with math. He will never get laid.

Being Math 153, course material is hard, but he makes it as easy and simple as possible. Explains everything great, and is HILARIOUS. I've never laughed so hard in a Math class. Best TA I've had by far. Really interested in helping students. Great TA and highly reccomended.

He's pretty cocky, and will make a decent amount of mistakes.  Also, he's kind of a ****.  I'd suggest a different TA, he's just not very willing to help you out, ever.  Also, the environment of his classroom is similar to that of the BMV.  You'll survive through the class, but if you can take someone else, go for it.

I had Chris as a lecturer.  I attended every class but ended up relying on my textbook to teach myself.  He was a little arrogant which made me feel uncomfortable in approaching him with questions.  I would recommend another teacher if possible.

He wasn't that bad of a TA. He did go through things very quickly, and often made mistakes. He had test every week, which were pretty simple. He always would answer questions if you had any, and was very helpful. Overall, his class was easy.
Great as a TA.  Very clear, and very good at clarifying.  Always an entertaining class period, and always a helpful one.

Possibly the worst TA.  He goes through everything really fast and explain things in ways that are hard to understand.  Often he will start a problem and be unable to finish it because he can't figure out where he messed up.  Students have to point out his mistakes frequently.  Recitation offers no help and the only reason I go is to turn in homewo

I had him as a lecturer, and I have to say that he wasn't that helpful. He went quickly through problems without slowing down to ask for questions. He was very unclear and didn't seem interested in his students. He was a little arrogant,and by the end of the quarter barely anyone was going to lecture. Not the worst, but pretty bad.

I went into this class after taking high school AP calculus.  I ended up having to teach the class myself normally because Chris couldn't explain many of the concepts clearly.  Take another TA if you can.
Chris was last to class everyday and was never prepared to teach. He did NOT prepare us for exams and was very unhelpful in explaining new material. DO NOT TAKE THIS TA.

Chris is an AWESOME teacher.  these "midterms every week were 4 question 30 min quizzes that were easy.   He made math fun, and his class was easy.  You really learn a lot without actually doing a lot of work. He is very lenient on grading.

Arrogant and thought he was the best teacher in OSU math since Brutus Buckeye, but in reality, wasn't all that good.  Had a midterm every week causing me a lot of stress.  At least he spoke English unlike some of the others...
Very nice professor, with well-prepared material, good handwriting, and clear explanations.

Material presented in lecture was really straightforward. Before each exam, we would do a review which was great preparation. Lecture notes were posted online in you missed class but I would recommend going because what we went over in class was what showed up on the exams.

Professor Gautam was truly amazing to have as a professor. He has a noticeable accent, but that is about par for math professors. It is very clear that he cares about each one of his students and is willing to explain anything you need help with. The content is by default difficult but he tries his best to ensure you are well prepared for it.
He is really nice and responsible! And he makes complex concepts much easier to understand.

Really sweet guy. Has a bit of an accent, which I'm usually terrible with, but could understand him just fine. Really passionate about math and spends a lot of time giving background to what your learning that I always found interesting. Teaches theory well and is really helpful at office hours if you need extra help.
Good instructors! Clear with lecture notes. Homework easy and quiz easy. Highly recommend.

I found this class very frustrating. He rarely does any examples in class ever. He'll just introduce a topic and spend the hour on a proof. As a result, I never knew how to do any of the homework problems at all without spending a ridiculous amount of time on them. I would have given him a 1 if he didn't curve the class a ton at the end.

This course really required me to self-study a LOT, because the lectures are generally hard to follow. However, professor Golubitsky allowed us to use his online textbook for free, which was very helpful for me to understand the concepts. There were weekly homeworks, which can be challenging. The exams were not very hard, to be honest.

I cannot put into words how truly terrible this mans class is. His handwriting is chicken scratch (at best) and if you want to learn from the textbook because you hate his teaching style, GOOD LUCK because he wrote it. To give you perspective, I have never received anything lower than a B at OSU.

He's one of the smartest people I've ever met. Lectures usually didn't make sense & were very confusing because he had a hard time breaking it down to us, but after finishing up a chapter he usually did a good job summing it all up into useable information. His exams are surprisingly easy and as long as you know what you're doing it's a good choice

Professor Golubitsky looks like an extremely knowledgeable person, but his lecture is very theoretical. He hardly ever give examples or do problems like other math teachers does, which I personally find really annoying. He is also not very good at clarifying concepts clearly. So I need to self-study the text book for the most part of the semester.

Am fortunated to have prof Marty, and even be able to work with him. He is a wise and welcomed person. However, this course requires us to work more outside classroom. Proofs in hw sometimes get very challenging. Be sure to ask him questions. Go to office hour, and so on. The exam are purely knowledge base, Merely testing us understanding of Theore

Marty is a nice man but is maybe too smart for his own good. His lectures are EXTREMELY theoretical and proof based. He hardly ever gives examples of how to apply theorems; be sure to stop & ask him to show the class what he means. Weekly hw can get exhausting. Despite the lectures being very difficult and dense, his exams are surprisingly easy.

Absolutely love Dr. Terman. He is an amazing professor. Grades in class are based only on quizzes and exams. However, he does a great job preparing you for the quizzes and exams. Also he's really accommodation with final grades in this class.

BEST MATH professor in OSU!
Very nice person with very easy exams! Easy A!

Good class, boring/droning lectures and examples were pretty long and involved, but homework was pretty easy if you took solid notes. HOWEVER, the final consisted of borderline-graduate level work. First and second exams I got an 85 and a 96, got a 45 on the final. I'd recommend his class, but that final was a gut-punch.

TRY YOUR BEST TO AVOID! He never comes prepared, basically reiterating the textbook. Ended up teaching myself more than half of the materials. Very monotone and lectures are all over the place. Often makes mistakes in lectures, confuses himself and the class, then says "anyway" and moves on without explaining. Won't recommend him at all!

He gave one homework assignment per week and it usually took about 5 to 10 minutes because he goes through most of the problems during lecture. His exams are extremely simple as long as you've been paying attention to lecture. He is easily approachable and wants to help everybody.

Great teacher! You have to remember guys, anyone who teaches Calculus 1 a lot is going to have a mediocre rating at best because its the first semi-challenging math course students take, so being the narcissists that most freshmen are they pass all the blame on to their teacher. So his rating here is terribly misleading. He's a really good teacher.

A good math teacher teaching diffential equations. Several class to get used to his voice volume. Listen carefully during class. Take notes. Homework are all from book so not really hard. Two exams are not really hard if you take notes from regular class.
Did not like his class at all. Did not clearly explain things. Lectures were not geared towards helping to do well on midterms and finals. Very disappointed.
He's very into what he's doing which is a very nice thing to see in a professor. He's honest with you about your midterms and tests. He does whatever you need help with and knows his math very well.
Really a fan of this guy. Not the most energetic, but he has a dry sense of humor that really keeps you interested. He explains concepts really well and makes is fairly easy to understand.
Boring and can't hear him past the 3rd row
Average math teacher - not amazing but not terrible either.
Great teacher. Contrary to the other comments, he actually does well at explaining concepts. Go to class with your brain active and a desire to learn and you'll do good.
Nice guy, but doesn't seem to care much about teaching. He walks in every day and just starts with a random math problem and usually doesn't finish anything. His logic doesn't make much sense either.
likely incompetent or just not that interested in teaching.

He doesn't seem to want to teach the class, arriving late every day. He never has anything planned, he just walks in and asks if anyone has any questions. I understand he's a great researcher, and probably a nice guy, but if he doesn't want to teach, he shouldn't. He seems more suited to being a TA than a teacher. If you have him, switch ASAP.
A great teacher, if you know what you're doing prior to the class.  He is very interesting and always is good for a laugh.

How can I describe Terman?  The man isn't clear on anything, his examples never work out the way he plans them, and cannot reason to save his life.  He seems very overwhelmed.  The TA was very helpful though.

I really didn't like his teaching style. He doesn't give clear examples, nor does he finish the ones he gives. He doesn't cover all of the material, and he is in general not clear when explaining a concept. He is a very nice, laid back guy though.

Very laid-back friendly teacher, made class fairly easy. Would skip sections he didn't like, and would let us leave class early on Fridays sometimes because he probably figured we didn't really want to be there anyway.
Great teacher.  Friendly, funny, and extremely interesting.  One of the best math professors I've had at this university.
good sense of humor

This course is not easy, but it is doable if you show up to lectures and study well for exams. Dawes is a great lecturer and very understanding; she let me take the final with a later section when I slept in past my section's exam- literally saved me from failing. Averages on exams were low 80s, so not terrible

Linear Algebra is a difficult subject so be prepared to study, a lot.  Dr. Dawes however is a fantastic person who is willing to work with her students.  Her office hours are great experiences and she is a great communicator in general.

Worst professor ever. Every time a student would ask a question, she would respond with another question. The tests were so confusing, and there were questions on there that we never went over in class. There is no curve/extra credit. Does not provide a lot of study resources. The book is useless. The only reason I passed was because of my tutor.

Professor Dawes lectures are essentially useless. She teaches straight from the book, and most of your learning will be done through recitation. Although she is a very nice person, she is not a good professor. Most of your grade will be from tests, which are graded harshly. Save your GPA and take Calc with another professor.

She is very smart, but she does not communicate the ideas well. We were also very underprepared for exams. Also the exams were HARD. She doesnt curve any individual assessments, just a final curve on the class, so you wont have an idea of your final grade until near the end the of class. I took Calc my senior year and got an A, got a C in hers :(

Biology majors  save yourself and just take calc 1151. It is fairer in terms of grading. I have always been good at math and took calc my senior year of high school. I passed with an A. Prof Dawes is clearly an intelligent person, but so bad at explaining anything. She overcomplicates everything in a way where you feel like u are actually stupid.
So bad does not explain

I understand calculus. I have taken a college calculus class before and received an A. I thought Id be fine in this class, but that was simply not the case. I have never had a worse math professor. Do not be like me, you will not be fine, take another class!!! I do not know anyone with a grade higher than a C, and there is NO CURVE.

I have never had a professor or teacher that I didn't like. That is, until I took her class. I'm a math person and still had extreme difficulty. She makes the content way harder than it should be. The first two midterms had an average grade of below 55%. and she DOES NOT curve. Had to drop this class and I am retaking it with someone new.

This class was the worst way possible to start college as a first year. DO NOT TAKE IT!!! save yourself by taking 1151 instead. Professor Dawes, while smart, overcomplicates simple calculus topics and makes midterms unimaginably difficult. the only thing that is saving my grade is my TA. Seriously, save your gpa and your pride and don't enroll!!!
a piece of me dies every time I attend one of her lectures. She over complicates and rushes through every topic. Lectures aren't even worth attending because she will just confuse you.

VERY few example problems done in lecture combined with a far-too technical textbook used for homework problems leads to students hitting a brick wall each week on how to do homework problems and therefore the midterms. Homework averages consistently in the 70% range. The lecturer knows a lot about the subject but this course is NOT organized.

I would not recommend taking her class to anyone. Yes she offers up office hours, but she does not offer much insight when you go. Midterms are very difficult and the only way to do reasonably well in the class is to get lucky enough to have a fantastic TA. Smart woman, not great at communicating the information to students. Take 1151!!!

Dr. Dawes is clearly very intelligent about mathematics. However, she does not do a good job communicating and sharing her knowledge with the students. Going to lectures is not even worth it. She will confuse you, and the practice problems done in lecture are far easier than any you will ever see on an exam. Recitation saved my grade.

She is a terrible professor to take as a Freshman. There should be a wider range of math 1156 professors so that most could avoid taking her. She doesn't give many outside resources, and those that she does give are from 2013. Take 1151, you will have more resources available to you. The third midterm was extremely difficult and there was no curve.

Dr. Dawes is very nice, and it is easy to tell that she knows a lot about Calculus. However, she is not always the best at explaining calculus concepts. She uses very complicated examples in class that don't always relate well to homework or exam questions. I had a good TA, and he is the only reason I've been able to get a good grade in this class.

Dr. Dawes is a very nice and intelligent lady, but lacks the ability to teach the calculus material well. Problems are overly complicated and they do not help to prepare students for exams. On one occasion, she created a test knowing that the class average would be an F; she admitted this to us in lecture. Take 1151 and save yourself the stress.

Way over complicates everything. Lecture is practically useless. Recitation is your only savior. (Just know that her tests will ask questions MUCH more difficult than was on the homework or in practice problems). Also when the entire class failed a midterm, like badly, she told us she expected the grades we got for that midterm??

Dr. Dawes was a poor professor. She over complicated the simplest concepts. She will turn you away if you ask for help on the homework and is quite bad with communication. Only reason I survived is because of my TA. The book is terrible with explanations too, so I suggest tutoring and Khan Academy. Do the suggested book problems & GO to recitation!

I found professor dawes to be pretty straightforward.  She covers the material well, sometimes not as clear as you might want, but she will answer questions at length and provides office hours that for me turned out to be very helpful.

She just wrote definitions and didn't really teach anything. I've taken AP Calc before and she made it way more complicated in the way she explained things. She was extremely unhelpful. I learned nothing from lecture. I learned everything during recitation. I wish I would have taken 1151

Her examples and ways of explaining the material were very confusing compared to the ones in the book or done by the TAs. You can't use graphing calculators like the other calculus classes and there's no curve.

Nice lady but not very helpful in class. her examples and assigned homework were way harder than they needed to be. She would ask for questions then if someone asked something she would say good question but I don't have time for that and come to office hours. I did well in precal but struggled with her.
Honestly one of the worst teachers I have ever had. She's a smart lady, but a terrible teacher. Your only chance is if you get a good TA

It was very clear from day one that she has a very strong grasp of her subject but absolutely no clue how to convey that information to her students. Do not take this class. You will have much more success in 1151.

She seems like a nice person, but she teaches straight from the book with examples that are next to impossible to understand. When asked questions, all she answers with is "it's something you learn with experience" or "because that comes out with the best result", which doesn't teach us anything. At all.
This man is a gem of a human being. Only class where I've never missed a lecture.

I've always struggled with math but he was very good at getting the point across and helping me understand. Attending class isn't really mandatory, but you should definitely go if you struggle with math. Don't buy the textbook if you don't plan on doing the problems for extra practice, it's a waste of money. If you have the chance, 100% get Andrew
Super kind and helpful makes sure you succeed
Fantastic TA, is always willing to help. He was always willing to help during office hours, even made more office hours for us. Really Cares about his students.
Andrew is a very helpful professor, fair grader, and always is looking out for his students.
Professor Young was an amazing professor. He is such a great teacher. He really cares about students and he wants everyone to succeed. I recommend everyone take this course! Great guy!!

He was very sarcastic and kinda cold. Seemed not to really care, very much a smart-ass. I already knew most of the material from high school as this class was precalculus so I had an A the entire time up until the final which was ridiculous! He gave quizzes every Friday that were open note and the exams he allowed a cheat sheet on. he was ok
Easy A. Show up, take a short quiz at the end of class over what you learned that day, get out early.

Easy professor. There are 3 tests and a final. He gives you practice exams before every test that are VERY similar to the actual test. He is boring, but he wants everyone to succeed. He is very helpful. Do the practice problems from the textbook over and over and you will be fine.
Great professor, the class is just tough. Knows what he's talking about and is willing to explain in depth. There are good math teachers and bad ones. He's a good one.
Quirky and funny, and a clear, concise lecturer. Good instructor.

Communicates very clearly in lectures. However he's a southpaw that uses an overhead projector, and often smears his handwriting. Note taking can be difficult, but he recognizes his problem and post all his notes online. He's also very good about responding to emails and the 5% curve he gives at the end of the quarter provides a nice boost.

He likes to go into the theory behind the math towards the end but tries to fit examples into his lectures.  He's a very nice and patient guy who you can approach with questions. He grades reasonably and fairly and he does have a sense of humor. Nicest prof teaching the 254 course.
Very good professor, just the right balance between depth and clarity.
Awesome teacher, very helpful. If you have any questions GO TO OFFICE HOURS!! def recommend!

Prof Young is quite a great teacher. He is very personable and will help with homework before lecturing in front of the entire class. He often makes jokes which makes class tolerable especially through winter quarter. I enjoyed having him as a teacher.
Great professor! Very easy to understand. If you have the opportunity take his class. You won't regret it.
Great teacher. Worked many example problems to go along with his notes - following the notes made tests and homework easy. Easy for even those that dont like math.
A nice, middle aged guy who cracks jokes and generally enjoys teaching. Notes were just copies of text book definitions which made it difficult to grasp what was going on.
Extremely helpful and an excellent math teacher. Perfect for someone who hates math or struggles with it.
Definitely the best professor I've ever had in my life!

This class was really hard online, but there was so much extra credit. Every homework assignment had extra credit questions, which eventually got extremely difficult, but definitely made you learn a lot. Dr. Gogolyev gives really great lectures. We spend most of our time on linear algebra, and finished with ODEs. Tests and quizzes are fair.

He is the best I've had at Ohio State. He articulates material clearly, his diagrams are always helpful, his examples are always meaningful. Exams and homework are fair. I would take him again given the chance. He will get a little annoyed if you're a few minutes late or you use your phone in class. But if that doesn't bother you then he's amazing.
He is very good. Makes everything clear and easy.
Prof Gogolyev is the best professor I've had at OSU and I would love to take another class of his in the future. Very clear and precise despite the content of the course being very difficult.
It cannot be denied that the content of this course is extremely difficult for me. However, he is very patient and kind to students, and it is helpful to attend his office hour.

Extremely difficult test and little feedback. Graded 1-2 homework problems per set. Tests were based more on fast computations than on understanding the material. If you can integrate by parts fast, you will succeed. If not, good luck. Tests were based on homework, just too much material to finish. I feel my grade didnt match understanding. Avoid.
The worst professor I had met in my 4 years of university life. If you want to get a high GPA, DO NOT CHOOSE THIS PROFESSOR! NEVER!

His lectures were worthless, we never got feedback on any tests or quizzes, and the class was horribly disorganized. There was a huge lack of leadership in the classroom and his grading is obscure. Assuredly the worst professor that I have ever had. Just get ready to teach yourself through reading, youtube, and the book. Doesn't respond to emails!

The material in this class is hard but the professor makes it much harder than it needs to be. He gets frustrated when you ask questions and doesn't give practice exams for review. He doesn't give any homework solutions or feedback so it's hard to check your work. My advice is to get ready to spend hours teaching yourself

He does a good job explaining things on average. Sometimes he'll write something wrong like a 0 instead of a 1 or miss a negative sign but if you say something he'll change it. The exams are on par with the homeworks so if you do the homeworks and understand them you'll be good.

The worst professor I have ever had. After the first lectures I stopped going and just read from the book. His lectures are horrible so I suggest skipping them. His midterms were easy, but the final was very difficult and did not reflect the midterms at all. Avoid this professor at all costs, probably the worst math professor at Ohio State.

Professor Guan reads right off of his very confusing slides. He's obviously smart but can not teach for his life. You will have to teach yourself everything from the book and online. I would avoid his class if possible. The quizzes/tests are harder than the homework and you are rushed to finish in time for basically every single one.

Avoid like the plague. Incoherent lectures reading off confusing slides that are hard to follow. Midterms were reasonable (if you're able to teach yourself the content), final was not. Linear algebra, Vector fields, and ODE chapters are easy to learn yourself, MV Calc chapter is challenging but manageable, good luck with the final PDE chapter.

Run for your life unless you're fully prepared to entirely teach yourself and hope you have a good TA. Useless professor. No feedback on anything. Extremely poor English, coming from someone who has extensive experience with non-native speakers. His lectures are incomprehensible with many errors on slides along w/ nodrop quizzes only in his section
Goooooood teacher

Can't stress enough: AVOID. Doesn't grade exams for 6+ weeks, doesn't explain material well and exams are not fair (gives a 3-4 hr exam in 2 hr). Was weeks ahead of the syllabus. Reach a point where the whole class is lost. Have 5% or less of the class at his lecture. Sporadically changes lecture times too. Homeworks can take a very long time too.

Very nice and wants to help, but lectures almost impossible to learn from. Only 10-15% of class still goes to them. Very theorem based, feels like I'm reading textbook. Doesn't follow syllabus (week ahead rn). I've taken material before but he's leaving me more confused than I was coming in. I'm usually an A student. Might be my first dropped class

Can't speak English to save his life. Lectures are disjointed and confusing. He'll often briefly touch on a topic, write a couple lines of notes on it, and then forget it and move to the next thing. Dr guan was the worst teacher Ive ever had. He over explained the most elementary of concepts and it seemed like he didnt know what he was going half the time. Luckily his tests were easy enough where failing wasnt an issue. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

You pretty much just listen to somebody attempt to speak english during lectures. Totally incomprehensible. He didn't even provide a syllabus until the second week of class. Only two exams, so if you do poorly on one you dont have much of a chance to fix your grade. Skip class and go to MSLC+TA office hours and you should be okay.

Bo Guan seemed to be an intelligent person, but was definitely not a good professor. He had difficulty explaining even the most basic of concepts clearly. I made it through the entire class with only a very superficial understanding of the material at best.
awful. I got A because I never listen the lectures and study on my own

Prof. Guan was horrendous: -Incapable of explaining even the most basic concepts to the class -Genuinely 0 point in attending lecture I wish I had just used the hour I wasted during lecture to study the material on my own. Avoid this professor at all costs. I pretty easily received an A in 1151 and 1172. He made an easier class nigh on impossible.

Bo Guan crushed any passion for mathematics that was left in me. His explanation of even simple topics is confusing, and I usually left class understanding less than I had before. I stopped going halfway through the semester and was much better off. Thank god I had a good TA or I would have had to teach myself the entire course. Avoid at all costs.
Lectures are pointless, dude makes no sense and is unable to communicate any of the material.

Prof tried to help us. However, he was really unable to communicate any of the concepts in a way that I understood. 2162 is a hard class already because there is so much to cover. Prof is not helpful in class or office hours. I went to a different prof lecture. TA was awesome. I went to his office hours multiple times a week and it saved my grade.

Prof. Guan is probably the best Diff Eq teacher at Ohio State. His accent is not bad at all, and is not that hard to understand. His lectures are basically useless though, as he teaches by just doing examples on the board, but fails to actually teach you how to do them. Tests arent bad though, so take his class for the better grade.

Dr. Guan is clearly intelligent but his lectures are simply awful. He wastes a LOT of time on proofs that don't help you understand the material whatsoever. You will learn more by yourself from the book than you will in lecture. I  finished Accelerated calc 2&3 for honors engineers with him and just found I have him for ODE and PDE next semester.

One of the most confusing and incomprehensible teacher I've ever had. Along with his horrible accent, he's like teaching to himself rather than teaching to the students. Homeworks are really challenging. Attendance is mandatory even though you would not understand even half of what he talks about. Would not recommend.

Dr. Guan is knowledgable but he doesn't know how to make you understand. Many of my classmates had totally no idea how to solve homework after attending class. If you choose him, I would encourage you to study by yourself for this course.
Horrible accent, can't transfer knowledge from himself to you. Really smart man though.

Extremely smart man, however it is difficult for him to transfer the knowledge from his head to his students.  His accent is kind of hard to understand, homework is long and difficult, and you have to study and review a lot to understand what's going on. But his tests were fairly easy and he curved grades a lot in the end.

He was all right. Homework problems sometimes a bit crazy, but his midterms were always easier. Go through the problems quick on tests because he gives a great deal of partial credit. Spent a little too much time deriving some theorems in class, but the book assigned for the class (Asmar) is a very good supplement. Fair class, fair teacher.

Probably the worst professor I've ever had.  Can't keep notes straight, hard to understand, assigns ridiculous homework problems.  I dread every single morning I have this class, and it's sad because I actually wanted to learn this material.
not bad
nice guy, easy exams.

talks crazy during lecture, good luck keeping up with him...TA's are where you learn the formula's and tricks to do well in this class...best thing you can do is make sure you understand the homework b/c the tests are very similar...if you can get ahold of a past exam u'll be set for this class
His test are easy, if you fail this class you should commit suicide
If you are very good at teaching yourself material, the tests are exactly like the homework. If you understand what is going on you will be fine, if not... good luck.

This dude is terrible at transfering knowledge from his head to yours. Very smart man, but not a good teacher in my opinion.

I had him for recitation in MATH 1148 and WOW! He was smart, but kinda passive aggressive.

Eduan is a very passionate and caring TA. Had him for math 1148 last semester (before leaving) and was fortunate to learn so much regarding algebra and the math solving process. He makes math 1148 very easy to understand and works consistently to help his students succeed.

The best teacher Ive ever had. I was very upset when he had to leave, due to his promotion but it was most definitely deserved. He was understanding, compassionate and made 8am Calc somehow enjoyable. I looked forward to attending his recitations and hope he does well with his new job.

Best math instructor and mentor I've ever had. Eduan made calculus easy to understand. He just got promoted in the university, so he is done with teaching after this semester. I cannot thank Eduan enough. You have made a huge difference in our lives and how we think about mathematics.

Math isn't my thing. If I manage to pass it's because Eduan is the best TA of all time. Follow along on the OneDrive folder and go to office hours. He is very personable and willing to go above and beyond for his students.

Professor Martinez-Soto is very friendly, polite, and will go out of his way to help students succeed in math. Amazing Prof! 11/10 would recommend.

I had Eduan for recitation in spring 2021 and he helped a lot. He wanted to help to make sure that you understand the material!

THE BEST MATH TEACHER EVER! I am taking his class over the summer. Eduan is a great teacher and explains everything well. This class is so much easier than the teacher I had before! 1075 can be difficult if you don't pay attention, but if you go to class, pay attention, and do your HW you will easily get an A!

Professor Martinez-Soto is the best math instructor I have ever had! Eduan keeps his virtual sessions interesting and shows the application of mathematics in everyday life. I wasn't even assigned to his section but I attend every one.
He is nice, funny, talks a lot and makes it as easy for us to understand as possible! Really cares and wants us to succeed. Offers very open office hours and help before exams.

I love Eduan! He cares about his students and he is an excellent professor. It is truly refreshing to see somebody so excited about math (especially at 8:00AM) and that excitement spread onto me and my group members. I would definitely want him again as my professor for the future.

Professor Martinez-Soto is by far the best teacher I have ever learned math from; he offers multiple points of view for students to discover which methods are best for them for learning math. He is kind and understanding and is really interested in making sure his students succeed.
Eduan is the best math professor at tOSU. Period. He makes math so easy to understand.
Eduan is the best math Professor for any math course. He really loves teaching and explains everything as clear as possible. Legend.
Dope

I don't think I have met a professor who was as excited about teaching his students or caring about how well they performed as Eduan. Eduan is really passionate about what he does. He creates a welcoming environment. His teaching is clear and in depth and he really takes the time to explain the whys behind the concepts. I wish that every professor was like him. He is truly a blessing, and this class has made me realize that I actually like doing math!!

Professor Martinez-Soto cares a lot, especially the students mental and physical health during this pandemic. He is a truly caring, well prepared, and effective instructor. When lectures were still in person he was an excellent instructor, and after all classes went online, that fact remained the same and he made the transition very smooth.

He's one of the best professors I've ever had! You can tell through his teaching and just getting to know him a little that he really cares about his students. He's super helpful in office hours and has even helped me later on when I wasn't even his class anymore (not to mention he remembered me from a 100+ person lecture from a whole year ago)

I cannot thank Eduan enough. He is not my professor, but I attend to his lectures and I understand better with him than my actual lecturer. He is absolutely the best. You can tell he loves what he does, and he knows that math is not for everyone. Very patient. He also teaches each topic as if you never heard of it. It helps you to have a better understanding of each topic.

E-D-U-A-N! Had him for MATH 1075. Had him for MATH 1148. I'm having him for MATH 1149 this semester. I refuse to take a math class he's not a lecturer or TA for. If you don't take him you're torturing yourself.
10/10 would recommend
Eduan is amazing with relating to his students, and identifying the proper ways to help his students understand math concepts. If there was a Hall of Fame wall for teachers please induct him.
Eduan is a 10/10 professor, knows what he is talking about and cares for his students!

I really enjoyed having Eduan as a professor. He was motivational and really cared for his students. Don't hesitate to reach out and go to his office hours. Go to the MSLC, you might see him there. I don't think any other instructor out there will be able to top him. His colored chalk and analogies are a big deal. Eduan always makes sure everyone in the classroom is on the same page. I failed my first math course in freshman year and Eduan has helped bring back my interest in math. It truly was an honor having him as my instructor. Instructors need to take tips from him!

Eduan is AMAZING. I have never met a more passionate, devoted, and kind professor like him. He believes in you and he let you know. His lectures are very clear and effective. I love Eduan. Had him for 1075 and now for 1148. He really makes me appreciate math in a way I've never have before. He is a role model for any student and instructor at OSU.
The Best College Math professor I have ever had.
Eduan is a legend. I greatly appreciated his class and his effort over the summer. Thank you for actually caring if your students understand the material or not and working as hard as you do!
EDUAN! Man that guy is something else! I wouldn't want to have anyone else to teach me math! Really knows how to teach and make sense of difficult material. Very humble and positive!

Love Eduan!! He is really inspiring and encouraging, which helps a lot when I don't have the motivation to continue working hard after breaks. Eduan is great at making math less painful and he encourages you to not give up no matter what you get in one test. Wish you could be my math teacher next semester!
Eduan is the best math professor Ive ever had. Period. He is kind and always encourages us to share our ideas. So inspiring! Thank you for this great semester. See you in Math 1148! :)

I liked this course. It requires a lot of critical thinking and having Eduan as your instructor is a big plus. Eduan is the best professor that I have ever had. He is so inspiring and I am motivated by his passion for math and for helping students not be afraid of math. He is completely dedicated to his students. The best ever!

Eduan is always there to help the students whenever they need him. I was always able to reach out to him whenever I needed help with math. I dont know if I will ever get a math professor as good as him. Coming as a freshman its really difficult to transition, however he made the learning environment comfortable and easier. Excellent math prof!
Legend.

Eduan makes every class feel comfortable and it feels like a great learning environment to be in. The feeling of disinterest and uncomfortable is never there. Great teacher with excellent people & communication skills. Very down to Earth and will go out of his way to help you if need be.

One of the best math professors I've had. From his lectures, you can tell he is really passionate about helping students learn. Completely open to any questions you might have, and ensures you understand the material. I strongly recommend him!

Eduan is a professor that puts all of his time and effort into helping students understand that subject matter. The best! Eduan can tell when you are clearly confused and asks what is confusing you instead of just moving on and hoping you understand later. Eduan is possibly THE best Instructor Ohio State has to offer. He has an amazing personality and his lectures are upbeat and entertaining. I went to his office hours and he was so helpful. He genuinely cares about every student he has. I was lucky to have him as one of my first instructors and Im sad that no one can compare.

Eduan is easily the best math instructor I've had in either high school or college. He cares about his students on a personal level. I felt as though our recitation group became a small family. Eduan is one of the most caring and passionate professors I have ever had. One of my favorite professors of all time. Thank you for being such an inspirational and caring professor!

Eduan is the first teacher to ever effectively engage me in a math class. He kept an otherwise boring class interesting and allowed me to ask many questions. Eduan is an amazing lecturer. His colored markers are super helpful when understanding the processes. He always make sure to explain every step so each student understands. Youre very lucky if you have him!

Literally I learned more from him than from all my teachers in the past (all combined). Eduan is a FANTASTIC professor and is always energetic and passionate about what he is teaching. He was the first math teacher Ive had that really made me understand things. He was meant to be a teacher. I wish I can have him for another course.
The best instructor Ive had throughout my time as a student. He makes lectures fun and entertaining. Eduan is always happy and excited to teach.
Eduan is and will be my favorite teacher at OSU. He makes math the simplest subject ever. I can't wait to have him as my teacher for Math 1131 next semester! :P

Professor Martinez-Soto is very funny and makes lecture relevant. I really enjoy his teaching style as he breaks down each problem and explains why something is the way it is. Eduan is the real MVP for math 1130.

EDUAN IS THE BEST!!!! He is engaging and always has high energy. Eduan really is always willing to help and makes sure you know the material. And GO to his office hours!!!! I hope to GOD I get him in 1149. Such an amazing professor thank you for everything if I do not have you this semester!!!!

Eduan is my favorite TA ever...... like seriously... Wish I could have him as a lecturer for calc.. He is patient and very passionate about his job and helping students succeed. Eduan is a gifted instructor. He is engaging and always has high energy. Extremely patient and would go the extra mile to make people understand things. We need more professors like him. Thank you for everything!!

Eduan is one of my favorite teachers at OSU. He truly cares about his students and is so passionate. Inspired me to work hard! Please continue using all the colored chalk and markers!!

Eduan is a great math teacher. He really cares about his students and does his best to keep everyone positive and motivated, as well as make lectures interesting. Eduan is the best math teacher I have ever had in my entire life. He definitely cares about his students success and is extremely interesting. I love his motivational speeches! Eduan saved my Calculus grade! I had him as a recitation TA for Calc and he is very supportive, easy to contact, and always fields students' questions. Professor Martinez-Soto is very enthusiastic about the course and teaching itself. He is very personable and makes learning boring subjects fun. I feel like I actually learned a lot and feel prepared for math 1149 and math 1151. Very engaging instructor plus gives good life lessons!

Eduan was an amazing professor. He has very organized and understandable notes. He is great at explaining even some of the hardest calculus concepts. Eduan is a really good professor. He is well organized in his notes and truly wants his students to succeed. The only thing I would say is DO NOT get the textbook. Eduan is the best. He has been covering my lecturer for the past 8 weeks and helped me understand math MUCH BETTER in a week than my actual lecturer has done all semester. Eduan is a wonderful Professor. He is deeply passionate about math, and it shows as he teaches. His teaching style is clear, consistent, and organized. Amazing instructor! If not for him I believe many students would not have done nearly as well as they did. He's very kind and humorous. I love going to his class because he creates such a positive atmosphere. Eduan deserves all the praise for his students' success!

Eduan is incredible. His lectures are so organized and clear-cut that he's pretty much impossible not to like. He gives you exactly the info you need, and is accessible if you ever need help. I have always hated math but he is legitimately the best math teacher I've ever had.

Eduan made this class incredibly easy to understand. He makes calculus much simpler to learn. I switched to his class because I heard good things about his teaching style and personality. He has exceeded my expectations in a 100%. One of the best instructors I ever had!
Great!

She is a really bad professor all around. Would not recommend taking her class, she is always putting down the wrong answer or debating with students about what is correct vs what is not. She does not follow her own notes, and she consistently has technological problems. Seriously, 0/10

YOU CANNOT UNDERSTAND THIS WOMAN. She is a nice person but you will not understand what is going on in class. Her notes make no sense and how she solves problems is more difficult than it has to be. STAY AWAY.

The worst teacher I think I have ever had. Luckily the class is pretty easy, but she has a terrible accent and does not know how to use the equipment for the projector. My TA was decent so he was able to help me get my A in the class, but I would still AVOID her at all costs.

can't understand her, she laughs when we failed, no curve, almost the whole class has dropped, she skips steps and is really hard to follow. TAs for this class aren't to great either.

Fairly intelligent, but extremely hard to understand. She has a very thick accent and speaks with somewhat broken english.

i loveddddd effat!!! she is such a good reacher!!! this was the easiest class i have ever taken. effat really really wants you to do well. she often gives you test questions. lets you retake quizzes if you get a bad grade and lets you ask questions during exams!!! CHOOSE HER NIGHT CLASS!!

Not a good teacher. Doesn't not speak clear English and doesn't help at all. the recitation teacher will help you alot more
